description:
Been trying out a lot of breakfast places and this is by far the best yet. Fresh ingredients and clean food, this was by far a top pick. 

FOOD : I ordered the healthy plate ; 3 egg whites, spinach, tomato, and asparagus with an English muffin as a side and a fruit cup. I looooved this plate. So clean and so light, it made me leave feeling satisfied and happy. The fruit was fresh and a great array of different fruit - banana, grapes, watermelon, grapefruit, raspberries, blackberries, apple, orange, strawberries... for REAL a great variety. This was all around phenomenal. I could tell it wasn't pre made or something fishy. I WILL be going back!! Yuumm. My mom loved her 3 egg omelette too, we were extremely happy. 

SERVICE : We has such sweet service. They were prompt and willing to take complicated orders. They sat us quickly and we had such a pleasant time. 

ATMOSPHERE : This was a pretty small restaurant, they had indoor and outdoor seating. The kitchen was visible to the customers, but there was a chill and warm vibe to it. There's a lot of people stuffed in and it's a little hectic at times but it's a great little place to stop in and have a lax morning.
author: Linden D.

description:
This place was very close to our hotel and we didn't want to do the boring hotel buffet. 

When you walk in it is all decorated with various Hollywood paraphernalia. Pretty cool old time photos of some of the most famous actors. Its a neat little place but not crazy fancy or anything. 

The menu is what you would expect from an approachable breakfast place. Their thing is that they have several dishes named after the actors themselves. I got the Marilynn Monroe. It was french toast with fresh fruit. The french toast was good but nothing out of the ordinary. The fruit was surprisingly fresh, all in all very well done. The coffee left you wanting more but you can't have it all I guess. 

Good experience but definitely not the best breakfast in town.
author: Adam H.

description:
Came in early and the place is already filling up at 730am! 
Ordered their crab omelette, and based on the portion I got salad instead of the regular hash brown. Such a good choice! The portion was outstanding and I really enjoyed my omelette. The crab meat, though not super fresh, was fresh enough for me as to not having that annoying strong seafood taste which usually stemmed up when the seafood was set long. The avocado goes well with it, and the whole thing was lightly salted. The overall taste was very balanced and the ingredients great.
My friend ordered eggs and bacon sandwich and he enjoyed it. The only complaints was that they gave too much fruits haha!
The side toast was ok, goes well with the omelette.
Service was good and fast. The staff was friendly. A very good experience overall.
author: Tian G.

description:
Iv been craving some non traditional eggs benedict and this place delivered. I came for an early sunday breakfast after working a night shift double. Its by alot of hotels in a tourist part of town so it was packed but I was able to get a table and staff were hustling so service was still quick.

I ordered the dungeness crab and spinach eggs benedict and upgraded the hash browns to their house special hollywood hashbrowns with bacon, onion, mushrooms, bell peppers, and cheddar cheese on top. The benedict was dank and the crab and hollandaise made for a rich and succulent combo. They include a bit of fruit and a big rack of hash browns. 

The hashbrowns were really tasty and filling but while the toppings were a flavor upgrade idk that its worth 3 more bucks for a sprinkle of stuff on top on an already 20 buck breakfast. If you dont really care about value and just want the best as I did that morning go for it tho.

All in all a really delicious meal that satisfied my craving and staff that were really hard working and efficient considering how packed the place was. In diner fashion they have a cool atmosphere and alot of old school photos of hollywood celebs etc if your into that too.
author: Sean G.

description:
Gave this a try due to the Yelp 4.5 star rating and we were staying at the Hyatt Centric across the street and saw the line from our room.  Portions are large and the dishes were good and satisfying, but there's nothing special about this place.  If you're in the area and looking for brunch, Surinan around the corner has a much more interesting and flavorful menu.

I ordered the Dungeness crab Benedict and upgraded the hash browns to the Hollywood Cafe hash browns.  The Benedict was fine though a bit milder than I prefer, and the crab a bit fishy.  Be careful eating it since we found a couple small pieces of shell in our crab.  3.5/5

The Hollywood hash browns were not crispy, and were topped with sautéed onions, peppers and bacon which made them more flavorful.  However I was a bit surprised that the upgrade cost was $3 when ordering a la carte was only $1.50 between the normal hash browns and the Hollywood style.  3.5/5

My husband ordered the egg sandwich which came with two English muffins with fluffy scrambled eggs and bacon inside.  Simple but solid, 4/5

We also ordered a fruit cup which had standard but good fruit like blueberries, blackberries, bananas, oranges, strawberries and grapes.  However at $10.99 I was expecting a larger bowl.  4/5

Fresh squeezed orange juice was good.  We arrived at 11am on a beautiful San Francisco Saturday and waited for about 25 minutes for a table of 2, which isn't that bad if you're used to the crazy brunch places in the more hipster areas.
author: Alice C.

description:
5 stars for this place.
Amazing food and a great location. Service was fast. We ordered pancakes and a vegetarian sandwich. Wow!! The grilled sandwich was on point in terms of flavors and the pancakes were too very tasty. If you are visiting the pier or staying nearby this place is a must try.
author: Isha R.

description: Extremely not impressed. This place is super busy and I cannot figure out why right now. I ordered a Denver omelette and this omelette was the farthest thing from an omelette. This was more like a bland egg pocket. All they did was cook three eggs and placed and BUNCH of HARD/ UNCOOKED ONIONS AND BELL-PEPPERS with cheese and served it to me. I could barely chew the bell-peppers. Obviously quantity is more important than quality here. I hate paying for okay at best kind of food! See the pictures of my bell peppers and onion omelette!!
author: Morgan P.

description:
Right in the heart of the tourist area of the Marina. I apologize I suppose yelp deleted my initial review. My prose not up to snuff???
Well that gives me a chance to add to the magic. 
I've been here several times, all with Sir Winston. Which means sat at one of the outdoor seats lining the front of the place. 
Always dog friendly, with actual doggie bowls for cool aqua. 
The portions are ginormous. That includes the variety of fresh fruit served in bowls over flowing with assorted berries, citrus, banana, kiwi, pineapple. The omelettes alway cooked to your specifications. Sour dough toast and endless coffee. 

Today was a great day to be outside in SF. Warm sunny, and for whatever reason... not too touristy.
Even took a couple of victory laps around the marina to familiar tourist traps, taking advantage of the lack of pink n yellow neon clad out of towners, throngs of kids in tow.

Frankly by the time I dropped Bae off to get in the usually wrapped around the block line, parked the whip up the street a half a click, we were seated. Ice cold water for us and Winston soon arrived without asking. A tag team of friendly, yellow tee shirt clad staff happily waited on us, leaving us not wanting for anything. 

Get in, get stuffed, and get out.  Another throng off hungry locals and tourists alike, eager to repeat the process await. Although today not so much. Crazy because this was a chamber of commerce day. 

Frankly we were heading to Union street for a hipster upscale brunch. 

As we drove by to spy the line... well the lack of it was all we needed. 

It's seven pm and we are still not hungry! That's with leaving so much uneaten. 
Great place to casually soak it all in, especially on a sunny day in the marina.
author: Craig G.

description:
I am so happy that this place lived up to the reviews! I only had to wait 5 minutes for a table for one outside, were I soaked up the SF Sunshine this Sunday morning at 9am. 

I wished I had of paid attention to the reviews that warned me the servings were huge. Did I mention the serving was double what o could eat, even when I was Post-workout starving! 

I order the crab and avocado omelette, which was tasty but not for those who don't like fishy crab. The highlights were the fruit fresh cup and the hash browns. Hands down some best of both I've had in a long time. And their soy, decaf latte was pretty good too.
author: NIKKI F.

description:
Don't know how the owners got my original review deleted (written Jan 2018).  They over charged me then (via Yelp's email May 2018) owner's message "promised" to mail me a refund.  No refund have arrived, even worse, now my review is gone. It was honest and heartfelt.  I have been a yelper for years, but am now wondering what's up with this system...is it REALLY fair and impartial?

The restaurant was okay.  Pricey and busy.  If you are planning on dropping that kind of change for brunch go to The Buena Vista.  The staff was wonderful.  It's authentic S.F.  and they won't take advantage of you being an out-of-towner!
author: Oogywawa O.

description:
For a hearty casual breakfast in San Francisco, visit Hollywood. 

This cafe celebrates movie legends with headshots on the walls and menu items named after popular actors, but the food is the real star  ... and reason to wait on busy mornings. Note that the restaurant doesn't open til 7:45 and closes at 1:45 each and every day. 

Since I popped in with my wife for a weekend breakfast during the lunch hour, we split actor-themed favorite for both meals.

A Marilyn Monroe Breakfast ($15.99) with wedges of French Toast and a bowl of Fresh Fruit was first. It was seductive, memorable, and disappeared quickly like its namesake. 

An Eastwood Cheesesteak Sandwich ($12.99) with thin Rib Eye Steak, roasted Peppers, Onions and Cheddar Cheese followed. Like Clint, it was crusty on the outside, but meaty and cheesy with a hint of heat oozing from within. 

Seating was tight and we took the first space available after a 20 minute wait. Once seated, service was rushed, but fine. 

Hollywood Cafe awards breakfast and lunch stars to San Francisco on a daily basis and is worthy of 4 stars on its own.
author: Michael S.

description:
My favorite breakfast spot in San Fran! I stayed at a hotel right down the street and wanted to grab a yummy breakfast because I had a lot of plans that day. I stayed for four nights and I got breakfast at the Hollywood Cafe every. single. morning. It was delicious!! I highly recommend the pancakes and side of hash browns.

The waiters/waitresses were very accommodating. The place is a little small, but that shouldn't deter you from going. If you have a chance to sit outside, do it! The inside gets a little stuffy. It gets busy in the mornings so you might have to wait, but it's worth it! 

I highly HIGHLY recommend coming here!
author: Emily P.

description:
5 stars - because Yelp doesn't allow 6 stars.

The food was 5 star worthy - other reviews show that and I have nothing to add. The real treat was how the staff treated my family of 7, including 1 and 2 year old toddlers. The 2 year old was squirmy and didn't love the tight space. But the staff engaged him. They each took him to the counter to "help" bring people their food. Some carried him, some held his hand and walked with him, but all of the waitstaff engaged him. When the meal was over, he felt like the hero of the place and said "bye"to each of them... they all were genuinely friendly in saying "bye" back, giving hugs/high fives, etc.

Again- food alone was five stars. Anyone who has ever dined with (or around) a toddler will know it can be a challenge. The service this waitstaff provided turned it into a delight. For that, there simply aren't enough stars! Will most hopefully return!
author: Matt H.

description:
The wait here can get pretty crazy, but it moves surprisingly fast! 

We ordered the original French toast combo which came with eggs and a choice of meat. There was fresh fruit that came with the French toast which was a nice touch! 

My partner ordered the C.A.S omelette which came with a hefty side of crispy hash and toast. The portions are very generous! 

I also ordered the misugaru legume latte which was a lightly sweet warm drink. 

Overall, this place has exceptionally friendly service and great food with huge portions for a fair price. The wait is well worth the experience!
author: Kimberly G.

description:
OK so this will come up as one of the top places to get breakfast in SF. And what I can tell you is that there is for sure a reason why! I actually like it so much that it's the only breakfast place I've made it a point to go to when I'm there. 

What I can tell you is to get here EARLY! There is not much seating at all (maybe ten tables inside and 4-5 outside). If you have a big party, get there right when they open. I'd imagine they would have a difficult time accommodating parties of 6 or more. When I came here the first time, I think we got here within 10 mins of opening and were seated right away. We quickly saw a line start forming and felt pleased with our decision to get there early. The second time I went, I was not as smart. It was July and I was in SF for the Marathon. It was a few days after the marathon and I wanted a nice big breakfast to splurge! I got here between 10-11 and saw the line outside. I was starving but it was also freezing outside (50s and windy). I stood outside for about 20 mins questioning my decision but it was too late to turn back now. There were probably 5-6 parties ahead of me and the line was moving SLOW. Luckily, being a solo traveler helped. After about 25 mins, an associate re-confirmed with me that I was a party of 1, then quickly went inside and came right back out and motioned me to come in. I was able to jump the whole line. SCORE! But regardless, just try to get here early. It's worth the wait, but like I said, due to little seating, the line moves slow.

I have gotten the Marilyn Monroe both times I've come here. It's three slices of French toast and a fruit cup. Now let me tell you that this fruit cup will be the BEST and most exotic fruit cup you will ever have in a restaurant. Most restaurants I go to will usually over-supply on the melons, have a few grapes in there, maybe strawberries and bananas if you're lucky. But this place LOADS you with EVERY kind of fruit imaginable. It's insane! Watermelon, apple, banana, oranges, grapefruit, strawberry, blackberry, raspberry, grapes, kiwi (KIWI!!!!!). I mean it's endless. I can never seem to finish the darn thing, but I really appreciate how they don't skimp at all. It's great!

I also got the hash brown this most recent time which I scarfed down. A great and hearty breakfast before sightseeing in SF!

What I will say that I didn't love about this place is that bc the line is so long, they kind of want you out of there ASAP. So they will give you your check before you're done eating. I had paid and was finishing my tea and just browsing on my phone and they came and started clearing stuff off my table (mind you I was still drinking the tea I paid for) and I felt like they were kinda telling me to get outta there. Also, the bathroom situation is kinda sketchy. They have to give you code and you go into this industrial building. Just overall sketchy. If you are a female alone back there, be cautious. I'd just prefer if they had a bathroom on site in the restaurant. Would make me feel much more safe!

Either way, make sure you come here on your visit to SF! Promise you'll never get a fruit cup like this anywhere else!
author: Chelsea E.

description: Being from Pittsburgh, my wife and I appreciate good bread. And the more we travel, the more we realize you can't beat fresh Italian bread from Mancini's in Pittsburgh. But San Francisco is close. The fresh baked sourdough bread at Hollywood Cafe was reason enough to visit. But so is the enormous cup of fruit and the huge omelets. We are here for one more day, and may even eat here again.
author: Joe G.

description:
Awake early in the morning because of our jet-lag, we decided to take a chance on Hollywood Cafe. The name was cool and the menu looked really nice. There was no queue as they had only just opened a couple of minutes earlier, however if you arrive any later than 7:30 am you can expect to find a queue of at least 30 minutes to an hour. We got a table outside and within minutes ordered our food and coffee. The food was extremely well prepared and fresh, the service was quick and very polite. You could tell that they were no strangers to efficiency. The presentation of the food is really what makes this cafe different from the ordinary breakfast place. If you're looking for a place to take that perfect instagram picture then this is definitely the place to do it! 

The atmosphere is very nice too although the restaurant doesn't have any restrooms which is a major flaw in my eyes. Additionally they could do with a few extra tables inside as it can be quite cold outside on a San Francisco morning.

Overall I definitely recommend this to anyone who's looking for a delicious breakfast! We loved it so much that we decided to go back the following morning.
author: Tom H.

description:
My partner and I weren't too sure where to have breakfast in SF and found this little spot near the pier.

We came here and the line was sooooo long but it went by really quickly! The wait wasn't awful. Being from LA, we are also used to it.

The food comes out pretty quickly and everything is FRESH. All the fruit is delicious and the food is great. Customer service is just as great! We had the nicest waiter!
author: Dayana P.

description: Line moves really fast and the service is quick and efficient. The food is your typical breakfast fare which is difficult to mess up. I thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast and mimosa. This would be the kind of place to take out of towners due to its crowd pleasing nature
author: Sharvari J.

description:
This place is a must if you visit San Francisco. The restaurant is small size, so you must wait in line for around 15-20 minutes (ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT!)
My family loves to come here everytime we visit SF. I guarantee you will love it!
author: Alejandra D.

description: I was surprised at how quick the queue moves here. Both times we came here, we got a table within 15-20 minutes. That is kind of rare for brunch places in SF. The french toast and pancakes were really good. The blueberry pancake was moist and flavorful. The hash browns are really crispy and delicious. The veggie omelette was kind of average, it had some tiny stray pieces of meat...which might might bother vegetarians. Scrambled eggs were good. The orange juice served is quite fresh. Service was good. The patio seating can be good. Overall, really good place for a no fuss/relaxed brunch.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
Came to SF on vacation this summer.  Looked on Yelp for a good breakfast place near our hotel.  Hollywood Cafe had the best reviews, maybe 4 blocks away.  Definitely get there before 7:30 any day you go, though for a small place, the line moves pretty fast. They turn tables very quickly.

The food - awesome breakfast food.  Highly recommend the chorizo, which is spicy and flavorful - but not so spicy you cannot taste!  Coming from AZ, we get great chorizo and this was very much on par.  The specialty plates are definitely worth a try as well.  The Vivian Leigh is a personal favorite, the croissant is soft and fresh, the eggs cooked perfectly.  

But the best thing on the menu - must order - is the fruit bowl!  HUGE bowl of fruit, definitely get something that comes with it.  The specialties come with it.  You can order a separate one and it's $9.95 - which seems like a lot for a fruit bowl, but if you really just want fruit, it's plenty for breakfast.  Fresh variety and large amount; definitely worth the full price!
author: Keith N.

description:
Delicious food!

Just what we needed to kick off our morning in San Francisco.

A bit of a wait in the mornings, but don't fret, line moves quick.

Excellent service, even more excellent food.
author: Leslie A.

description: Loved the vanilla french toast with almonds! The french toast combo was good too. The fruit was fresh and we didn't have to wait to sit which was great.
author: Lauren J.

description: Awesome food! I had the ham and eggs. Well cooked, great coffee and ok service. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
author: Christen D.

description:
Came here for brunch after a run on a sunny Sunday. It had a line, but it was still so worth the wait. They move tables pretty quickly so although the line snaked around the corner when we got there, we waited 25-30 minutes.

I got a California salad, adding smoked salmon and a cup of the misugaru legume latte.

Starting with the misugaru legume latte - it was ok. It was a warm drink that was silky, slightly sweet, and nutty. The taste reminds me Chinese black sesame pudding while the texture was a slightly grainy soy milk. I wouldn't get it again, but it was nice trying it. 

The California salad ($13) came with avocado, sprouts, and tomatoes on top of a bed of mixed greens. It comes with a delicious, zesty lemon vinaigrette, which I got on the side. I added an order of smoked salmon ($4) on top of the salad. It comes with two pieces of toast and butter.

This was one of the best salads I had in a while. All of the ingredients were bright and fresh and the dressing was just absolutely fabulous. I mashed some avocado on top of toast and added smoked salmon to make some fancy avocado toast. The second piece of toast I spread their raspberry jam on as a dessert toast.
author: Jessica C.

description: It was delicious! Great place to stop by for brunch as a tourist and in walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions along the coast.
author: Chelle N.

description:
After reading the great reviews about this place, I had to check it out while visiting San Francisco. 

Be prepared to stand in line outside and wait for a table. Even a table for two took over 20 minutes. We sat outside on the patio in front of the cafe

The good portions are big and the food is tasty. Veggie omelet was very filling (add cheese please). 

Definitely would recommend this spot to anyone in the Frisco area.
author: e m.

description:
Excellent place for Breakfast but come hungry as the servings are huge!

I order a la cart as there was no way I could eat all the food when you order a Breakfast meal. I ordered scrambled eggs and bacon. If you like your bacon crispy be sure to ask for it to be cooked longer. It was good but it would have been better if I had ordered the pancakes or French toast but not on my diet plan.

However, on my second visit I broke my rules and ordered the original Eggs Benedict and could only eat one...OH MY.  Delicious. 
 
And be ready to wait in line. They offer seating inside and out and they are very efficient in turning the 18 tables.

While waiting in line you are lusting over the beauty of the food as the outside tables are filled with diners enjoying their meal.

So good and must place to eat while in SFO.
author: Mechelle S.

description: Food is really good staff are very friendly, eggs is very yummy definitely I will come back
author: Alan C.

description:
Don't let the long line fool you into thinking long wait. They are quick and run around organized and get you seated quickly. 
Excellent staff!
They food was fresh and top quality!
I got the sweet bacon with the eggs and it was the best bacon I've ever had. Must get!
author: Pamela R.

description: Great place to eat in North Beach. Be prepared to wait in line, but you'll get over it once you take your first bite! I love they serve fresh SF sourdough bread and butter with breakfast and the fresh fruit side dish is loaded with great berries and other fruit, not melon like you often get in other places.  We had an omelette with apple-chicken sausage and mushrooms-super yummy. Took half of it home and ate it for dinner.  I've just added this to the list of my favorite breakfast places in SF.
author: Kim B.

description: Fantastic, delicious superior place to eat! The line in front just proved it is worth waiting for. We were handed a menu while waiting and it was amazing how fast we were seated. The food is amazing: i had a traditional Benedict  and husband had some kind of delicious egg scramble. The has browns here are really superior to anyplace. The java was hot and fresh. We were not rushed but the wait staff were efficient and quick.
author: Linda M.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning and waited a good 25 minutes for our table. The staff were super friendly and efficient. 

Food was fresh, price was decent, service was good. Didn't think the food or place was unique so I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.
author: W W.

description: My party of 3 came here around 10 on a Friday morning and of course there was already a line forming outside. The staff are super efficient and the line went by quick. We sat outside and it was a nice spot to people watch. I had the chocolate chip pancakes that came with fruit along with 2 over easy eggs and hashbrowns and sourdough toast. The food was SO good. Just writing this review makes me drool over their pancakes. It's a little on the pricier side for breakfast but I think it's worth it. Service was good as well. Check out this place if you're in the area.
author: Nhu H.

description:
Food is good. Fresh ingredients and good portion. 

This place is 50% close to being a-hole-in-the-wall place. The wait is long. Our line was about 12 people and it took 40 minutes before we sat down. They have about 6 tables outside and 10 tables inside. They were busy and we didn't feel like they were pushing us out even though the check came right after we finished eating. You will need a code to get into the building restroom and it's a long hall way to get to inside. It's super dirty and needs major renovation. 

If I was to visit San Francisco again I'd go elsewhere
author: Vinh D.

description:
One Sunday, during noon time, I came here with a friend because we felt like getting breakfast food near North Beach. There was a short line when we arrived, and we quickly moved up and got seated since there was only one party ahead of us. We sat on one of the outside tables, and it felt pretty nice especially on a sunny day. I knew I wanted the pancakes coming in here, I just didn't know what type of pancakes. I eventually settled on the blueberry pancakes, although the combo would have been nice too. I just wasn't feeling like getting any meat at that time. Anyways, we ordered and our food came within ten minutes, which was pretty nice. 

The blueberry pancakes were great, and they were very nice fluffy. The staff was very generous with the fruits and it was nice of them to shower my pancakes with plenty of fresh assorted fruits. You could see there was a slice of grapefruit, two orange slices, strawberries, bananas, blackberries and a generous helping of blueberries on the side. Also, it was nice of them to give a very large dollop of whip cream on top. 

Overall, I thought the meal was fantastic, and the pancakes tasted pretty great. Generous portions all around and service was excellent for the price. Would definitely try to find another opportunity to come back. What could have made this place better is if they had more pancake flavors. But then again, that's just a personal preference and not a big deal. In summary, solid four stars and highly recommended to others looking for brunch near North Beach/Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Nelson X.

description: This would be my favorite spot for breakfast and definitely will go back. Foods were good for everyone. They have kids meal which very good price. My pancake was very nice with all the berries and orange sliced. My daughter was enjoying it so much with her plate and we were sharing the pancake. The service is excellent, likely is Thai people operated restaurant which I was enjoying their service so much. I would recommended anyone to drop by coz they are the only restaurant that open early at 7 am near by Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco.
author: Penwarat S.

description:
Came in here simply to try the fruit bowl and I must say that it's one of best fruit bowls that I've tasted. From the presentation to the variety of the fruits ( too many to list) it was quite good. It ran about $11 before tax which seemed fair given the amount of fruit given and the touristy location. 

I look forward to returning and trying other items on the menu .
author: Rod M.

description: Visit this place simply for the mountain of fruit you receive with your order. So fresh and wonderful. Everything else was just a bonus. Great place!!!!
author: Alexa G.

description:
This place is pretty good! We always walk past it in SF and there's always a line and a bunch of people seated outside. We had to give it a try....especially because it's called Hollywood Cafe and we're from Los Angeles...lol. 

You don't put your name down you just get in line but they do come ask how many are in your party and call you to get seated accordingly. Although there was a line of a quite few parties in front of us, we waited about 15 minutes. The line goes pretty fast. We glanced over the menu while waiting and I must say they have quite a few options. 

Got the French toast combo which has eggs, choice of meat, and 3 slices of French toast. I got the vanilla French toast which has banana purée and slices on with whipped cream and sliced almonds. Pretty good!! Love the banana touches on it. More sweet than the classic toast though because it has some cereal crust on top. 
Eggs were nicely cooked although I got over easy when I asked for over medium. 

Overall great place though
author: Melissa L.

description:
Went here on a perfect(sunny and not windy) San Francisco morning. Absolutely loved the food and the service. 

Reached a little early(~11 am), and got a seat in 15 mins. Got the rancheros eggs which were basically half fried eggs topped with nachos and cheese- cant beat that

Also tried the "Audrey Hepburn", perfect pancakes.
100% would recommend.
author: Apoorva M.

description:
This place was DELICIOUS! We were AMAZED by the food quality - everything was fresh, authentic and looked hand picked. The servers were very attentive. The meal itself was one of the best breakfast meals we have ever had in the last 28 years. This restaurant is a MUST! 

If you are reading a review that is less than 5 stars, that person either had a bad experience, which is a one off situation, or they didn't like all the positive reviews and wanted to be critical and stand out for attention. 

You should be done searching for your place to eat. This is definitely the place!
author: Tory H.

description: Don't be deterred by the long lines because the servers are fast and friendly. Tables turned over quickly and what appeared would be a lengthy wait only turned out to be about 20 minutes. The Dungeness Benedict was tasty and I appreciated that they don't skimp on the crab. It comes with a large serving of hash browns on the side and I washed it all down with one of their three mimosa choices (The Grand Mimosa). Overall pleasant experience that makes for a delicious and filling breakfast.
author: Mike C.

description: I would say 3.5 it was ok food the turkey eggs Benedict didn't give me a wow I didn't really like it. The Hollywood hash browns were pretty good. The basic pancake I felt it should've came with sides such as bacon and hash but it did not. I guess the price wasn't so bad for 3 pancakes and fruits on the side I believe it was about $9 . We spent the total of $40 on pancakes, eggs Benedict and 2 drinks honestly I felt like it wasn't worth $40. But I would come to try something else to give it another chance and see if it gives me the wow factor.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great breakfast place. The waiter and host was very kind and helpful! We chose to sit outside and a few minutes later we realized how sunny and uncomfortable it was. We asked to be moved inside and without a blink of an eye they cleared a table and moved us quickly! It was a Sunday morning and was VERY busy but we were served like it wasn't. I highly recommend this place!
author: Megan W.

description: Great spot! Food was quality and staff was okay. Only drawback is some of the prices. For a breakfast spot, their prices read more like dinner.
author: Nikki W.

description:
Food was good, all generic nothing to wow about. Price was a little high but that's all in San Fran. Long line for food you can find at Dennys. Service was alright, but again nothing to wow about. $6 for 1 pancake was a little too much for me, when at Dennys you get unlimited for 4.99...

The pancake felt rubbery too. Anyway good place to breakfast if you're around the corner and there is no line.

Also your entire party must be there with you, if not they won't count you in on sign in list.
author: Isaias P.

description: Took another group here for a 3rd time repeat visit and they loved it! The fruit bowls, customer service and efficiency make the wait in line worth it!
author: Becky K.

description:
What a cute little place to have brunch. Scott and I wanted to have an adventure in SF last weekend and wanted to try a random new place for brunch. Do you know how hard that was? Somehow we settled on this place.

He's a Benedict guy and so that's what he got. I ordered the vanilla French toast.

His Benedict was delegate and delicious. Really liked the presentation. It was simple, not overdone. Classic, just the way we like it.

My French toast was different. It was the first time I had "crispy" French toast. It seemed to be crusted in something but I did not mind it. There was some banana purée concoction hidden under the slices. I found the purée to be a nice add of flavor. I enjoyed the presentation as well. But charging $2 extra for syrup was a complete travesty to me. 

Brunch was good though and we got to sit outside....a must for brunch in my opinion! You get the ultimate bougie brunch experience that way!
author: Alexys E.

description:
Famous. The line will be long weekend or not. But fret not, that is part of the charm for this spot. 

What makes this place stand apart from most other brunch joints is their sweet and healthy bowl of fruit salad that usually accompanies your breakfast delight. 

I recommend the breakfast mimosa flight. 

Other than these couple highlights, there is nothing spectacularly special about the way they cook their eggs, toasts, or bacon. Even the benedicts weren't something to "die for". You can have a similar experience at any other less pricey brunch/breakfast eatery.
author: Dave Y.

description: ...maybe it's just me, but has to be the most overrated breakfast place in the world. I don't understand the line-ups out the door. Most of what they do is typical breakfast fare, that you can find at most any other "breakfast" joints... nothing extraordinary. If you don't want to lineup, don't - it isn't worth the wait at all.
author: Audrey L.

description:
My husband and I have been here on several occasions while visiting San Francisco. It's one of those places that we HAVE TO visit when we are in town. 

My husband loves the Dungenous crab benedict. He absolutely LOVES this dish so much that he refuses to order anything else. I change up my order but for the most part, my favorites are the Vivian Leigh (scrambled eggs, bacon, and mild cheddar served on a croissant with a bowl of fresh fruit) and the Dolce French toast. This place never disappoints! The food looks as amazing as it tastes. The fruit that comes with the Vivian Leigh and the Dolce French toast are always as fresh as can be. All of the food that we've tried from here is good, it never disappoints. 

The service is excellent, very fast and friendly. The restaurant itself is always clean and well kept. There is always a line to dine here but it moves rather quickly and the food is certainly worth the wait.
author: Valerie R.

description: I really enjoy this please I love The food is always amazing. When you arrive there is normally a line in front of the restaurant but it moves very quickly the staff is very friendly and always serves you with a smile. This time I had the blueberry pancakes a side of bacon and hashbrowns to be honest this is a lot of food. The portions are large and very delicious. I sat in the outside of the restaurant they have heaters above the tables and it keeps you nice and warm and cozy regardless of how chilly it may be outside. I recommend this place because the smiles are beautiful and the coffee is nice and hot...
author: Nick D.

description: Reasonable breakfast hotspot near Fisherman's Wharf.  Get there early or the line will be down the block.  The French toast was absolutely incredible.  The eggs were good too, but the French toast was easily the winner of our brunch.  The prices are reasonable and outdoor seating is available too.  A solid spot for breakfast.
author: Ally B.

description: This place was the bomb for breakfast! I got the three eggs with chips, avocado, pico and such. It was great and it was less than 17.00 and change. My buddy ate at the hotel across the street and said he paid 40+ for an omelette and bacon....whoops! If you are in the Fisherman's wharf area don't let this unassuming little joint pass you by, you won't be sorry.
author: Mike H.

description:
The restaurant is super busy and hype! My parents loved their orders but personally I was a little upset because I ordered salmon toast which was supposed to have avocado and smoked salmon but it had smoked salmon and asparagus. Lol, did they think "Let's put another green thing in there and she won't notice?" 

My sister also really loved hers which was the banana chocolate pancakes. Giving 4/5 stars because their flavors are great and my family loved their dishes but I'm still salty.
author: Emella C.

description: This breakfast spot had the best service, couldn't believe how attentive the staff was. The blueberry pancakes were fast and delicious. Don't forget to order a side of hash browns.
author: Christopher M.

description:
I heard about this place through a friend and wow am I glad I took her advice! I ordered the vanilla Crunchy French Toast with a California club/fries and it was delicious! The customer service was also great. They were very attentive which is a big plus for me.

The prices were also very reasonable. Definitely recommend and will be back next time I'm in San Fran !
author: Steve M.

description: There was a long line but it went by pretty fast. We sat outside and I ordered the eggs Benedict with hashbrowns - it was delicious and I could tell that the hollandaise sauce was homemade. My daughter ordered the walnuts cinnamon French toast which she said was the best. Bacon was also very delicious. The wait staff was very friendly and accommodating, The restaurant was very clean. I would definitely come eat here again!
author: Toni T.

description: Great breakfast/brunch spot. There's a 20-30 mins wait in the morning, but worth it if you're wanting a hearty breakfast. Fluffy overstuffed omelettes (chicken apple sausage w/mushrooms was wonderful). Fruit bowls featured wide variety of perfectly ripe berries, melons, citrus, bananas, etc. No one at our table managed to clean their plate, and everyone walked away happy. Wait staff works well as a team. I did notice that when it's really busy, a number of tables were not getting all their orders at the same time. Happened to us today. Would come back if I'm not in a rush.
author: Maria F.

description: My friends and I had an incredible brunch experience here while visiting San Francisco. We tried this place completely on a whim after I read several great reviews about it. We weren't disappointed. My friend said this was her favorite dining spot out of all the places we tried while vacationing. I'd definitely come back the next time I'm visiting the Bay Area. The portions, prices, and taste are all excellent!
author: Deisha L.

description: I very rarely want to dine in the same restaurant twice in San Francisco because there are so many options. But this place is somewhere I will bring anyone who comes to visit because the food is so crazy good. I had the banana chocolate chip pancakes and they were perfection. They also give you a side of fruit which is so fresh. There is also a lot of great options on the menu and I can't wait to go back. Every time I pass by there is a huge line. But it's worth the wait!!
author: Amy D.

description:
Just casually checking all my bookmarked places on yelp and saw this place, then and I was like I have to leave a review. 

I went there back in November and I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Food is more than perfect. Staffs are really nice and welcoming. Longer lines during popular hours. I went 4 times during my 6 days trip in sf. Recommend this place 101%. I would definitely go again when I'm in sf next.
author: Elise F.

description:
A group of four of us showed up at 9:45 (the fifth in their way) on a Saturday and had to wait in line for about 30-45 which we expected since the restaurant is small and popular. First of all, the wait is worth it so don't let that scare you away.

Second, be warned that they will not seat you until your whole party is present. This is the only issue we had. We waited the 30-45 minutes and we were missing our fifth person and we had to convinced them it was okay and promised them we would order for our fifth person so that they would seat us. It was a little frustrating, especially after waiting for so long. 

On the up side, the food was delicious!! Two of us had the eggs Benedict (with crab) and the French toast combo with the Dolce style French toast (both pictured). Everything was served quickly and delicious. We highly recommend the food and mimosas! 

Oh, be warned if you sit outside the homeless may harass you briefly but the owners are quick to chase them away. 

Highly recommend and enjoy!
author: Laura L.

description:
Wowee my fav spot for breakfast!  There was a line out the door at 0745 but it moved quickly.  Service polite and fast.

The Vivien Leigh special was awesome - croissant flaky and tasty bacon with eggs.

My fruit salad was amazing - almost every fruit imaginable - banana, blackberries, blueberries, cantaloupe, grapes, grapefruit honeydew, kiwi, orange, raspberries, strawberries, and watermelon !!!

Highly recommended!!!
author: Christine L.

description: Came here on Christmas Eve and arrived at open time. There was no line to get in when we showed up but there was when we left. Fiancée ordered chilaquiles which were not chilaquiles. She got scrambled eggs with tortilla chips that looked like they were from a generic store brand. Extremely disappointing. I enjoyed my Denver omelette. I liked the hash brown even more. Waiter could've been nicer.
author: Juan M.

description:
This place is worth the wait! Great place for breakfast, especially after the Across the Bay 12K yesterday. Needed carbs super bad after the race so my friends & I trekked on over since it was very close to where we parked our car.

The wait was about 30 mins on a Sunday morning. There is no list, but a line. Someone comes down the line and asks how many is in your party and they write it down but you must stay in line. They don't take names! 

Once seated we were promptly asked for our drink order. I opted for the mango mimosa. Unfortunately, there was no hint of mango at all! I think we ended up with regular mimosas but it's OK. They are all the same price at $8 a glass. Not a fan of mimosas? They have bloody mary's made with soju - also $8!

Food wise, I'm pretty basic. I like my typical 2 egg breakfast. I ordered mine with bacon and you get a side of hasbrowns & sour dough toast. SO. GOOD. My fiance made a good point and said that typically at breakfast places, you get super oily greasy diner food. But not here! We left feeling full but not greasy - YES!
author: Andrea F.

description:
Was staying down the street at the Sheraton and was glad my girlfriend and I came here for breakfast.

We got to the restaurant around 11am and there was no one in line with only about 3 open tables. As soon as we got seated, a line formed really fast! We got pretty lucky. We also ended up sitting outside in the nice weather with a view of the street.

I ordered the Meat Lover Omelette with a side of hash browns. The side of hash browns was more like an entree! The portion was out of this world. It was like the size of an iPad. The omelette came with cheese, sausages, bacon bits, and ham. It was amazing. I also ordered a Mango Mimosa, but it tasted just like a normal mimosa with orange juice. It was good though, so no complaints here. The service was fine and the price was very reasonable.

If I'm back again in SF, I would definitely come back here for breakfast/brunch.
author: Derek D.

description: Good food, slightly burnt coffee, attentive service in a small cafe.  We both got the breakfast burritos and they were satisfying for about 7 hours without feeling like a belly bomb.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Hollywood Cafe was two blocks from the Sheraton we stayed at and with so many positive reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try. We arrived around 11am with no wait. The seats inside were all taken, so we were seated outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather. The options on the menu were plenty with so many brunch choices. 

I ordered Rancheros, which was a Mexican inspired dish packed full of flavor that included 2 eggs, spicy tomato sauce, avocado, cheese and lettuce on top of tortilla chips and a huge side of hash browns. Omg, the hash browns were perfectly crispy, lightly seasoned and so very delicious! I wish we ordered pancakes, but we had so much food on our plates that I'm glad we didn't. Hopefully, next time!

Our food came out at a decent time and the servers were very accommodating. The prices are average, but for about $14 a plate, the servings are huge and worth it.
author: Gina S.

description:
Very cute brunch spot located by the pier! 
Not much of a wait for a table for 4 on a Sunday! We were very lucky. 
Not a fancy cafe, but a chill- laid back spot to have good food and good conversations. 
I got the chai tea latte, which tasted great but was a bit too sweet even when I asked for less chai. Honestly my drink tasted like milk tea for some reason, but none the less very delicious.
I got the Denver omelette (14.99) with an upgrade of Hollywood hash browns (2.99). 
Portions are hefty, so bring your appetite! My omelette was filled with cheesey goodness-chopped up cubed ham, with nicely grilled onions & bell peppers. YUM. Hash browns were delicious-crispy and thin. The "Hollywood" hash browns just comes with some bacon, green onions, mushrooms, and some melted cheese. Great addition to the crispy potatoes! 
Waiters are nice and attentive. Tables seemed clean, but the down side is that the restroom is outside the restaurant, through another door and down 2 different hallways. A bit annoying. 
Definitely would be back to this spot if I'm in the area- but parking is a biiaaa
author: Maria C.

description: Best brunch in the city. Usually a wait, but they get people in and out pretty quick. I've had the omelette and French toast so far. Usually back and forth between those. My lady friend got a pancake on my last trip and it looked pretty good and big in size. Came with a generous portion of fresh fruit too. Added a mimosa flight which was great. Their OJ is the freshest I've EVER tasted hands down.
author: Andre P.

description: Last day in San Francisco we on the beach again before start next trip we decided to have lunch here
author: Maddy J. R.

description:
Not only is it the food appealing to the eye it's amazing going in the belly!!!
Latte was soo good for a restaurant and well!!
Good service and clean!! A must in  u
author: Melissa G.

description: Great breakfast!  Big portions and variety of fresh fruit. Line moves fast.  Every plate that passed us looked good!
author: Kathy M.

description: The service at this place is outstanding. We barely ordered before the food came out! It was really very fast service and they constantly checked on you and your beverage. I had the egg sandwich. I was expecting one sandwich and there were two! I will say that the sandwich tasted ok but there wasn't much flavor to it. I saw some other people ordering the fruit bowl, and I wish I had gotten that. It is massive and packed with tasty looking fruit. This place is busy but they get people in and out pretty fast so even if there is a line it moves quickly.
author: Tabitha M.

description: I had two very delicious breakfasts at Hollywood cafe while on vacation in San Francisco. I especially loved the sourdough toast and enormous hash brown! The French Toast was amazing and came with nice fresh fruit. The food was also very well presented and I was actually happy just looking at it before I tasted! See pictures attached!
author: Leo A.

description:
This place was amazing!! So good and worth the wait. Yes, there is a wait. But I would wait in that line again. 

Great mimosas flight. There were 4 of us and we were all extremely happy with our food! It's small and feels a little claustrophobic, but great food at not a bad price. Family friendly, quiet and delicious. Go here!!
author: Celeste C.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried Hollywood Cafe for the first time today and it did not disappoint. We got there at 9:30 am and waited in line for about 20 minutes, which allowed us to explore the menu and decide on what we were going to eat. The restaurant is fairly small and cozy and decorated with framed pictures of celebrities.

As far as breakfast goes, I ended up ordering two eggs with the ham steak and Hollywood hash browns (instead of the regular hash browns, for an extra 2.99). The plate came with 3 pieces of lightly toasted sourdough bread. Overall, the food tasted great, but here are my critiques:

- the ham steak was slightly dry - most likely because it was charred, which added flavor, so I can't complain 
- the Hollywood hash browns were very good, but there really wasn't enough onion/mushroom/bell pepper mixture on them, which is a little bit disappointing when you're spending an extra 3$ just for that 

I would recommend this place if you enjoy good food, want large portions and don't mind waiting in line for a little while.
author: Sabrina B.

description: The Hollywood Cafe is a delicious spot in San Francisco. The service was wonderful and the food was fresh and delicious.
author: Kayla J.

description:
Nestled between the wharf and another random building, Hollywood Cafe offers a variety of breakfast staples. 

I decided on the pancake combo after a night of heavy sangria drinking and avoiding the SantaCon crew. The pancakes were fluffy and the sausage was really tasty. 

So why didn't they get five stars? Cause it's a freaking mission to find the restroom. 

Once you pay a toll, you rummage your way through the jungle, solve the riddle, climb the forbidden ladder and find a talking monkey to help you the rest of the way. 

If it was past 8p, I'd be scared out of my mind to use this restroom. Wish they were able to somehow have one IN the restaurant and not having to walk through the shady back hall and punch codes to get to it.
author: Rosa P.

description: I really enjoyed the over flowing fruit cup and the Dungenous Crab Eggs Benedict was so yummy!!
author: Julia R.

description: Went here for second breakfast and enjoyed everything we tried. Yes, second breakfast, I had already eaten eggs at home before showing up to this place so I tried their veggie breakfast sandwich which has SO many vegetables of all kinds. So many that it's basically impossible to pick up and eat. I was forced to 'deconstruct' it. My friend thought she was paying way too much for two pancakes until it came out with a giant bowl of various very fresh fruit. Totally a good value for all that when most breakfast places will charge a few bucks for a little saucer of over- and under-ripe melon. They don't  skimp on the expensive HEALTHY ingredients and we loved that. Servers were very nice even though they were trying to close pretty soon after we sat down. I'd return.
author: New2Northbeach N.

description:
So worth the trip!!! Th best Dungeness crab omelette I have ever had!!!
I would recommend the Hollywood Cafe to all my family and friends. Make the stop and eat some excellent food.
author: Paul D.

description:
Oh my gosh! Worth the wait!  We were so excited to find this little gem! We wanted a delicious little place to eat and were beyond thrilled when we found out this was only a block from our hotel! We love good food and truly this place started our day off right! 
I ordered the Audrey Hepburn and my hubby ordered the French toast combo.. I also ordered the Hollywood hash because why not lol... Everything tasted fresh.. they had beautiful fresh fruit! The pancakes were good (while I realize it's hard to mess them up it was seriously delicious!) 
He loved his French toast we both loved the bacon.. the Hollywood hash was so tasty! We both loved every bite! Ps love that they give you a menu while you wait... best way to get people in and out is to have them know what they want before they sit down! Lol
author: Tanya B.

description:
HUGE. (That's what she said). 

Yeah, yeah go on and throw that dungeness crab benedict at my face for that lame one. 

Seriously, what drew me to this place were the generous portions. Definitely come hungry. Service is fast and friendly. Don't expect any innovative flavors. Great value, solid spot to break your fast. 

+ NO reservations
author: Merica S.

description: This place is amazing! The line was around the corner, but the wait was only 15 minutes.  The service was super-attentive.  The food was quick and delicious.  It was, by far, the best breakfast I've had in the last 5 years.
author: Adina G.

description: Food was delicious!!!  Definitely would come back and highly recommend.   Ordered pancakes, eggs, sausage, and fruit. Yum!
author: Lisa P.

description: Crab omelette w sweet bacon was so good! Wait down the street looked long but got in within 30 min. Great service.
author: David D.

description: Cute little cafe, will definitely be coming back when in San Francisco, specialize in breakfast and brunch, which is why they have short hours 9am-1:45pm, coming from L.A you know I loved the restaurant name.
author: Chelo A.

description:
Fresh fruit overload!!!  This place has the best fresh fruit ever!!

The restaurant is real cute and quaint.  We sat at a little table by the window and enjoyed every minute.  The waiter was nice and my omelette was delish!  As I stated earlier, the fresh fruit was the star of my meal!  We will definitely be coming back to Hollywood Cafe in our next visit to San Fran!
author: Anissa G.

description: 2nd time here and still 100% a five! Cant beat the omelettes and fresh fruit salad. Home cooking at it's best. They even have home made jam on the table. No prepackaged Smuckers. A little pricey but worth it when you visit SF. Get there early. Lines get long and seating is limited.
author: Andy C.

description: Vegeterian eggs whites omelette and fresh toasts  excellent breakfast, cozy, good service, highly recommended,
author: Jorge B.

description:
Fantastic traditional American breakfast. I had the 3 egg Denver omelet. it was so generous I had to get an extra order of hash browns just to balance it out.

But okay let's be honest San Francisco has a bad homeless problem. Eating Within earshot  of Commander phlegm was just not the most enjoyable experience for breakfast.

Service in food are great.
author: Todd C.

description: The Dungenous Crab Eggs Benedict is the best eggs benny I have ever had! So good! Show up right at 7 am to get a seat right away, this place fills up quick. We got our order taken immediately, the food and the bill came fast. Wham bam thank you ma'am and we were fat and happy. I love this place.
author: Angie M.

description: So much food for great prices and the fruit bowl was HUGE without it being half melons. Hash browns were crispy enough but not too crispy. Bacon was crispy as well! Would definitely walk 2 miles to eat here (which I did because parking is a pain).
author: Susan K.

description: This place is the best breakfast spot around! Be prepared to wait anywhere from 15-30 minutes BUT so worth it! Service is great, Food is better! The fruit is all so fresh. Their sourdough bread and butter is to DIE for!  My husband got the B.A.T (bacon, avocado, tomato) scrambled eggs with hash and toast. I got the Dolce French Toast. I've ate here in the past and no matter what you eat, you can't go wrong. I highly recommend visiting this cafe.
author: Kelley W.

description: Please don't be too concerned with my two star rating it was just my one time experience,,, Yes you have to stand in line but it goes pretty quick. My food was awesome ,, my girl friends food ,, well not so bad but but with her crab Egg Benedict there were huge chunks of lemon with the pill still on them and seed not quite right on the pallet to taste that bitterness of the lemon rind ,, when I asked them about this they told me they put the lemon in there to keep the smell from the taint of the crab smell down because he said sometimes crab get stinky well if you have stinky crab it means you do not have fresh crab because fresh crab does not stink like that ,, and customer service I understand they're busy but the customer service could be better they barely came back to check on us,, would I go back yes I would the rest of the food was amazing
author: Mike V.

description: Came here for a quick breakfast before meetings with my sister. No wait on a Tuesday morning. I ordered the vanilla French toast which sat atop a banana-cinnamon-y purée and my sister had the smoked salmon eggs Benedict. Benedict was interesting as it was served with asparagus (I'm used to spinach) but overall was tasty. I loved my dish-- a huge fan of banana! French toast was rolled in what appeared to be some type of flake cereal (Frosted Flake-like) and had a great crunchy texture to the exterior. Served with fresh strawberries, blackberries, and orange slices.
author: Julie N.

description:
What a great breakfast spot! We waited about 15 minutes on a Saturday morning for a table. The staff was super friendly and the food was exactly what we hoped for. Well prepared, thoughtfully plated and fast. If you are looking for a classic American breakfast with filling portions, this is the perfect choice.

*I ordered the sweet bacon which had a smokey bbq flavor.it was great, but not quite what I was expecting from the description.
author: Jessa Y.

description: It was good. Simple, yet homely. Me, and my brothers friend's family really liked it. The eggs were nice, but the food were kinda expensive and the Line was extremely long. It was visually pleasing and I really enjoyed it there.
author: Gyuri H.

description:
Oooowee!!!! Hollywood Cafe lived up to all the hype! Nice location! I arrived around 0930 all tables inside were occupied and there was a 15-20 min wait. I wanted inside seating due to it being 55degrees outside( I'm from the south that's cold). So I sat and waited. Their kitchen is opened so you could see the cooks and staff preparing the food. 
Well I couldn't wait any longer (only waited about 5min) I was starving so I asked to be seated outside. Just my luck they had heaters above the tables!! So now I was ready to order!
I ordered the Audrey Hepbun. IT WAS DELICIOUS! Pancakes were just right, just enough butter, right amount of powdered sugar, and the syrup was good. Now on to this fruit bowl!!! It included blackberries, raspberries, apples,green and red grapes, honey dew melon, cantaloupe, orange slices, grapefruit, bananas, kiwis, and a slice of watermelon. All fresh and sweet! I was very satisfied with this breakfast!
author: Joiya A.

description: Don't let the line intimidate you.. it moves fast! Service, mango mimosas and food (avocado toast) were all great! We will definitely be back!
author: Nycole R.

description: Every time I'm in SF I make sure to have breakfast here. Food is delicious. Fresh and very flavorful. I love the sparagus eggs Benedict and the Marilyn Monroe French toast. Useful Tip- come early, the line firms quick. The place is small so if ur not an early bird you can wait for about 1 hour
author: Cyn R.

description: Good service, but these are not chilaquiles! Nacho chips with jalapeños and just throw in some eggs, doesn't make it chilaquiles! Just saying. Not even spicy at all, whatsoever. Wish they would have made it more authentic and a lot better tasting.
author: Maryanna G.

description: Very impressed! There was a line outside when we arrived at 9 am Sunday morning, but we were sat almost immediately as a party of 7. The service was quick and we ordered and got our food after only waiting a couple of minutes. I ordered the Dolce French toast with a side of Hollywood hash browns that had bacon and cheddar cheese on top. Everything was delicious, my only wish is that the Dolce French toast had more carmel drizzle instead of just on the bananas. But other than that I have zero complaints, friendly staff also!
author: Victoria C.

description:
I was a little unhappy when I saw the line in front, but I am happy to say it went by rather quickly.

The food was great and definitely hit the spot. My classic french toast combo was everything I hoped it'd be. 

Don't expect much when it comes to service-- it's clear the staff just wants to get you in and out as soon as possible. I didnt mind because i just wanted my food as soon as possible. 

I would recommend if youre looking for a satisfying quick breakfast.
author: Allison Q.

description: Food here is delicious! Everything tasted fresh and full of flavor! I ordered avocado toast! Loved it! Service was friendly but it did take a while to get the food. This place is packed! The only thing we didnt like it water... tap water that tasted bad but not enough issue to drop a point because loved the food!
author: Anu W.

description: There was a short wait but when we got inside it was a great experience all around. The wait staff worked together to knock things out and did it with a smile and was very helpful with any needs we had. The eggs were buttery, in a good way, and i love their toast. It was more like a bakers bread rather than a loaf of white bread. Great experience overall.
author: Kristy T.

description: Pretty good food. Very impressed! The California club was the best sandwich I've had in years!
author: Matthew M.

description: Came here for a late lunch (around 11am) and there was a short wait, but not as bad as I expected. Once inside, the service was very quick and we ordered food right away. I got the BAT scramble (minus the tomatoes) and I substituted the side of hash browns for an order of fresh fruit (extra charge of $3.99). The food was fantastic and portions very generous. There was a great variety of fruit (banana, grapes, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries and citrus fruits) that came in the fruit bowl and it was all very fresh. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great breakfast options in the area!
author: Kathleen L.

description: I felt the reviews didn't meet the standard I was hoping for. The quality of the food wasn't great. I can compare this to any typical greasy spoon. If that's your thing, you will love it here. The service was fast and friendly.
author: Isabel P.

description:
Visited on a Saturday morning around 8 AM. There was a wait of about 10 minutes but the staff provided us menus in line and the weather was beautiful. 

We ordered the eggs Benedict with bacon, asparagus, and tomatoes as well as French toast. The eggs Benedict was FANTASTIC! Probably the best I've ever had. The French toast was good but nothing to write home about. Service was prompt and very courteous. Prices were reasonable for the area. We spent about $36 which included a tip. 

There is outdoor seating as well as indoor seating but space is tight. However, everyone is very friendly so we had a chance to chat with neighboring couples. 

Overall a great little spot close to hotels and the wharf.
author: Spencer R.

description:
This was a good find! Staying down the street at a AirBNB, we used our trusty Yelp to find a place for breakfast. We made the walk on down and were glad we did.

Once we got there, there was already a line of people waiting for a table. It didn't take us too long to get a table, only about 15 minutes. I didn't see the inside, but there were a few outside tables which is where we ended up sitting. From the entrance, I could see a coffee bar which was super cute and inviting.

We sat down and were greeted instantly. A very nice young man took our drink order and food order. My roommate ordered the french toast combo and I order the Dungeness Crab Benedict. MMMM. Mine was fantastic. Lemony and savory. Cooked to perfection. The crab was great! Very fresh. My roommate said his french toast was probably the best he's ever had out at a restaurant. I was surprised! He is a french toast aficionado, if there is such a thing haha. Either way, he orders it everywhere so this place really must have been the best he's ever had!

The service was prompt, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was very enjoyable. Highly recommend!
author: Zoe F.

description:
Would give more stars if I could. Expect a 30min'ish wait I  a weekend, but the wait is soooo worth it. Staff brings you a menu, so you have a great idea of what you want. 

Then the food... you could just share a plate, but I'd rather stab a mo-fo than share my shrimp-salmon eggs Benny. The ommlett my dad ordered was also amazing & could feed a family. The bloody Mary is the right kinda spicy. They also offer both hot & iced coffee, mmmmm.

The staff was super polite & very friendly.
author: Veronica B.

description:
I have to say that I loved going out to Hollywood Cafe for breakfast/brunch. Being the potato maniac that I am, I was more than excited to try their hashbrowns. And wow, they did not disappoint. They were well seasoned, crispy, and just overall savory potato goodness. I typically get a sweet and a savory option during brunch so I opted for the classic french toast alongside the hashbrowns. The french toast was very good and incredibly filling. My friend ordered an egg dish which came with a side of toast and I have to admit, that was some amazing toast. 

The wait can get a bit ridiculous if you go close to peak meal times. The line is typically formed just outside the restaurant and there didn't seem to be any type of list. Get there early, grab a seat, and have some great food!
author: Lakshmi M.

description: We had breakfast at about 9am Sunday morning and only waited maybe 10 minutes. I had French toast and a side of sausage and my son had the blueberry pancakes. The fresh orange juice was delicious but the sausage lacked flavor and the banana on my plate was overripe. My son enjoyed his pancakes and my French toast was sweet and fluffy. Overall it was a good experience, good service and reasonably priced.
author: Brittany C.

description: I've always heard great review about the Hollywood cafe but there is always a huge line up, no matter how good reviews are I'm just not that keen on waiting in line for anything. On this gorgeous sunny morning i walked by and there was no line up but about a 5-10 minute wait to sit outside, that seemed reasonable so i waited. I ordered the crab omelette. It was absolutely delicious, gigantic and filled with goodness. I ate at 10 am and kept me full till 6 . Absolutely worth the line up if you are into that kinda of thing...
author: Stefanie K.

description:
(Warning: super belated review. I just found the photos of this place again from when I wasn't so into Yelp, and started drooling over the fruit again.)

If you're big on fruit and healthy foods at breakfast, I suggest checking out Hollywood Cafe if you're in this part of town. It's a tiny little place close to the wharf, but far enough from the hustle and bustle that you'll be fine. They'll start you off with coffee, which gets to the table really quickly, and a plate of sourdough, SF's finest. Both are pretty good, although the tastes conftrast each other if you take a bite of one after a sip of the other.

When I came, I got the Vivian Leigh (croissant sandwich), and while the cheese, eggs, and bacon weren't anything special, the variety of fruit in January really was. It's not berry season this time of year, so it was a pleasantly sweet surprise. I think I struggled to finish the fruit more than I did the sandwich. If it's any rule I live by, though, it's that if you can't finish everything on your plate, at least go for the expensive stuff. The place in general is average-priced by SF standards, and I'd argue it's a really good place to still get breakfast among the brunch craze.

If you get a seat inside, the service is really fast and you get to see the servers maneuvering their way around the tiny place, which is kind of fun to watch in and of itself. :) You go, servers!
author: Gwen W.

description: We got into fisherman's wharf Friday and saw the line around the block, we decided to come in on Saturday early to beat the line. It worked, so if you want to avoid lines come in early! Onto the food, my wife got the healthy plate and was pretty happy with it. I got the crab Benedict, wasn't super impressed but it was a decent plate and the service was good. They left the lemon peels in hollandaise so I'd randomly eat lemon skin with my Benedict. Other than that it was a good meal.
author: Johnny B.

description:
Despite the line forming out the door we were seated fairly quickly however our food did take some time to arrive. Oh well that's what you get for Sunday morning next to the Wharf.

If you are hungry or hungover Hollywood Cafe has got you covered. The portions are large and everything comforting about breakfast. I ordered the B.A.T (which stands for bacon, avocado, tomato) three egg scramble with hollywood hash browns. Three eggs with all those veggies and cheddar cheese came to be a huge omelet. Next to it was a huge slab of hash browns and of course I had fat eyes and had to get them hollywood style so more bacon, mushrooms, cheese, green onion, and the kitchen sink. It would have been a bit more unique and tasty if they mixed in the hollywood part with the potatoes and then fried it but I was able to just mix it up myself. The orange juice was also freshly squeezed which is a huge thumbs up. The table next to us got the mimosa sampler which looked heavenly but I was still suffering from hell/a major hangover. Hollywood Cafe tops regular diner food and definitely hit the spot.
author: Debi N.

description:
I can't believe I never tried this place!  

I had a hankering for a really delish fruit bowl with my breakfast.  After browsing through some spots on yelp, I came across Hollywood Cafe.  I found beautiful pics of fruit bowls and that was the deciding factor.  

When we got there, we only had to wait 5 minutes before getting a table.  Awesome.  I ordered chicken apple sausage, eggs, wheat toast, and subbed potatoes for a fruit bowl.  

My egg was odd though...overcooked and tasted like lemon?  Not sure what happened there.   Otherwise, everything else was excellent.  The fruit bowl was ginormous and stacked with various types of deliciousness:  blackberries, raspberries, watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, orange, grapes, and grapefruit.

I loved the jam on the table also.  Service was excellent and my coffee never saw the bottom of the cup.  5 stars and a revisit very soon.
author: Jen W.

description:
New Year, New Restaurants! Met up with a friend to have brunch in San Francisco. Chose to go to Hollywood Cafe on Sunday at 10:45 am. By the time I got there, there was a line about 10 people deep. The restaurant itself is small, but the kitchen and wait staff do a tremendous job of getting people seated and fed in a timely manner. Excellent service as demonstrated by the 5 times a waiter asked my friend if he wanted more coffee every time they saw his cup was running low. 

I ordered the Dungeness crab Benedict. The English muffin was crisp and there was a good amount of crab meat and spinach. I wasn't expecting the slice of lemon which was refreshing at first but then began to take over the taste of everything else because of the level of sourness. I understand it was there most likely to help reduce the "fishy" taste of crab, but it ended up taking away from everything except the egg. The egg was beautifully presented but, once cut into, revealed that it was slightly overcooked as the egg wasn't runny in the way I'd expect a Benedict to be. That being said, it's the best crab benedict that I've had in SF so far. 

The hash browns that came with my meal were excellent. They were crisp, crunchy, thin, and in a big portion. I'm glad it wasn't just undercooked carbs on my plate. 

The orange juice was freshly squeezed with plenty of pulp. This is how I like my orange juice so I thoroughly enjoyed having it with my food. 

I would definitely come back to try other items on the menu despite all the places I'd still like to try in SF. When the service and food are good, it's hard not to want to come back.
author: Olivia C.

description: The food was fantastic!  A little on the expensive side but worth it in my opinion.  I had the vanilla French toast and it was incredible.  My wife had the California BLT? And she loved it also.  Good location close to the tourist attractions.  Will definitely go back again.
author: Wes F.

description: I was drooling over all of the other reviews, but my meat lovers omelet was not super exciting.  It was good, but not THAT good like everyone is raving about.  The hash browns were lacking flavor.  Service was good, no line at 11am on a Tuesday when we went.
author: Kay S.

description:
After a disappointing trip to Pat's Cafe, we decided to check out Hollywood.  There was a bit of a wait to get inside.  We waited about 20 minutes, which wasn't bad.  The interior is pretty cramped and there aren't many seats, but the decor is nice as are the employees.  We could have sat outside, but it was cold and there was this large truck hauling bikes parked right in front, making a lot of noise.

The food was terrific.  I had the vanilla french toast with bacon.  My wife had the hash burrito and couldn't finish it all.  Overall a good experience and location.
author: Fred P.

description:
Fresh food, good customer service 
I recommend it .
The line might be long but is definitely worth it. The food is served pretty quick for how many people are there and the employees were nice and caring. It's located near pier 39 so you can go and check out the other attractions
author: Adel K.

description:
I came here for brunch with my husband while we were traveling out of town. We got there around 10:30 on Saturday morning and their was already a line outside. It moved quickly and we were seated in  15-20 minutes. 

The menu is overwhelming, especially when this is the first meal of the day and want to start off on the right foot. Half a star off for the amount of times we were asked if we were ready to order in a 10 minute window. We were clearly still actively looking at the menu and were giving no "we're ready to order" signals. Not the end of the world. 

I ordered the Vivian Leigh (egg, cheese, and bacon on a croissant with a HUGE fruit bowl). My sandwich was yummy with big chunks of bacon. Not too cheesy, which was nice. But honestly, the thing that blew me away about this breakfast was the fruit bowl! It was the largest serving of fruit I've ever seen in a restaurant and contained everything: grapes, raspberries, blackberries, oranges, grapefruit, banana, apple, honeydew, cantaloupe, kiwi, and pineapple. Insane. 

My hubby got a vegetarian omelet with bacon and the Hollywood hash. He was underwhelmed and had some serious food envy of my meal. As with many veggie omelets, it was a little watery tasting. The hash also didn't really do it for him. 

Once we ordered I felt like the rush we were feeling from the staff ended. We ate in peace with a few coffee refills. Overall, I really enjoyed this place. Ask my husband, though, and he'd probably give it 3 stars.
author: Rachel T.

description: This place is a must in San Francisco for breakfast. You will wait (even on weekdays) but it's worth it. We ate outside and the weather was beautiful. Prompt service and waters right away. Husband ordered the breakfast sandwich and was surprised by how big it was, in fact, there were 2! My omelette was delicious and we split a bowl of fruit which was enormous. Breakfast was delicious and not horribly expensive for SF. Would've eaten there again but found it on our last day.
author: Jamie S.

description: This is a San Fransisco gem & a must for anyone wanting a delicious breakfast/brunch. The staff is attentive, quick & efficient. The food is delicious. We tried the egg sandwich, veggie breakfast sandwich, Vanilla French Toast and original breakfast & all were outstanding. The cost is SF standard, but more than worth it. Simply a memorable spot that I will be coming back to!
author: Jose Q.

description:
Great service, great food & multiple types of Mimosa's!  
Loved the food! I had the S.A. with a side of capers, def. coming back.
author: Sadies M.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped here for breakfast Tuesday morning around 9am and the restaurant was busy. But we lucked out and there was a table inside for us. The server wasn't always available to tend to us but she had other tables, so that's understandable. Another employee was more than happy to take our order and deliver our drinks - much appreciated!

Overall it was a very welcoming and cozy atmosphere. The food portions were large and so so delicious! I'm in San Francisco for vacation, so I'll be very sad to leave this breakfast nook behind but I'll try to visit again before I leave!
author: Emma G.

description:
Definitely a solid choice.  There was a wait but it was a quick wait.  Clean environment.  Wait staff hustled.  I never had an empty water or coffee.  Food was VERY tasty.  Breakfast isn't hard to screw up, but this was above average it quality.  Fruit bowl portion was HUGE and quite the variety.  Left feeling full and happy!

I had the chicken sausage omelette...never had chicken sausage before so I wanted to try it.  Was worth the gamble, unique flavor.
author: K V.

description: Very good breakfast food, made to order and fresh! The line can be very long, but it is worth the wait.
author: Edit O.

description:
In the middle of a big city this is one of the cutest smallest and most efficient restaurant I have been to.
