The menu includes healthy breakfast and lunch options, and portion sizes are generous but not overwhelming. 

There is a line to be seat however it moves very quickly as these employees are fast-paced and very friendly!! 

I highly recommend this place!
author: Raelene R.

description:
Really good breakfast but expect to wait on line to get in (all good things are wirth the wait)
My wife ordered the SA which is Smoked salmon, asparagus and egg on sourdough bread. Very healthy, tasty and light.
I ordered the Salmon Benedict which has Smoked salmon, asparagus, caper berry and 2 poached eggs on English muffin, w/ hollandaise sauce. 
Not quite as healthy but still very tasty.

 Definitely worth a shot.
author: Michaelangelo P.

description: Great breakfast a wide variety reasonable prices and nice employees. And delicious outdoor and indoor seating not fancy but comfy I definitely enjoyed my meal their you she stop by their
author: Molly M.

description: We tried to go to Mama's but the line was a two hour wait so we ended up at Hollywood Cafe. The line was also down the street but it only took about 20 min to get a table. It was so good that we came two mornings in a row and every dish we got was amazing! B.A.T. and French toast were our favorites and the fresh orange juice was so good!
author: Cody B.

description: Great service, great food. Went with my wife and our two friends. I ordered the Hash Burrito and I have to say it was so bomb!! I asked for the wasabi sauce on the side (not much a fan of wasabi). I highly recommend it. Service and food was fantastic!
author: Travis J.

description:
Been in  line for about 30 min. It's worth waiting. 
Good Customer service, awesome! 
Foods are delicious and fresh!
author: Kris T.

description: It was a picture of a big bowl of fresh fruit that drew me in. Came here for breakfast with my boyfriend our first day in San Francisco. The restaurant seemed to be family owned. When we arrived there was a short line about 5 people ahead of us. We were able to be seated quickly, within the first 10 minutes of waiting. Immediately, was greeting and brought drinks. I ordered the meat lovers omelet with a side of fruit and my boyfriend ordered the classic eggs Benedict with a side of hash browns. Everything was amazing and the fruit tasted so fresh. However, the omelet was filled with meat. I understand, it is called the meat lovers omelet, but every single bite was just filled with bacon, ham and sausage. It was a little too much for me. Other than that, everything was great
author: Molly M.

description: Loved this place! Super tiny little brunch place that normally has quite a wait time/line but all the food is soooo yummy! I highly recommend!
author: Sabrina F.

description: I'm a college student and then one thing I will say about my school is that breakfast isn't the best. So when I get to leave school and travel, I am incredibly picky about breakfast because it's my favorite meal of the day. Hollywood Cafe killed it. This was one of the, if not the, best breakfast that I have ever had. The fruit was fresh, the french toast was delicious, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The line out the door every morning, even on weekdays, tells the story. It was so good that we went two days in a row, which is a rarity. Honestly can't say enough good things about the Hollywood Cafe!
author: Matt H.

description: My friends and I visited SF and chose this place because it was close to our hotel. We didn't expect much and just want there for brunch. When we saw a line, it was clear the cafe is popular among people. But was it only because it's location? Definitely not! The menu items were called by names of celebrities and the taste met the bar. Against our original plan to try as many places as we wanted during our stay, we were back the next morning. Really recommend this place!
author: Anna K.

description:
Came in on a Thurday at 8:30am alone and was seated right away. I got the Lox Benedict which was super tasty. The hashbrowns were nice and crisp, as well. 

Service was fairly quick and polite.
author: Rose P.

description: My family and I ate at this great cafe last weekend. The food was great. The host/ waiter /server all in one was amazing!!! I had French toast combo very good!!! Great breakfast spot!  There was a bit of a  wait  but the host made sure you were acknowledged and the food was worth it!
author: Elna S.

description:
A cute little cafe with large photos of Celebrities!
Relished the yummy fresh fruits  , pancakes  cooked to perfection, high piled veggie sandwich  & crispy golden hash browns 

A must visit!!!!!!
author: Jahnavi W.

description: Unfortunately this place does NOT live up to its Yelp reviews. I am an SF local and decided to check this place out due to its amazing reviews and photos. The foods looks SO much better than it tastes as you can see. The grilled croissant tasted sour and bitter, probably from an unclean grill. The eggs were old and bacon soggy. Save yourself the trip!
author: Brisa S.

description:
I absolutely love this spot for breakfast.  I am a SF native and will eat here anytime, even during tourist season.  Yes, it is at the Wharf but don't judge it by that.  The service is great, the food is delicious and fresh and plentiful.  During the tourist season don't let the line scare you, it moves quickly.  Off-season, you walk right in.  It's a hidden treasure for those of us who live here.  A good breakfast spot is hard to find here in SF, but lucky to have Hollywood Cafe here.  The coffee is delicious and the exceptional servers never let your cup empty.  The bacon is always cooked just right!  I come here before or after my swim at North Beach Pool.  

The only minus is the long walk to the restroom.  But I didn't come her for that.  Use one before you come.
author: Felicia V.

description:
I asked if there were any vegan options off the menu, so the server suggested getting a "3 egg vegetable omelette and hash" without the eggs. So I paid $15 for some hash potatoes and vegetables, and left hungry. The freshly squeezed orange juice was tasty though. 
My friend got eggs, vegetables and toast, and also thought he portions was small for the price. 
I think it's a little overhyped, and they definitely need to add at least one reasonable vegan option.
author: Yuliana H.

description: Great cafe for breakfast or brunch. We sat outside on a sunny February day in SF! I had the Audrey Hepburn, with blueberry pancakes and an amazing fruit salad. It was really good and the prices are reasonable. My wife tried the Hollywood hash browns and really enjoyed them.
author: George B.

description: I loved the classic French toast with a side of bacon. The fresh squeezed OJ was amazing. The blueberry pancakes were phenomenal. Sausage patty was alright... how with bacon. Be sure to ask for Pure Maple syrup! Try accommodated my request for sautéed spinach w two poached eggs and avocado. The Grand mimosa was wonderful while we sat outside in late Feb with the overhead heater on us! There was no wait! We all thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast.
author: Erica M.

description: First things first, I spent $30ish for just me...so the pricing is not CHEAP. BUT the food is pretty good, and the staff are amazingly courteous, attentive, and kind. Especially for how busy they were! Had to wait in a long line outside, but you can order coffee or drinks to sip on while you wait. The food came out in a timely manner, and was very fresh. I had no regrets haha.
author: Jenny L.

description: This is a fairly small establishment that looks larger from the outside.  The food was decent but on the small side for the price.  Be aware that 15-20 minutes probably means 45.  Service was lacking for the number of servers they had running around.  Better options to be had in the neighborhood.
author: Matt T.

description:
This is the breakfast spot I've ever been to in my life.  I could not be a bigger proponent of this spot for breakfast.  This past time was my fourth visit but I have yet to write a review until now.  This time I went for the "Vivien Leigh" breakfast platter which is pretty simple but will always be my favorite savory breakfast dish.  This included an egg scramble with bacon and cheese mixed in on a delicious and perfectly seared croissant, delicious sour dough bread and butter, and the fruit bowl to end all fruit bowls.  In fact, most of the reviews here will mention their famous fruit bowls because they are huge, as fresh as can be (much of it sourced right here in California), and features the best and priciest fruits such as grapes, strawberries, kiwi, and rasberries.  They do not fill you bowl with honey dew like most places do.  If this is your first visit you MUST get the side of fruit.  I've had some of the sweet breakfast options as well, such as the french toast, and it is as amazing as it looks.  I also love their breakfast potatoes, which often get mistaken for crepes.  Regardless, they are delicious and love the way they are plated.  Their coffee and espresso drinks are also pretty decent given this is not explicitly a coffee shop by any means... At Hollywood Cafe, the Food is the star!  I find it crazy that this place is in the Fisherman's Wharf which is the known tourist district, but go figure!  This place is not cheap either, but you get what you pay for, and consider the fact you are in downtown San Francisco as well.

Price:  6/10 (More like $$$ Yelp, breakfast plates are mostly $15-$20)

Value: 8/10 (it is just breakfast, but its San Fran and its a great experience)

Service:  8/10  Good, but this place is usually very crowded.

Food:  10/10  For breakfast, it doesn't get any better.

Will return!
author: Blake B.

description: Decent breakfast! Wide selection on offer. I had the combo which consisted of pancakes, scrambled eggs, sausage and fresh fruit!
author: Shane R.

description: Absolutely amazing service and food. We're a family of 5 and was in and out with in 45 min. It's priced very well for the amount of food you actually get. The mimosa flight(3) was the best I've ever had.
author: Mari D.

description: This is definitely worth the wait.always a line. But good food ,and good service. We got the 3 eggs BAT and it cones with hash browns and toast, and also got the chilaquiles were even spicy ,and that too comes with hash browns. All good
author: Nuria R.

description: A little wait, but it is worth it! Salmon avocado toast with a side salad.  I added an egg on the side.  Great eats!
author: Martha P.

description: Tried the healthy plate and chai latte. Meh. Food was ok. Drink was ok. Service was alright. An ok option if you're in the area and need some food. Pretty touristy for a touristy part of town.
author: Linda H.

description: This place is a must go. The downside is the line, it has a wait most of the time... it is a little bit expensive but the plates are huge and fulfilling! You should definitely try.
author: Ceren Y.

description:
Breakfast are my favorite meal of the day. 

Toke my family to fisherman this weekend.   
And we stoped at Hollywood cafe.  


Perfection !!


The food could not be any better.  I love it.  We all did.  
Taste amazing.   So many choices.  

Service was fantastic.   

Really perfection.  


I love that place
author: Jenifer R.

description:
This a pretty good place to get some breakfast or brunch or lunch. It does help that it is very close to work. There is usually not a line whenever we go and the service is pretty good. They are friendly and attentive. The food arrives in a timely manner and I have not had anything bad yet. I would highly recommend their Korean Burger. The house made sauce is delicious and a little spicy.

I would recommend this spot that is right off the main Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Camera P.

description: Everything we could have asked for. Casual, friendly, fast service, great food. The millionaire's bacon was as promised. So thick, crusty but tender, and full of flavor. We shared a table with three other people and had a great time. The portions are huge, so don't plan on needing lunch if you're there for a late breakfast!
author: Jean H.

description:
We visited for breakfast on a Friday morning with a party of 8.  This restaurant serves fantastic and plenty of food, but it's definitely not great for parities larger than 4.  Thankfully, we didn't wait long for a table and were seated in the back of the restaurant at the only table large enough to seat us.  As mentioned in previous reviews, there's no real good place to wait so you awkwardly hover over those eating on the sidewalk.  Each table has strawberry and orange jam available for use.  I ordered the crab Benedict and I definitely do not regret it!  It was fantastic and had plenty lump crab that you could see and taste.  I ordered the Hollywood hash browns and honestly wish I hadn't.  I was disappointed in this side dish, as the cheese tasted like cheese wiz.  Not yummy.  I also had the misugaru latte for the first time and had no idea what to expect.  Earthy and delicious!   I shared an order of the dolce French toast with my family and was not impressed.  

A family member told me they thought the cappuccino was good but not very bold in flavor.  Another family member loved her salmon Benedict, another really enjoyed the apple chicken sausage, another thought the meat lover omelette was bomb, another was very happy with her heuvos rancheros was great and another was not satisfied with her tropical iced tea.  She said it just tasted like regular unsweetened tea. 

The wait staff was great and very friendly!   They replaced a cappuccino that we split on accident for free.  They also split our checks and allowed for multiple cards to be used.  

I would stick with the omelette and benedicts.  You can't got wrong with any of them!   

FYI, no wifi at this location and the bathroom is in a super sketch location.
author: Regine B.

description: Really gross water, adding fresh fruit costs $11 and the waiter was not nice at all. Don't waste your time or money
author: Bella I.

description:
Really good eggs Benedict and pancakes!
Quick wait time too even though there was a line.
author: Patrycia S.

description: When we arrived the line was out the door however it moved quickly. The food was good, service was good. The place is small and the bathroom situation is different but overall the place didnt disappoint.
author: Trina C.

description: Found this spot on yelp and it was right down the street from my hotel and it has 4.5 stars so we got up early and tried it and I'm glad I did we arrived there was alittle line so we waited 10 mins they brought us a menu to look it over so we kinda knew what we wanted and we noticed every plate came with fresh fruit I got the meat lover omelette is was really good times of meat in every bite fresh fruit was tasty and ordered a side pancake it was really good tooo and the Asian kid that was our waiter was good too!
author: Rick C.

description: this is probably the best breakfast place in San Francisco! there's nothing a good fresh food here. Nothing fancy, but everything is spectacular! A place like this makes omelets, pancakes, and French toast the way your mom used to make them growing up. Great service as well. If you don't mind the wait on the weekends, this is the place to go every time you're in San Francisco.
author: Jose R.

description: Wow!!!  The omelets and french toast are sooo good!!! Will be coming back multiple times on this trip!
author: Kevin S.

description:
The never ending line of customers throughout the day! When I arrived I ended up waiting in line and when I got seated the line kept on growing but it's worth the wait if you stay. The food was absolutely amazing and serve was great as well. 

Ended up getting the sweet bacon, the shrimp and smoked salmon eggs Benedict, and the Dungeness crab eggs Benedict (got too lemony after awhile because the end up putting a slice of lemon inbetween the crab and egg - - I would suggest asking them to put the lemon on the side). 

The food came out pretty fast and the service was awesome.
author: Magz K.

description:
Don't be afraid of the long lines outside this restaurant! It goes by pretty fast. Right by the wharf and all the tourist spots. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor seating would offer heat lamps if it was cold. Very busy place for the short hours they have. Service was good and fast.

They offer free French bread with butter by  ours came when the food came. I was impressed with their French toast plates. My Dolce was very good. I actually thought it was a lot of bread but it was equal parts, bread and fresh fruits. I liked the candied walnuts. The only thing I wish they had more of was the whip cream on top. They barely put any. My hubby ordered their crab Benedict. I tried it and it was ok to me. The freshly brewed coffee is good especially the refills. Haha. Many of our friends had dishes with hash browns and bacon. Looked very good. 

If we had to stay in the area again, I would come back for the other French bread dishes and maybe the others. ;-)
author: Edna G.

description: So delicious. 20 minute wait , for first available seating. Sat outside , a little annoying. As people were says ding in line 6 feet from us. That said , service was good and eggs cooked exactly as ordered, fresh squeezed oj---yum , and an amazing fresh fruit bowl.
author: Pat D.

description: My fav breakfast spot in the city!!! Fruit is fresh and on point. I've had their omelettes, Eggs Benedict choices, pancakes, french toast....you name it. It's my go to place every time I visit San Fran. Never been disappointed.
author: Dori C.

description:
This place is a hidden jem on the wharf Must say I was quite surprised. Breakfast is the bomb and lunch Is fabulous. 

Ding ding the ship has arrived!!!
author: Frederick S.

description:
Came here and had red lipstick on my cup, ironically my sister had dark lipstick on her cup, too. The couple next to us overheard our conversation about the lipstick and heard us tell the waitor so the couple joked with us like "oh let me check mine too" and SURE ENOUGH, he has lipstick on his cup!! This was not just a fluke, you were able to see a woman's lip imprint on the cup with lipstick residue left behind...

Definitely not a sanitary place by any means. How do three people have a woman's colored lipstick on their glasses.. waitor didn't even apologize to any of us- although his expression was priceless. Was completely grossed out before even getting my breakfast.
author: Brittany D.

description: Amazing brunch.  Recommend the dolce or vanilla french toast.  Don't be surprised if there's a line outside.  We waited in the cold and it was well worth it!
author: Ryanne G.

description:
In 25 plus years have never found anything 
Close to mamas girl for breakfast.. 
this place is a very close second excellent
A lot bigger the lines are long but it's seats a lot  people ... 
I had there famous French toast dolce 
It doesn't need whip cream ..
Definitely recommend it I will definitely be back I'd like to try their eggs Benedict next it all looks delicious pancakes look awesome to
author: Michael P.

description: We decided to give this place a try after reading all the yelp review.  Food was mediocre.   Orange juice was fresh.  One of the only place that was open early, so not a whole lot of choices.  Staff was friendly,  atmosphere was good.    Give this place a try if your in the area, but I'm sure there are better places.
author: Steve C.

description: Looked around for a breakfast place close to our hotel, this place seemed a good option. Tried it out and we are very happy with our choice. Awesome breakfast guys and service. Keep up the great work. Definitely coming back.
author: Roheen S.

description:
This is the most amazing breakfast I've ever had and for once I never thought getting up 5am in the morning was worth it. The quality and the taste of the food is unbelievable. As a New Yorker, I am used to having home fries served on the side. Instead they serve fruits and I love the alternative. These fruits are served fresh and is simply just amazing.

Now i see why people tell me to get here mad early. As my group got ready to leave, there was a nice line outside, some had been waiting for an hour just to have breakfast here. I still think the wait is still worth it all!
author: Jacky C.

description: Great food, good service, very busy. Get here early or your gonna be wait, the place is small.
author: Savvy S.

description:
Don't know how it's possible that this place has so many good reviews:
1. Dirty table
2. I'm not joking, waiter said if you want real eggs you have to ask... Otherwise you get "egg product with a little milk"
3. Hashbrowns ice cold (maybe you need to ask for hot, who knows)
4. Expensive af
5. Crooked picture frames everywhere.  Hurt my sweet ojos.
author: Kevoonce K.

description: The service is really friendly and it has a nice atmosphere. But the speed at what the food comes out is slow and honestly it is kind of disappointing of what you would expect from a place like this.
author: Amardeep S.

description: Worth the wait!  Small, quaint restaurant located on North Point near the wharf.  I highly recommend the fruit salad- fresh and sweet.  We ordered hot chocolates to start the morning off and I am an expert hot chocolatier.  It was definitely perfect.  We had the breakfast croissant sandwich, turkey Benedict and scrambled eggs etc.  sour dough is awesome here too!  We waited for about 40 mins before being sat but as I said, it was worth the wait!
author: Amy C.

description: The food is amazing! Great customer service. We got seated super fast and the food was delivered to our table quick
author: Dorys P.

description: Great place if you're looking for a solid breakfast, reasonably priced. Service is quick so good if you're in a time crunch. I had eggs and chicken apple sausage and shared a chocolate chip pancake.
author: Juancarlos M.

description: I'd say this place is overrated. Pretty expensive for a basic breakfast. French toast was dried out. Fruit bowl was very nice and generous.
author: Nancy A.

description: Found this place through yelp. The food was great, we went early in the morning so there wasn't a lot of wait time, in fact we found parking right in front of the restaurant itself. I liked the fact that our food was served in a fast manner of time. The workers were very kind & I love how the dish is set up with a surplus of fruit. Will definitely come back in the future
author: Miriam R.

description: Great service and fast lines. We didn't have to wait long considering that the location stays busy. The food was also excellent.
author: Nichole T.

description:
Nice little cafe close to Pier 39 and Alcatraz landing dock. The wait was about 10 minutes for 11 am on a Sunday which was great. The organization of the wait wasn't ideal, though. You just kind of form a line on the sidewalk in front on the doors. 

We were seated inside and the tables were packed in very closely to one another which would have been fine if not for our obnoxious table neighbors.

We ordered Orange, Grapefruite, and Mango Mimosas, Chilaquiles,  Ham and Cheese Omelette, Original French Toast, and Dolce French Toast. Definitely would not recommend the chilaquiles. They scramble the eggs with chorizo and tomatillo sauce then give you a side of baseball field tortilla chips. The Omelette was good, lots of ham and cheese. The French Toast was amazing. Portion is 3 halves of toast which we found strange, but delicious nonetheless.

Our waitress was probably below average, perhaps because she was busy. But she wasn't timely in addition to forgetting we asked for things. The busser was killing it though, which was appreciated. 

Overall I would probably comeback if in the area. A little pricey, but really good food.
author: Madison A.

description:
Great little (and I mean little) breakfast place near Fisherman's Wharf.  There was a line to get a table for most of the morning.

The breakfast sandwiches were great and everyone loved the B.A.T. with fresh avocados.
author: James S.

description: On a recent Out of town trip we decided to try out this cafe after reading all the great reviews. The line moved fairly quickly and we were seated in no time, the waiters were constantly moving around and refilling water and coffee without having to ask. We ordered the Vanilla French toast with almonds , 2 eggs and bacon with sliced fruit It was all DELICIOUS! I would definitely recommend this cafe to all , service, wait time, quality as well as quantity of food was more than worth it.
author: Vince B.

description: Food was great but this place can get very busy due to their location (in a very popular spot from all the hotels). Since they were so busy it seemed like the service was tough for them to keep up with volume of customers for the 9 am morning rush.
author: Florentino A.

description:
Found this place on the recommendation of the holiday inn express next door. I was a little leery when I first walked up because it's definitely not a fancy place and a little run down but it was actually a great choice. 

The coffee was decent. Cafe quality to me but not bad. And they have large selection of items. Great thing is at noon they still serve breakfast so it was perfect for me.  

I ordered the hash burrito and basically it's just a breakfast burrito with hash browns bacon avocado and egg. Comes with wasabi cream instead of regular sour cream so I had it on the side but it was tasty and not too wasabi tasting. I enjoyed the meal and even saved half for later. Winning!!

One thing is they charge an extra misc tax which I think is for sitting outside (like in Venice???). I really don't know but it was $3.00 for just me. Hmmmm
author: Jeannette L.

description:
How have I not written a review for possibly my favorite breakfast spot in SF? No, they're not doing some super fancy breakfast brunch pub farm to table type thing, but they are consistently pumping out simple and delicious fare with super fresh ingredients. Their service is fast and even with what appears to be a long line, the wait is never too long. Be warned, I've only been here for breakfast, but I've been here many times. 

I've never had anything I didn't like here... their French toast, the crab or meatlover's omelet, the veggie sandwich (add bacon), the fresh fruit, the sourdough toast... it's all stellar. What really got my attention off the bat is that they use real fruit in their fruit bowls and on their French toast. It's not the typical orange wedge, cantaloupe, and grapes. 
You get raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, banana, citrus, honeydew, kiwi... Whatever is in season they serve it, and they are generous with it.

The only knock on this lovely place is that they once gave out the sourdough toast like water, you just got some... and asking for extra didn't cost you. 
Now you only get it with certain plates and ordering any more will show up on the bill. Kind of a drag... It's not like I come here and just order a side of scrambled eggs and fill up on toast, so having this taken away is just a bummer. The other thing is that as the morning goes on, the portions get smaller... from what I've experienced. The first few times I came here, it was usually early... just about when they opened their doors, and man, the portions were GENEROUS. The last few times, I've come later in the morning and there has been a notable disparity. I'm hoping it's just the time of the morning and not altogether smaller no matter the time. I'll find out next time I'm in the city early in the morning. 

I don't recommend the Wharf as I've spent so much time in SF, but if you must visit there then HW Cafe is perfect to have an early great breakfast and walk over to the Wharf/Pier 39 before it gets too crowded with tourists.
author: Raul M.

description: This place was highly recommended as a good breakfast spot. Though there is usually a line, the service is extremely fast and the food will not disappoint. Everyone was enjoying their food and commenting on how great it tasted. I had the morning salad, which I thought was an interesting combination of poached eggs with a caprese salad and an Asian-style salad... and it all worked beautifully. Who would have ever thought of this combination? San Francisco has perfected fusion food.
author: J L.

description: Each time we came here there was no wait though I can understand how there would be one for weekend brunch, considering the size of the place.  Reliable and healthy-ish breakfast place with quick, efficient service.  We never left hungry or dissatisfied. I enjoyed the Vivian Leigh twice, and my friend liked their asparagus eggs benedict. The fruit bowl was fresh and really added a spark to the meal.  A cup of black tea and orange juice and I had the healthy breakfast my mom always wanted me to have. When in San Fran next I'll be back.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Nice breakfast with big portions, way bigger than i can handle.
Fast and tasty, they got tables out side and it's warm (thanks for heaters).
author: Constantin S.

description: Went in on a Sunday with a party of 7 and to our surprise we didn't wait more than 5 minutes to be seated. He service was extremely fast which we liked! Outside seating was a little small so the plates took up the entire table. I will say to come very HUNGRY because the portions are extremely large. I ordered a vanilla French toast with a side of the hash browns and was not disappointed.
author: Karina T.

description: Not very vegan or gluten free friendly. Basically I had a bowl of fruit. My husband had French toast and said it was delicious. The staff was friendly.
author: Samantha P.

description: This place is incredible. 10 stars. Food is so fresh, and delicious.  Portions are generous.  There is always a line, but it moves quickly.  Waitstaff is extremelycompetent, and attentive. I cant say enough great things about Hollywood Cafe.
author: Kristine O.

description: Great food! We didn't have to wait at all, which was so lucky. Will definitely come back again next time we are in the city
author: Kathy W.

description: My favorite meal is breakfast no matter what time of day. With that being said I had to google search 'best breakfast/brunch near me' while I was visiting The Bay Area. Needless to say quite a few highly rated joints popped up but the Wifey and I both agreed that this was most definitely the place (sometimes you just gotta feel it) They are a very popular establishment and there was indeed a lengthy line but upon arrival they provide you with warm smiles and menu so when it's time to get your seat you'll be ready to eat. I don't know how they did it but we were seated pretty fast and orders taken within minutes upon getting our table. Again, friendly service, amazing food with large portions and ample options, small but cozy dining space with an outside bistro/cafe vibe, family friendly, LGBT friendly and just downright delicious. I'll frequent this cafe upon my San Francisco ventures.
author: Marie S.

description: Great place for breakfast place, had the French toast and Denver omelet, amazing. The fruit was fresh and had loads of flavor and the coffee was hot. We were fortunate enough to not have to wait as many people mention but it is a small place so I can see why. The bathroom was an adventure, good luck.
author: Michael Q.

description: This is a great little place close to fisherman's wharf  with a great atmosphere. I got the Vivian and some French toast. Portion sizes were huge and the food was excellent.
author: James G.

description: Good place for breakfast and brunch! There was a line, but it appears that is normal. :-)
author: Sereyna G.

description:
Best eggs Benedict I have ever had ( smoked turkey ) .
The sizes are HUGE , they are extremely fast and it's not expensive at all .
Perfect 10
author: Or A.

description: Went here b/c of the reviews and it didn't disappoint! Super busy, worth the wait. Only downfall was the water, yuck city water, but food amazing!
author: Lara T.

description: This place is such a go-to for my friends and I. We're all from the Bay Area and even though it's in such a close proximity to where we all live, we still make it a point to get there as early as possible. No matter what time you go, there will be line of upwards to 10-15 people. But as far as the food goes, it's awesome! The portions are huge and the prices are incredibly reasonable. One of my favorites is the fruit they have here. You'll get an overflowing side of seasonal mixed fruit that tastes so fresh and sweet. Every time I go, I always try to order something new and so far, I haven't been let down! This restaurant is also extremely close to Pier 39 and other fun activities, if you want make a day out of it! I highly suggest this place if you're a tourist or resident to San Francisco. Get up early and go eat here!!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I got the blueberry pancakes and the Greek omelet. The blueberry pancake came with two pancakes and it came with a bunch of fruits and a lot of purée on top. The omelet had amazing hash browns and the omelet was alright. It was good but I wish the omelet was a little runny. 

Service was GREAT. The ladies there are very attentive! You are two blocks or less away from the warf which is great and convenient. If you want parking, meter parking may be best!
author: Darlene T.

description:
Was getting off the plane when this older gentleman said he'd recommend I go to Hollywood cafe. So! I went. First time in San Fran. Lover of brunch. No wait time. Sat outside. Not a scenic view but not bad. 

Ordered the Marilyn Monroe combo so french toast, an AMAZING assortment of fruit, eggs and bacon for 18.99 or 16.99. Can't remember. Nevertheless it was the best fruit ever. Usually u get 90% melon 2 grapes and a third of a strawberry if you're lucky. But I had bananas blueberries orange slices strawberries and a grapefruit slice. It was definitely a lot of food. I'd go back. French toast was also good. Nothing really exciting about it. Either it's good or it's not lol.
author: Amari C.

description: I can't believe I didn't take a picture of my bacon egg croissant sandwich . It was awesome. We also ordered the lox bagel. Both were good and the little one had fruit loops, can't mess those up lol. The side of bacon was great along with the fresh squeezed OJ. The wait wasn't bad at all for Sunday morning at 8:30 am and it was a nice day out, the neighborhood was pleasant.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Awesome quality food and for a decent price.

Be sure to come here bright and early, otherwise look forward to a long line and a minimum 30-45 minute wait. The restaurant provides limited seating with 50% accommodation indoors and the other 50% outdoors. If you're one to get easily cold like me, never fear, there's outdoor heating available so you'll be relatively comfortable sitting outside.

They have a wide variety of typical American breakfast items but from what we sampled (the Marilyn Monroe and the Denver), they do an exceptional job. The Marilyn Monroe (french toast and fresh fruit) was delightful. The bread was light, chewy yet substantial at the same time. The dish came overloaded with fresh fruit. Everything was fresh and sweet. The Denver (omelette with sausage, peppers, onions, hash brown and sour dough bread) was just as delicious. The omelette was light and fluffy, and the hash browns were cooked to perfection.

Despite how busy this place was, the server stopped by on numerous occasions to top off our coffee and check to see we were enjoying our dining experience.

We left the place with a content belly and a bill just over $30. We'll most definitely be back.
author: Claudia C.

description: Came in for breakfast, this place is pretty busy obviously a local favorite. The quality of food was great, but I came in specifically for eggs Benedict which are not inexpensive and my eggs yolks were cooked all the way through. Everyone else's burritos and omelette were fantastic. Fresh squeezed orange juice, and coffee is great.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: This place was great. There was a line, but it was a beautiful day and the wait was well worth it. It was also a Sunday morning, which could have something to do with it! Despite the wait and business, the staff was cheerful and quick. After sitting down we got our food within 20 minutes, and it was delicious! Definitely recommend the eggs benedict and the Marilyn Monroe. Also great people-watching opportunities if you sit outside!
author: Nina E.

description: Great food.  Best breakfast in the city.  The staff is great at managing the line (and this place is so good there is always a line).  Can't go wrong here.  You will leave full!
author: Jeffry D.

description: This is a little place we walked right by it and seen the food other people were eating and had to go back.We had the steak hoagies on ciabatta bread .only open for breakfast and lunch can't weight to try breakfast.
author: Laura G.

description: This place is super cute and the menu is great! Sweet service and a nice location. It's a great spot if you want classic american breakfast without the heaviness!!  Something about the old Hollywood vibe and huge windows makes it feel more of a date spot, plus it's a little cramped so unless u plan to eat outside I wouldn't recommend bringing in strollers.
author: Yasmeen S.

description:
Breakfast is, hands-down, my absolute favorite meal of the day, and this place reaffirms my undying love for it. Just happened to be in the area around 7 AM, so we decided to check out a spot we wouldn't normally get to visit. Thanks to Yelp yet again for bringing another amazing place to my attention. You do yo thang, Yelp!

The four of us arrived just around 7:30 and stood in the short but already-growing line. By the time we were seated, a massive line had formed behind us and only the first lucky 30 or so of us found ourselves at a table. We felt like winners! With buzzers going and confetti streaming from the sky and everything. 

AMBIANCE/SERVICE:
----------------------
Nothing too special about the environment other than that it's in North Beach. It has a spectacular view once you step outside. Parking in this area may be rather difficult. Inside is a typical cafe that isn't quite quaint but not modernized either. Clean but efficient.

Service is also clean and efficient. They're friendly enough but they're so busy they need to focus on the tasks at hand. My latte was forgotten a few times and it arrived when I had already eaten most of my meal. The server was apologetic and brought it out as soon as it was ready.

FOOD:
-------
But the food is the real showstopper here, of course.

Let me comment first of all on the **Sweet Bacon**. Glazed with maple syrup, fresh orange juice, brown sugar, and Grand Marnier, this meaty goodness is so delectable. And the great thing is they it with many dishes. You can ask to clarify. I ordered a side of the sweet bacon without realizing it already came with most of our dishes! Oh well, no harm in extra bacon. Who's gonna say no to bonus meat!?

Next up I have to tell you about those **Hollywood Hash Browns** topped with bacon, mushroom, onion, bell pepper, basil flakes, and melted cheddar cheese. If you're not sure whether to upgrade your hash browns, the answer is yes. 

Okay now, on the entrees at last!

1) People rave about the **Dungeness Eggs Benedict** and with great reason. This dish is excellent! The poached egg is done just perfectly that it runs all over the crab meat and English muffin just the way it should. I really couldn't ask for more. 

2) The **Vivian Leigh** breakfast special is very delicious: eggs scrambled with bacon and mild cheddar cheese on a grilled croissant with fresh fruit. Don't be fooled by the "with fresh fruit"--your plate will be overflowing with a virtual cornucopia of divine fruit. We were impressed to count at least 15 types of fruit! 

3) If you love your meat, go for the **Meat Lover Scramble** which is stuffed bacon, sausage, ham, and mild cheddar. Super hearty and you won't be hungry for quite some time.

The **Latte** was decent and a great complement to my meal. I definitely needed a kick to wake up after engaging in massive food coma.

TIP: Get here well before 8 AM. This place be popular.

DATE TIP: Definitely a fun breakfast date spot, if you happen to be up early on the weekend (or haven't gone to sleep yet!).
author: Denise L.

description:
It was so good I came back the next day. Great variety of breakfast staples with a twist. Great bacon, perfect portions and almost always with a little fresh fruit to brighten the plate and your belly. 

Super service and fair prices. Be aware that there is usually a line early and prepare accordingly. Well worth the brief wait!
author: Michael C.

description: This place put other breakfast spots to shame.... I'm serious. We were staying at the nearby Marriott and was on a hunt for some good breakfast food. The place gets super busy so expect to wait if your there at prime time but it's totally worth the wait. This is the type of breakfast place I only dream of because I was never able to find it before. I had French toast, eggs and fresh fruit. Everything was great and if I didn't live across he country I would be here everyday but it's prob better for my waist line that I don't. This place will not disappoint!
author: Bridget G.

description: This was the first restaurant I ever visiting in San Francisco in December of 2015. Fast forward 2 years and I've been back a few more times. Always expect a line outside, even on weekdays! However, don't fret!! The line moves extremely quickly. Although the line moves fast, I've never felt rushed by any of the staff at Hollywood Cafe. My favorite thing here are the Hollywood hash browns! They are a thin, flat, crispy, delicious turn on hash browns than the typical mushy, cold in the middle hash browns you get at other places. Prices are steep, but it's San Francisco AND near Fisherman's Wharf. Go for the Dungeness Benedicts- you won't regret it!
author: Whitney P.

description:
So good I've made it my destination GO-TO breakfast spot...hitting Hollywood 3x this week alone. They open promptly at 7am which is prime time to get there before the crowd starts to form. They close promptly at 1:45pm daily. 

I enjoyed the Healthy Plate, a heaping amount of food for one. Two egg whites scrambled with spinach, asparagus, tomatoes, bell pepper TONS of fresh fruit (red grapes, banana slices, watermelon, berries, kiwi, pineapple, melon, grapefruit & oranges.) Also....an English muffin which I subbed for a delectable warm croissant & house made marmalade. Easily, this can be shared or split into 2 meals. 

Service was super efficient; you can see the teamwork and it's pretty impressive. Not only is your specific server concerned with your dining experience, you may have 4-5 employees walk by at any given time asking if you need anything, if everything is ok, how are you doing.

The dishes all looked uniform and beautifully presented. I wondered what each table was having delivered because it all looked devour-able. 

Not a bad seat in the house, I love Hollywood Cafe. I want to pack it up in a Pod and take it back home with me. 

~Christy
author: Christy A.

description:
Okay, so we came here on a Tuesday around 11:00 and we only waited for about 5 minutes or less before we were seated which was a really nice surprise because some reviews said the wait could be out the door. Great start to the morning! After being seated, we were promptly asked what we would like to drink and I stuck with water while my girlfriend ordered a vanilla latte. Water: Yum. Vanilla Latte: Delicious, but not out of this world spectacular. Pretty much what you would expect ordering a mocha from a place that doesn't specialize in coffee. Next, we ordered our food... And waited... And waited. Apparently, we were unfortunate enough to be caught in the middle of a surprise visit from a city inspector and they had to stop everything in the kitchen for 30 minutes. Okay, not their fault but I was STARVING and ready for my food. The meal:

Dish 1: Chilaquiles (chorizo, eggs, cheese, tortilla chips, tomatillo salsa, hash browns and sourdough toast on the side) 

Dish 2: BAT (Bacon, Avocado, Tomato, and cheese scramble with a fruit cup in place of hash browns (+3.99). 

Dish 1: I thought the chorizo was very flavorful for American chorizo. Certainly of better quality than a lot of other breakfast restaurants. The tomatillo salsa, while I would have loved more, was a wonderful addition on top. I was also thankful for the chips because what is chorizo and eggs without chips? Hash browns were extremely large but pretty average. Kind of difficult to cut, yet thin. Not crazy about them. The sourdough bread is what I really could have done without. It was dry, crispy, and lacked any flavor whatsoever. I would have preferred an option for some fruit or even normal toast. The final comment I had about the dish was I found what I'm assuming is the skin of the chorizo in the mix of that and my eggs. While edible (yes I tried it) it was an unpleasant sight, and there was kind of a lot of it in there which I'm not sure if that's how it always is or what... But overall it was a delicious meal and well deserving of 4 stars. 

Dish 2: BAT scramble. Really delicious scramble with a generous portion of big slices of bacon, avocado, and...tomato? They left out the tomato... Oh well it was still delicious. The one major downfall of this dish was how much cheese they added. It was definitely an excess amount of cheese that actually made the eggs slimy. If one wanted cheese eggs, these are perfect, butttt a little less cheese would have made this a near perfect dish. The side of fruit was SO delicious and every single piece of fruit was fresh and juicy. 

Overall, a solid 4 star restaurant with HUGE portions and delicious, fresh breakfast food.
author: Alex M.

description: Loved this place! We were trying to avoid fisherman's wharf since it's such a touristy area, but this place is quite the gem. Really reasonably priced and the food tasted great. The mango mimosa was amazing, but for $12 I got the flight of all 3 and none of them disappointed.
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here late Monday morning so there was plenty of seating available both inside and out on the sidewalk.  The place had a nice feel to it, airy and bright and our server was extremely friendly and fast.

We got the Greek Omelet and Turkey Eggs Benedict, both equally delicious.  We had several beverages because our taste buds were all over the place.  Their orange juice was fresh pressed and their house coffee had a good kick.  I asked for a Coke and was brought a can so I'm assuming they don't do free refills with soda.
author: Christine B.

description:
What a great place for breakfast.  Great food and amazing service.  Long lines for breakfast but the wait wasn't too bad with the staffs efficiency. 

We were staying acoss the street at the Hyatt and walked across the street Sunday morning for breakfast at 8am.  There was already a line forming outside for a table when we arrived.  There's no sign up sheet; just get in line with your entire party and the entire party must be present to be seated.

We were a party of three adults and three toddlers so we had to wait for the big table to open up in the back.  The waitress was kind enough to inform us our table was getting cleaned and we'd be seated shortly.  In the mean time she gave us a menu and took our order while we waited for our table to be set up.  How efficient!  

We ordered the vivian leigh, denver omelette, marilyn monroe, and scrambled eggs and toast for the kids.  The vivian leigh was a scrambled egg and bacon croissant sandwich with a huge side of fruit.  It was a very filling sammie and a great fuel to start the day. The marilyn monroe was three wedges of french toast and also a huge side of fruit.  The denver omelette was good but could of had more cheese per my brother-in-law.

What's popular about the place is the huge side of fruit with the breakfast specials.  It consisted of every common fruit you can can think and it was all fresh, nothing out of a can.

Service was on point and great from the very beginning.  They were attentive even though they were busy with the morning rush.  They also have seating outside for parties of two or four and street parking only.  Located walking distance to ghirardelli and fishermans wharf.
author: Dianna D.

description:
Food was great I came back twice for breakfast on my visit to San Francisco.  
Excelente service too.
author: leo l.

description:
LOVE this place for breakfast.  Be prepared to stand in line but know that it moves fairly fast.  They don't take names or have a list - you stand in line and wait your turn for the next available table.  

Skip the coffee, it's bitter and served in a 6oz cup but the food is fantastic.  

I ordered two eggs over medium which were cooked perfectly and was served with the thinnest layer and most delicious, crispy but softest hash browns ever.  I then added the sweet bacon which is limp but unique.  It's a specialty here and marinated in brown sugar, grand marnier and orange juice.  The texture threw me off but it's worth at least a try.  On the side are four slices of toasted and buttered sourdough.  Slather that with the house made jam on the table and be happy!

My husband ordered the French toast combo which was 3 large slices of French toast topped with tons of fresh fruit and a side of sausage and scrambled eggs.  

We were pleasantly surprised at the end of the meal but cleaned our plates and left in a good mood.
author: Tammie W.

description:
I've been traveling to San Francisco for a long time but never heard of this visit cafe. I'm so glad I've had the opportunity to stumble upon this this weekend. 

Service: they are amazing at making sure you're doing well and your coffee is filled. They were attentive and polite. Their line may be long but goes by very quickly. 

Food: my friends and I ordered the hash-burrito (with chicken apple sausage), Dungeness crab benedicts, chilequiles and French toast combo. ALL were amazing! We devoured our food in a heart beat! It has great flavor and just worked well together. Just an FYI, the chilequiles is not the average egg with the tortilla chips. They have the chips on the side of the plate and the toppings on the other so you treat it like a dip. Oh! The fresh orange juice is a must have as well!! 

Overall, I highly recommend this place. It was a great experience and most definitely a must try.
author: Leanne P.

description: This is a happening spot! It was right next to our hotel so we ventured out at about 10am on a Saturday and there was a long line along the sidewalk but it moves very quickly. The food was excellent...I had the classic eggs benedict and opted for their perfectly amazing fruit bowl with it! Definitely come here again ..two thumbs up!
author: K R.

description: Great breakfast - we had breakfast burrito and pancakes. Line went fast to get in. Service was friendly and fast.
author: Tara M.

description: Such a great place! The portions are amazing and the food is definitely carefully prepared and fresh!
author: LuLu S.

description: Short wait for a Sunday morning, a bit rushed and the coffee was watery. ALTHOUGH my pressed orange juice was fresh and my chai latte was smooth and creamy. I couldn't wait to dig into the breakfast burrito stuffed with scrambled eggs, avocado, cheese, and hash brown topped with their homemade creamy wasabi sauce. Including  a fine presentation, I was ready to devour which later left me full and with a smile.
author: Maya B.

description:
Absolutely love this new place i recently discover while out on a job site. 

Friendly & Smiley staffs. Great proportion of food. Delicious Latte. Fresh & Good choice of fruits that comes along certain dish or order a bowl of fruits.. u won't be sorry. I order the French Toast Combo & it was fulfilling plus delicious. 

Probably the best little place to grab some breakfast or sandwiches in the North Beach/ Fisherman Wharf area.
author: Ali L.

description: Could say it's probably the best brunch I've ever had!!! Got pancakes that tastes just like moms, perfectly cooked eggs, crispy hash browns, and deliciously fresh fruit!! Boyfriend got eggs Florentine and the hollandaise sauce was perfect. So many options to choose from. Went at 12:30 and got a table right away outside. The service was perfect- quick, polite and always a full glass. Wish I lived I San Francisco, but will definitely eat here next time I come back.
author: Jordyn V.

description: Pretty dang good breakfast and the fruit bowls are impressive! So much good fruit! My classic Benedict was pretty standard. They toasted the English muffin enough which is awesome. A lot of places don't and they end up soggy. They also didn't drown it in hollandaise like other places which is great too. The hash brown was perfect too. Nice and crispy, just how I like it!
author: Audrey L.

description: Really great French toast and eggs. A bit toontouristy, but it's expected for this area. I was surprised there was a line, but more surprised as to how quickly and efficiently decisions were made to seat people. Everything here moves fast. Once you sit, you're expected to know what you want pretty quickly. I wasn't rushed to leave, but the bill was brought with the entree. Staff is charming and efficient. Food is great! The breakfast sandwich is what I'll try next time. Coffee is also really strong and tasty. A good spit to go before you hit the piers for the day.
author: Steve L.

description: Came to this spot with a couple of friends and my gf looking to have a hearty breakfast before heading out to Alcatraz. We walked in and were immediately seated. The coffee was good but the food could have been better. When placing our order we were told that they could not accommodate my gf's chilaquilas by making the eggs over easy rather than the scrambled eggs that they offer. We accepted it and when they brought out her food,they just gave her from what looked like an omelette that was turned in scrambled eggs. We informed the waitress of this and she stated that they were sorry and went back just to bring back chips and stated that they forgot to put chips inside. We advised that from what they are giving us is completely different from their description of chilaquilas on the menu. The waitress apologized and tried explaining to us what happened and at this point we needed to get going and gave the waitress the benefit of the doubt and just kept the plate. The food was so poorly made that my gf barely ate it and my hueuvos rancheros weren't so much hueuvos rancheros as they were nothing more than scrambled eggs with added items. Very disappointing!!! Definitely wouldn't recommend these items to anyone who have had quality hueuvos rancheros and chilaquilas. Maybe the next time we try this place, we will just stick to the simple items on the menu.
author: Kevin P.

description: We were so impressed by the delicious food and great service! Everyone was so friendly and went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable. There was a line when we arrived, but we were seated quite fast and service as a whole was very prompt.
author: Lexy B.

description:
Finding ourselves in San Francisco on a Saturday morning and not wanting to eat breakfast in our hotel, we walked to a nearby cafe, The Hollywood Cafe.   It was a Saturday morning not quite 8 o'clock and there was already a line out the door.  That's a good sign if you're looking for a good breakfast, not so good if you are starving!   Part of the reason for the line is because it is very small inside and there are a few tables outside.  We put our name on the list and since we said we would be willing to sit outside, we only had to wait a few minutes.

We soon learned why outside seating was so available.  If you sit facing out, you are just a few inches away from the people standing in line.  So, there you are eating while someone is looking longingly at your food.  Also, within just a few minutes, the sun had risen above the buildings in front and was right in my eyes.  If you are going to eat outside in the morning, I would suggest facing the restaurant, if you don't want people looking right at you and sun in your eyes.

When it comes to the food however, there was nothing lacking.  My husband got the James Dean - which was two eggs, bacon, toast and fruit.  His eggs were cooked perfectly as was the bacon.  I got the Marilyn Monroe - which was french toast and fruit.  Oh my gosh.  The french toast was excellent, crispy on the outside, perfect on the inside.  The show stopper however was the fruit.  The fruit cup was literally overflowing onto my plate.  It was filled with raspberries, blackberries, watermelon, oranges, apples, bananas, kiwi, grapefruit, and cantaloup.   It goes on record as the most beautiful breakfast that I've ever eaten!!  It was the perfect way to start a glorious Saturday in San Francisco.
author: Pam G.

description: This spot has a delicious brunch! The mimosas are amazing, and the crab florentine is one of the best I've ever tasted! The service is exceptional as well! Highly recommend if you are in the area!
author: Shawna G.

description: The Hollywood Cafe was top rated for breakfast in the area by our hotel, so we thought we'd give it a try. The atmosphere was okay. The service was good.  The food options were decent and the prices were about what you find everywhere.  It's biggest flaw - it's not Eight AM which is just a little further up the street.  We had eaten at Eight AM the day before and the Hollywood Cafe just doesn't compare.  I ordered the French toast with caramelized banana and was quickly disappointed by the portion size for what you pay.  3 lukewarm halves for $14.  The flavor was nothing special.  My husband ordered the Florentine Benedict with hash browns which we also shared.  It really needed some seasoning and it, too, was lukewarm.  Overall disappointing.  If I had no other option, I would have rather gone to IHOP just up the street.  But I DID have another option.  I could have gone back to Eight AM and had another spectacular hot, fresh, and substantial breakfast.  Lesson learned!
author: Rina H.

description: Quick service with great customer service. Very good food. Would definitely go back to try other items on the menu. My girlfriend and I are visiting from Canada and we were going to the Alcatraz tour at 0930 we arrived to Hollywood Cafe at 0800 and were out by 0830. Superb experience. 10/10. DDSA..
author: Joey D.

description: I still love this place and it's a must if your visiting! Hint: get there at 7am when they open, we had no wait on a Saturday morning! This is my breakfast spot when in San Francisco. The coffee is so hot and delicious. The staff is super friendly. My husband and I both ordered the croissant with eggs and bacon and a fruit bowl. I can't remember the name of it, but it's freakin delicious! Don't skip this place!
author: Carly T.

description: One of the must-eat places if ever you're in San Francisco. Food and service is very good. Big servings. If you love breakfast this is a good place. I'm not much of a breakfast person but my friend convinced me to try this place out. I'm glad I did. The downside is it's a very touristy restaurant so expect long lines and a wait. Try to be there as early as you can to avoid it. Would come back if ever I'm in the area.
author: Mikhail F.

description: Wonderful quaint breakfast spot close to Fisherman's Warf. I had the Western Omelet with hash browns and toast. It was amazing (also huge, recommend splitting if not a big eater). They were very generous with the ingredients inside. Definitely a go back to place. The prices were fair, server was very gracious and they had outside seating which is a great start to any morning!
author: Steve K.

description: Wait wasn't too bad on a Friday mid morning. Fresh fruit is very good. Ordered French Toast, hash burrito, eggs and hash browns. Food comes out fast.
author: Ben R.

description:
When you have a plan yet you forget that children do get exhausted, you inadvertently screw up wonderful dinner plans. And this leads to frustration and spats of inner anger for not having a full proof eating plan....
And as you go to bed knowing all to well that in a few hours you need to get up at 4 am to stand in line to purchase tickets to Alcatraz because you though, that 2 weeks early was "more than enough time to get tickets..." and you didn't (side note, you wanna go see the Rock in high season... buy your tickets minimum a month in advance) but I digress... where was I?
Oh yeah, walking out the hotel to go stand in line, so there I was cursing the cold (I'm from miami so any temp under 72 is cold for us) with only a sweatshirt which let in the colder breeze, I cross the street and make a right to pier 33 and halfway down the block I spot the Hollywood cafe... still closed but I didn't give it much of a thought except for the hope of a future Latte and the cheesy decor showing black and white pics of past Hollywood stars... thus the name.
Well, off I went into the dawn to try my hand at standing in line with about 50 other folks... by 6:30 the line had grown to over 150... and as my stomach rolled and complained the line grew even longer.
And as if Murphy himself was watching, the announcement that everyone in the party had to be present or no ticket took whatever good mood I had, which wasn't much, and crushed it. 
10 seconds later I woke up my wife and 3 kids from what was sure to be dreams of cuddling by a warm fire as the aroma of chocolate chip cookies baked in a skillet pan.
"Honey wake everyone up, and rush over here I'm 30 people away from purchasing tickets...if you are not here we are not going... hurry!" I hear a grumble on the other end and realize it's time to dad up! Cause the clan ain't gonna make it!
The clock ticks by and I get closer... no sign of the family. A few more minutes stretch on and it's game time... two windows open up. One has a 20 something goddess working the tickets with a million dollar smile. The other window is another 20 something young man that was clearly hung over.
Don't get me wrong, I have mojo.... but my mojo ain't what what it used to be, so it was time to work my magic on hungover man... I started off with an apology then whipped out the pictures from the day before... it was clear that he just didn't want to hear anymore... so he smiled, told me not to worry and sold me 5 tickets! Sans family! 
Hungover man was now 'The Man'!
Not seconds later they ran out of tickets and my wife called to see status. I exaggerated my story and mentioned my hunger to which she responded that she was passing the Hollywood cafe and the line to get in was rather long.
"Stand in line! On my way"
And 25 min later we where having a breakfast feast!
I'll start with letting you know... it's a popular place so be ready to stand in line. As mentioned... you are looking at 20 to 30 min wait for 5, less for parties 4 and under.
Service was quick... and to my delight my Latte came in a large cup and was delicious! So much so that I had a second cup when the meal arrived.
California is a big state and so where the meals that overflowed with fruit over the thick French toast and the fluffy eggs... boy did we eat! So much that non felt hungry till that restaurant zombie hour 3-5 where doors close and there is no one in sight.
So as you can probably deduce... it was damn good, and for San Francisco... a great price... so much so that we ate there the next morning before taking off to Yosemite... road trip but that's another story!
author: Robert B.

description: It's an excellent breakfast and lunch spot to get your day started. Fast and friendly service that serving great food.
author: Serenity C.

description: This place is Amazon. We were visiting SF for spring break, our last morning in town and I found this place by mistake. I would say the best mistake I have ever had. Anyway I gave Hollywood Cafe 5 stars, because they desire it. The breakfast is like homemade from grandmas. We loved it, will eat there again when in SF.
author: Ken B.

description:
The food is just ok, 3-star quality. 
Be aware this place is supet disorganized. Expect 30min+ after you order. The worst thing is that when I requested my order after 20min wait, the server lied to me that it's only been 10 min. And I saw customer coming later than us received order even earlier. Worst service ever.
author: Zhen X.

description: The Blueberry Pancakes were perfect and the hashbrowns were a good portion for the price. Stop in and check it out, but get there early - the place filled up quick.
author: Zoe B.

description:
Brought my mommy here for a Mother's Day brunch & was not disappointed.

SERVICE: Since it was just the 2 of us, we didn't have to wait long but the place is usually packed due to it's location at the Wharf (tourists, galore!). 

FOOD: My mother had either the  breakfast sandwich & was satisfied (not an easy woman to please). I had the eggs benedict with salmon and they were NOT stingy with the portions either. This came with a side of hash browns & orange slices that were actually fresh!? 

All in all, I was skeptical about this place since eateries at the Wharf are either a hit or miss BUT i was pleasantly surprised by this joint. Will be returning!
author: Som S.

description: This location has great service, pretty big portions and the orange juice is amazing! Fruit bowls are a must try, so much great fruit diversity.
author: Kevin G.

description: I was looking for a place near Fisherman's Wharf for brunch that was a little away from the touristy places along the main strip.  I had the eggs Florentine and my boyfriend had the veggie omelette.  The fresh squeeze d orange juice was  also good. We both enjoyed our food and the atmosphere of the restaurant.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  Will definitely come back the next time I am at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Wanda L.

description: Excellent breakfast spot near the Fishermans Wharf. Wait time is a little long and service lacked. The portions are large and very filling. I ordered the eggs Benedict and it was delicious! Definitely recommend this as a brunch spot. Just be aware that the restaurant is very tiny and wait time can be long.
author: Amanda A.

description:
It was very good.
I took the " Audrey Hepbun " and my sister the " Marylin Monroe " and it worths it! Big portions 
It was quite expensive but it's okay because (almost) everything in SF is expensive...(43$ for the 2 menus and 2 orange juice) 
We had to wait 15 minutes bc of the amount of people! But I expected that
author: Victoria G.

description: Great spot for breakfast! Big plates at a great price. I loved my chicken apple sausage omelette! Wowza. Good stuff! The hash browns are super good too. Can't wait to come and eat here again.
author: Alicia C.

description: This place is really cute and a total tourist attraction so get ready to get in line! Even then, they're pretty good at attending people. We waited in line for about 30 minutes which isn't too bad for being a first come first serve type of place. The only reason I'm giving it a four is because I wasn't impressed by the pancakes. They're not fluffy, they're more spongey, which I didn't like. They tasted like the generic ones I tried to make once using a pre-made mix called Bisquick.
author: Jaqui Z.

description:
Based on YELP reviews and recommendations from our hotel staff, we walked 3 blocks to the Hollywood Cafe for breakfast. Arriving about 9:15, we waited in line for 25 minutes outside while watching amazing breakfasts be served to those eating outside.  And, it was worth the wait!  The lattes were excellent.  Hubby ordered a large plate with 2 eggs, 3 pcs. of bacon, 2 halves of french toast, and a beautiful array of fruit. I had the eggs Benedict and the hollandaise sauce was soooo good. This was accompanied with a ton of seasoned hash browns and fruit. 

Would definitely want to eat there next time in SF!
author: John- D.

description: The line here was pretty long during lunch hours but the wait was so worth it!! The breakfast was great although pricey. I got a sandwich and could only finish half. It was cheesy and filled with tender meat. The hash browns here are good too. The place itself is pretty small but I like the movie theatre theme. Glad I stopped here on my trip to california!
author: Kelly N.

description: Not a fan it was overhyped and the atmosphere was eh, the food was pretty mediocre I totally would just not go back
author: Michelle M.

description:
This is one of the best places to have breakfast in San Francisco for sure. I have been here twice and have tried couple of items from the menu and none of them have disappointed me. The restaurant opens at 7AM and is open only till lunch time (1:45PM) and it is almost always crowded. My first visit was just 10mins after it opened (7:10AM) and it was crowded (I was able to find table only because I was alone). 

Food: 
They typically start off with serving coffee which is again great and much essential to kick-start your day.  Food is central to any successful restaurant and Hollywood Cafe nails it hands down. In two visits, we have tried vegetarian omelette and BAT (sans bacon) (typically served with hash browns and toasted sourdough bread), Dolce french toast, veggie burger (served with french fries). The food is absolutely delicious and makes up for an amazing breakfast. Especially the deep fried food, which can easily turn very greasy, wasn't very oily and great in taste. 

Ambiance: 
The ambiance lives up to the name as you see framed photos of hollywood stars on one of the walls. The place is, however, a little cramped. At any place, you would be sitting just centimeters away from your next table. However, the glass wall on the road side makes up for the required natural light which doesn't make the space suffocating. There is a sitting arrangement outside as well for those who want to have their meal outdoors. 

Service:
The service is quite good for the amount of rush they receive. Our order didn't take much time to arrive. The guy who normally serves coffee checks in regularly if you need a refill and makes sure your mug is never empty. The staff is quite friendly and calm, although quite eager to serve you a check once you're almost done with your meal without checking if we would like to have something else.
author: Jay M.

description: This place was ok. I expected more from the reviews I had read. The food was ok but the only thing I didn't like was the workers just watching you and bringing the check before I was done.
author: Omar G.

description: Amazing food for the price! I had the crab eggs benedict and it was one of the best plates I have had since visiting San Fransisco.
author: Lindsey K.

description: Perfect breakfast spot! Lines can get long on the weekends but worth the wait. Sit outside if weather permits. I had a B.A.T. Scramble. LOADED with bacon and yummy cheese. Good food, quick, pleasant service!
author: Kelly H.

description: Everyone raves about this place, I was staying across the street at the Hyatt and my room faces this restaurant and it's true that it gets crowded fast and I mean by 8 am there is a line. I went twice once to sit inside and once to place a to go order. They are fast and polite, the omelette was huge but there hasbrowns are good and so is their sourdough bread w raspberry jam. The second time. (I was in San Fran for a week and this place was right across the street) I ordered a traditional breakfast w an oj to go. My total came to $20 and I'm like okkkkk well that small oj was $5 but when I tasted it/ it was fresh so I wasn't mad anymore. I asked for the bacon to be crispy and when I got back to my room, it wasn't crisp but oh well. Overall i would recommend it . This review is for the week of July 22nd 2018.
author: Evita H.

description: I made reservations at Surisan for brunch on a Saturday for the patio because we were bringing a dog but it ended being a little rainy so they wouldn't let us sit on the patio. I remembered that Hollywood Cafe was on my list of brunch places to try in the city. They had outside seating with heaters, brought the dog water and gave her lots of pats on the head, and were really quick the service. The vanilla French toast was AMAZING (wish i had a second helping) and the salmon Benedict i had was pretty good. My friends also ordered crab Benedict's and say they were okay. Not the best latte I've had but overall i was happy with the salmon Benedict, vanilla French toast, and service. I would definitely come back!
author: Anjelica H.

description: Portions were huge for the pricing! Our entire party was happily full when we left. Line can be long in the morning but we were there before 8 and only had to wait 10 minutes. The service was quick and polite :) highly recommend stopping here for breakfast when in the wharf, its in the perfect location.
author: Sadie C.

description: Had a very short wait on a Saturday morning around 11am. Food was great. Dined on the chilaquiles plate and was pleasantly surprised. Spied on our table neighbors and made a mental note to get the fruit bowl if I ever make it back there because it looked amazing.
author: Kelli W.

description:
Very good breakfast spot for comfort food. Many places apparently open later in the day in the area than what we are used to on the east coast, but this hole in the wall was packed when we got there. Ordered the pancake combo that came with 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, choice of meat, and lots of very fresh fruit. I ate it all. 

Lots of people walked by, at least 3 groups while we were there, and saw all the great food and ended up staying to eat. Sign of a great restaurant. Service was very quick and only had to wait about 5 min for a table when we arrived. Would def go back and highly recommend.
author: Bryan B.

description: Timely service with a smile. The line went quick when we arrived about 9 am on a Saturday. Worth the wait - don't let the line scare you away. Delicious food, fresh fruit, endless coffee... shared  the ranchero and a breakfast wrap so we could try both... neither disappointed. We ended up sitting outside on a 57 degree morning and the heaters made the experience quite comfortable.
author: Meg B.

description: Great place for breakfast! Food for anyone. Visited three times on vacation. A must if you are in S.F.
author: Jaime V.

description:
+1 more to my list of favorite brunch places! 

This place is pretty amazing. Came here on a Saturday morning around 11 am and the wait was about 30 mins for a party of 2, which also happened to be one of the shorter times I had to wait for brunch. There is no waitlist, instead you just line up outside the door and you get seated when you're first in line. They may or may not take your order while you're in line, but regardless if they do or not, the service was good in the sense that you wouldn't have to wait forever to place your order.

I had the pleasure of ordering the crabs benedict and oh my buddha, this is definitely one of the best brunch dish I had. The crab was real (not thoose imitation stuff) and they did not cheap out of the meat as well. Although the crab had a slight fishy taste to it, the dish overall was really good. The dish also comes with hashbrown (which were good although slightly soggy at some parts) and bread + butter (wished they gave us more butter though)  

Overall, I highly recommend this place. Service wasn't lacking, the line wasn't bad and the food was delicious !
author: Jenny N.

description: Came from Southern CA to eat at a Hollywood Cafe.....  Well I was not disappointed with their Hollywood hash browns, it was thin but it is because they the whole hash brown is crispy goodness with no soggy middle!  Their service was also great, didn't have to flag any servers down!  Huge plus!  Next time I want to try the Bloody Mary with Soju . Maybe they should venture out and have one in Hollywood
author: Grant O.

description: Love love love this place! Yes! The food looks just as good as the photos do! I didn't even take photos because they will look. Exactly the same! Ate here both mornings I was in San Francisco and will every other time I'm here for breakfast. Hands down one of my favorite places! They make great cappuccinos and the sour dough bread toasted with butter and home made preserves is enough but no, there's more! Mountains of fruits with a delicious huge  croissants filled with scrambled eggs  and hickory bacon  bites! It's called the Vivian Leigh and she's a must have at Hollywood cafe! Here's a pic of her co-star the cappuccino!
author: Jen O.

description: I'm not impressed with anything except the service from the busser. The food was ok. Not a place I would suggest for people to come eat. I was expecting really good breakfast.
author: Jo K.

description: We found ourselves on a freezing Pier 39 at 7 AM with 1 kid who was complaining over and over. We found our way to Hollywood Cafe just in time to snatch the last table for 4 inside (we did not have to wait, hooray!). My child ordered chocolate chip pancakes, the teen French Toast, my friend blueberry pancakes, and I got Ranchos. Everything arrived within minutes with a side of seasonal fruit, and portions were more than generous...we left with a to-go of fruit salad because we did not want the delicious fruit go to waste. I really like places favored by locals, and Hollywood Cafe felt like a local spot. This café made the day for us despite the freezing morning.
author: Matilda B.

description: I had the veggie omelette here, see picture. From a world traveller this is the best bf i have had. For $14, includes fresh toast, huge hash brown. Everything tasted very fresh and tasty. Great service and ambience too. Their cappuccino beats peets and starbucks hands down
author: Khader M.

description: It was really busy when we went in for Monday morning breakfast, but the wait was quick, and the service was great. Everything we ordered was great and came with a Huge side of fresh fruit! Would definitely go back.
author: Megan A.

description:
Excellent food and excellent customer service! The wait could be 15 mins or so, but we were there on a holiday 3 day weekend and maybe that's why, but worth it. If you like your coffee hot and full, you'll be coming to the right place. Food is fresh and quite tasty. I had eggs Benedict with crab and the next day eggs Benedict and my husband had eggs and sausage. We both tried the Hollywood hash the second time and it was delicious. It was convenient for us as it was right across the street from the Hyatt Centric where we stayed. 
They are only open for breakfast and lunch, we didn't try lunch but again, it was a delicious breakfast!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I like to try new places at least once. 

I like to eat at new restaurant at least once a week. 

I like to eat at Hollywood Cafe in Fisherman's Wharf, despite it being touristy area.  

The line may seem long, but do not let it fool you. It was less than twenty minutes wait for us. 

Hungry, need to eat quickly? They got you covered!

Within minutes of ordering the food, it came out quickly and ready to be devoured.
