The fresh fruit bowl was ginormous. 

An egg Benedict and scramble egg was huge portion. 

The service was fast and friendly.

I enjoyed this breakfast spot. I hope you give it a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: The food is soooooo good! I got some hash brown with huevos rancheros. I also ate of the wife's ham. And some of my daughters French toast. And sons fries. Wow, that's a lot. Once again, pricey. Get a cash advance.
author: Eddie H.

description: This place is amazing, be ready to eat. Fruit is excellent, and the eggs Benedict is perfection
author: Mickie C.

description:
The old saying "quality and quantity doesn't come in the same package" doesn't apply here but expect to pay for it. We arrived here not long after they opened to try and avoid the long lines and that strategy seemed to work, but it's apparent that a lot of other people do the same so at some point it just won't matter five minutes after we were seated the line was at least 20 people deep. The food is truly amazing as hundreds before me have stated there is no doubt about it. I have had similar breakfast experiences but those have been rare so I agree this is a pretty special place.

The food is well prepared and the presentation is about as creative as you could ever expect I mean how many ways can you arrange breakfast well it appears there are an infinite amount of ways, looking around at the staff its difficult to see where the talent lies especially if you look at the amount of food the kitchen puts out. 

Hollywood Hashbrowns - simply amazing
Meat Lovers Omelette - simply amazing
Fruit Bowl - simply amazing
Sourdough Toast - simply amazing

It's impossible for me to give this place anything less than 5 stars, if I found any weakness it's space, the tables are small and very close together, so hopefully you're fortunate enough to have good neighbors, we weren't so luck no fault of the restaurant but very distracting and it did negatively affect the over-all experience. We had two loud mouth arrogant business men practically sitting right of top of us, in between them throwing the F-bomb out ever other word they were spitting their food while smacking the entire time, I so regret not requesting another table in a way that would of been obvious to those jerks. So yes the close proximity of the tables in some sections are a problem but it won't deter people from swarming here.
author: Dave O.

description: When we arrived at 9a on a Monday the line was already down the street! We knew it had to be good and we had to try it!! We only waited about 25 min for a table and the service was quick! Very simple menu but the food was delicious! I ordered the SA (smoked salmon, asparagus on sourdough bread topped with a poached egg) and a mango mimosa, the hubby got traditional bacon, eggs and hashbrowns(he was not a fan of the hash browns). We were very happy with the quality of food, price and great service!
author: Sylvia M.

description: Went on a saturday morning, got in line for breakfast for 2. Sat in about 20 minutes,it was a gorgeous day for January. We loved the vibe and Sat outside. Hash burrito and fruit were amazing,highly recommend for a neighborhood feel.
author: Erin G.

description:
This is one of those hole-in-the-wall places you hear about in San Francisco. It's definitely a small place, but the food is very good. The breakfast wrap I ordered was very good with a lot of vegetables inside. Everything tasted fresh and like it was just made.

The service is also very attentive, especially since I sat outside. Even though the restaurant was full, my food came fairly quickly (15 minutes ish). 

This place is just a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square and the Musee de Mecanique. It's also right across the street from the Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf. If you're going to stop by any of those places, it's definitely worth a try.

I went around 11am, and I only waited about 20 minutes for a table, which is not bad. Whenever I come by this area, I always know where I'm going to grab breakfast.
author: Sam M.

description:
Fantastic find! We ate there both mornings of our trip to San Francisco. Not only were we lucky to find it in the first place, but the service the food and the location were all too good to pass up on the second day.

Everything we ate was great, and the $10 fruit bowl was worth the $10.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
I find it rather amusing that Jamie W. and I decided to eat here just before taking the three-hour San Francisco Movie Tour. It's like we intentionally built a Tinseltown theme around our entire Saturday morning when honestly I was just reading that the breakfasts here were pretty good. But then again, I really don't know any locals who admit to coming here since it's in the heart of the tourist zone on Northpoint at Fisherman's Wharf. Sure enough, as I was walking toward the place from Columbus, I saw the place was packed with tourists speaking with all sorts of accents from across the country and around the world. Apparently all the tourists at the big hotels had been informed to come here (photo: http://bit.ly/1NOa3R0).

It's not a big place and it appeared that half the seating was outside on the sidewalk judging by how many tables they squeezed onto the pavement. We got lucky because a large group of Germans, the Von Trapp family I'm presuming, was just being seated as we swooped in and got a table on the sidewalk. Moments later, a long queue formed, and the hostess was not about to tolerate any line cuts or unnecessary badgering. She treated them like the prisoners of war in "Platoon" and even dictated how people should stand and stop blocking the sidewalk. She handed out one menu per party as she made it clear she was taking it back the moment they get seated. Such authority, such unblinking conviction. I think I was in love.

The servers moved like whirling dervishes, and we felt like pawns in a game of speed chess. Of course, I went with the Hollywood theme, surprisingly bypassing both the Audrey Hepburn and the Gregory Peck (even though I love "Roman Holiday") in favor of the Vivien Leigh, which consisted of scrambled eggs with chopped bacon and melted cheddar, all of it stuffed into a jumbo croissant, and served with an overflowing fruit cup festooned with berries (photo: http://bit.ly/1RMj91e). The berries were fresh and sweet, and while I liked the girth and flavor of the croissant sandwich, it was lukewarm, a disappointment considering how robust it looked on the plate. Jamie decided to go with one of the omelets, the classic $12.50 Denver.

It was pretty hefty with ham, cheese, bell pepper and mild cheddar, and then he let all hell break loose with Hollywood's Hash Brown, which was a bargain at just $2 extra since it was a flat of hash browns topped with bacon, mushrooms, onions, bell peppers and cheddar (photo:  http://bit.ly/1NnBLG2). Again the massive size of the portion was compromised by the low temperature of the dish. We were wondering if the dishes were pre-made to some degree to increase the turnover of the tables. I wouldn't have minded this approach had they mastered the timing more. I think if the hostess took a bite, she would have thrown the plate at the chef and told him to start over again. There aren't enough drill sergeants like her in the restaurant business.

FOOD - 3 stars...huge truck-driver-size portions and great fruit cup but hamstrung by lukewarm temperatures
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...every inch of that space was used
SERVICE - 3 stars...buzzsaws but none sharper than that hostess, she scares yet excites me
TOTAL - 3 stars...Hooray for Hollywood?
author: Ed U.

description: We lived two blocks from this place for 7 years and ate there dozens of times. Not once did we have anything less than fantastic food and service. And that's saying a lot coming from locals who have eaten at some of the best restaurants in SF. We literally crave their pancakes, omelettes, millionaires bacon and French toast. As our family has grown, they've accommodated us with kindness and courtesy. Truly a San Francisco gem.
author: Heather S.

description: The food was excellent. Service friendly and if you arrive early like before 8am you won't have to wait. We left at 7:45 and the line to wait was already started. Yuuuummmmmy!!!
author: Melissa H.

description:
Walked in on a Wednesday morning at 9:00. There was no wait but the place was almost full. It's pretty small and tight.

Food is decent. We ordered the Marilyn Monroe and it comes with the best fruit bowl I have ever ordered! The variety and quality of the fruit was amazing and they give you sooooo much! Also ordered the Hollywood Hash Browns. It looks underwhelming but actually tastes better than it looks. 

Service was excellent.  They were always coming around to refill my coffee.
author: Jill B.

description: Love love love the sweet bacon!!! They would really highlight it on the menu better because it is amazing. I ordered the vanilla banana French toast and it was great, just the right crunch on the outside with a good soft inside. Coffee was great too. Gets busy and is very small. We arrived right at 7 and by the time we left they were starting to have a line. Do yourself a favor and get the sweet bacon!
author: Meredith C.

description:
Excellent restaurant!! The food was delicious!!! Expect a line outside (even on a Monday morning) but the line moved pretty quickly and we did not have to wait long. The food and the service were absolutely EXCELLENT!!

We enjoyed chocolate chip and banana chocolate chip pancakes which were both delicious!! The fruit that came with the banana cho. chip pancakes were so fresh and tasty (and a large portion of fruit at that). The fruit included watermelon, kiwi, apples, grapes, bananas, oranges, grapefruit blackberries, and raspberries. AMAZING! Highly recommend coming here!
author: Amanda G.

description: Good place for breakfast & brunch and is right opposite to Hyatt Centric. If you are staying close to fisherman wharf then this is an ideal option for breakfast. It's best if you get outside seating (depending on weather). Inside seating seems bit cramped. If you have bigger group then avoid it unless you want to split. All in all it's a good place for breakfast.
author: Puneet K.

description: The food was amazing here .  Recommend that everyone try it. Customer service was top notch. Our food was fast and HOT...
author: Greg M.

description:
Stood in line at 9:30am on a Sunday morning and was able to get a table in 20 minutes (although the line was much, much longer when we left). The waiters were very attentive, my girlfriend's cup of coffee was always full. She ordered the original eggs benedict, which came with hash browns. It was pretty standard but the hash browns could have been crispier. I got the pancake combo, which came with two eggs, bacon and fruit (I forgot to take the pic before I ate the fruit). Again, everything was standard although I do like my bacon more crispy. The fruit, I have to say, was all good, not one sour piece.

Overall, I wouldn't wait longer than I did, but it's conveniently located next to a couple hotels. The portions are large so you'll have enough energy to explore fisherman's wharf.
author: Vinny T.

description: Great food & portions! Helpful staff. The only knock is it's pretty tiny. We sat outside which was nice but there is a constant line of people waiting to be seated standing next to you the whole meal. And since it's breakfast time, the sun was beaming on one side the table, relentless, hot & no relief. Add a small table-top & having to move items (hot sauces & ketchup) to the ground, you feel pretty cramped. The plus side is the food is delicious enough to put up with seating conditions. Enjoy!
author: Kim M.

description: This place was walking distance from our hotel. We decided to give it a try based on Yelp reviews. The food was deliciousl. Our server and the bus boys were all very attentive. My children loved there food .
author: Evelyn L.

description: Great little cafe for brunch. Price.is reasonable. Good menu selection. I had the breakfast burrito which filled me up the whole afternoon.
author: Roadrunner G.

description: We came here early one morning to enjoy a fairly empty cable car ride from Union Square down to the Wharf to enjoy breakfast.  There are other options nearby, but we wanted to try Hollywood cafe.  When we got there, there was a small line forming outside, and my group of four was second in line, behind another group of four.  They also have outside seating with heat lamps, but on this particular morning, we wanted to be inside where it was warm.  After a short 10 minute wait, we were seated inside the café, which really isn't that large.  The menu is extensive and they seem to favor having multiple types of eggs benedict.  In fact, while we were waiting in line outside, a customer who was leaving said "TRY THE EGGS BENEDICT, they are fabulous!"  I was tempted, but I usually stick to a classic breakfast, so of course, I ordered the Huevos Rancheros.  My kids got pancakes & French toast, and my wife got her usual breakfast sandwich with eggs / bacon.  Service was top notch, as obviously, they want to get you in and out, but not in a rushing way.  Our drink order was taken quickly and brought quickly.  Not five minutes after we ordered our food, it was at the table.  Crazy fast, but also crazy good!  Nobody complained about their breakfast, as our kids wolfed down their meals.  My huevos rancheros were very good as well, only being rivaled by the ones I've in the divey restuarants of Mexico City.  Overall, it seems that this restaurant knows what its doing, is popular, keeps its customers happy, and serves up good food.  My other love is that they never let our coffee cups get empty.  Asking for more coffee is annoying and I never had to ask here.  The only weird thing was that there is no rest room inside the café.  It's too small for that.  However, if you need to use the restroom, they give you a code to use to go in next door, venture through the bowels of the building, and find a restroom that seems to be available to other establishments in the area.  Also, as we were leaving, the waiting line increased by a large factor, so if you want to come here, be the early bird.  HIGHLY recommend this place!!
author: Herb D.

description: Amazing experience from beginning to end. The food was delicious  you could taste the freshness of the fruit. And the costumer service was outstanding, the workers were very attentive.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I love brunch and was really looking forward to this place after seeing great reviews and long lines. I went by for breakfast and got the Florentine Bennie. Not anything to write home about... the sauce was just average Bene, potatoes were the same. 
The service was excellent though! Prompt seating and attention to refills and pre bussing. Maybe I just didn't order the right thing?
author: Sarah S.

description: We really enjoyed Hollywood Cafe. Not too long of a wait for a Sunday am, prices are a bit steep but it's San Francisco, & to be expected. Our party for French toast/Pancakes & both were really delicious with fresh fruit which made for a nice surprise. Their vanilla lattes were great!
author: Janaye J.

description: Best place in town to have brea or lunch. Delicious food and very nice people taking good care of you. Best way to start the day.
author: Marina B.

description:
Every time I come to the US I like to start my first day with a greasy breakfast :-) so in searching for a local greasy spoon came across this place and decided to give it a try. 

I arrived at 7:30am and it was packed. I am guessing its popular with people in the area and by 7:45 there was about 10 people waiting for tables. It's not a very big place and there is seating outside as well for the warmer days. It's breakfast and lunch menu. 

The bread here is excellent....coming from Germany an important part of a good breakfast ;-)) I had the hash brown with eggs and sweet bacon...the bacon is marinated in a secret sauce and looks gooey and black and I loved it :-)) the hash brown was ok nothing special and the eggs cooked to perfection. Coffee was good as was the fresh orange juice. 

I would come back here again and enjoy other items on the breakfast menu. They only seat full parties so if there are people missing in your party wait it out as they do get a bit upset, like they did with me as I took a table and waited for my friend to arrive ;-))
author: Sam S.

description: Very rude waiters !! I waited in line like everyone else !!! I requested. Table for 4 as I had friends coming !! They told me by 3 different people and several times that they don't allow people to add on ?????? Also they got upset when I asked the to separate the check ??  Horrible service..
author: Christina G.

description: The fruit, the fruit!!! One of the most impressive fruit "sides" with brunch entrees ever. This wasn't your average soggy melon mix, it was cut so fresh the bananas hadn't browned and had kiwis, oranges and various berries.
author: Emily H.

description: I was recommended to come here by my concierge at Hyatt across the street. There was a 10 minute wait and I was given a chance to dive through the menu. It was simple and I decided to order the original eggs Benedict and the vanilla French toast. The food was served in about 10 minutes and I was greeted with a variety of colors. There was fresh fruit spread throughout the plate which was a pleasant surprise. It was balanced, nothing was overpowering. The cheese on the eggs Benedict complimented the bacon and the English muffin. The French toast was sweet but not up to the point where I'd feel sick. If anyone isn't sure where to go for breakfast this is the perfect place to spend a morning with family.
author: Justin C.

description: There was a small queue to be seated but this proves how popular the place is. Great breakfast and good coffee that was refilled regularly. Hash browns, eggs and toast recommended. A great start to the day.
author: Fiona E.

description: Ate here for breakfast today. All of the staff were super friendly and attentive. My coffee got refilled consistently and that is very important to me. I ordered an eggs Benedict with hash browns. It had so much flavor and the eggs were perfectly runny. The hash browns were thin and crisp. I always add pepper, hot sauce and ketchup. So amazing!!! The pancakes were even superb with chocolate chips and bananas cooked inside of them. I could not have asked for a better breakfast or friendlier service.
author: Sarina F.

description: First time visiting today. I just had some egg whites with hash browns, coffee and a English muffin. Food was really good, I enjoyed the jam. Staff was EXCEPTIONAL and super attentive. My only complaint was it was almost $18 for only that but I'm an out of towner so I'm sure it's standard.
author: J V.

description:
Fantastic breakfast! Excellent mocha coffee. Service was quick, even as busy as it was. Was there about 9am on Saturday, waited 10 min and got an inside table for 2. Both of us had the turkey eggs benedict. Was delicious. The Hollandaise sauce was light and creamy, the turkey sliced thick, hashbrowns perfectly cooked in both sides. 
Wish we had more time on this vacation, I'd eat here every morning.
author: Shelly R.

description: Great little cafe. Indoor and outdoor seating. I got the ham egg and cheese sandwich - which was actually 2 sandwiches! The eggs were great, I went back the next day and almost ordered it again but decided to try something else. The coffee is strong (but as a native New Yorker I appreciate strong coffee).  The staff is very attentive but not over the top. My mom ordered the BLT and my friend ordered the Rancheros and we were all very satisfied with our food.
author: Kerry M.

description: Overrated!!! They have no clue what Chilaquiles are!!! When it says it comes with chips I guess they were talking about the chipped plate. No action taken. Y the manager.
author: Maurizio F.

description: Eat at this place twice in a row, love their fresh squeeze orange juice, must have the Hollywood hash-brown and their fruit bowl
author: Sisi F.

description: First of all, great service. It is a tiny little cafe with great outdoor seating, but fairly cramped indoor seating (no biggie). The food was very good, especially the fresh fruit salad that comes with nearly every dish. I had the croissant sandwich (forgot the name) and it was great. Big, thick slices of flavorful bacon. I would definitely go back.
author: Britany F.

description: Great breakfast, from beginning to end. The service was great, the food was amazing. Something for everyone.
author: Theresa F.

description:
The hotel we stayed at Fisherman's Wharf (Zephyr) does not offer breakfast which was a good motive for us to explore the nearby places so Hollywood was one of them. 

We went there on a Monday morning, the line ahead of us was like 15 people, a waiter takes your name, preferred seating inside/outside and number of your party to follow up. Since the weather can be really chilly on mornings (July), inside was our choice. So might be longer wait because it is not a big place. Let's say 15 inside and 6 tables outside more or the less. You do the math.

Service is good, mostly Asian employees. Coffee was so so. I tried the asparagus eggs Benedict. It was okay. Hash brown is nice. They refill your coffee A LOT and without notice so they mass the milk and coffee measure, I did not like that. They may ask before pouring.

Interior design needs a renovation maybe a reform. All photos with different frames looks messy on that yellow-mustard colored walls.

I do not think it is worthy for that wait and atmosphere. Overrated.

* Fruit bowls seemed really fresh as an additional note.
author: Ceren A.

description:
Had the crab meat omelette with the fruit bowl. Even though this place is in Fisherman's Wharf (tourist area) it's really good and not too expensive. This place is always busy almost any day of the week so it's good to come early! We came before 8 and it was pretty much filled and we had to sit on the sidewalk.

The omelette was great, it came with a huge abundance of fried vegetable, bacon, green onions, green pepper and red onions. Also it came with a ton of crab meat inside and a huge flat perfectly cooked hash brown. The omelette itself was cooked for just the right amount of time.

Good service and fair prices!
author: Christopher L.

description: Came here for breakfast and luckily didn't have to wait very long maybe because we arrived around 11am. They are open daily 7am-1:45. Their mango mimosa was very tasty and I got a good buzz from one glass only. I also ordered the Denver omelette with hash browns. Their sourdough bread is so good and crunchy!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: My wife and I recently celebrated our wedding anniversary in San Francisco. We were staying at the Tuscan (soon to be renamed Hotel Zoe) which is located at Mason and North Point, about 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. I checked on Yelp for nearby breakfast establishments and Hollywood Cafe popped up, only one block from the hotel on North Point. I must say that the breakfast was terrific! My wife had the bowl of fruit with yogurt and I had the Marilyn Monroe, which is french toast with fruit. Delicious and huge portions! The fruit was fresh and plenty of it. The next time we are in San Francisco, Hollywood Cafe will be on our must do list.
author: Gordon G.

description: The food is average, but seemingly well prepared. I noticed that two employees (host and waiter/runner) gave me "stinky eyes" right after they looked at the amount of tip given. Otherwise, customer service was fine.
author: Marinella G.

description: First off, my coffee cup had a lip stick stain on it. Secondly, I got the "steak" which looks like a hamburger patty, which I do understand it is homemade ground but it was pretty gross, topped with mushrooms. Luckily my boyfriend liked their chicken sandwich so I ate some of that and the hash browns. Everything else did look delicious, so whatever you do, do not get the steak!
author: Madeline E.

description:
Well... I thought their rating may have been artificially inflated due to location in a touristy area surrounded by hotels ...but I was wrong!

We walked across the street from our hotel (Hyatt Fishermans Wharf) and grabbed a great outdoor table where we enjoyed the crisp air over coffee while we waited for our Grub. 

I enjoyed the Audrey Hepburn - 3 pancakes (almost a lil' sweet buckwheaty tasting.. Yumm n no syrup needed) and a colorful fruit bowl that overfloweth like a dream.  My better half enjoyed a plate we couldn't  pronounce  which consisted of chorizo, salsa, tortilla chips, scrambled eggs, cheese and beautiful sliced succulent avocado fanned over the top with the largest "slab" of hash browns over the plate .. Oh.. And if that wasn't enough - his came with toasted thick sourdough bread. 

Victor, our server, was most friendly and poised....our $2.75 cups of hot coffee never went below 2 sips.
 
Would we go back - heck yeah!
author: Karyn K.

description: This is a good breakfast place. Serves good food, plays music early morning. Hospitable staff.
author: Rithin P.

description: Great food and Wait Staff! The food is some of the best breakfast I have had. There is fruit served with almost every dish and it is all super fresh. Our group of four came here 2 days in a row.
author: Joseph C.

description:
I recently took a road trip to San Francisco with my family. While down there, we decided to try something other than IHOP for breakfast... best decision ever!
We stepped out of our hotel to find a long line of people waiting to get into this breakfast cafe. We stood in line on the sidewalk for thirty minutes before our name was called so be prepared to wait. But the wait was worth it! The food also took quite a bit of time but the cafe was packed so we figured that would happen. 
The orange juice tasted as if it was freshly squeezed into my glass! And the food was delicious!
author: Stephani Z.

description: Let me start off by saying that we did come at 9am on a Saturday but the weather was horrible and this place was still packed. We had to wait 45 minutes in a dingy back hallway with 20 other folks. Once we were sat the food was very good and the staff was attentive. It would have been better for the outdoor seating if it had not been pouring.
author: Mike J.

description: If you love good food, and enjoy going to a sketchy restroom. Go to this place, and make sure to try the blueberry pancakes while visiting
author: Mia L.

description: Lots of fresh fruits with your pancakes. The vegetables are also fresh. Many options on the menu for breakfast. The pancakes are not fluffy and buttery but ok with fruits and syrup. It's walking distance from fishermans wharf. They have indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Rieko M.

description:
Incredible !

The fruit is of high quality. 

Get the old favorite eggs. The ham is thick and savory. 

Hash browns are out of this world.

Do not get I intimidated by the line. .. it moves quickly.
author: Frank O.

description: Eat there while I'm SF for breakfast. Service was excellent and the food was very good and well presented. A little bit pricier than 8am which is amazing. I wouldn't pass up Hollywood as well.
author: Craig R.

description: This place was fantastic. Food was fresh and very tasty. Service was perfect. My wife had the healthy plate and it was wonderful. My daughter had French toast and hash browns and they were the best she has ever had. My only complaints were we had to wait 20 mins for a table and it was a little expensive. But I would still go back in a minute.
author: John B.

description: Great breakfast spot.  Big portions and very good food.  We sat outside and enjoyed the sunshine-filled morning.  Good food and if you are down in this area for breakfast I would highly recommend this place.
author: Roger B.

description:
Delicious breakfast! But be sure to get here with ample time and wait in line to be seated! Seating is very limited and can get pretty crowded in the mornings. My breakfast more than made up for the wait. 

The orange juice is fresh squeezed and their tea had a delicious hint of passion fruit! Speaking of fruit oh my goodness I hadn't seen such berries so fresh! For a bit extra you can have a reasonable amount of fresh fruit with your breakfast to include blackberries, raspberries, kiwi, strawberry, grapes, pineapple, melon, and apple (pretty much a rainbow of fruit!) 

This little restaurant is conveniently located near Fisherman's Wharf, and many of the hotels. Must try their fresh fruit!
author: Nasha W.

description: Great portion size...couldnt finish it all. Hash browns were delicious and crispy. French toast was golden and cooked just right.  Sweet bacon...try it.
author: Dawana G.

description:
Breakfast at the Wharf

This place completely surprised me! It is a few blocks away from me and although I have walked by it many times, I always snubbed it because I saw it as a "tourist hangout"! Well surprise surprise! It may be a tourist hangout but the food is pretty good and the prices are very reasonable. It is a small place, but if you are big on breakfast or Brunch, I can tell you that you won't be disappointed. If you are a local, you'll have to rub shoulders with tourists, but what's wrong with that as long as the food and the service is good?!

Anyway, local or visitor, give it a try if you are around and judge for yourself.
author: Afshin A.

description: This is my go-to breakfast place whenever I come to San Francisco. Great assortment of breakfast food with generous portions of fruit. I love how the fruit is not your typical cantaloupe and melon too. Lots of berries and grapefruit etc. It's really busy on the weekends so be sure to arrive early!
author: Alix F.

description: We walked in the rain and waited 40 minutes in the historic  Taylor building hallways to eat here....yes, it is worth it.  Even though everywhere on the Wharf sells Crab and shrimp with breakfast, these folks do it very special and delicious!
author: Kim J.

description: GREAT food and service.... Well worth the wait in line for 15-20 minutes on a Sunday morning!!
author: Tom L.

description: I was worried this was a tourist trap. Maybe it is, maybe it isn't but my scramble was amazing and the service was fast. The fruit bowl was great.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I was there a couple months ago and totally forgot to write the review. 
The food has nothing special. I got some pancakes, nothing exciting about them something I could I've done at home. And so the food isn't great and is overpriced that's why the 3 stars.
There are many other breakfast places in the city that might be "pricey" but offer something extra either, big portions, exciting additions or changes to traditional recipes, cool environments, experiences to the senses, or something. This place nothing really.
Regular food overly priced
author: Natalia E.

description: What a nice little breakfast place! The hotel front desk employee recommended this spot to us. And I'm really glad we decided to give it a try! It's a small spot, so be prepared to wait for a table. We came here during our first trip to San Francisco last Friday morning. It was around 8:30am. Luckily they had a table ready for us. We were seated outside. One of the server recommended a table right underneath a heater(thank God!). I ordered their classic eggs benedict.  Oh my goodness!!! It was to die for! The hollandaise sauce was on point and the yolk on the poached eggs was runny! (Just how I like it!) huuuuu-woooooow! I was in heaven. Their hash brown was made into a toasty rectangle(I've never had them like that before!). I loved everything! My hubby on the other hand wasn't too thrilled with his order. He had something with turkey sausage. The turkey sausage kinda tasted like it was the frozen kind(which is why I gave it 4-stars). But if ever I'm in San Fran again, I will definitely be back!
author: Carmel T.

description: Great food with a long wait.  If you need a heavy breakfast, it is worth it but mentally prepare yourself for the line.  Everything is good but the line is bad.
author: Jason B.

description: Great breakfast/brunch spot near fisherman's wharf! On a Sunday morning we only had to wait for 10 minutes for a table and our food was brought out very shortly after ordering. Hot, fresh, and tasty. Even our picky eater loved the pancakes and bacon. My eggs Benedict was really good, except the eggs were just a little over cooked. Forget about waiting an hour in line, if you are hungry, come here!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Truly disgusting. Turkey Benedict tastes like popcorn butter. Ratings are inflated by tourists - go to Pat's instead.
author: Wesley L.

description: We had the Vivian Leigh and it was delicious! Best breakfast We had while visiting San Francisco actually. The enormous portion of fruit that came with breakfast was so good! We had a small wait but the service was great.
author: Shanna S.

description:
Solid brunch place with good service and generous portions.

The line for a table looked really long when I got here around 10:30 on a Saturday morning, but they seated us really quickly. As a party of two, we were seated within 5 minutes. There is a small amount of outdoor seating which is so pleasant if the weather is nice.

I got the crab benedict (16.00) and I loved it! The poached eggs were super tender and the Hollandaise and oozing yolk made every bite creamy and rich. I also subbed the hash browns for fruit (+3.50) since I saw from Yelp photos that the fruit servings are huge, and they really are. Very generous amount of a variety of berries, as well as banana, pineapple, watermelon, honeydew, etc. The hash browns look delicious but fruit is great as a lighter option.
author: Lily T.

description:
The Hollywood Cafe was a stop of my group on a brisk Tuesday morning to eat a quick breakfast before going on a Golden Gate Bay cruise, and boy, we picked the right spot. 

Upon getting to the breakfast place we found a line of around 20 people but it moved surprisingly fast. We were swiftly ushered to a seat and ordered our dishes. I ordered the Gregory Peck special, consisting of fried mushrooms, egg, toast, hash browns, and more. 

Once we received our food we quickly dove in, not hesitating to indulge in our breakfast. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash browns at the right crispness. We were actually planning to eat a huge lunch later but mowed that down to a snack after realizing how full we were after leaving the cafe.

TL;DR:

Pros:
-Appetizing food, great start to the day
-Didn't even need to have a big lunch after this!

Cons:
-Greeted by line but it moved quickly 

Final Verdict: 4.4 STARS (Rounded to 4 stars)
author: Edmund Z.

description: Omg! So good! Almost everything can be made into vegetarian. My man had the orange French toast which is made with grand marnier in the batter. And I had the breakfast wrap minus the bacon. Holy. And the fresh fruit is to die for there. Only thing is service can be a little better. Found them lacking. But other then that I would come back. :)
author: ivanna h.

description: My absolute favorite brunch spot in SF. They provide a meals worth of high value fruit with almost every dish, and have a few fusion dishes; try the hash burrito with wasabi sauce. They don't take reservations, or even let you put your name down, you stand in line until a table is ready. However it moves fast and once you're seated you are never rushed through your meal. Their service is immaculate.
author: Patrick K.

description: Delicious food, ordered the shrimp and salmon benedict. Great customer service, outdoor seating available when the weather is nice. Only a couple blocks from the pier. Great way to start your day in SF.
author: Olive F.

description: 15 min wait despite a long line, but definitely worth it. Great breakfast, especially the crab omelette and the breakfast wrap. My daughter loves the chocolate chip pancakes. Very friendly staff.
author: Ken L.

description:
The perfect breakfast before a day of sightseeing! 

We stopped here before our 8:45 Alcatraz cruise because it was just down the street from the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf, where we were staying. We got there right after they opened at 7, and we were done with breakfast by 7:45. *Note that the place was packed by the time we were done, so if you have time constraints make sure you get there early. 

We were promptly seated and brought water and menus by the friendly staff. It's a cute little cafe with large photos of celebrities (Elvis, Marilyn Monroe, Clark Gable). The menu even has dishes named after said celebrities. Fun! 

I enjoyed the Morning Wrap which was more like a breakfast burrito - refried beans, eggs, bacon, avocado on a tomato tortilla with a side of house made pico. It was amazing and humongous! My fiancé enjoyed his eggs, chorizo link, and ridiculously large helping of hash browns. We were also given a side of sourdough toast which was better than what they serve at Boudin Bakery. 

The servers were all friendly and it was nice to see them working as a team. Our main waitress filled water glasses for other tables and vice versa. A different waiter took our check because he knew we were in a hurry and our server was taking an order.

Next time we will split one breakfast but will be back for sure, and recommend anyone in town to come too!
author: Jenni L.

description:
A little pricy but very very delicious food!! & big portions! They definitely do not skimp out! French toast slices are very thick & airy, hash browns are nice & crispy on the outside while fluffy on the inside, Dungeness crab benedict is loaded with tons of crab & spinach topped w/ a perfectly poached egg & creamy hollandaise sauce. Hawaiian omelette is huge loaded with pineapple & ham - delicious! Fruit bowl is huge & loaded w/ watermelon chunks, blackberries, raspberries, cherries, grapefruit slices, orange slices, kiwi slices, banana slices, honeydew chunks & cantaloupe chunks. 

Bottom line - great location, right by the Fisherman's wharf & really great food.
author: Kristie L.

description: I love this place and always go when I come to San Fran! They always serve ample amounts of the most beautiful berries on their waffles, pancakes etc! I usually order the Marilyn Monroe!
author: Marilyn H.

description: This place was fantastic. Super friendly servers. Generous portions. Pleasant atmosphere. Beautiful woman with me. Dungeness Eggs Benedict was delicious! This was a Tuesday morning so it wasn't crowded: no wait!
author: Matthew J.

description:
In my experience, it's easy for brunch to be mediocre, and very difficult to be outstanding. Hollywood Cafe was solidly in the middle of the pack. A solid brunch, but nothing too special (but as I said, it's hard to make something like pancakes and French toast innovative and brilliant). I ordered the dungenous crab eggs benedict, and the egg was definitely overdone - but the capers and sauce were great. 

We got there a little before noon on Saturday and there was a short line, but it went fast. Service felt rushed, but friendly. There's no bathroom, so be aware of that.
author: Lauren C.

description: The orange juice is bomb! And so is the food. Portions are more than enough. The staff is friendly and seating is right away. Next time I'm back in town I'm coming back.
author: Vivian P.

description:
We almost didn't go because of the plethora of people waiting outside, but we decided to put our name down and before we knew it we were eating a delicious breakfast. In fact, we liked it so much the first time we ate there again! If you ask for fruit as your side be prepared to be barraged by more fruit than you can handle...I actually felt bad not being able to eat it all because it was fresh raspberries, blueberries, etc. 

On our first visit I absentmindedly left my credit card on the table and when I called about three hours later they told me that they had it. When I went to retrieve the card, even though I gave my name, the man still asked for some form of ID which I thought was very nice. Bravo Hollywood Cafe, and thank you!
author: Mitch K.

description: My veggies and egg whites were not that great, it's a little overpriced in my opinion. On the other hand, their fruit bowls are good.
author: Diana B.

description:
Here we are again...Not soon enough in my humble opinion, but we only get to SF to ride our bikes every so often. 

If there is a better place in SF to have beakfast we dont know were it is...The unassuming sidewalk cafe has never disappointed and if you're a connoisseur of the breakfast meal I challenge you to find a flaw in this establishment..barring the restrooms. 

P.S. - Don't forget to put your name on the list...We've seen many a tourist sit outside "in line" waiting for their name to be called ;-)
author: Lorri D.

description:
3 stars at best. 

Wife and I flew up to sf for the day and this was our first stop before venturing out around SF all day. 

Line moved quickly so that was good. Service was friendly and attentive. Stats for that. 

Food on the other hand was just okay. Felt rushed.  Actually it was rushed and came out faster than I thought. 

I had the Hawaiian omelette it was decent or as described at least. The hash browns were just okay. They were cold when they got to us. We read reviews and asked for them to be extra done. We also got a side of hash browns Hollywood style which was a lazy attempt at melted cheese onions and peppers on top. The Benedict lacked flavor. *But it looked great! 

This place looks better on paper or in pictures than on the real plate. We won't be rushing back.
author: Jow O.

description: There will be a line but the proprietor has their stuff together, line moves quickly compared to most in the city. Hearty breakfast for a cold SF morning .
author: Joe Y.

description: The Irish coffee is stout but tasty and the breakfast is top notch! Service is quick and friendly even in a rush. Great place!
author: Marcus V.

description: Breakfast was good and decent.  Not much different than your average breakfast place.  We ordered the Gregory Peck and we were surprised that the steak was so small.   The prices were quite high, due to the location by the water.    I gave this place 3 stars because it wasn't horrible, but it also wasn't amazing.  The line was long outside so we had these really high expectations, but in the end it was average breakfast food that suffices.  The service was good and food was average, but with so many places nearby without the long line I would look for another place.
author: Sophie G.

description: Quick service and pretty good.  Go to Hollywood instead of Mama's.  The place is bigger so the wait is pretty short.  The only thing that didn't impress me were the hashbrowns.
author: Bernie H.

description:
Best place i ever been for breakfast! 
We got there at around 11am on Saturday, the line wasn't that bad - around 8 people in front of us. 
The food was amazing! Don't miss the fruit bowl!
author: Mai L.

description:
Came for breakfast and loved it so much we came back for lunch!

There was a line but it moved fast and our party of 5 was able to sit down quickly.

Great service and great food. For breakfast our group got eggs Benedict, the Vivian Leigh, and breakfast wrap. For lunch we got the strawberry salad, avocado salad, tuna melt, BLT, and burger. All were great!
author: Laura M.

description: The line outside the door tells you this place is worth the wait! The staff is super friendly and the food is delicious. We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning and had the Audrey Hepburn (the fruit cup itself was a meal and everything was fresh and ripe!), the ranchero eggs, a mocha, and a chai latte... everything was awesome!
author: Heather D.

description: Very glad we googled best breakfast around Fisherman's Wharf and this place came up. I had the Ham and Cheese Omelette and man it was huge, I couldn't even finish my meal and I'm a bigger dude. Omelette was just like the ones I make at home so the meal felt good. Me being from Minnesota don't cha know, lol
author: David P.

description: Always a wait here but you won't wait long . They really turn over the tables quickly without you feeling rushed . Freshly squeezed OJ , delicious jams . Everything I have had here is top notch . Great service . Don't be intimidated by the long lines . A must try .
author: Greg E.

description: Am I making your food jealous yet?!  Check out my delicious and healthy breakfast in #BarquistFitness #California #HealthCoach #CleanEating
author: Julie H.

description: Delicious food and very close to fisherman's wharf so the area is nice to walk at. Had the best Benedict's to choose from!
author: Pakiza C.

description: This was a great spot to get breakfast that was close by my hotel. The food was presented very well, and tasted even better than expected. Will definitely be returning here during my trip.
author: Manuel A.

description:
Being generous with a 3 of 5 because perhaps this was a fluke, but we had quite a negative experience here. Our plastic juice and water glasses were cloudy and badly scratched. I asked if I could substitute my toast for fruit and acknowledged that there would be an upcharge, but i was told that i could only substitute the hashbrowns. 

We ordered the C.A.S. omelette and Steak and Eggs. The omelette was bland and the toast that i didn't want had hair in it. The steak and eggs was really a Salisbury steak, not a cut as one would expect based on the menu description. 

Not a place I would recommend.
author: Carolyn V.

description: Did not like the food, ambiance, service ok and dirty place. Food was served cold and taste is not appetizing at all.
author: Nimmi M.

description: I am avoiding to eat at tourist spots and Hollywood Cafe is one of them. We ordered Salomon Benedict and classic eggs and bacon. Nothing special, probably SF visitors would like it but I have had so many better brunches in SF and I could not enjoy my food in Hollywood Cafe.
author: Ahmadreza K.

description:
Probably one of the best place in San Francisco to get breakfast! Be aware that there may be a line but it's worth the wait.

I ordered the Chilaquiles, which I honestly don't remember the contents, but I remember  that it's one of the best breakfast entrees I ever had.

My experience in Hollywood Cafe was positive. The customer service here was also superb and continually asked my friends and I if we ever needed anything.
author: Aj C.

description:
Mediocre, ordinary, average, uninspired- all of these words came to mind after our breakfast here.

Why, Yelp does this place have so many stars?!

I had the crab omelette. It was heavy on the green onion and cheese, light on the crab. It was a large omelette, but not especially flavorful or delicious. The hashbrowns were the frozen variety, and they were also bland. 

The bathroom situation here is sketchy AF. You have to ask someone for the code. Then go outside and down a ways, and through a separate door. Then, you have to go down a creepy hallway, around a corner, and you'll find the bathroom. It was reasonably clean, but I would expect a better bathroom from a place charging these pricepoints. 

It wasn't awful, it wasn't awesome... no one got sick or kidnapped when they went to the bathroom... but it didn't leave enough of an impression that I would ever go back.
author: Ashley P.

description:
The older I get the less I realize I know.  Truly, in the scheme of things, I know nothing.  Read this anyway.

That morning this week passed would be further affirmation of a fact that really needs no further affirmation.  We're having breakfast where?  Fisherman's Wharf.  Oh.  Being more patient (my patience grows in inverse proportion to my intelligence) I elected to simply drive on, to trust the lapin and let her sense and sensibility be my guide.  Trust, thus far it's been spot on.

The line was long and for a moment I thought this was going to turn out in a less than stellar way but then I went and got coffee and I returned to occupy a part of the conversation with the couple from Dallas and rabbit all talking where to go and what to do and their dialect brought me back to those summers in West Texas and the boots my neighbor gave me and y'all don't even know from Texas so hush.

Hollywood staff have their practice down.  If we could scrape them and put them in a petri dish a few short years from now all American productivity problems would be solved.  Why it seems the hardest workers are often born on other soil is a question for another day.  No wonder we want to katy bar the door.

The space inside is small but the vast majority of patrons are from other lands on other time zones and they have bridges and prisons to see so they eat fast and don't tarry.  Our line was maybe 20 deep when we started but we were inside in less than a half hour.  That works.

It was the breakfast dishes we had and they were very tasty and very reasonably priced.  If memory serves wabbit had a scramble of some sort and I the Benedict.  Shared a bowl of fresh beautiful well-assorted (aka not just melon) fruit as big as my head.  The ambiance isn't all beards and glasses and affected accents and for this I was very happy and thought that hmm perhaps the wharf is actually a respite for some of the copy cat lifestyle that grows like weeds elsewhere.  Folks from out of town are earnest, and if they are partial to t-shirt shops and horrid bike-riding habits who am I to judge.  They're more real in many ways.

This is a pleasant change of pace.  Per the kaninchen, do give it a try.  The simple things in life ...
author: Markus N.

description: Very cute brunch place in San Fran by Pier 39. The employees were very friendly and their service was really fast. Place was clean. I got the Shrimp Benedict and my boyfriend got the regular scrambled eggs/sausage/hash. Food was yummy.
author: Lai P.

description: Great little spot not far from fisherman's wharf. My vegetarian omelette was delicious. Fast service too. Highly recommend. They also have outside seating options which is nice. I would definitely come again.
author: Dan D.

description:
On my recent trip to San Fran we stopped by Hollywood Cafe for brunch! It was right up the street from our hotel but more importantly, HC has great reviews on Yelp!

Location - a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Near a ton of tourist spots and hotels. There isn't a ton of seating so be warned HC might not be the best option for an extra large group. There is a good amount of outdoor seating but the tables are tiny so it was a struggle to fit all 6 of us and our plates at the table but we made it work. 

Food - solid breakfast spot. I had the BAT (bacon, avocado, and tomato and eggs) which is great after a night of drinking. I ordered it with egg whites (because, healthy). Word of advice: order the Hollywood Cafe Hashbrowns - basically a play on loaded mashed potatoes (hashbrowns topped with peppers, onion, cheese, and bacon). Every table gets a stack of toasted sourdough bread which is a big hit with a bunch of hungry 30 something's. The mango mimosa was a big hit as well.   

Service: boy they are fast here. The food is turned out so quickly. I think that's how they're able to have such a high volume in such a tiny space. One note, you will likely have 3 or 4 different servers. Basically everyone that walks by asks if you need anything. And when the food is ready, whatever server is around brings it out. I'm not mad at this, by the way. All of the servers were super friendly.
author: Christina P.

description: We found this cozy cafe around the corner from our hotel. There was a line to get a table, like the line idea instead of taking names seemed like it went faster. We had breakfast and the food was really good except for the potatoes could've been cooked a tiny bit more. The service was awesome and extremely attentive. I would recommend. If ever up in the area again I'd revisit for sure.
author: Nita H.

description:
Absolutely amazing! It's fresh, convenient, delicious and everything else you'd want in a breakfast/brunch spot! 

While I'm from NJ I've been here quite a few times while visiting the area, years ago I did a Yelp search while sitting in my hotel room starving with my family begging for me to 'just pick a place'. We walked over to this gem and holy sh*t we were amazed! 

The omelette are the size of your face, overflowing fruit bowls are the best additive to any meal and the French toast is to die for. 

You won't be disappointed with this place, really you won't.
author: Lauren T.

description: Best place for breakfast in the Fishermen Wharf area. Don't let the long line stop you, it moves pretty fast. Ordered the Marilyn Monroe, French toast with fruit bowl. Without exaggerating the best fruit bowl I have ever seen. Everything fresh, sweet and perfectly ripe. The French toast was just as good. Great service, kept my coffee cup full. Highly, highly recommended.
author: Rick D.

description: I had the eggs Benedict original. A good presentation but the flavors were average. My wife had the basics pancakes with scrambled eggs. I ordered an Orange juice $4.99 and my wife a Diet Coke. Service was good and the food was plentiful, we both thought it lacked flavor.
author: Petey C.

description: Great breakfast! Good fresh OJ and fruit. We got the Mediterranean Wrap and banana pancakes. Everything was delicious and wait staff was quick! We got here a little after 8 and didn't have to wait too long. 10 minutes maybe.
author: Terra E.

description: Sorry, but I don't get the favorable reviews. I will definitely agree that the fruit is a fantastic substitute for hash browns. But I need a little more than a bowl of tasty fruit to justify $50 for 2 breakfasts. Contrary to claims, it isn't "always" busy. We stopped by at around 7:30 and there were only 4 tables occupied. The sausage patties were tasteless, the eggs were...eggs. If this is what warrants 5 stars you folks need to get out of the city a little more.
author: Larry C.

description: Yummiest burrito ever!  A must try, quaint home style breakfast and lunch restaurant. This was just an order to go and worth the stop. There is usually a line, as this place is small. The line does go fast and worth the wait and money if you wish to eat in. Friendly and courteous staff, menu has a wide selection of breakfast and brunch items to choose and doesn't disappoint.
author: Barbie H.

description: Great breakfast if you are a breakfast lover! My husband ordered a meat plate and definitely lacked something else that so much fries hid!
author: Lizzie C.

description: There's always a line of people waiting for a table, and there's a reason why! The food was absolutely amazing......so delicious!! The presentation was beautiful and the service, very good. I would go back here in a heartbeat! So many wonderful choices. I had the Vivian Leigh, and the accompanying fruit cup was so fresh and tasty. Will definitely come back here again and recommend it to everyone living in it visiting SF!!!
author: Marichel G.

description: Some of the best breakfast options I've ever had. Get the Vivian or the Turkey Benny. Phenomenal.
author: James O.

description: Delicious food!!! It's kind of awkward to walk up to the first time bc you're trying to figure out the line situation...basically everyone just forms a long line down the sidewalk in front...i waited for about 15 min, it went by quickly, and had about 4 parties ahead of me.
author: Sofia P.

description: Delicious, fresh and plentiful servings. Maybe best eggs benedict I've ever had. I had dungeness crab eggs benedict and husband had standard benedict. Daughter loved audrey hepburn bfast. Best orange juice ever and enormous hash browns. No need for lunch after this bfast! Locally owned and convenient to our fishermans wharf hotel.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Food looks beautiful but the taste is bland. 

The line is super long and the service is mediocre at best. 

Eat somewhere else and be happy. Or eat here but don't expect much. 

Meh. 

Better off going somewhere else.
author: Betty N.

description:
Hollywood Cafe was Stop #1 on my 2014 Birthday Food Crawl.  

I've always wanted to come here ever since I saw a YouTube video of one my favorite J-pop singers, May'n, eating over here for breakfast.  It was brief, but she looked like she was enjoying her meal so much (http://bit.ly/1vGt5nq).  I think if I never saw that little clip, I probably wouldn't have ever considered coming here, especially with it being at Fisherman's Wharf.  Though it's pretty impressive how despite being in a touristy part of town, Hollywood Cafe still cranks out some delicious food at low prices making it very easy to see why this place always has a long wait to get a table.  I would call this place the Brenda's of Fisherman's Wharf because of that.

Dungeness Crab Benedict with Hollywood Hash Browns --  http://bit.ly/1zwIK42
It was almost like I had two main entrees on one plate!
With the Hollywood Cafe being located near Fisherman's Wharf,  I wouldn't really expect anything less with the Dungeness Crab Benedict.  And it did not disappoint.  These were loaded with a huge amount of fresh Crab Meat!  It was amazing!  The hollandaise sauce was perfect making these one of the best Benedicts I've had in SF!  (Sorry, Zazie!!)  The Hollywood Hash Browns seem to steal the show on this plate topped with Bacon, mushroom, onion, bell pepper, basil flakes and melted cheddar cheese.  So much going on with this and it's really good! 

One thing I've also noticed looking at other people plates is that if it comes with fruit, they definitely don't skimp on the fruit.  They generously serve you a mountain for freshly cut fruit!  How awesome is that?

I definitely would love to come back to Hollywood Cafe again.  What I've had so far has been awesome and I'm looking forward to try their other breakfast and lunch items.  If you do decide to check it out, I highly recommend coming early, otherwise be prepared for at least an hour wait.  It's still worth it!
author: Rodney H.

description: Love coming here the best breakfast place I have tried so far fruit is always fresh and they don't disappoint. Totally worth the money.
author: Janett J.

description: Great place for breakfast in the city. Seating was fast and service was friendly! Would recommend to a friend
author: Allie T.

description:
Okay, so the food was good.
Service was excellent but if anybody from management is reading this, do something about the bathrooms.
Horrible!!! That ruined the entire experience.
Still 4 stars, but avoid using the bathroom.
author: Mike Y.

description: The line was long but went fast no longer then 20 min. The service was great. the food came fast, it was fresh and hot. The portions were perfect. Good price! This place was worth every bit.
author: Amanda P.

description: The food was great! Even my picky husband and picky kids all loved what they ordered. I didn't mind waiting in line outside on the curb because the line moved fairly quickly. The line also got long fast, so I would recommend arriving early. The staff was attentive and didn't rush us, even though they obviously want the tables to turn when the line is so long. The food came quick and the coffee was always full. Glad we tried it.
author: Allie S.

description:
The food was really good and the portions are generous. I just took off one star because the lady that came to attend the line was super rude. She asked how many and inside or outside and we said inside and she just said ok it's a long wait and continued to the next party. So my friend said oh can we change it to either, and the lady shushed my friend to stop talking. So rude. 

Got the eggs Benedict with salmon and shrimp  and Hollywood hashbrowns. They were so good. I also asked for hash to be extra crispy. The toppings on the hash was omgahhhh tasty. The poached egg was cooked perfectly and was amazingly gooey. The salmon was a little too salty. 

My friends ordered a side of fruit and it was so much fruit, very generous with portions. 

We sat outside and the sun was really burning into my legs so careful if you don't like being hit by the sun.
author: Jackie N.

description: I heard about this place from a coworker, and when he told me it was at Fisherman's Wharf, I totally discounted it. But then when I read all the good reviews, I decided to come check it out on a early Saturday morning. We got here a little after 10 AM, and got into the line outside of the restaurants, there were two parties ahead of us. The wait was probably 10 minutes. We both really liked our food. Will be coming back, even if this is in Fishemans wharf.
author: Jenny L.

description: The food was amazing. Service could not be better. Really enjoyed our visit. The staff was so attentive and ready to help each other. I had the hash burrito with fresh avocado. Could not have been better. Definitely would recommend.
author: Scott H.

description: Great food! Worth the wait! Our family highly recommends the crab omelet. For the non seafood eaters, pancakes were delicious!!
author: Lindsey S.

description: Couldn't have gone to a better place for breakfast. I mean WOW! The Bloody Mary was amazing and the turkey eggs Benedict was FIRE! Presentation is a plus too! All other food items I could see around me were incredible. A+++
author: Sean K.

description: My second time visiting Hollywood Cafe, but my fiancee' s first. It is a very quaint little cafe with outdoor seating (they do have heaters above the tables for cold mornings), but if you prefer to sit inside be prepared to have a small wait (we waited about 10 minutes). I had the crab omelette, it was full of crab, however the flavor was lacking and it needed to be a bit warmer, the hashbrowns were amazing though   and the toast was a tummy thick cut sourdough. My fiancee had the Hawaiian omelette (pineapple, ham, and cheese), She said hers was amazing however it was very filling with everything inside! We each had a cup of hot chocolate @ 4$ a pop, they were nice coffee cup sizes however a bit pricy for being a powder mix and not homemade. Our total was 39$ before tip, not too bad for all the food we received.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
This place is breakfast heaven on earth! There are sooo many good breakfast spots in SF, but sorry this one takes the cake!

One word... "Hollywood Hashbrown"... Ok two words, or three.. I don't know. What it means- it is a crispy crunchety hash brown that is literally the size of the entire plate! It is an extra $2, but that has got to be one of the greatest ways to spend 2 dollars I can think of.

What I got: I ordered the "Chilaquiles" and upgraded to the "Hollywood Hash." Dude, this breakfast was ridiculous! It had Bacon, Chorizo,  fresh avocado, peppers, onions, tomatillo salsa, this thing was off the charts good. I am venturing to say it was the GREATEST BREAKFAST OF ALL TIME. I know that is a big statement but Its true! You know an establishment is serious about breakfast when they cut the succulent crunchy bacon strips into bite size pieces. What a treat!

What the Wifey got: Orangish French Toast. This french toast super flavorful with a delicious dulce appropriately named "orangish" flavored sauce on top. The french toast was thick, succulent, and browned to perfection. It was great.. However my wife a little envious of my Chilaquiles for what its worth.

The Verdict: Best breakfast I have ever had.. So far SF was a little bit of a downer for us, but this spot is an absolute bright spot and makes me consider coming back.

Keep doing your thing Hollywood and do NOT change the Chilaquiles!! I will be back tomorrow!
author: Jason C.

description: We were lucky enough to stumble upon this little gem. For the price, it's an amazing value. A bit of a wait naturally, but worth it. Enjoy!
author: Ian H.

description: Five of us enjoyed breakfast here, each having a different selection. The portions were HUGE, the service was great and the breakfasts were awesome. Always worth the wait!
author: Misty Z.

description: Love finding great breakfast spots.  Try it and I promise that you won't disappoint.  Really fresh fruit but the Dungeness was awesome!!
author: David W.

description: Amazing place for brunch. I was with a group of 10 friends and we loved the brunch here.
author: Namrata D.

description: Such fresh food and not your standard fruit bowl: berries galore, pineapple, kiwi, grapes, grapefruit, orange and melon - yumm! Our party ordered eggs, French toast, an egg wrap and the "healthy plate" - all made with love - tasty and made to order. So good we're going back again. The wait was about 20 minutes, but worth it
author: Germaine H.

description: Spent the weekend in SF and we stopped in here for breakfast. The food was absolutely amazing. We had a wait a bit outside in line but once sat the food came out immediately. I thought it was a bit pricey for two people as we paid $55 for breakfast which might be the case with all things in this area. For that, I am giving them 4 stars but I would highly recommend.
author: John M.

description: Delicious food with huge portions. Sitting outside was a treat. The Denver omelette was good but maybe a few too many bell peppers. The coffee was hot and they kept it coming. Hash browns were crispy and not too salty. We loved it here and will be back next visit for sure.
author: Robert G.

description: Being that it was walking distance from our hotel we decided to try it out. Sweet lord baby jesus!! This place is awesome. We definitely picked a great spot to eat some breakfast while in San Fran. I got the Meat Lover omelette and I hit the nail on the head with that one. My fiancé got the veggie omelette and that was really good. Each plate comes with hash browns and they are amazing. I will come back soon cause I love San Fran. Everyone in the San Fran area needs to come and eat at this place.
author: Darwin I.

description: Very small cafe however nothing small about food and service.   Outstanding.   Best breakfast by far.
author: John L.

description: One of the best brunch places in town ! Hash Browns are a must here. It was brunchtastic !!
author: Vikrant S.

description:
I came to this place on spring break w/ friends.(March 22nd) Wanted to have breakfast before we started our day around San Francisco. So I looked up to find breakfast places to eat that was walking distance. & seen good reviews about this place. So me & my girls argee to go to this place.

We started walking had my GPS for the directions to get there it didn't take long to get there it was very close by. And notice the line was outside. It wasn't a long line, it was a small place but had tables outside as well. The wait for us wasn't very long (10mins) & they seated us outside. We had a menu already while waiting in line so we know what we wanted. We sat down & the waiter asked what we wanted to drink, gave us our drinks then came back asked what we wanted to order. I got the omelette with hash browns the omelette had ham, bacon,& sausage w/cheese & onions. My friends order the same thing it was name after a movie star I couldn't think of her name. But it had two sausage patties hash browns & eggs w/onions & peppers.

They said the enjoyed thier breakfast and I did as well. It was a nice hearty breakfast to start our day around San Francisco. This place is very popular because of the food portions. Nice experience to be in San Francisco will definitely go here again whenever I have a chance to go to San Francisco.
author: Lillian K.

description:
Love this place, the wife and I make it a point to go here each time we're in the city (we live in Santa Rosa)
Each time we go we get something different, and each time we love it.
It's coma food. They give you so much you need a nap after you eat ( so fresh)
.
author: Kevin K.

description: These folks do breakfast right!   Small little cafe near the Wharf.  You must have the "sweet bacon" and the house hash browns.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Paul M.

description: Ordered a burger...had no flavor. Oh and that was a mushroom burger that literally had three small slices of mushrooms for $15. The waitress was however really nice.
author: Kel L.

description:
I have to say, I am impressed. I thought this spot would be another over-hyped brunch spot, but I was pleasantly surprised. 

I came here with a girlfriend to celebrate her super late birthday. We both opted for a Hollywood Favorite: she got the Vivian Leigh and I got the Marilyn. 

First off, as many other yelpers had mentioned, their fruit portions are huge. If you aren't a big breakfast person, it's a mean in itself. Not only were the portions great, but the variety plus the quality of the fruit just makes it even better. Don't even get me started on the french toast....I want to say it was the best french toast I've ever had because it was cooked so perfectly: that crisp on the outside that gives you that nice texture and bite and then nice and chewy in the middle. Even after the french toast cooled down and sat on my plate as I attended to my fussing son, it still held it's texture and was simply divine. 

Service here was superb. Even with a line and the hustle and bustle of Saturday brunch, they were very accommodating to my son and I--they saw I had a stroller and gave me a table that had easy access and helped me move it in and out when the table next to us left and the next party got seated. They also filled our water multiple times. 

This place is a must for breakfast, lunch, or brunch. I look forward to my next trek to SF so I can come back and try more of their dishes!
author: Jamie A.

description: I can definitely say that if you're looking for a different place than the top 2 breakfast/lunch chains, then this is the place to go. Although small, this cafe was just right. The service was responsive and fast, yet not hostile. We felt welcomed. The food went above my expectations but was not the best i've ever had. It all tasted great, and we would definitely go again. If you're looking for something new and reasonably priced, then this is the place to go.
author: Ricky O.

description: Really good breakfast spot.  I had the crab omelette and it was delicious. I recommend getting there early to avoid the line!
author: Brooks A.

description:
Excellent high quality breakfast / lunch cafe (mainly on breakfast) located near the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf. Why 5-star? Pretty simple - friendly customer service, generous food portions, fluffy french toast, and delicious fruits (yes, fruits)!

Our group came here for 8 AM breakfast and we were prompted seated without having to wait (you know the old saying - early bird gets the worm). To start, I ordered a cup of hot tea and I was given with various tea bag (approximately 5~10 choices, I picked the Earl Grey). Oh, free refills on coffee + hot water for tea. In fact, one of the staff refilled my friend's drink in a blink of an eye!

Three wedges french toast combo (classic french toast with two eggs + sausage patty, $12) - Soft and fluffy french toast ... orange marmalade with right sweetness ... juicy and flavorful sausage patty ... slices of orange that actually tasted sweet and not sour ... fresh grapefruit + banana + strawberry ... yum, yum, yum!

Expect a hearty and delicious breakfast at Hollywood Cafe, highly recommended.
author: Luke L.

description: Don't be scared by the line! It's absolutely worth it! Incredible food, flavors, generous helpings...we ordered omelets, French toast and a breakfast sandwich and shared and honestly everything was perfect. I was surprised by the generous helpings of quality fresh fruit! Just look at all the pictures! Can't wait to come back!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
We ate here the morning we arrived in SF. My family members were all VERY hungry and we saw on Yelp that this place was close to our hotel (Pier 3030). 

Heads up- this place is TINY so if you go during peak breakfast hours, expect to have to sit outside on a tiny table, or wait a while. We opted to eat outside due to the hunger level, but we kind of regretted it, as it was a cold and drizzly January winter morning. 

Aside from that, the food was very good! A 4.8/5'. Their fresh fruit that came with our breakfasts was delicious. Each fruit was perfectly ripe and sweet. We ordered some sourdough toast to come out before our breakfasts to tide over my little one who was getting very hangry lol. By the time we finished the toast, our main meals were being placed in front of us. Perfect timing. 

It was fairly overpriced, but I guess that's pretty standard for the Warf area. 

I'd eat here again! :)
author: Christina O.

description:
I guess this is one of "those" places you have to go for brunch in the city, for locals and tourists alike. Signs of a good brunch place:

1. There is always a line up at least 30 mins long, even in the rain;
2. They have a self serve sign up sheet;
3. The tables are spaced out like sardines 

Hollywood Cafe fits the bill on all 3. 

The menu is mouthwatering and like the other reviews said, all plates are overflowing, especially with fresh fruit! (And who doesn't love fruit). My friend ordered the Marilyn Monroe (top seller) and I had overeasy eggs with "Hollywood Hash"; a gigantic hash brown patty topped with a whole lotta goodness (see photo). I could barely finish it but damn that was good.

And the service is spot on; very friendly and attentive! 

I would totally go back to try more.
author: Cristina P.

description: Awesome breakfast spot in fisherman's wharf! Our first breakfast in San Francisco and it didn't disappoint. About a 25 min wait, but worth it! The French toast was amazing!
author: Thomas R.

description:
Marilyn Monroe was alive and well today, until I ate it.

Hollywood Cafe was apparently in the tourist books. Somehow I didn't get the tourist vibe when we were there. Although I did not look forward to entering the city with the most tourist in town, this cafe just seemed like a must-try.

I had the Marilyn Monroe, which was three slices of french toast with a HUGGGEEE bowl of fruits, and I mean, HUGE. The pictures don't lie people! I've had better french toast, but nothing can beat how much fruits I was given. If the complimentary bread (which was delicious by the way) wasn't provided to have the delicious jam be spread upon and devoured beforehand, I would've definitely eaten all the fruits in sight! I gave away half of my fruit and an entire slice of french toast and I was still super full! The hash browns aren't as crispy as I would like and the eggs were done too well today.

BUT the service is amazing and they are nonstop filling my coffee and water! I am a happy camper overall!
author: Linda K.

description: Happened upon this place thanks to Yelp!  I was visiting SF, doing all the touristy stuff very early in the morning - so nothing was really open on the wharf yet.  My friend and I found this place and goodness it was delicious!  Best breakfast in a long time!  Yummy fresh fruit, pancakes cooked to perfection, crispy bacon, hash browns how I like 'em!
author: Lisa A.

description: Out of 5 I would probably give this a 3, because the food is pretty good I would probably give it a 3 and the service was mediocre so also another 3. The environment in which you sit is pretty standard, but what really set this place to down to a 3 in my opinion was the price, i mean it cost 10.99 for just a standard French toast which came with 3 pieces of French toast and some fruit, and 13.99 for standard eggs Benedict which gave a grand total of 27.10. You may say well this a standard price for two people? True but for the taste of the food that price is just not worth it.So for those following reasons I give this a 3.
author: Ryan R.

description: There seems to always be a long line out the door of this place!  But don't worry, It moves quickly.  We stayed nearby and decided to check it out because of the strong Yelp reviews.  The name "Hollywood Cafe" didn't grab me and seemed so touristy and kitsch, but let me tell you this place is totally legit for a hearty and fresh breakfast!  I tried the Dimchae eggs Benedict- poached eggs, sliced sweet potato, kimchi (yaaaas!), and hollandaise on English muffin.  This is served with a large sheet of hash browns and some fruit.  It was different and very delicious.  DH had pancakes, which were great as well.  We shared a fruit bowl, which is a massive portion.  Cappuccino is also good here.  Certainly not a cheap breakfast, but you do get a lot of quality food.
author: Amelia S.

description: Nice place located in Fisherman's Wharf.  Good food!  I had the smoked salmon and eggs scrambled and they weren't shy about the smoked salmon at all!  Friend had the Eggs Benedict and never said a word while eating.  Line can get long like all breakfast / brunch places but moves rather quickly for a small place.  Would be hard to recommend for large parties, but overall enjoyed the food.  Service was average but not bad.  Would recommend if you're in the area.
author: Calvin J.

description:
Yes. Just, yes. 

When you get to Hollywood Cafe, there will be a line. Grab a menu and stand in the damn line because the meal that you are about to enjoy will be 100% worth it. 

My boyfriend and i chose this spot on a recent visit to San Francisco and are considering driving back just to eat here. So good!

He got the orangeish french toast and literally can't stop thinking about it. He gets french toast whenever we go to brunch and said that this was his favorite by far. I got the chicken apple sausage omelette with hash browns and a side of fruit. The omelet was jam packed with sausage, mushrooms, tomatoes and cheese and it was the most amazing omelet i have ever had. Also, the hash browns were perfect. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Amazing. I decided to get a side of fruit to trick my brain into thinking i was being healthy and because of all the delicious pictures on Yelp and i was not disappointed. All the fruit was super fresh and just delicious. 

Also, their iced tea and coffee is also on point. Basically everything on the menu is heavenly and you won't regret it.
author: Varsha N.

description:
Excellent food and very friendly staff! 
After a long flight from New York, decided to go here for brunch and i ate everything!
author: Daniel D.

description:
I've never been served so much food in my entire life. My plate was just over flowing with fruits! All kinds of fruits! Fresh strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, apples, bananas, pineapple, honeydew, cantaloupe, grapes, grapefruit!! Wow.. I was astonished by how much they expect customers to eat! My boyfriend and I came super early for breakfast like right when they opened and the place was already filled with tourist and I can see why. My boyfriend got a scramble and I had a bacon egg croissant sandwich with a side of fruit. More like fruit with a side of croissant. 

Everything looked and tasted great! Highly recommended.
author: Linz C.

description: Great cafe a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf. Large portions, eggs perfectly cooked and the best smokiest bacon I've ever had!
