Hash browns were crisp from end to end, not soggy in the middle like most I've had. Crab Benedict was scrumptious! Service was top notch and the coffee flowed freely! We will be back next time we're in town.
author: Laurie A.

description:
I'm so honored to be writing my 600th review for Hollywood café aka my BFF's...

It seemed like so long ago when I ate here, maybe because it was. 
I had taken a break from writing my thesis and needed to grab some breakfast. Oh...my...heavens.

I almost wrote my thesis on the food here instead. Simply amazing. I ordered a fruit bowl that came with the freshest, juiciest fruit on this green earth. 
This was accompanied by the crab omelet with a side of eggs. Everything was so tasty and fulfilling, the kind of meal that you'll definitely need a nap after consuming. 

The next day was graduation (yippppppy), so my mom and I headed over a few hours before the ceremony to indulge in some pancakes and waffles. Once again...so damn delicioso. Talk about the perfect start to the day.
I'm actually slightly disappointed with myself because I've lived in SF for 3 years and occasionally passed this joint on the way to classes, but never went in until my last days in this city. WTF! Hopefully you are reading my review and are heading there right now yourself.  

Additional notes:
-Good for groups, but small dining area.
-Indoor and outdoor seating.
-Very crowded on weekends, like most brunch spots.
-You'll receive the same food portion for takeout, as you do dining in.
-Staff is friendly and efficient.
-Does not accept reservations.
author: Court S.

description:
Hollywood Cafe is quite charming and inexpensive for its excellent quality of food. It's definitely the best breakfast spot in Fisherman's Wharf and it won't cost you a leg and an arm.

My girlfriend and I came here one early morning on a Friday for breakfast and there was only a brief 5 minute wait. I love the interior wall pictures, filled with ex and current Hollywood stars; who would have thought there be a LA theme restaurant in San Francisco? Upon seated, we were given a basket of free complimentary warm toasty bread with butter and waters. I ordered the Hawaiian omelette combo while my gf ordered the sunny side up egg combo.

Hawaiian omelette (4/5 stars): this omelette is huge. made with fresh eggs and satisfied my hungry appetite.  I love the pineapple and ham inside and the "brown" saucy pineapple on the outside. The mixed berries that come with it were a great touch! Sweet and delicious does it justice! Only flaw was the hash browns that accompanied my meal. It was not very crispy and too soft for my liking. 

sunny side up egg combo (N/A stars): I didn't have a single bite, but my gf loved it!

Hollywodo Cafe does a lot of stuff right. They have home made organic jams, Himalayan salt from Trader Joes and excellent service! If you find yourself in Fisherman's Wharf and in need of some breakfast foods, Hollywood Cafe will serve you just right
author: Philip M.

description:
Completely average. 

I searched yelp for the highest rated breakfast spots in the area, and Hollywood Cafe came up.

We ordered a crab eggs benedict, and it was good, but nothing spectacular. 

We were seated outside, so the hungry folks waiting in line kept watching us eat, which was kind of distracting. 

The coffee was pretty bad. The service was meh.

I have read other reviews, and the majority of praise is going to their bowls of fresh fruit? Yes, California has great-tasting fruit -- welcome :) I just don't see how buying and serving fresh fruit merits 5 stars.
author: Omar A.

description: Great breakfast. Large portions perfectly cooked. Fun environment. Friendly, attentive staff. Will definitely Go back next time I'm in the City.
author: david l.

description: This was so good we went there both mornings we were available. It's been awhile since our trip and we still talk about it!
author: Hilary P.

description: Burrito filled with eggs, hash browns,ham,cheese,avocado . Meatlovers omlete..fast service, coffee refills!!  Yummy
author: Patti A.

description: Amazing place for breakfast and brunch. Fast to be seated even though there was a line when we got there. The food was fantastic and the price was not bad. If you are in San Francisco i suggest you check this place out.
author: Oscar R.

description:
We are a family of 5 and decided to eat here because our 1st Yelp choice (Pat's Cafe) was closed for kitchen renovations. What a great backup! There was a line on the sidewalk but we didn't wait more than 10 minutes for a table. We ate outside even though it was cool, there were heat lamps hanging that kept us warm. 

The food came out in 15 minutes (so fast!). It was hot and very tasty. We would definitely eat here again. It didn't get 5 stars because I think everything should be amazing to earn 5 full stars and the table cloth had holes in it, we had to ask for napkins,silverware, refills on coffee & water etc, but the food was good!
author: Sylvia O.

description: I've been here before and had better.  The bacon was limp not crisp the patty sausage cold and questionable texture... flavor and ingredients .  The eggs were cold.... initially, they came back hot but in pieces... a lot of eggs in small pieces... hunks...When the plate went back I could see the expressions change on the faces of the cooks and staff.... it made me uncomfortable.  They seemed to be having a conversation and laughing...Got a discount still spent $15.00 on breakfast.......bacon, Sausage eggs and pancakes....
author: Kathy W.

description:
Visiting and trying new places. This place was delicious. Sure, breakfast is breakfast, but they're French toast was yum and totally and a fluff taste to it, bacon was thick and cooked just right, my over easy eggs were cooked perfectly, my wife's Benedict was also delicious. 

The wait wasn't too long, and the service was fast. I wish the actually dine in area was bigger but it was a nice day to eat outside. 

I would definitely go back.
author: Michaelangelo M.

description: Glad we tried this place while visiting from Michigan! We had breakfast here on a Thursday morning and got seated right away. The food was excellent, food came out fast and service was good!
author: Nick G.

description: Best thing we ordered here was the crab omelette, unfortunately we didn't take a pic, but it was super delish. Be prepared for a line going into this place, but once you get inside the service is great. Our food came out pretty fast, and they were on top with filling our coffee. The eggs Benedict were just ok... the hollandaise sauce was a bit too tarte for my taste, and the hashbrowns I had were not too hot. Honestly would give this place a solid 3.5, but the service ppl were super helpful. The food is good, but keep in mind in San Francisco there are loads of awesome brunch places...!
author: Giang C.

description: Hollywood cafe knows great breakfast! The food is most definitely worth the wait in line. Once I find something I like, I tend to order it every time. My go-to item here is the crab omelette (with hollandaise if I feel I deserve the extra calories). The omelette is rich and delightful with a satisfying amount of crab meat perfectly paired with smooth avocado, Swiss cheese, and scallion. It comes with a side of hash browns and sourdough toast. Today I discovered the blackberry jam on the table and it is most definitely "the jam" once you spread it on top of the butter and toast. You'll leave feeling full and happy. Perfect meal to prepare you for a day of sight-seeing.
author: Katie B.

description:
Food is amazing!! 
Line up is a little long, 
And ambiance of the whole restaurant is very rustic. 
Interesting trip to find the bathroom. 
But overall, quick efficient service and great food.
author: Nicole V.

description:
This place is amazing. Came here on Saturday morning for brunch. Had to wait in line for sometime but it's worth the wait.

We ordered healthy plate- egg white omelette With fruit bowl and Ranchero egg . Both were amazing . They serve homemade jam which tasty yummy. 

Overall I recommend this place .the food was delicious and it's worth the wait.
author: Munch B.

description: The taste was great but the portions were so much smaller than the picture. The Hollywood Hasbrowns looked and tasted pretty rushed there was nothing truly exciting about them but they were ok. Where was the fruit?! There was a couple pieces on my plate a raspberry, a blackberry and a couple grapefruit slices that was it! The jam was good on the toast I wish that was warmer though. Now the flavor of the pancake was a different story! I loved it so I will be back for those. My friend ordered the French toast, sausage and eggs on the side and she said her meal was exciting but small I'm portions compared to the wonderful pics we saw on Yelp that hyped this place up. I hope to give this place another chance but hoping for a better experience especially if I'm going to wait in line for almost an hour..
author: Danielle M.

description:
The Hollywood cafe did not disappoint!!!!  We walked a couple of blocks from the Courtyard and arrived at 7:20. The place was already 80% full. Service was prompt and the food was plentiful and delicious. I had the BAT and upgraded to the Hollywood Hashbrowns for $2 more. My son had the Vivian Leigh. The fruit bowl with his meal would have cost $13 somewhere else!!!!  Absolutely delicious. 

They turn tables around very fast so the line moves. When we left the line was down the street. Great place for a delicious and quick big breakfast before touring San Francisco. This would not be the place to leisurely read your paper with a cup of coffee. They keep it moving!!!

Edited to add:  it was so good yesterday we came back again!!!!!
author: Moira L.

description: Always plenty to eat and is always delicious. The fruit bowl for a side is no joke. Such a variety in fruits and is delicious. The Vivian Leigh is a hit with us as well as the omelettes. The bacon in the VL sandwich is amazing and the hash browns are as big as your face. Overall a good experience and we usually share food.
author: Taylor J.

description: The fresh fruit was simply amazing. Like, I was blown away at how delicious all of the fruit was. The sweet blueberries, the juicy strawberries, the tart blackberries. That little side alone was delicious and worthwhile. The French toast was also delicious, simply done and well executed. Crunchy outside, soft inside. Delicious! I got the plain hash browns on the side, and it was a large portion (size of a rectangular serving dish). They were good, but nothing noteworthy. They have loaded hash browns that are probably better, but I was looking for a little lighter to go with heavy French toast. Overall, would totally recommend and would visit again if I was in the area.
author: Joe W.

description: Highly recommend this restaurant. Visited once for breakfast while on vacation. We had noticed this location prior to our visit but they had a long line outside for a table. A local saw us debating whether or not to get into the line that morning and told us it was totally worth it. We returned a few days later and got in the line before it got long. We sat down quickly. It's a small cute place. The service was friendly, quick, and attentive. I got a basic breakfast, nothing fancy (eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, toast). Everything was great, as expected. The last end of the hashbrown was a little thinner and therefore, crisper than I normally like. But it was still good. My husband got a Hawaiian omelette. It was huge! He loved it. We also shared an order of buttermilk pancakes. So delicious! So rich and fluffy. Every dish came with a fresh serving of fruit - strawberries, blackberries, bananas, orange slices, grapefruit slices, etc. The strawberries were so fresh. Again, so delicious! My husband had a cappuccino and loved it too! Seriously, no complaints. Everything was delicious, fresh, reasonably priced, quick, and worth whatever wait is happening outside.
author: Lissette B.

description: The friendly and professional staff at this restaurant are great! The food is good and the decor is unique.  I would recommend visiting.
author: Sheila M.

description: Food was excellent, great portions. The wait was a bit uncomfortable, and servers wanted to flip tables fast so you feel a little rushed. But fantastic little eaterie near Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Tracy N.

description:
Pretty good breakfast! Big varieties. And you can choose to eat healthy! 
I loved it!
author: Amanda Z.

description: Delicious food, generous portions, friendly staff - recommended all around!
author: Brian S.

description:
Breakfast to the max! 

Located directly across the street from our hotel and very close to Fishermans Wharf I could see the long lines every morning from our hotel room & thought to myself we have to try this place out. First time we waited over half an hour. Rarely would I say the wait is worth it but it really was!

The service was awesome (a family affair). It's incredible to see people so happy early in the morning since I don't get it together until the afternoon. 

The food was fantastic! Maple glazed bacon (one word - BOMB), perfectly crispy hash browns that were as big as your plate, perfectly cooked eggs and delicious fresh fruit. On a side note the fruit bowls here are no joke. See the other yelpers pics to check those out! My man ordered ham which was massive and everything came with fresh bread accompanied by homemade jam & some butter. We loved it all!

This place has indoor seating as well as outdoor and we were lucky enough to experience both during our trip. Locals would bring their fur babies which I always love seeing pet friendly businesses and it was a great start to every day in San Fran!
author: Ania K.

description: I'm not really sure why people like this place so much. It's overpriced and extremely mediocre. The service is also extremely mediocre. I'm really upset to see this place to come up as #1 on yelp for this areas breakfast because after trying it is rather go to ihop (and I hate ihop).
author: Selby S.

description:
Ok so it was my first time being up in San Francisco, and it was my first day with 2 of my friends that wanted to explore. We woke up and decided to go eat some breakfast, we searched on Yelp and found this place near by from where we were staying at, so we decided to give it a try. The restaurant itself was cute and not too big and it gave a semi 50s feel to it. The menu did have wide selections to eat and for good prices! 2 of my fiends got omelets but I got the Carmel Fried banana French toast with walnuts. I first ordered a glass of OJ since the workers said it was really popular and oh my god, I have never tired an OJ like that one, it fresh sweet and every right bit of tangy, totally worth $4. Once our food came the presentation was lovely and the fruit looked supper fresh. 

Costumer service was great, workers were kind and quick and when they brought our food, BIG PORTIONS for good prices. I still recall the first bite of the French toast and WOW BEST FRENCH TOAST I HAVE EVER PUT IN MY MOUTH!!! It was crispy and sugary on the outside and soft and warm in the inside, and the bananas and walnuts were beautifully caramelized. I enjoyed every bite of it so much, I actually finished all of my meal, which I hardly ever do! This brunch place is now actually on my top 3 favorite brunch places of all time, and I highly recommend this place to anyone, wether you are a local or a tourist.The food is absolutely Devine and the costumer service is great and fast. Even though it might look like your typical brunch restaurant on the outside, there's gold in the inside!!!
author: Gabriela A.

description:
Cute breakfast spot a few steps away from fisherman's wharf.  Food and service is great! I recommend coming in early as lines tend to form around 9-10.  We ordered the crab and original (ham) Benedict.  The eggs were cooked perfectly (nice and runny) and the hollandaise sauce was on point .  The crab was just a little fishy for my taste, but when in San Fran, how could I not at least try the crab :p
We also got a couple of slices of sourdough toast which went fabulously well with the fresh jams on the table (raspberry jam was bomb).
Highly recommend subbing the hash brown for a side of fresh fruit; you get tons of fresh and colorful fruit! Perfect way to jump start your day/get hydrated before walking all around San Francisco :)
author: Michelle M.

description: Food was delicious all around the table. Loved the French toast, crab omelette, and eggs Benedict. Great service and portions.
author: Anna S.

description: Delicious! Found this place on yelp.  Vegetable omelette with Hollywood hash browns and beautiful fruit cup.
author: Afrika R.

description: How in the world did this place get 4.5 stars??? I got the orangish French toast. It was really eggy and kind of soggy. Their omelet was not that flavorful and had no cheese. The hash browns were burnt, flat, and oily. The portions were small. The pancakes were just meh. Flavor just wasn't great/existent. The only redeeming qualities were that they had really great presentation and the fruits were good.
author: Amanda T.

description:
Four stars because of the huge lines at times. I'm just not willing to wait for more than 30 minutes for brunch. that is just ridiculous.

But the times I've been able to be seated immediately I've enjoyed this place a lot. They have huge portions of breakfast classics along with toast, bowls of fruit, etc. Very reasonable prices and fast service. They even have a real lunch menu as well, so the selections are pretty extensive

Just be careful, the fruit has bugs in them, but that is because they intentionally don't wash their fruit. They told me it was just how it is... Well I didn't get a stomache!
author: Mingmei N.

description:
We waited for about 10 minutes and it was definitely worth the wait !! Our waitress was was sweet, attentive. She always came around filling up our coffees. The food was delicious! My french toast was tasty, good portion, nice presentation. The fruit was a nice added side. Fresh, good quality food. We will be back tomorrow! 

****
Came back yesterday and it was still delicious! We waited for about 15 minutes which is not bad. I had the same thing. The French toast combo. Fresh fruit , nice portion,  nice presentation. Better than our dinner.
author: J J.

description: Oh my goodness, did I ever love this place for breakfast!  My husband and I went early on a Sunday morning, right after they opened, and we got there right on time because as soon as we were seated, a line started forming out the door.  I had done my research and really looked at what people liked, so I decided to go with the eggs benedict and smoked salmon.  I decided that I might as well splurge so I also got the Hollywood hash browns.  This was hands down, one of the best breakfasts I've ever had in my life.  The smoked salmon was perfect.  It was so fresh, and they didn't overdo it to the point where it starts tasting too fishy.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the yolk just oozed out.  The Hollywood hash browns were delicious as well. My husband had a more basic eggs and hash browns breakfast, but he said it was really good, although I couldn't help noticing how many times he glanced over at my plate to see if I was going to eat everything.  I played nice and shared.  Also, I got the mimosa sampler.  It was delicious.  I loved trying the different flavors of each one.  The next time we visit San Francisco, I will be sure to come back.
author: Anna V.

description:
I enjoyed my crab omelet. It wasn't salty and honestly it could use a bit more salt, but I didn't mind since it's healthier with less salt. My husband had the meat lover omelet and I think it was perfectly seasoned since the meat was salty. Overall, we enjoyed our meal.

The line wasn't bad since we were there by 9am. One of the staff passed out menus while you wait in line. By the time they're ready to seat you, they take your order before sitting you at you're table. Talk about being efficient. 

Friendly staff and very quick paced for them.
author: Fei Z.

description:
Visiting Hollywood Cafe was a delightful and delicious  experience.  The food was really tasty - OMG so yummy!!  The portions were enormous, and the service was excellent. 

My son and I enjoyed the Hollywood Hashbrowns, which was served with bacon, grilled onions and peppers, cheese and our choice of eggs, along with avocado (extra) and sourdough toast covered in housemade jam.

My husband had the Vanilla French Toast....to which I of course helped myself. The French toast was incredible - with a crispy coating outside, and perfectly cooked center (no mush inside and no eggy coating outside). The French toast is served with a banana purée sauce that I must admit does not look completely appetizing, but it is absolutely delectable. I would have guzzled it with a straw if they let me.  The French toast was topped with a light sprinkling of powdered sugar, whipped cream and almonds. Oh so yummy!  

My daughter ordered the Strawberry pancakes - also terrific. So much that she ordered them every time we ate at Hollywood Cafe. We couldn't talk her into anything else. The pancakes looked light and fluffy, and were topped with whipped cream and ton of fresh strawberries. 

If you're visiting Fisherman's Wharf, the Hollywood Cafe is a "must try."  Don't be intimidated by the line. It moves quickly and it gives you a great opportunity to explore their extensive menu of deliciousness. I do recommend you arrive early if possible, but either way - this place is worth the wait. Enjoy!!
author: Keisha L.

description:
Great place to stop for a super fast and delicious breakfast. Not sure how there are one and two star reviews here. They have a menu of breakfast selections for just About everyone. 

The Audrey Hepburn comes with two fluffy pancakes and a huge mixed fruit bowl. 

Rancheros is a huge plate of deliciousness. 

The old favorite with two eggs meat and hash brown. 

Staff is friendly and super efficient. In and out. 

I see a two star review on here complaining about small tables but LOOK AT THE FOOD IN THE REVIEW!!!!
author: Jamie S.

description: Had breakfast here because of great reviews on Yelp plus a personal recommendation. We had to stand in line for 20 minutes to get in the first time but it was worth it. Delicious! So...tried it again when we were in SF a few months later. Only a 10 minute wait this time. Same delicious fruit, french toast and omelet. Highly recommended.
author: Gloria D.

description: We loved the breakfast. I liked egg Benedict.. the fruit bowl was large.. try this place for breakfast
author: Raf M.

description:
Combo pancakes are amazing!!
Everything is incredibly fresh from the eggs to strawberries....first quality food...absolutely!!
The staff is fantastic!!
author: Maria G.

description: Very tiny restaurant with an often extensive wait. The menu was either traditional or uninspiring. Food and service was good.
author: Dario F.

description:
This was one of the best breakfasts we have ever eaten!!  We waited about 20 minutes in drizzly, misty weather and it was so worthwhile!!  The food is amazing, coffee is very good, orange juice is fresh squeezed & delicious.

INSIDER'S TIP: If you're jonesing for your morning caffeine fix, have a friend hold your place in line then go inside and order a to-go coffee, then go back out to face the line with your warm, delicious mood booster in hand! 

The line forms along the curb outside. You don't put your name in, just get in line. The seating is very limited, so unless the weather is very bad just tell them you want whatever comes up first. There are heaters above the outside tables, and they are sheltered under awnings. You may wind up as we did, directly next to the front door eating in front of dozens of hungry people, but it will be worth it!!

In order to make things go as quickly as possible, they will hand you a menu when you are next up for a table. Read it & figure out what you want now, don't waste time lollygagging with your friends...as they will expect your order right after you're seated. This is how they keep that line moving!!

Although it's very busy on Sunday mornings, the service was extremely efficient so we got our food quickly after ordering. 

My picky eater husband said the "Hollywood Style" hash browns were "Life Changing". They were amazingly good. Delicately crispy on the edges, tender in the center, and loaded with sautéed fresh peppers, onions and mushrooms all in a delicious cheesy sauce. We ordered them as an extra side, and were so glad we did. They are a must-try!

I got the french toast combo which was the best french toast I've ever had in my life.  The bread was thick cut and it was perfectly grilled and the "traditional" flavor batter was superb. They have several flavors of french toast batter, including one with gran marnier which I'm betting would be spectacular! 

The bacon was thick sliced but not tough, perfectly cooked; it was SO GOOD! The fresh fruit that accompanies each breakfast meal was supremely fresh and ripe. The banana especially was on point, creamy and perfectly ripened, and perfect with the french toast. 

The scrambled eggs were very good, and you get a huge portion of them. My husband got the Vivien Leigh, which is eggs scrambled with chopped bacon and cheddar cheese on a grilled croissant, with a huge portion of fresh fruit. It was more than he could finish, but he sure made a good go of it!

Do yourself a favor and make time for breakfast here!!!
author: M M.

description:
Tourist area....great Yelp reviews...have to wait in line...could go so many different ways...

But it was yum.  Crab omelet was huge, delicious, fresh.  Fruit was all good (no sad strawberries or rotting raspberries), also fresh and portion on point.  Bathrooms are scary, bring a friend.  Remember the number next to your name when you add your name to the waitlist, as they call out by number.  Lots of choices of condiments.  Hand sanitizer is by the kitchen, as there's no soap in the washroom
author: Amelia J.

description:
Perhaps it's a "tourist" thing but I'm just not getting the 4*-5* rating here.  It wasn't a bad breakfast, but I have had much better - especially in the City.

I ordered the shrimp and salmon benedict and it was okay.  The sauce was excellent, but my eggs were way {way} over poached.  I did specify, even though you shouldn't have to with an Eggs Benny, "soft poached eggs".  They were way overcooked.  The hashbrowns were just okay to me - a little chewey.

Hubby got the meat lover's omelette and liked it but he did say it was a little bland.  

Service was 100% 5* - excellent.  My coffee cup was full the entire time.  We were checked on frequently and had everything we needed.  If I could rate 3.5* I would.  Overall the food was okay, not awful but not "amazing either.  I'd come back and maybe try something different.
author: Samantha T.

description: Love love love the French toast with fresh fruit bowl! The toasts were super warm, soft, delicious! The fruit bowl was humongous! It's definitely worth the wait, but if you can, try to get there by 9ish am to beat the crowd.
author: Christine Y.

description:
The first thing I find amazing about this place is massive portions. Absolutely huge!  
The menu is great and complex, I believe it can satisfy any gourmet. 
Every plate has massive portions of fresh fruit on top. 

I had scrambled eggs and hashbrown topped with melted cheese, peppers, green onions and corn. Served with a few slices of orange it looked amazing.

I've paid $11 and think it was totally worth it. 

Perfect place to have a breakfast or even lunch, highly recommend!
author: Lyubomyr R.

description:
We came for brunch on Saturday. The place was packed and the service was great!

I had an avocado/turkey salad to balance all the crappy food I've been eating all week lol. It was lovely and refreshing. They had some bacon pieces, I think it was their sweet bacon, so delicious! My boyfriend got the avocado/turkey Benedict which was sooooo good! My mouth is watering now just thinking about it. I also liked the tuna melt that my bf's sister got too. 

All in all a wonderful experience. I recommend it to anyone coming down to the pier!
author: Jessica C.

description: Hands-down my favorite place to eat when I visit the Bay Area. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. The staff are the friendliest in the city and although there's always a line, they are quick and efficient!
author: A L.

description: Great breakfast. Yes its near fisherman wharf but for a solid breakfast its worth the wait. Got the meat lovers omelette, hash browns and a side of fruit. Amazing portions for a very reasonable price. Omelette was huge with good chucks of ham, sausage, and bacon. Hash browns was thin and crispy. What impressed me the most was the side of fruit. It had fresh strawberries, bananas, raspberries, and pineapple. For a fast simple breakfast in SF this place is great
author: Peter P.

description: I came here on a Saturday with a group of 5 people around 1030-11am. We waited outside in line for about 30 min and were given a menu to look at. I ordered the Vivian Leigh. The sandwich was really good and I was impressed the croissant didn't get soggy at the end. The big fruit bowl was a highlight. I'll definitely be back when I'm in SF.
author: Morgan D.

description: This place was adorable and well worth the long long line! The portions are huge and everything they use is extremely fresh! Of course none of us could decide what we wanted so we all ended up ordering one item and sharing. They were all delicious!
author: Irina G.

description: Very good food and great presentation. Excellent service and fare prices They're not stingy on the fruit. Love that we had berries and citrus and bananas. Would definitely recommend Hollywood Cafe.
author: Lorraine V.

description: Very casual ambience. Food is tasty and consistent. Expect a wait, But a worthwhile wait.
author: Geo. G.

description:
This place was so bad, I suspect that the reviews here are fake.

- Stale toast.
- Bad service.
- Mediocre food.
- High prices (yes I know SF is expensive, but the quality here was about Denny's level.)
author: Michael M.

description:
Long lines on the weekend! Attracts a mix of locals and tourists! But that's SF for you! :)

Great selection of food - something for everyone. Came on the weekend and lined up in the rain since there's no paper for you to write your name down. Good thing it was not pouring! I ordered the eggs Benedict (one of my fav thing to order for breakfast!) which came with their famous hash brown. Food was okay but not the best since the poached egg was way over cooked! The hash brown could be a bit crispier though. Service was okay, a bit disappointed that no one came to check on how we are doing and how the food turned out for us. I would have told them the egg was over cooked. Not that big of a deal.. Just ate and left. Will probably be back to try other items!
author: Lily M.

description: Stopped here for breakfast before going to Alcatraz. There was a short love,  but it moved quickly. Ordered the croissant breakfast sandwich. Pretty tasty overall, but not mind blowing. Came with a side of fruit which was HUGE and very fresh. Would come back.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
Very nice restaurant at the heart of the city by the bay. Great restaurant to check out for visitors and tourists who want to experience San Francisco brunch. The restaurant is very large and has indoor and outdoor seating, good for groups, kids, and doggies! 

The menu has many things to choose from! From salads, sandwiches, omelettes, Benedicts, burgers, and many more! I came here with my dad after he got his massage and was greeted by a warm and friendly staff! He ordered the turkey and avocado Benedict and I ordered the chicken with basil pesto and arugula sandwich. 

Oh my gosh, the portion was huge!!!! Definitely worth the money and will guarantee to make you full! The food was very delicious and the fruits and greens were very fresh! Definitely recommend skipping breakfast to come here, you will be FULL! 

Parking is very convenient with meter and street parking. The area is very nice to explore, great weather and just a few blocks from the pier. Definitely recommend coming! :)
author: Wendy Z.

description: Arrived around 7.30 and was seated outside, inside 20 minute  wait.  Coffee was delivery was fast and good. Food was good portions and tasty, would return here
author: Tara M.

description:
First breakfast in San Francisco

I arrived and had to wait for about 10-15 minutes in the line. The staff is super friendly though and have been distributing cold water with lemon to everyone in the line while they're waiting in the line. Very nice gesture! 

I had a cappuccino which was average, the coffee itself wasn't great. 

We also ordered Omelette Denver with fruits on the side and Turkey Benedict with hash brown on the side.

The portions are very generous, the fruits were very fresh; however the main course itself (both Benedict and Denver) were okay. Nothing to complain about but it wasn't a bit plain and not very tasty.

Overall good experience. I would give 3 stars but the service and the friendly forced me to be more generous :)
author: Amir H.

description:
Had a wonderful seafood Benny here servers were very fast and  portion was USA large 

These joint know value and quality 

Highly recommend it for sure
author: Dale M.

description:
This small cafe is the perfect treat for anyone who is vacationing and wants a place they can nostalgically look back on as a good memory with loved ones.

My boyfriend and I woke up early after reading reviews on how crowded it gets. Let me tell you, no one is exaggerating here that you MUST come in when it first opens if you do not want to wait for a table to open up. By 7:10am, the seating was already full and I can see why.

I ordered the Marilyn Monroe (French Toast with fruit) and my boyfriend ordered the Vivian Leigh (Egg Croissant Sandwich with fruit). We both agreed that this place is freakin' delicious and all the fruit they give you adds a unique and colorful presentation to your meal. The ambience is nice as well since it's a small place with decor related to Hollywood. The employees were very pleasant and our orders came out quickly. We ended up coming back to try their pancakes with fruit and picked up omelettes to go for my mom and step dad who stayed back at the hotel.

I  love and definitely recommend this place!
author: Katie L.

description:
Most important meal of the day!

We came to this cafe 2 separate times during our 4 day vacation to San Francisco. Walking up it had a pretty large line however, it was only a 20 min wait. You won't find your standard hostess table here, you just hop to the end of the line and as you approach the front a little lady will great you. While you're in line they will hand out menus... so you should be prepared to order your drinks and breakfast at the same time. I'm sure this is how they have a fast flow of short ticket times.

We sat down and ordered a mimosas, great size for $7 and plenty in champagne in them. We saw the massive amounts of food as we waited in line so my girlfriend and I shared the Vivian Leigh, a chopped egg and bacon croissant sandwich. The chunks of bacon were a little too much for me... and I LOVE Bacon! The croissant was good, flakey and buttery. The special came with a largest bowl of fruit EVER! I mean it's a light meal in itself. We also added side of pancakes, which was no doubt large too. It tasted amazing. 

The second time we went back we still got the side pancake but added the B.A.T( bacon, avocado, tomato) 3 scrambled eggs which came with crispy hash browns and sourdough toast.  Mmmm yummm, I  liked it better than the meal before. Great place to start off the day, I suggest if you can agree on the same thing...share! That way you have the energy for doing your tourist activities but are not so full you want to die. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, for the price and amount of food it was a great find! Good job SF!
author: Alesia D.

description: Service, food and price makes this place a truly 5 star.  We had dolce waffle, veg sandwich and ranchero. Everything was fresh and delicious. The portions are big. Staff was friendly.
author: Pravar V.

description: Holy cow-- The Hollywood Cafe lives up to the hype! My family and I came on a Friday morning and while there was a line of about 25 people it moved fairly quickly. We were promptly seated and served. Our food came out within ten minutes of us ordering. The ingredients were fresh and the portions were huge. I highly recommend!
author: Gabrielle R.

description: Great meal in a top notch location. The weekend brunch lines can look long but it moves fast. Love the hash browns
author: Carl S.

description:
My family stayed at a hotel close by and noticed a line here one morning. We decided to give it a shot-Whoa!  I figured it would be a diner-like tourist trap. Each meal we got was excellent. The Vivian Leigh, chocolate chip pancakes, a stuffed meat lovers omelette-all delicious!  The toppers were the fruit cups- no canned fruit here. There were at least 10 different cut up fresh fruit served in a bowl. 
The morning was chilly so we sat under heat lamps outside and people watched. Great way to spend a morning in SF!
author: Shawn S.

description:
Great breakfast spot. Came here at 7, before catching a boat to Alcatraz. The restaurant was packed (we got the last table), which is usually a good sign. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe (recommend!) and it was amazing French toast with a side of fruit. The service was great, and the drinks came out soon after we had arrived. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. Lots of menu options, a regular breakfast spot. 

Don't miss it if you're in San Francisco! Amazing.
author: Emma H.

description: Good outside place to eat some good breakfast server was very attempting very helpful. Fast and clean.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I previously rated this place 4 stars. I don't know why; perhaps for servings too large. 

We arrived at eight-ish, and the sidewalk was already full. But BAM! Just like that, tables were emptied, cleared, and refilled with hungry people. We didn't wait 10 minutes. Then promptly our drink orders were taken (the coffee is great), then the food. All of it was before us on the table within another 10--including fresh raspberry jam and a marmalade for the bread.

If you don't hate fruit, you'll love the fruit "cup." We counted 13 kinds of fruit in it. It came with the kid's Marilyn Monroe. Wife and I each got the B.A.M. We should have split one. Seriously, you'll feel bad about all the food you can't eat.
author: Dean L.

description:
We got to Hollywood Cafe right after noon on a Saturday, and no line! There were tables open both inside and outside, even on a warm summer day. We chose a nice table outside where we watched the tourists passing by.

I was feeling healthy, so I got the turkey and avocado salad with bacon. It was so simple, but one of the best salads I've had in a long time! The portion was pretty large, and the ingredients were super fresh, well-proportioned, and cut into perfect sizes. I would eat this salad every day (and be way healthier)!

My boyfriend also loved his eggs, and everyone's fruit cups looked amazing. Prices are pretty reasonable. Service is adequate, but definitely busy with all the tables.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
The food was so bomb! I would say a little pricey for my liking but it is so totally worth it for a breakfast like that near the pier 
Will most definitely come back for the dolce French toast and the awesome mimosas
author: Liz G.

description: Excellent service, but get there EARLY. Limited seating. Food was great as well as coffee. It was refreshing to eat homestyle food here after trying more exotic foods on our trip in San Francisco.
author: Bethany K.

description:
After all the hype & great reviews! We decided it's a have too! We waited for about 25 mins. Not bad. 
The food however was not all that its hyped up to be. The only thing we really liked was the hash browns. Everything else was good but now worth $60 for bacon & eggs! Fruit bowl was big. But still now worth the $9 
Overall- it was nice to stop at a well known place but won't be our destination spot!
author: Dominica R.

description:
This place is really good.  There was a line but it moved quickly. The service was prompt and friendly.  All of our meals were good and there were six of us.  I would definitely eat here again when in SF.

It was worth the 20 minutes we waited.
author: Jon S.

description: Place was pretty good. Good selection of food and large portions. Pricey but worth it. Get there early or else you will be waiting on line
author: Joseph F.

description: Consistently good food!!! Every visit to San Francisco includes a breakfast or lunch at the Hollywood Cafe.  Customer Service is warm and friendly and the food is ALWAYS very fresh and delicious!!!
author: Jodi F.

description: Good Food! Wish it was a bit bigger, but it's SF!!!! The quality of their food and service is usually very good. There is always a long line in front but seating is available usually within the first 20 minutes to half an hour of waiting. There is usually always street parking right around the corner so this place is very convenient!
author: rachael B.

description:
I always come here when I'm SF. Huge portions for a good price and the food is tasty. 

With being said, good food comes long waits so come here early and make sure to have all of your party with you tone seated.
author: Aaron G.

description: Great service. Yummy menu! Interesting people. Recommend !! We had the healthy plate and Dungeness crab eggs Benedict with fresh fruit instead of hash browns.
author: Marsha B.

description: Terrible food, terrible service, tacky decor. I'm thinking there is a serious shortage of breakfast spots on the wharf because this place is truly awful yet consistently has a line out the door. I will definitely not be returning.
author: Brittany J.

description: I love Hollywood Cafe! I got take out and the prices were reasonable and the food was delicious. I had the Vivian Leigh and it was eggs on a croissant with bacon - so so good and massive. The eggs were fantastic. There was bountiful fruit instead of fries and more carbs. I love stopping by this cafe when I'm in SF.
author: Judy S.

description: This was the first place I ate at during my last trip to California. We sat outside and the weather was perfect! There was a line outside because this place is popular but it went by super quickly because the people who work there are used to that. Everything was so fresh and amazing I wish I didn't live in Texas so I could go every weekend! I got a salad with turkey, avocado, mozzarella, fruit, tomatoes and balsamic and it was honestly the best salad I've ever had. I also got the mango mimosa which was super good. My friends got the vanilla French toast and loved it. If I go back I'm definitely trying that!
author: Danielle M.

description:
"Best breakfast I've ever had" said my husband who is a foodie especially in the morning!! 

Wow! I waited outside for a table of two in a long line that went fairly quick. These people here hustle hard to get people in and out in the perfect amount of time!! Standing in the line actually helps you decide what you're getting. 

I ate 5 hours ago and I'm just now getting hungry. The food REALLY fills you up. 

I got the French toast combo with bacon and eggs. Everything was on point!
My husband got this crab dish thing that was huge. Neither of us could finish but seriously so worth the wait. 

We both got out of there for $35 and will be returning for sure next time we're in San Fran!
author: Diesel H.

description: This is in the top 5 places in the US that I've had breakfast. I love fruit and the fruit was amazing!! Next time in San Fran I will make my way over to the wharf area for this restaurant!
author: Korynne B.

description: My absolute favorite brunch place in SF. My friend and I got here right when they opened and were immediately seated. The place started to fill up fast. They have great portion sizes and delicious, massive sides of fruit. Just as I'm writing this review, I'm thinking about my next trip to Hollywood Cafe.
author: Christina M.

description:
We were here a year ago and came back for the crab omelette, my fav. My brother ordered meat lover and we substituted w egg whites. 

Both dishes are good, even they are a slightly smaller portion but great tastes still. The waitresses are nice and friendly.
author: Gracie L.

description: I was disappointment when I saw the long the but it was worth it. The food was great and with a crowd like that, they were good with service. First time here and will definitely return.
author: Ani K.

description:
Great breakfast spot in Fishermen's Warf. Outside/sidewalk seating available as well.

We were seated fairly quickly despite it being fairly busy. Food was very fresh, well prepared and served quick.

The Hash burrito was delicious and generously portioned.
author: Erica B.

description: This place is amazing! The whole experience was great and the food was very delightful.
author: Crystal R.

description:
Breakfast how it needs to be done. Large plates for good prices. Favo by locals and loved by visitors.

American breakfast in Fishermans Warf
author: Stephan Z.

description: This place is awesome!  I am glad it's not located near my home or I would gain too much weight.  The portions are substantial, presentation is perfect, and prices very reasonable.  I highly recommend but give yourself some time it's not a large place and there is alway a line (15-20mins)
author: Henry F.

description: Great breakfast before exploring San Francisco for the day.  Ordered the Marilyn Monroe, the French toast was very good and came with a great mixed fruit cup.  Also ordered the breakfast burrito and this was very good also (ordered without the lettuce...not sure why you would want lettuce on it?).  The service was good and the location is ideal for pier 39.
author: David F.

description:
Places like this is the exact reason why Brunch is my favorite type of meal! I came here with my friend after we ran the Across the Bay 12k on April 26, 2015 because all of the brunch places closer to the water were packed! Sooooo glad we ended up coming here.

There was a pretty modest sized waiting list, but we were able to place our order to go and received our food pretty quickly. I ordered the Turkey Eggs Benedict with avocado, english muffin, and a hollandaise sauce. My meal (I think most breakfast meals do) also came with 4 slices of sourdough bread and a heaping serving of hash browns. 

The servers were all very friendly and the food was delicious. everyone should try this place :)
author: linda y.

description:
want to have energy to sight see or just enough fuel to travel ....This by far thee best breakfast place near the fishermen's peir! The service absolutely a joy and my goodness the portions are enough for two but the taste is so amazing you may over eat....

have the French Toast. ....sweet fruit piled up on your plate...oh yes you will Love Love this place!  Moca yummiest yet.... just come check out for yourself and you won't be disappointed!
author: Sandy K.

description: Food was good, but not amazing. My boyfriend got the Hollywood hash browns and thought they were great! I got the vegetarian omelet and didn't love it but loved the fresh fruit bowl. The service was good!
author: Susannah H.

description:
Great brunch place for the area. Came here for brunch and luckily got the last table available. They serve you water in a mason jar, cute! Everything on the menu is a little pricey but their portions are a good size. Food took a little over 10 minutes to arrive which is a pretty good speed.

I got the crab omelette $14 and I was very surprised at how much REAL CRAB MEAT they gave. I was expecting like less than a spoon of crab meat but this is the real deal. I can say I probably got a whole crab's worth of meat in my omelette. Very delicious. The hash browns and toast that accompanied were great as well. I also tried a little bit of the crab and salmon/shrimp benedicts and they were tasty.

Although the area is not ideal for parking, this was a great place to eat. There will definitely be a next time for me.
author: Benita M.

description: What a delightful little breakfast place. The food is great, the service is great, portion sizes are more than most people can handle, but there is room for improvement. The quality of coffee they serve...could be better. And so could the queue management. There was a whole bunch of people waiting on the street in front of the restaurant. I waited 30 mins. It was worth it,but this is definitely place for improvement. Given the tiny amount of space they have, it would be great if they used some kind of technology to manage online check ins, reservations, seating etc.
author: Matija A.

description:
Prepare to wait a bit. Thats cool because the crowd moves fast. This is basically diner food. It's good but I'm not blown away. I don't understand how it gets 4 stars or better in review. Perhaps this is because it's the best non-chain restaurant in a very tourist oriented area. Perhaps it is because of the catchy names on the menu. 

The service was fast and the food is presented well. The staff are very friendly. If you do eat here for breakfast / brunch make sure you have the Hollywood Hash Browns. They are hearty and seasoned smartly. Skip the french toast, the bread is a bit soggy.
author: Mark V.

description:
Really enjoyed this place that we chose based on the high yelp reviews.  When using reviews, I look for average and # of reviews and when you sport 4+ average with 1,000+ reviews, odds are good that the place will be great.  

We went Friday at around 11 am - there was a line that extended not quite to the corner on which the establishment is located.  Took around 20 minutes, struck up a conversation with another couple and ended up sharing a table with them.  The other couple had been there the day before and enjoyed it so much that they came back the next morning so I was feeling pretty good about enjoying my meal.

The menu is fairly expansive with some unique offerings, S had one of the salads and had them trick it out with some crab and I was feeling a little sweet so chose what was essentially a banana fosters french toast offering over many of the tempting omelette offerings.  

Both plates lived up to expectations - immediately you can tell that items were fresh and "homemade"  - the freshness was off the charts.  The french toast melted in my mouth and the contrast between the velvety bananas and the caramel with the texture of the french toast.  I don't usually go french toast but I am now a fan.  

The wait and the limited hours will deter people from giving this place a try and sometimes hype can be tricky because of all the reviews you expect this place to be a contender for your last meal on earth.  Temper your expectations - it is breakfast food.  It is not 28 day dry aged porterhouse.  

Service was impeccable so no star dings for that.

I will happily return and Hollywood Cafe is definitely deserving of its standing as one of the best breakfast places in downtown SF.
author: Michael G.

description:
Fantastic! 
Met all expectations! Great food, great service...a must stop! Be prepared for a short wait because people must be in the know about this place. 
Only one complaint... Shared restroom with building... Could have been much cleaner.
author: Trisha K.

description: Best breakfast I have had in a long time. Comfort food for sure!! Don't let the line scare you it goes fast
author: Malia B.

description: This is the best breakfast I've had, it is so worth the wait and all the good Yelp reviews! If you are in the area you must try this place!!! I had the Dungeness egg Benedict and left nothing on my plate, I ate every single bite. The chai tea is as well amazing. The portion sizes are huge.
author: Alexis R.

description: Pricey but excellent. Pancakes come as an order of 2 would have liked 3. Extra thick bacon yummy.
author: Lynn W.

description: This is hands down THE BEST breakfast place ever! So my first impression was Whoa! Thats a long waiting line ... but don't panic! The line usually passes super quick and you'll be seated in no time ! I ordered a cappuccino along with salmon eggs Benedict ... the cappuccino was on point ! It was creamy, foamy and delicious ... I can't even start about how amazing the eggs benedict were ... the eggs were perfectly cooked on a crispy english muffin topped with avocado, asparagus, capers, spinach and a delicious sauce ! The hash browns were perfectly crispy and golden brown ... the service was beyond polite and accommodating... quick and friendly ! Will definitely come back for more !!
author: Roba Z.

description: Good service and good food. We had the eggs benedict with crab.  Very generous portion sizes.
author: Sandee P.

description: We both ordered the Rancheros, looking forward to a saucy cheesy breakfast. Instead we were served very very dry over cooked burnt eggs with chips on top. Super disappointing for a 4.5 stared restaurant and a $50+ breakfast.
author: Sara M.

description:
Eat here in the morning, and you may not need to eat again until dinner time. And you won't regret it. Ample, tasty portions of eggs, hash browns and whatever else you order.

It might seem pricey unless you have something with fruit. You get a TON of fresh fruit with your breakfast, which will make you feel better about all the calories you're taking in.

The decor is charming. It's small, so it can easily get crowded, but it's easy to see why people flock to it.
author: Beau D.

description: The wait was worth it. Fresh coffee and always stopping by to provide refills. The food was super fresh and delicious. Quick service once we were seated!
author: Cynthia H.

description: Party of seven on Sunday during Memorial Day. Got seated relatively quickly. Service was pretty mediocre but the food makes up for it. We got a whole bunch of things and everybody enjoyed what they got. I ordered Vivian Leigh without bacon and the croissant was to die for. As I mentioned before, service was lackluster. They forgot our orders and it took forever to bring out. Also added a tip themselves probably sensing that we weren't happy. Prices were pretty fair and the portions were very generous. Would come back for the food but that's about it.
author: Izzat A.

description:
Cute, bright and clean place we checked out for breakfast when we were in the city.  The food was really good (not the best I have ever had, but pretty good) but the service was so fast!  They are in a tiny space so they need to turn over tables pretty quick.

They did have a lot of fresh fruit options which my kids loved.  They had the pancakes and bacon, while hubby and I had the eggs benedict and orange marmalade pancakes.  Decent, but not earth shattering.  Also veeeery expensive, but hey, that is what you get when you come to SF.
author: Alicia R.

description: Passed by this restaurant on our way to the wharf and decided to stop in for breakfast. SO GLAD WE DID! Great portions and fresh! I had the french toast with a side ham. My husbanf had the denver omelet. Both were delicious and gave us the fuel we needed to bike the golden gate!
author: Kristen C.

description: Stopped by the sweet little place Friday January 20. I was seated quickly, food came out quick, and I was not disappointed! I ordered a breakfast burrito and my goodness...it was a LARGE helping! Would love to go back!
author: Alicia M.

description: If I could give more than 5 stars, this place would get a rating that good! I'm not an easy sell on breakfast. It is my very favorite meal of the day and I happen to be a pretty damn good breakfast cook myself. This place knocked my snobby breakfast socks off. We ordered Dulce French Toast, Dungeness Eggs Benedict and a fruit plate that looked more like a fruit PLATTER that came directly from the lushest places in the world. The staff was friendly and promptly took our orders and refilled our coffee before we had to ask. Do yourself a favor, whether a tourist or a native to the city... GO!! Now. Even if you aren't hungry. You will be when you see this food!
author: Suzanne P.

description: What a place. Walked by it one day and noticed the line.. The next day we walked to Hollywood Café and stood in a short line. The inside is small but they are well organized and get things done. Now for the food. Excellent. The Fresh Toast was flavored and oh was it good, plus you get a bowl of fruit, fresh and sweet.. My friend had a Benedict and all she could do was finish the plate and smile. Don't let the line discourage you, get in it. You know how good it is when you go back the next morning.
author: Terry W.

description:
This an honest review for Hollywood cafe. 
They rock!!! High quality food, extremely efficient supply chain, friendly staff, reasonable prices and with all of these only 30 minuteish wait time on weekend. I've been to this place at least 30 times now! Not a single time got disappointed. Make sure you try their chai latte!
author: Rana K.

description: The food here was very subpar, along with the service. We waited about 15 minutes to eat and was stuffed in the small back corner. The service was inattentive and all over the place. The food was very mediocre. Probably wouldn't go back despite the good reviews.
author: Karlee I.

description:
There was a line outside of the cafe (in the rain!). It was totally worth the wait. 

The orange juice is freshly squeezed, pricey, but refreshing. I had the burrito. It was avocado, eggs, potatoes, cheese, and ham. It was huge and by far the best burrito I've ever had. I had a hard time choosing. I was looking around and everyone seemed to be enjoying their food. 

The staff was very nice. They all worked together, so our needs were always met and taken care of. 

I can see why they are successful.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Vivien Leigh was soooooooooooo delish.

There was a line. So prepare for a wait (not long 15 minutes when we were there). Sat outside, very nice. The food was good. Coffee was very good! 

Enjoyed it. Its a great spot for breakfast.
author: Florie Q.

description:
I came down for Memorial Day weekend with my friends, and we were referred here. It was so delicious. We all had an amazing breakfast. Hands down for this place! 
I will definitely have breakfast again!
author: Fabby C.

description: Excellent food. Made fresh with great ingredients. Unique dishes that the whole family loved. Orange juice was very fresh. Be prepared to stand in line, but absolutely worth it.
author: Zain B.

description: Hole in the wall restaurant good for a quick lunch. Got here about an hour before closing time and it was not busy at all. I got the cheesesteak. Not the most traditional but tasted good none the less. I would eat here again if in the area. Quick service and lots of welcome drink refills without asking.
author: Hayes J.

description: We went here for a brunch today and I have to say that it was rather tasty. My brother had the pancake combo which came with two eggs, 3 slices of bacon, two pancakes, and some fresh fruit. My mom and I shared the crab omelette, which came with hash browns, three slices of toast, and some fresh fruit. It was all very delicious but the bill came out to nearly $60... the drinks were rather pricey... $5 for orange juice and for hot chocolate...
author: Priya D.

description:
Minimum 30 minute wait for brunch, and you have to wait in line (no putting your name down and coming back later). It was fun seeing the photos of the hollywood stars on the walls, but the novelty wore off pretty fast.

The highlight of this place was really the fruit bowls. Everything else was pretty basic. French toast -- basic. Breakfast croissant -- oily/greasy, and pretty basic. Latte -- pretty basic. It's not a bad place for brunch if you're staying in one of the hotels nearby, but I don't think I'd be returning anytime soon. 

Great place for babies and strollers though -- they are pretty accommodating to families and kids.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Scrumptious crab benedict, expeditious service amidst the hustle bustle...

Hubby had the eggs rancheros...also excellent.  hash browns were my favorite!
author: Joan B.

description: Great place for brunch. Generous portion without compromising the quality and taste. We ordered blueberry buttermilk pancakes and California scrambled eggs. We also asked for the Hollywood hash brown and it was Super delicious!!! A must visit if you want an unforgettable brunch experience in San Francisco!
author: Mooi L.

description: So yummy! I ordered the Audrey Hepburn and the fruit was such a big portion and amazing, I had to take the rest home. We got here around 9 and the line wasn't too long yet. We already knew what we were getting by the time we sat down and service was so fast, I don't even think we had to wait 10 minutes. It is a little cramped but what can you expect in sf.
author: Jessica R.

description: The wait is long but the food is reasonably priced and delicious. I had their eggs benedict and it was great! Their hot chocolate and mochas were super good too! Will definitely come back when I'm in the area!
author: Dee Y.

description:
This is a great place to grab brunch. The food and drinks are absolutely delicious. There is only one reason I took off a star.

Food: They have an outstanding brunch menu. We got the breakfast wraps and they were solid. 

Fruit: Take a look at the pictures, it is amazing. 

Drinks: Bloody Marys were great. 

Service: Fast and friendly.  

My only issue with this place is this. They form the line outside to wait for tables in front of those that are eating. If you are eating here outside you will have hungry people literally 4-5 feet away staring (longingly) at you eating your food. If you are waiting you are watching people 4-5 feet away eat food you want to be enjoying. This is not a good setup. They should invest in pagers or in some way not have those waiting line up right in front of those eating food. I am probably not the first person to bring this up and maybe they have other issues handling this some other way, but with modern technology no need to have people face off (those that are hungry right in the face of those eating).
author: Rob K.

description: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had! The crab Benedict is a must! Vanilla French toast is to die for!! Would come back for sure! Friendly, fast service and mouthwatering fresh food...DO IT!
author: Bree B.

description: Every time I'm up here, I have to come here. The food is amazing and the portions are huge. Always on point! Close to fishermans wharf too. Usually go to pier 39 and walk off breakfast there.
author: Cee R.

description: Loved this place! We stayed next door at the hotel and decided to walk over one morning for breakfast. The Marilyn Monroe special was excellent. They give you a large sized portion of fresh berries and the food was absolutely delicious. The service was also great. This place gets pretty busy and you have to come early to get a seat. I highly recommend Hollywood Cafe.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place may possibly serve the best breakfast I ever had. It's like they know exactly what you want. Service was extremely friendly and quick. I got the crab benedict and made the hashbrowns Hollywood style? I think that's what it's called. The fruit bowl my friend had was unreal as well (super fresh with tons of berries). I would come here over and over again for breakfast.
author: Carly H.

description: Coming here for breakfast was a delicious choice!  Portions are large, food is flavorful. A bit on the pricier side but none the less worth trying. This cafe offered good service, not too long of wait on the food and kid friendly. Only downside is no bathroom, you need to go around the corner to a public one.
author: Mayra C.

description: Had a good breakfast, hubby had pancake combo, I had the Gregory Peck  and the best coffee. We loved it. Small small cozy place small wait (10 min) and worth it.
author: Maria R.

description: the potato`s were so good the pancakes it was not expensive for a breakfast like this
author: Jaxon M.

description:
Hollywood Cafe is such a great choice down in the Pier 39 area. For starters, I chose this place solely on the review and I am so glad I did. The staff here does an amazing job at getting people their orders quickly so that they can eat and get the next costumer in, without sacrificing on food quality. We waited about 20 minutes before getting a table and once inside and ordered, it took less than 10 minutes for the food to arrive. The hardest part of the Hollywood Cafe is making a decision on what to order, all the food looked amazing. As much as I wanted to try the french toast I ended up getting the egg sandwich and fruit bowl which was outstanding! 

I hope you decide to give this place a try, definitely won't be disappointed.
author: Aron H.

description:
Utterly awful place, only suitable for tourists trapped in the wharf area.

My omelet was utterly without flavor - like an omelet at a chain hotel or something. The hashbrowns weren't terrible I guess.

One of the main reasons I disliked this place was the bathroom. Like visiting the third world. 

Locals: avoid.
author: Mike G.

description: Great breakfast spot!  Was in SF last weekend with a group of eight friends, and you know how difficult it can be to find a place to eat with a large group and no reservations.  Hollywood Café was right across the street from our hotel, so we took a chance.  Fortunately they had a table available and sat us right away!  Food and service were all excellent.  And large portions too!  Despite it being busy, they never rushed us to free up the table for other guests.  A great place for breakfast and would definitely recommend.  We'll be back for sure!
author: George T.

description:
Great brunch!  We ordered a French Toast combo, a Pancake Combo, and Two Eggs with Sausage Patty. 

We got there just before the rush and waited for about 5 minutes or so. We ordered regular coffee which was stronger than most other breakfast places, so that was good. After we ordered our breakfast, the food came pretty quickly. Portion size was big.

The honey ham was flavourful. The eggs had a bit of seasoning, the hash brown was had a good crunch, lots of fruit.

Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the service. We had a party of 4, when we got where we pulled a high chair over from another empty table. I barely put my stuff down and the waiter came and said I can't put the high chair at the end of the table. That was fine. But she rushed me to pull one of the chairs out (that I have put some stuff on so that I could put my daughter in the high chair.). Also, the person who poured the coffee had problem aiming at the cups. All our cups got wet, table got wet, and the coffee even dropped on the spoon that are in the marmalade.
author: Donia T.

description: Great Service. Great Staff. Great Food. When they are packed they have a line outside for you to wait in; but the line goes quick. They have amazing coffee and keto friendly options. They do not rush you out; after we finished eating they cleaned up our plates and asked if we wanted more coffee/water or anything else instead of delivering the check, I appreciate this. It's worth the wait in the line!! Love you guys and keep up the great service & Food!!! Yummy!
author: Virg M.

description: Great place for breakfast and yes, I think worth the wait!  We had the vanilla French toasts and maple bacon, eggs,sourdough, and skinny vanilla latte's.   like that helped!  We inlay ate half. Huge portions, particularly the vanilla French toast.  I comes with tons of fruit and berries.  It was yummy food, the line moves quickly.  We met a charming couple from UK/Scotland and enjoyed conversation over breakfast.   Great start for the day.
author: Robert B.

description: Have been searching for the perfect Eggs Benedict and must say this one is a favorite! I ordered the turkey avocado and it was just cooked to perfection. Service was also really good! Must say I'll be back!
author: Jocelyn I.

description:
Was in the area and decided to grab lunch here. 

I got Regular Eggs Benedict and babe got a Breakfast Sandwich. Food wasn't exceptional, but it wasn't bad either. Just very average, and I've definitely had better. I don't know, I really don't have much to say other than that it was just another "meal" of the day. 

I think the hasbrowns on my dish was the best part, but the parts placed under the benedict were already soggy when it arrived to the table. 

I'm just not feeling this place. It's more of a spot for tourists, because locals should know better.
author: Harriet W.

description:
This spot is worth the wait in line. It's a little spot that offers a heck of a breakfast. We waited outside for about 10 minutes.  Upon seating us, the waiter immediately took our drink order. The food is absolutely delicious and the portions are healthy. The fruit bowls are served with most of the breakfast entrees and is fresh.  We are here for 6 days and will most likely be here daily. Don't miss the gem! 
Ps... The vanilla French toast was delicious.
author: S B.

description:
The Hollywood Cafe has the most delicious breakfast in town. The 15 minute wait is totally worth it. The french toast is to die for! Crispy on the outside, moist and full of goodness on the inside. The fresh fruit plate is piled high with generous amounts of sweet and delicious fruit and fresh yogurt. Absolutely delicious!

The staff is professional and amazingly attentive. Our coffee cups were never cold or empty. Loved that! Enjoyed every bit and bite of it.
author: Gozi A.

description:
Food was bombdiggity!

Arrived here around 8 AM and got seated quickly. A line formed later on. The place is small but clean and organized. The staff was super friendly. I ordered the crab omelette. The omelette had crab meat, avocado, scallion, swiss cheese and side caperberry. I ordered the hollywood hash browns to go with the omelette and it's topped with bacon, mushroom, onion, bell peppers, basil flakes and melted cheddar cheese. The portion was pretty big. The only downside is that I found crab shells in my omelette. At least I know they used real crab meat.
author: Kathy M.

description:
This is well worth the visit and was so close to a five star that I was debating it.  In the end, it is a four with the ability to easily be a five with a little more effort by the waiting staff.    

They have many things that will just impress you immediately.  The staff and condiments on the table set a tone that you should expect nothing short of amazing.  The staff is extremely friendly, and greater us with a smile.  They even went out of their way to say thank you for waiting with enthusiasm after we waited only 5 minutes.

The restaurant itself is small, so expect to wait.  The table comes stocked with three different hot sauses, pepper rounds in its own grinder, hymalayan salt, and home made jams that are orgasmic.  Pair the jams with the sourdough bread that they give you while you are waiting, and you just may have a... ehhhem... multiples.  

The tea is a great option for a drink, as well as the OJ.  The OJ is fresh squeezed and the tea comes in uniquely hand crafted cups and choice of 10 tea bags for each patron.  I would suggest honey be provided with tea orders in the future though.  We didn't ask for it, so they may have it.  

I ordered the carb omelet, and it was ok.  I would not recommend it, but it was prepared well and had a generous portion of crab.  I ordered it with a substitute of feta, but it came as advertised with cheddar.  Cheddar and crab are just not a good mix for me.  There was also some crab shell in the meat.  

The food hear is also a great value with plates around $13; Dennys around the corner charges more.
author: Scott L.

description: Simply delicious, a very good portion, and fair prices. There is always  a line to get a table so get there by 8am on weekends. During the week days it is less crowded. A better option is take out.
author: Irais M.

description: The typical venue offers nothing special - I can't even understand why people like to be seated outside with such a poor street view. That being said, there are a few positive things the restaurant has; portions are big, food never disappoints and the staff is very accommodating. Try the huge pancakes but don't take too many or you will finish with a doggy bag to go. One breakfast was enough for two people, lots of fruit and toast with coffee topped up.
author: Melissa C.

description: The long line went by fast and was SO worth the wait! The fruit as so fresh! We had the meat lovers omelet and French toast! AMAZING!!
author: Clayron H.

description: We went there on a Friday about 20 minute wait. No reservations first come first serve. Great food and service.
author: Boon P.

description: For how long the line was they got us in there quickly! Food was good, worth a trip. I had the bacon/eggs/hashbrown/toast plate, very delicious.
author: Benjamin A.

description: The service is good and quick but a little too quick. The veggies came out raw and without bacon in my omelet. I get that it is the heart of tourist and pier 39 but you have to deliver on the product. Good value and way too big of portion... split a meal and enjoy the people watching from the outdoor tables.
author: Matthew N.

description:
A MUST MUST MUST if visiting SF!  Best breakfast hands down!  Got there around 8:30am, waited about 30 min.  So worth it!
My family of 5 had a little of everything g.  no complaints.  I had the Vivien Leigh..DELISH!
author: kim v.

description: Wow! The reviewer's were not kidding. The food is just amazing and service is friendly and prompt. My husband and I shared a scrambled egg dish and they never winced. And we together couldn't finish it. And it was truly delicious. My applause to the staff of the Hollywood Café. The cooks, the servers ,everybody did a great job. We will be back tomorrow.
author: Virginia H.

description: Amazingly delicious Veg hash browns ! Sooo good, we came here 2 days in a row !! Bear with the long line - It's definitely worth it.
author: Ankur P.

description: Small dining room and gets busy fast in the morning  lots of tourist  get there early  generous portions people will line up st the door to wait for a table  they have great raspberry jam for your sour dough toast glad we tried it
author: Annie H.

description:
So far... service is terrible.  Will update after we taste the food .

Update: So after the waitres walked away from us three different times while we were trying to ask a question, the service improved and the food was delicious!
author: J G.

description:
OMG. This place was amazing. We were leaving San Francisco and needed to eat breakfast before we left. We were staying at the Holiday Inn and it was only a block away. When we got closer to it we saw that it already had a wait (this was around 9am). We waited for about 20 minutes before we were seated.

As we waited more and more people began to show up. They have a clip board inside where you go write down your name so make sure you do that. 

They are really fast about getting you seated and served. We sat outside, which was a first for me, but it wasn't too bad after you got over the fact of people watching you eat. 

I was being a fatty that morning so I got two eggs, bacon, fruit, and a side of has browns. The hash brown was a huge rectangle the size of a piece of paper but was oh sooo good. The fruit was overwhelming but delicious. They definitely serve you a good amount. 

The service was fast and they definitely were staffed correctly.

They don't have parking but if you go early enough there were meter parking all around still available.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Delicious, fast service, attentive staff.  I had the salmon shrimp eggs Benedict.  They were good.  The omelette a we're super delicious and loaded.  Lots of food in one omelette.  The line goes by pretty quick. Naturally squeezed orange juice.  Coffee was yummy!
author: Yvette H.

description: Must visit! Absolutely incredible american breakfast/lunch place. There was a line 10minutes before openning. Worthy to visit and have some great breakfast. We will definitely Come Back.
author: Anna H.

description:
What a great find thanks to Yelp! My family of 5 had brunch at the Hollywood Cafe on Sunday and what a great experience.  I was very skeptical because of its proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and frankly didn't want to fall into a tourist trap.  

The place is not very big, but it had outside seating and they turn over tables very quickly.  My party of 5 probably waited 15 minutes total.  Not bad at all.  The service is very quick and attentive.  The food was plentiful and came out in no time. 

While I wasn't a fan of paying $8 for fruit, I was shocked at the amount of fruit that came out.  I'm used to paying $5 for a 2 pieces of cantaloupe and some grapes, the fruit plate at Hollywood Cafe was incredibly generous and overflowing with raspberries, blackberries, oranges, bananas, kiwi, grapes and cantaloupe  Overall, our meal was great.  The bacon was thick and crispy, eggs cooked just right and the coffee hot.

Hollywood Cafe was a great find for sure!
author: Nancy K.

description: The food was excellent! Service was also outstanding. This will definitely be a place to come back to when I visit again!
author: Calvin S.

description:
My go to breakfast place in North San Francisco. Great quality food in large portions with quick service. Had the coffee for the first time and it was delicious. I'm usually a OJ guy. Ive had the crab benedict, multiple omlettes, and the bacon avocado tomato acranble, all delicious. Comes with a rectangle of hash browns as large as a sheet of paper, toast twice the normal size, and a delicious garnish of raspberries, blackberries,  and orange slices.

SF prices ($15 w/o tip), and too popular for its own good. During the rush, only waiting 20 minutes is like winning the lottery. You can often see the crowd from down the street. Worth it though.
author: John P.

description:
I took some out-of-town guests to this place because I thought that it would be a better option than IHOP.  The next morning, they went to IHOP.    

That said, I loved my crab omelette, which was was very hearty with huge chunks of real crab.  Yum!    

Also, I was so stoked to see misugaru latte under the healthy drinks section.  I can't find this anywhere except at Caffe Bene!
author: Miran C.

description:
We came it at about 9:30 Friday morning, only had a ten minute wait; sign up sheet is self serve. Tables outside were pretty small, and there were only two of us; more than that would have been uncomfortable.  

We ordered the Vivian Leigh (scrambled eggs with cheddar and bacon on a croissant with fruit bowl) and the Hollywood Hash-browns.  Food came out quickly, and both dishes were excellent.
