Vivian Leigh - Scrambled eggs were cooked well, not too dry, good ratio of bacon and cheese.  Croissant was fluffy, buttery, delicious!  Fruit bowl had blackberries, raspberries, grapes, bananas, strawberries, cantaloupe and honeydew.  Some fruit bowls overdo it on the melon and and skimp on the berries.  Not here!  The bowl was overflowing with delicious berries.

Hollywood Hasbrowns - Good sized serving, cooked well, nice and crispy.  Comes covered in bacon, peppers, green onions, and a cheese sauce.  These were great, but I wasn't a huge fan on the sauce.  Little too nacho cheesy for me, but there wasn't much of it, and I would order the dish again

A great find that lived up to expectations, will definitely return.
author: Natalie F.

description:
Definitely a good breakfast spot. I got the 3 eggs with bacon, avocado, tomato, and cheddar which was very good. This came with hash browns that are fried flat into a "sheet". Never had them like this before and they were good as well. The sourdough toast was different. The crust was a bit tough but otherwise it was good.

My fiance got the orangish french toast with fresh fruit.  We both tried it and agreed that it was very tasty. You could tell the fruit was fresh and not canned. The orange juice she ordered was better than average but it was a bit pricey ($4.50). 

The service was about average, nothing special but also nothing bad to say. It gets packed early and the line can be long so get there early. For what you get the prices are good but there are some pricey options. We ate outside so we can't speak to the Hollywood-themed decor. Overall I would definitely recommend.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Deciding to try a new brunch place for Labor Day weekend was risky but what else can you do when you're staying in town for the long weekend.  The worst part was I realized it's right in one of the most touristy spots, Fishermen Wharf. I wasn't surprised when I got there on my bike and saw the line was practically all the way to the end of the block. Nothing new in this city, especially for Sunday brunch and on one of our Indian summer days.  Seems like everyone and their mother was out soaking in the sun. 
Despite the long line, we got a table in less than the usual hour wait. Granted it was outside seating where you're roasting in direct sunlight since Karl was nowhere in sight, it was bearable. 
One of the reason in deciding to eat here was the unbelievable rating. Had to see for myself.  True, portions are great but sadly fruit portions that most boast about was lacking for us. An order of the original eggs Benedict came with TWO pieces of berries. My French toast combo was decent in terms of the actual French Toast, but I didn't like the extra charge for the maple syrup.  I got it with bacon and had my two eggs poached.  Unfortunately they couldn't get it just right. I felt like Goldilocks, one was more like hard boiled eggs while the second had the whites still runny.  Thick cut bacon is nothing like Sweet Maple just okay.
Service was also lacking.  They never checked in to refill our drinks, only to give the check. Three stars for decent & mediocre food and price. I'll stick to our usual brunch like Mission Beach Cafe, Dotties, Brenda's and so many more.
author: Naty D.

description: The food was great! Nothing over the top spectacular but it was good breakfast food. The line did go quickly, as other reviewers mentioned. I had French toast with two eggs and sausage. Eggs were perfectly cooked for over medium which is hard to get sometimes. The sausage was good too. French toast was average. Service was fast as well.
author: Amy D.

description:
A year later and I still love this place.  The quality of the food is good, the servers are all really nice and service is quick. The portions are also huge!

The only new thing I tried this time was the chilaquilles which were stuffed under a large portion of hash browns. I kept looking around at what everyone else was ordering and I can't wait to try more  items on next trip.
author: Sara L.

description: The food here was great very nice and fast service near my hotel and near the piers I would definitely recommend coming here all the other reviews are on point and this place does live up to the hype
author: Angel R.

description: Great location, excellent food.  Ate there twice during our trip to San Francisco,  food, location...so good.  Most staff is great, however on our second visit we were a little stunned by the bitch that took our order...very unpleasant, rude, argumentative,  even saw her talking shit about other patrons to one of her colleagues.  I know people can have bad days, but if you are in the service and hospitality industry you gotta check your attitude.  We mentioned our experience to another waitress who was so nice,  very apologetic and won us over with her huge smile.  We'll be back, just hope they train the mean one.
author: Tim R.

description:
I don't think I really know how to feel about this place, but at the end of the day it was prettttttty delicious so I can't fathom giving it any less than 4 stars, particularly since the service was so excellent.

We came here because the line at Mama's. I don't think I need to say anymore except I really legitimately have tried to go to Mama's probably 4-5 times and even arrived at 7:45am once (I know ... late ...) but seriously, the wait is just ridic!

This place was a little ways down the street, but totally walkable and the wait was pretty short.

This place I think is run by either Koreans or ... Chinese people. Probably Koreans, lots of great Korean inspired fusion breakfast dishes on the menu. The price is really reasonable for SF and especially reasonable for this tourist area. 

I honestly thought it was going to be a really touristy, kind of meh place but they shocked me with the amount of fruit they give you as a side as well as the tastiness of their dishes! I really liked my benedicts and basically everything we got was an A+ hit. I love that this place is so unexpected, and the portions are huge. Totally recommended for brunch!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Ate here after yelping a breakfast place near our hotel, and this place did not disappoint. I ordered the B.A.T. eggs and they were really good. The latté was so pretty I didn't want to drink it but of course I did, we ordered an extra side of fruit and every single prince of fruit was fresh, perfectly ripe, and no mooshy pieces. My son said "this is the best breakfast I ever had!" And I didn't know whether to be happy that he enjoyed his breakfast or sad that he's never said that about the breakfast I've made him lol.
author: April D.

description: Excellent breakfast with pancakes and loads of fresh fruits. Reasonable coffee ( for the US: good coffee) and friendly and competent staff. Recommended!
author: Kl S.

description:
Evey thing we tried was so delicious that we couldn't stop eating! We had Eggs, hash brown the regular and Hollywood style, french toast, and burgers.
Highly recommended
author: Yaman A.

description: Been here three times to make sure I am getting consistent read but it is so unfair to even include this anywhere on a list with the likes of Dotties True Blue.  This would not even be a corporate dining room in New York City or LA.  Fast various egg dishes with sloppy rushed service who could care less about how accurate they are in getting you what you ordered (toast came after the meal, no cheese, Etc) and being asked "can I get you anything else or how is everything, while my mouth is full is just annoying.  This is that kind of place....and since you cannot answer, they just rip the check off and slap it on the table and are never to be seen again.  Hollywood, you are hyped and over rated --
author: Gary W.

description: This place quickly became a favorite! We came first for lunch: cheesesteak sandwich was amazing, and the fruit out of this world! Big, colorful, fresh, and tasty fruit was just what we needed after flight from East coast. We came back next day for breakfast and that did not disappoint! We will be back: that is how interesting the menu was and how good everything out of the kitchen looked!
author: Joshua A.

description:
The food was mediocre... not as "amazing" as everyone makes it seem to be ranked number 9 on Trip Advisor.... I ordered the pancake combo with scrambled eggs and bacon. The thing that bothered me was that there was fruit on my plate, which i did not know was going to be added to the plate. Normally, this would be a pleasant surprise considering how fresh the fruit is.... BUT I HATE bananas with a passion! And guess what? They were directly under my pancakes, which made my pancakes taste like bananas :( 

Maybe they should let you know that the combos come with fruit so that I can say NO to the bananas!!!

Everything else was good...
author: Rachel R.

description:
I went here for breakfast and there was a line. We waited about 30 minutes to get inside and the servers were very efficient. 

I would have to say it might be the best run breakfast restaurant I have ever been to. The food was great, the theme was also well chosen, great presentation with the fruits and all the workers were so efficient we didn't notice how packed it was. 

We got plates off the "favorites" menu and everything was very good. The hash browns were really good. Everything perfect.
author: Andrew C.

description: This was the best breakfast I have ever had! My sister and I came here for a late brunch and ordered different things to split. I got the classic French toast which came with a side of fruit.  My sister got scrambled eggs, hash browns, and bacon.  We both split our plates and were blown away! I would certainly recommend this place. Only con is the small size of the place so plan to wait.
author: Alexandra P.

description: Whenever I went there because it opens early and was around the corner of my hotel, the staff was beyond friendly. The portions are big but the quality in my opinion is very poor. So it happened to me 2 times, that my cappuccino cup was not properly washed. I never use sugar but I found an empty saché in my cup! Just disgusting! And when I complained, they said they'll take it off the bill... never happened!
author: Angelina P.

description: We ate at this cafe twice in a 4 day stay.  Portions are so large that the second time we split an omelet.   Food is fresh and tasty. Friendly staff. Don't be alarmed if there is a line, they serve people very quickly but do not make you feel rushed.
author: Pam N.

description: We're visiting San Francisco for the week and wanted to try all kinds of different mom and pops little restaurants , well we sure did we found this amazing little spot . The food is so tasty and the portion is just perfect ! The staff is also very friendly . I would highly recommend it to anyone that doesn't want an ordinary "chain" restaurant that is found anywhere .
author: Veronica L.

description: Great breakfast.  Fast service.  Prices a tad high, but this is SF.  Coffee was on the cold side.
author: Carolina M.

description:
Small hole in the wall place with awesome food. Prices were good and OJ was very fresh. 

French toast was yummy and entrees came with a lot of fresh fruit. Definitely would return.
author: Ashley C.

description: Best place I ate at in San Francisco, I even went there 2/3 days I was here that's how good it was. Definitely pricey ($15 for pancakes & fruit), but well worth it. The servers were friendly & one even remembered me from the day prior. Be sure to order the fruit cup, it will perfectly complete your meal. Get there early to avoid long lines & try to sit outside under the table farthest to the right when you look at the restaurant because it's right under the heater.
author: Kourtney C.

description:
We ordered the crab omelette, and French toast for brunch. They were delicious and pretty special. The fruits were sweet and fresh. I think this is the best breakfast place I've ever been to

I am glad we did not have to wait long to be seated. We ate outside the restaurant and we were not freezing as they had little heaters hanging above the chairs.
author: Rowena R.

description: Amazing breakfast in San Fran. The waiting was less than 5min. They have outdoor heaters too. I had the healthy breakfast and it was delicious and very fulfilling ! The soy latte u ordered was in point too!
author: Jenn C.

description: We were tourists from Germany, the service was perfect. We ate some breakfasts, it was really really good. In our opinion the best Breakfast-cafe in the whole city. It was all fresh, and really fast as well.
author: Patrick D.

description: Outstanding. We had breakfast here and came back for lunch.  The food was excellent, the price was moderate. and the staff was friendly and attentive. You can't go wrong here.
author: Bob H.

description: A little undersized and not very "posh" but unique and really good food.  Service was what to be expected...
author: Michael R.

description:
Best Breakfast without breaking your
Pocket. We were staying at wharf and ended up here for breakfast. Came to know about history of this place while searching. All the portions were massive and very nicely made. I dont know about others but that strawberry jelly on the table was the best i have had. I ordered the omelette while the others ordered eggs Benedict etc. all ended well. 
One recommendation is to consider bigger tables outside. Had to get creative with big plates ;)
author: Sid B.

description: Great food! They had a bit of a line but it was worth the wait. The staff was very friendly and even though they were extremely busy they still checked up on our table regularly. Our meals were served with fresh fruit and every thing was delicious.
author: Jessica G.

description: Wow, I really like this place. The secret to really enjoying your time here is to get up early before the crowd comes. I manage to get in by eight and was able to be seated right away. I had their pancakes combo which came with fruit and eggs, as a beverage I ordered their vanilla cappuccino. Everything was very good, the pancake batter was sweet with like cinnamon taste to it, the eggs were prepared well and the portion sizes were enough for two people. Please come and see what the fuss is about and you will not be disappointed but you must come early. Enjoy!!!
author: Leivonie H.

description:
I loved my visit here, the portions were big for the prices and the food was good. The atmosphere was quaint and the service was quick!

FOOD:
Ordered a vegetarian omelette ($12.00 and has arugula, mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions) wrapped in perfectly cooked eggs. Fluffy and delicate, definitely satisfying! It also comes with has browns on the side, you can always opt for a big bowl of fresh fruits for an extra $3.00 and egg whites for an extra $2.00. It came out stuffed to the brim with fresh vegetables and fresh fruits on top.

SERVICE:
Impressively quick but with smiling faces all the time. :) The food came out maybe 7-10 minutes after we ordered. They also kept our waters filled and kept tabs on how we were, which was an A in my book. We came in about an hour before they closed and there was no wait whatsoever! Yay for us!

ATMOSPHERE:
The dine-in area was pretty small, and there's no real a/c and the weekend we visited, it was hot and sunny. Wish that could've been adjusted. But minor stuff, I loved how close it is to the warf so there are always interesting things happening on the walkway where their patio is located. :) Plus you get to dine behind the beach. :D
author: Stacy C.

description:
I absolutely love brunch & like most people, I was influenced to try this place for their insanely generous portions of fruits! I finally came in to try the place out for Saturday brunch & naturally, there was a wait but it wasn't that bad as it was about 25 mins for a party of 4. 

I was torn for almost the entire wait time trying to decide between the Vivian Leigh & Marilyn Monroe! In the end, I opted for the Vivian Leigh which was scrambled eggs with chopped bacon & cheese in a croissant with a huge side of fruit. I did find it to be pretty good but I wish that the eggs were better mixed together with the bacon & cheese. It was really unbalanced as on more than half of the sandwich was just plain scrambled eggs & then all of bacon bits & cheese on the other side. Also, the eggs were a bit too over cooked so it was partially dry. The eggs could've used some more seasoning aside from the salt & pepper provided on the table. Some seasoning, a nice sauce or spread would've made a great difference. Aside from that, the side of fruit did not disappoint as I had to take most of mine togo. I really appreciated the freshness & massive portion especially for the raspberries since they  are my favorite & they aren't cheap to buy!

Overall, I did have pretty good dining experience as the food came out within a reasonable amount of time & the customer service was good. I would definitely like to come back & try the other dishes!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Nice to sit out side and have a wonderful brunch here!
I had a big crab omelet which has juicy crab meat and cheese...yum!!!
Add $3 for a plate of fruit, well, it's a bowl of berries and fresh stuff!! 
Worth to try it!!
author: Ayin H.

description:
Food and service was great. I only give it a 4 star because of the location of the bathroom.

Overall this is one of the best places for breakfast if you need it fast. I think this place is comparable to a good black bear diner. This is a must go!
author: Ian A.

description:
In town for Fleet Week and hit this cafe for Sunday breakfast. Be prepared to wait 20-30 mins., but it is worth it!

We had crab eggs Benedict, a breakfast wrap, Hollywood hash browns and fresh fruit (plenty to take home).

Food is amazing!
author: S. M.

description: Got there around 10:45am on a Saturday and the wait was only about 15 minutes if that. Spinach tomato eggs Benedict was so so so yummy. Enjoyed my breakfast with a tasty but STRONG Mimosa(not complaining ). I would definitely come back and try other dishes.
author: Denise U.

description: Great little cafe hidden amongst the hotels. LOVED the coffee here and it was always nice and hot!! We had the seascape.... Yum if you like eggs benny... Has sliced salmon, yum! Shrimp and a yummy cool hash brown. Service was good and fast. Seating is limited. We were here at about 9am on a wed. We had our 9wk old with us and they made a spot for his stroller. Cute place, good food & coffee .. With character.
author: Shree N.

description:
Fruit.

I feel lazy, so while I'll be complete with this review, I won't be all fancy with it.

Decent sized wait on a Monday morning, though that's likely due to its proximity to nearby hotels and the Fisherman's Wharf.  A little hectic as one lady was running around with the sign-in clipboard checking on parties and we tried to flag her down to put our name down and she yelled at us to read the sign and go inside to put our name down...on the clipboard...that wasn't inside...it's with you lady.  But she seemed a little frustrated with the crowd so I'll cut her some slack.

Basic breakfast items again, but oh my God fruit.  If you order anything that comes with a fruit bowl, you apparently receive a full pound of fruit.  There was so much fruit on the table, more fruit than I think I have ever seen in my entire life.  And it was good fruit too.  I've never had blackberries or raspberries that were so flavorful.

But every rose has its thorn.  I tried the hash-burrito, which contained hash browns, eggs, ham, avocado, and a wasabi-cream sauce.  It was good, but the sauce was...lacking.  I ate through the first half, and it had plenty of sauce...actually too much sauce as I got down to the end and it was sort of all puddled up.  Then I had the second half...and there was no sauce in it at all.  This wasn't an anomaly either, someone else at the table got the same thing and experienced the same divide in sauce.

This restaurant is decent and more than fair with their portion sizes, but they survive mostly on the support of tourists.
author: Tim O.

description: Portions were excellent, anything with a fruit is a must. Sweet fruit, large variety and was decent priced. Awesome place if you're looking to get in and out for site seeing and don't want the traditional "fast food". Plus, if you're super nosey you sit so close to other people you can easily eavesdrop into others gossip .  That was the only downside, seating is crowded like a bunch of packed sardines
author: Marcella R.

description: Food was amazing.  The presentation was awesone.  Coffee and orange juice was fresh.  The service was great.
author: Liz C.

description:
That's right I love breakfast and I loved this place!

Yelp- thank you :)

We walked up to the line waiting outside the restaurant around 8am and were seated by 8.15pm.

The waiters were super friendly and quick in getting us coffee.

I'd say what makes this place 5 star is the food.

The coffee was the only thing that was average.

Everything else we ordered orange French toast, rancheros, pancake.. Were excellent. Perfectly cooked and super fresh! Not like your typical breakfast place which just fries everything so it tastes good!

Wait patiently ... It's worth it :)
author: Anitha C.

description: I recommend coming here for breakfast. It's a sweet place with good food, really recommend the pancakes. It's good place to eat cheap and relatively fast. The food quality is not out of this world, but it is an enjoyable place to go
author: Valeria S.

description: This is my all time favorite breakfast place in SF. Sure, there are a ALOT of choices for breakfast/brunch in SF but none beats Hollywood Cafe. It's all about the fresh, sweet abundant fruit! Many options from pancakes, French toast, to omelets, eggs benedict. All pretty standard breakfast fair done right with massive and delectable fruit on the side. It's located in the heart of fisherman's warf. Frequented by many travelers.  Wait is long but staff is speedy. Would definitely recommend
author: Patty C.

description: Awesome find just a short walk from our hotel! We went twice during our recent visit to the city!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Seriously, the other reviews are right. This place serves the best breakfast in the whole of the Bay, and it's a must visit for anyone staying in this part of town. 

Be prepared to wait in line, especially during tourist season, but the line does move pretty quickly. The service is friendly and efficient, but the best thing about this place is definitely the food. I highly recommend both the fruit bowl and the Hollywood hash browns, which were delicious. 

I don't often give 5 stars, but this place definitely deserves it!
author: Daniel B.

description: Omg what a fantastic place for breakfast. We did wait a little bit but well worth the wait. I hope to go back tomorrow. I had the classic French toast with fruit and 100% maple syrup. It was fantastic. My husband had the rancheros and a side of chorizo. Omg the flavored were so delicious. He could t get over the combination of tastes in his mouth. He never likes to combine too many things but he took the plunge and went for it. He talked about it all day and how incredible it was. The service was great and quick. Hope to go back again in the morning of we are going to do breakfast. Must go must wait in line well worth it.
author: Nicole T.

description: The line was about 30 minutes for me. I had the Vivian Leigh, a croissant with eggs, cheese and ham, with a bowl of fresh fruit. The right amount of crispness with delicious melted cheese. A bit pricey, but worth it.
author: Toni T.

description: Do not order the famous dish. The fruit is not fresh and the waitress is really want you leave not enjoy the food. I do have a bad experience.
author: Wenhui Z.

description:
If you're visiting SF and are in the fisherman's wharf area this is the place to go for breakfast! Such fresh amazing food. My party and I stayed at the hotel Zephyer (Definitely recommend staying there) and Hollywood cafe is only 2 blocks aways from the hotel. This place gets packed so come early and be open to sitting outside if you want to be seated quickly.
Went here twice during my visit. 

I definitely recommend: 

-Mocha coffee
-french toast combo 
-hashbrowns
-fruit bowl
-breakfast salad

Amazing food and for SF the prices are definitely not too bad. 

For 4 people the bills ended up being around $60 bucks.

Love this place!
author: Jami S.

description:
Friday, 11:45 AM. 
No reservations. 

Quickie:
+ Food quality
+ Hygiene
+ Customer service
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety

And then...?
Hollywood Cafe has other omelettes I want to try. 

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Eggs Benedict: Kimchi 
     + Properly fermented cabbage puts an Eastern spin on a Western dish.

Constructive comments:
*Do you compost?
*Source ingredients
author: Chuck N.

description:
Food was surprisingly good for being in a tourist area.  We enjoyed sitting outside and my salad was very fresh! 

However, I saw our waitress in the bathroom and she left without washing her hands, which is why I'm rating the place so low.  She did wear gloves when serving food, but still...  There was no soap in the bathroom, so I couldn't even wash mine.  Didn't seem like the cleanest place, especially for a food establishment.
author: Shawn O.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning around 7am and sat outside. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe (you get to pick your French toast option) and I got the Dolce. It was very good! They give you a massive bowl of fruit- like so much fruit you will never ever finish it in one sitting, but I like that and I think that's their "thing". We took the rest of ours to go. I also had a latte which was very good.

I also have to mention that a homeless man entered the restaurant and one of the friendly servers filled his entire large thermos with hot coffee and it just about moved me to tears. He also brought him cream and sugar. You gotta respect that.
author: Sarah M.

description: Randomly ended up here. The orange juice was amazing. I also love the tropical ice tea. I didn't like the huevos rancheros that much. It was almost like eggs on tortilla chips topped with salsa. The "Hollywood style" hash browns saved the new though.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Best smoked salmon I've ever had! If you are weary about eating raw fish, don't be. Their salmon is the perfect consistency and the flavor is not fishy at all.

The service here is also superb. The waiters are lightening quick and they are very nice. 

The portions are very generous, so be sure to not over order. 

My wife says this is her favorite breakfast place in San Fransisco :)
author: Mohammad A.

description: Very fast service. Good food. Much variety on the menu and decent prices. Very close to Fisherman Wharf.
author: Patricia F.

description:
I just don't get what all the hype is about this place.  Yes they have a huge hash brown and a good serving of fruit but overall it's just a breakfast place that is "okay". 

I ordered their famous hash brown that's topped with mushrooms and cream sauce and bacon... Minus the bacon. The hashbrowns were cooked perfectly, but the mushrooms tastes like they were from a can. I just scooped them to the side. I also ordered Rancharoes eggs topped with tortilla chips, salsa and avocado. This part was pretty tasty, but everything was piled on the plate it was  ....a huge mess. I mean really? Do you think I want to eat my fruit covered and salsa? 

The main reason Hollywood Café gets only three stars and not four, is because the service was not spot on it's overhyped for the price, and it's a huge tourist trap.
author: Toni J.

description:
This restaurant is absolutely fantastic!!! The restaurant is very welcoming with its amber and sunset orange wallpaper lined with black and white pictures of Hollywood actors and its small, cozy interior, especially in the early morning hours. 

The service was very friendly, and the quality of the food was out of this world, from the fresh fruit to the eggs. It may seem unusual, but the eggs were my favorite part of my meal. No matter what style you get them in, they are always cooked perfectly. I got the sunny side up eggs, and it was the best sunny side up egg I have ever had. The yolk was perfectly runny and the egg white was cooked just right with a little crispiness. 

For breakfast, I definitely recommend the blueberry pancakes. The pancakes are chocked full of blueberries, and they give you a lot of fruit. They were quite fluffy, and they give you the perfect portion.
author: Zoe C.

description:
This was our second resort since another place was way too long of a line. My wife wanted breakfast and it was already 1PM due to wasting time wondering if we should wait it out at the other place. We ventured in to "HOLLYWOOD CAFE" already thinking this was going to be "whatever" because it wasn't our first choice.

Well I was silenced because our first experience here proved us wrong. Being so close to the wharf--one of the major tourist spots in SF, we were expecting high prices, small portions, and average quality. We were surprised to see portions were plentiful, prices were very competitive, and the food was great! 

I wasn't feeling breakfast so I ordered the California Burger. MAN IT WAS SO GOOD! Especially at the price. It was $11-12. It was a good size burger. I'm a fat boy and I was satisfied at half of the burger, so finishing up the rest--I was done! It comes with fries, but not boring fries-- but CURLY FRIES!! SUPER DUPER POINTS! The ingredients were all fresh tasting and the bun tasted almost croissant like. It had a hefty amount of avocado and SPROUTS! It was just great!

My wife's breakfast was good too. Bacon was on point. French Toast was good.

Key thing with this place is they do not SKIMP out on things. Each dish comes with loads of fruit!! Not the usual few pieces you would expect, but a good portion. I've seen other tables who ordered an actual side of fruit and it was shocking to see how much they give. 

This placed surprised me, mainly because we were so bummed we couldn't go to our first choice restaurant and we had the mentality that anything else wouldn't compare. But we were wrong, and I'm glad we came. Although this is right by one of the biggest tourist area's in SF, the quality and value were excellent. You normally expect overpriced and average food in tourist areas, but this place was neither.

Hopefully things don't change. I would definitely go back.

PS, the service was great btw. Only hiccup was our original waitress who took our order messed up. 2 in our party said we wanted a side of FRENCH TOAST, but they gave us FRENCH FRIES (which are curly fries btw-no complaints its awesome) . So we thought that was the side of fries for the 2 burgers that we ordered, but it wasn't. The manager said we can keep it which was nice. But our waitress gave us the cold shoulder the rest of our time there. To the point she didn't wait on us anymore. Mistakes happen, she didn't apologize, nor were we mad about it, but had to point that out. It was her mistake though, she probably wrote it wrong and got confused, as she asked us when we ordered the burgers if we wanted salad or french fries. It happens, no big deal.
author: Eugene N.

description:
Too much good food for one person!

The wait was worth it. My omelette was comically huge and remarkably delicious. The Hollywood hashbrowns were good, but not worth the extra price. Regular hashbrowns are almost place-mat size, covering the plater. Mine had vegetables covering them.

Even though they were packed on a Sunday morning, service was attentive and the food came out in a decent amount of time. This is a winner in every category.
author: Brian M.

description: Amazing breakfast that's well worth the wait! The food was delicious and tasted very fresh! My girlfriend and I split a buttermilk pancake and were mind blown! She got the hash burrito and I got the B.A.T. both of which we would gladly recommend.
author: Nicholas T.

description:
My husband and I decided to try this place out due to the close proximity to where we were staying and we are glad we did. Just as others have commented, there was a line but since it was just the two of us we were sat pretty  quickly. Larger groups may have a longer wait. 

 My husband ordered the two egg breakfast and upgraded the hash browns to the Hollywood hash browns. I had the Orange French toast. All was spectacular. The fresh fruit that came along with my French toast was amazing and their signature bacon was really good. We both cleaned our plates except for a few pieces of toast.

Bottom line...It is worth standing in line for breakfast at the Hollywood Cafe.
author: Tracy B.

description:
The dungeness crab omelette is one of my favorite dishes in the bay area!  The omelette was huge, stuffed with fresh crab meat and avocado.   Additionally,  the meal was served with a hashbrown the size of my plate. 

I highly recommend this place!!
author: Josh R.

description:
The French Toast--YUM! Definitely a place worth stopping by for breakfast. The food was great and the presentation was fantastic.

Tip: Leave the hotel early if you want to avoid a long line. 

We arrived at 7:30AM on a Thursday and the place was almost full but no wait.

Arrived there again on a Friday at 9:30AM and the line was out the door along the sidewalk.
author: Zira C.

description:
This place was great! The service was wonderful, especially when they took extra good care of my 2 year old son. Then we ordered... And wow! I had the vanilla French toast and my
Wife had the eggs and Hollywood hash browns. So tasty! Our little man had the chocolate chip pancake and his face was priceless when it arrived! We were not disappointed in the least! I recommend this place to anyone interested!
author: Bryant H.

description: I totally agree with the comment from the other Yelper about the food looking better in the photos than on the plate. The only request is that we asked for was extra-extra crispy hash-browns and they came out just regular and room temp to cold. The owner should know that breakfast is a menu item that needs to be served right away because it doesn't hold heat well. It also doesn't help when the door is left open when the temp is in the 40s...duh? In the Denver omelette the ingredients were not even sauteed. I hate not having my food come out as ordered because if you have to re-do anyone's items, then the other person waits as they watch the other eat, which doesn't make any sense.....I have higher expectations for a pricey breakfast place. I have had hotter temp breakfast at a fast-food places.
author: Mike C.

description: Long line when we got here, but it went very fast. Food was amazing. Very large portions, service was great. We highly recommend this place.
author: Ryan S.

description: Regular selection of breakfast foods. My partner got the French toast combo- it was a big serving and delightful. I got the bagel and lox which came disassembled with lox, tomatoes, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, cream cheese, and provolone. Outside seating had heaters which was nice on a chilly morning. There was a wait but only about 20 minutes on a Sunday morning.
author: Killian S.

description:
Just writing this review is already making me hungry!!! Came here with two of my girlfriend's on a Saturday around noon. We actually came here from the popular Brenda's French Soul Food. We left there because that place had an hour and a half wait!!! Thank god that we left and came here because this place did not disappoint any of us!!! It is a very cute cafe and was full of people but the wait was only 15 minutes!!

Here's what we had:

Audrey Hepburn - For the first time, the pancakes were perfect size!! It's so frustrating when you go other breakfast places and the size of the pancake and the amount they give you is unrealistic. They also provided a side of peanut butter when we asked for some (surprisingly some restaurants don't carry peanut butter). The bowl of fruit was to die for! Fresh and had a great variety of different fruits! The hash browns looked amazing and super crispy like how I like them. But surprisingly they weren't as crispy but still good.

Salmon-Shrimp Eggs Benedict - My girlfriend ordered this and I didn't get to try any of it because she ate it ALL! So with that being said, I guess it was delicious!

Steak Sandwich - Everything from the bread to the meat inside the sandwich was delicious!

Mango Mimosas - They are strong! So if you like them strong, order them!
author: Emily P.

description: Stopped in before alcatraz tour. Small spot but great food and coffee was strong. Nice people great service. Make sure you try the vanilla French toast. Amazing!
author: Nanc A.

description:
Food was amazing. Service was terrible. Therefore, I have to give this place 3 stars.  Service and food go hand in hand.  If one is lacking, your customers most likely won't return.

I put my name down for 4.  It was only about a 15 minute wait, not bad.  The server took 10 minutes to even "greet" us.  She comes up to us and says "ready?" Lol, good morning to you too.  So we order a hot tea, an OJ, a coffee, and 2 waters.  She only brings 1 water, leaving me without a drink.

I didn't know that everything came with sourdough toast.  I ordered the french toast platter and wanted bread for my eggs, so I ordered wheat toast.  The waitress should have warned us that we were already going to receive a pound of bread at that time.  But then again, she had no communication skills. Who am I kidding?

We get our fresh sourdough bread which is absolutely delicious!  Next we get ONE benedict.  My dad's benedict.  We wait another 8-10 minutes for the rest of the food.  We told my dad to eat because we didn't want his food to get cold.  By the time ours came out, he was completely done, and only had fruit left.  This is so unprofessional and my biggest pet peeve.  

My french toast was good, and my parents loved their egg benedicts.  My brother thought his pancakes were just okay.  The fruit was absolutely delicious, very fresh.

Waitress lacked a personality, communication, and service skills.  We only saw her when she took our order and one other time.  Someone else brought our drinks, and our food.  A different lady even dropped our check off.  Without a "thank you" or anything. 

Next time I'll find great food WITH great service.
author: Addy L.

description: I highly recommend this place. Big portions and yummy!I think my meal was enough to feed 2 people.
author: Cartrina C.

description: Small space and there can be a wait but it's worth it. We had good service and good food. The pancakes are to die for!! Would go back for sure.
author: Cindy S.

description:
Awesome food!! Have the Vanilla french toast. I had the CAS omelet and it was ok. The fruit is really fresh! Service was decent. Wait wasn't too long. Maybe 25 mins. There was a line so u know it's good. 
Highly recommend it. Definitely one of my fave in SF! :)
author: Maria V.

description: Despite long lines queuing up, efficiently organized, very friendly staff more running than walking. Good breakfast at reasonable prices. Definitely worth to line up!
author: Brigitte H.

description: AMAZING! Their fruit bowls are so legit and the Marilyn Monroe was delicious!! Their Hollywood hash brown was also incredible. We will definitely be back!! We heard about this place from friends who said it was incredible and it did not disappoint!!
author: Brittany M.

description:
A well-intended restaurant with a great menu and great location, that just doesn't execute. The service is noticeably sub-par. The only redeeming quality of this place is the quantity of food served and overall atmosphere. 

Notables:

1) There was hair in my food 

2) The servers were poor communicators that just seemed dazed? 

3) Our waitress poured the water into glasses and spilled it on my friend 

4) Funny story:  My roommate's dish was supposed to have sweet potatoes in it but she could not taste any. She asked our waitress where the sweet potatoes were and the girl curtly asserted "Sweet potatoes? Um sorry ma'am. that's not correct. We don't serve sweet potatoes in any of our dishes." ....Until she quickly left for the kitchen and came back five minutes later to point out that the sweet potatoes would be found in between the eggs and the English muffin. 

5) The tables outside are SUPER small. We couldn't fit all on plates on it and had to heap and consolidate multiple items onto one entree plate. I think that's plainly unacceptable. 

Overall, with a cute, touristy, ocean-side feel -- one would expect the entire experience but it just doesn't deliver.
author: Arushi S.

description: Went here for Breakfast on a Monday morning and there was a line out the door.  We waited about 20 min and were sat inside.  I ordered 2 eggs with bacon, hashbrowns and sourdough toast.  I also got a Grand Mimosa.  Everything was delicious!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Stumbled upon this place from Yelp during a morning with a friend as we were looking for a place to eat. This was a great find! It was busy so we knew it would be good. The portions are definitely generous, the plates of food are great looking here, and the staff is friendly. I'd come here again!
author: Aryo S.

description: DONT LOOK ANYWHERE ELSE.  I am visiting SF and this is the second day in a row we had breakfast here and it's unbelievable.   I had the eggs Benedict florentine and I added tomatoes.  I also had a side of Dolce French toast excellent!  The service was quick and the place was clean.  If I was here another week I would come here every day
author: Mike B.

description:
So amazing!  We came at about 10:30 on a Saturday morning.  You write your name on a clipboard, the number in your party, and if you prefer inside, or outside seating.  We put "any" and got a seat within 15 minutes outside.

Amongst my husband we ordered:
-Two mimosas - very good and served in a wine glass (i.e. more to drink)
-A side of fruit - which was huge and and so much variety in it - strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, orange, banana, kiwi, grapes, grapefruit, watermelon, and honeydew!  Holy cow, we could not finish this!
-Dolce French Toast with the fried Banana - Again so amazing and also with so much fruit
-A side of chicken apple sausage - good

They also serve toast with butter as a free starter. 

All amazing!  All wonderful.  Would definitely come back if I'm down near the pier again.
author: Cassandra A.

description:
Best breakfast I have ever had! Still dreaming of it, can't wait to visit the city again just so I can wake up and eat here. 
Long line, but well worth the wait!!
author: Juliet F.

description: Wow, this place takes breakfast and gives you what you want.  The Denver omelette was huge that could feed 2.  I got the hash browns hollywood style and worth the experience.  Wife's eggs benedict was good, eggs properly cooked.   Coffee was ok, orange juice was freshly squeezed but not the best we've had so far.  The fresh fruit you get is a meal in itself the amount you get and it's very delicious.
author: Rick H.

description:
Pix on website looks a lot better.

It wasn't bad, it was somewhat cheap around $10 for a brunch item.  But the pix on their website is a lot better than reality - misleading is always bad.

Restaurant filled with mostly tourists.
author: Gloria T.

description: Great food!!! However, after spending $50 for two meals plus a 30% tip we were asked to leave our table. We were sitting there planning on where to walk to next with our four year old and the waitress said they needed our table. She said we could move to the front if we would like. She was kind in how she said it but at the same time I was shocked!!! We were treated like cattle. Hustled in and the second we paid and they got their tip they hustled us out. This would have been a five star review because of the food but after that I can't. We left with our four year old daughter crying. I'm sad a good brunch was ruined in the end. What a disappointment.
author: Brooklyn R.

description:
We stayed at a near by hotel for 1 week for business and ate at this restaurant daily for breakfast. We needed a place we could walk to and opened so we could get to our conference on time. And we really didn't want a chain restaurant like subway or IHOP.

Get anything with the fruit bowl. Includes lots of fresh raspberries, blackberries, kiwi, pineapple, etc. I highly recommend the french toast--light & flavorful. My husband liked the hash browns--crispy on both sides. We even thought the coffee was particularly good.

We got to know the family, who were kind, and always kept our coffee topped off. Great find for breakfast
author: Shana V.

description: They certainly do not skimp on food here! However, they do skimp on usage of plates. I got a breakfast combo including pancakes, eggs and fruit, so naturally these are not things I would like to eat all together in one bite. The fruit leaked into my eggs, I ended up spilling syrup on my pants in an attempt to avoid the eggs, and the whole thing was a big, frustrating mess. Luckily, the food was delicious, or I probably would have left not a happy camper. The hashbrown was perfectly seasoned, as well, though I was bummed that I had to order this separate, so it ended up taking up additional room on the teensy table. The table, however, was perfectly placed outside, and it was a perfectly sunny, crisp morning in the city. We got seated right away, however, it was a Wednesday morning, and as I can tell from previous posts, this may not be the usual.
author: Dayna R.

description: Definitely recommend the egg benedicts; crab meat, spinach, hollandaise, and caperberry. Hash browns were nice and crisp. And the service was amazing. As well as the price.
author: Willy F.

description: Across the street from the Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf, HC was a pleasant surprise. To speed our seating, we decided to eat outside with the heaters to help warm us during our meal. We ordered the crab eggs benedict and an order of fresh fruit (was very fresh). The meal was tasty and the service very prompt and attentive. Highly recommended if you seek an authentic home cooked breakfast while in the area.
author: Gene C.

description:
Wow! This is a great breakfast restaurant in San Fransisco. They have amazing options, and they have a lot of delicious fruit. This is the best breakfast restaurant I have ever been to.

I ordered a delicious chocolate chip pancake with whipped cream(that could be on the kids menu). This is a great restaurant and I highly recommend it.
author: Marshy M.

description:
After seeing the excellent Yelp reviews & the line outside of our hotel window, we decided to give this place a chance for breakfast.  

For starters, you wait in line until there is a table ready.  This is excellent marketing for the restaurant as it seems like it is "line worthy", but in reality the line is a combination a small restaurant in a high traffic, touristy, area. (We waiting only 10 min around 8:40 am on a Thursday)

Service was friendly and prompt; we ordered the "Marilyn Monroe" (french toast + fruit) and the BAT (bacon,avocado,tomato) scramble. The French toast is standard...not memorable either way.  Yes, the fruit bowl is huge and delicious, however at $13.50 I don't think it's that great of a deal.  The BAT is above average with a generous serving of avocado, but the hash browns were disappointing. Ultimately The Hollywood Cafe filled a need...a place to eat breakfast, but should they be "famous" for their food??? Nope!
author: Athena B.

description:
Definitely order the fruit cup.  The portion truly is a meal on its own.  

The service was quick, polite and without pressure to hurry up.  The food tasted great.  I had the vegetarian omelet which was very good and filling.

I waited about 45 minutes to be seated but it was worth it.
author: Joel L.

description: I liked it here so much the first time that I even came a second time during my short time in SF! I love their B.A.T eggs and hash browns (so much flavor), but also really enjoyed their large fruit cups with berries and their breakfast wraps. The line can get long but it moves quickly. The servers are fast and nice. Great breakfast spot!!!
author: Teresa N.

description: Food was EXCELLENT!! It's the best brunch I've had in San Fran thus far. Fruit is fresh and sweet and meal was delicious. I want to come tomorrow again. Well worth the wait in line. The mango mimosa was delicious and they need to sell carafes. I had the crab Benedict and Hollywood hash browns.
author: Evelyn O.

description: Came here for brunch on a Sunday. Food was excellent. Service was also great just a little bit slow.
author: Agatha P.

description:
I have to admit the name and location initially raised a few red flags for me, but those were quickly dismissed once we arrived and saw the food on peoples plates.  I knew we were in for a bit of a wait based on the amount of people loitering about outside.  The estimated wait was 30-45 minutes which turned out to be pretty spot on.  

I ordered the smoked turkey eggs Benedict, the other two in my party ordered the lox bagle and two egg scramble with Hollywood hashbrowns.  My meal must have came with an entire avocado, definitely a plus.  

As others have mentioned, the fresh fruit is super delicious!  All of our meals were pretty large and I don't think any of us managed to finish the entire thing, although we were very tempted to push through.  All of us were thoroughly satisfied with our meals.  

This place is definitely a gem among most of the other restaurants that line the fishermans wharf area.  As a local, I'm happy to say I would definitely visit this spot for brunch again in the future.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Post-half marathon only calls for two things - showering and eating. Thankfully Hollywood Cafe helped us out with the latter.

FOOD:
Blueberry pancakes: They usually come with whipped cream, blueberry compote, and fresh blueberries, but despite ordering them without whipped cream, I was served pancakes with the whole she-bang. Not a big deal as boyfriend ate the entire serving after I wiped them off. The pancakes were very tough - it's as if they over beat the batter. They were more cakey than fluffy, but I was more focused on the HUGE mound of fresh fruit on the side. Raspberries, strawberries, honeydew, cantaloupe.. you name it, it's on your plate. Amazing. 
Turkey eggs benedict: The boyfriend really enjoyed this, and it ALSO came with a heaping serving of fresh fruit. These portions are on the large side and sort of justify the hefty price point (we were also in super touristy marina). 

SERVICE: 
Service varied from incredibly slow (when we asked for the check) to very attentive. 

OTHER:
-No AC. I guess this wouldn't really matter because SF weather is moderately cool to begin with, but it was pretty warm in the restaurant. No shade on the patio makes it a lose-lose situation on a hot day.
author: Nicole L.

description:
My husband and I went here on our honeymoon with a couple of friends from Texas. I chose this place because of it's really high Yelp rating and the proximity to our hotel. The line was about 10-15 deep when we got there, but it moved fairly quickly considering how small the actual restaurant is. Our food came out quickly, in huge portions, and delicious! Our friend ordered the fruit bowl and it was overflowing with fresh, ripe, tasty fruit!
I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an interesting place to grab breakfast.
author: Brook M.

description: Great choices for breakfast, we came with a group of 7 and all enjoyed; we were treated with fast service.  We waited 35min at 9:30am on a Saturday for a table.
author: Chris S.

description: I've really enjoyed this cafe for multiple reasons! I've come in summer time and brought my dog. We sat outside and when I ordered her an egg, they even brought her a water bowl! I've brought family who have also loved the place! Great location, great food. Sometimes you get lucky and can park right out front! I usually get the yummy French toast with a fruit bowl. Awesome Hollywood hash browns too! And yummy mimosas. The wait line can get long but luckily I've never had a problem with a crazy long wait. I always upgrade the French toast and that's never a problem either. The fruit they use in their bowls is an excellent combo, usually grapes blackberries blueberries melon orange grapefruit pineapple kiwi strawberries raspberries banana but varies by what's in season. So good and the portion actually fills you up quite well!!! When I'm in the mood for a good diner and want to avoid any unknown factors I come here and know I won't be disappointed! The only weird thing is the bathroom it's actually outside of the restaurant in this creepy little hallway. No big deal I just brought a friend!
author: Adri A.

description: Food was good. Service was good. Didn't see anything spectacular about the place or the food. Just okay.
author: Chelsea S.

description: Cool place that has a lot of character. The wait was a little long to get in and the food was just "pretty good." Overall, my wife and I were happy with our visit.
author: Chad T.

description: Excellent place for breakfast! Portions are very generous, fairly priced and excellent, friendly service. Will definitely come back.
author: Omar M.

description:
Oh my god. I have found it. The best breakfast/brunch spot with inevitably the worst parking endeavor in the Bay Area.   

I've had my eye on this place for a while, but finally got around to trying the place out on a wednesday mid-morning. I figured that they'd have a calmer crowd, and my intuition was correct. This place gets mad packed. Don't even try coming here on the weekends with the tourists and all. You'll spend an hour trying to find parking and you don't want that unless you want a head start on greying your hairs. 

As far as the food goes, everything good that anyone ever says about this place is true. They don't skimp on SHT. Massive portions is what you'll get. If you're trying to eat healthier opt out for the fresh fruit as your side. They give you a mountain worth. A definite try would be the crab omelette. They put a generous portion of crab into it and I have a feeling that they try to let their customers know that they use fresh crab. How you may ask? I found like 3 pieces of crab shell in the omelette. Bruh, I get that you use fresh crab. You don't need to let us know by "accidentally" putting crab shells in there. 

The service was straight. Nothing out of the ordinary, except for the fact that the waitress kept trying to refill our water cups after every sip and even though they were still already full. Bruh, we're in a drought. Calm down.  

All in all, If this place wasn't in the heart of the main tourist spot in the city, I'd definitely come back. Why you gotta be in sf man, why?
author: EJ B.

description: Great service, and good food. I ate breakfast here 3 mornings of my week visit to San Fran.
author: Viola H.

description: The food was soooooo good, the only downside was the wait but other than that the food was great the service was awesome. If I ever come back to San Francisco I will definitely come back again. We had the French Toast, and omelette, and the chilaquiles, it was all great. Even the fresh fruit on the plate was good.
author: Ruby G.

description:
We have eaten here twice since we arrived in town 5 days ago. We had an amazing breakfast and lunch! 
I highly recommend this place.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch/lunch.  We waited about 15 minutes before being seated.

Crab Benedict- The toast was nicely toasted--great foundations for the load of crab and egg.  The crab could've used a splash of lemon or something--it was missing something.  The hashbrowns were nice and crispy--if it weren't soggy in the center from the crab benedict, it would've been perfect.
French Toast- Wasn't too eggy.  Right amount of sweetness.  Accompanied by a bowl with LOTS of fresh fruit.

Service- Great.  Attentive.
Food- HUGE portions.

Once you walk in, you will notice TONS of fruits on each table.  It's crazy the amount of fruits they give you!!!!
author: Linda N.

description:
One of my favorite stops in San Francisco was this little cafe. It's so bright and fresh and airy, especially if you can score a table outside in the morning sunlight. We popped by around 11 am on a Saturday, so you can bet it was crowded. We could have had a table inside pretty quickly, but we really wanted to sit out in the fresh air, so we waited about thirty minutes. This was no big deal in the nice weather, but there is no where to sit and not a lot of space to stand, so you just kind of awkwardly hover around the people who are already seated. Oh well, at least you can look at their food and start thinking about what you want.

Everything on the menu is very reasonably priced and sounds amazing. I decided to go with the Rancheros, which is just a ridiculous amount of food, so beware. Two eggs over medium with plenty of salsa, served on top of tortilla chips, avocado, and hashbrowns (Hollywood style, which means they have peppers, cheese, bacon, onion, and basil added. Geez). There's also plenty of random fruit on your plate, so you don't need to order a side of fruit unless you're a serious fruit fiend. Adam ordered the crazy-hearty-helping of French toast served with eggs, bacon, and fruit. All of the food is picture perfect and so delicious. But I truly think there's too much of it. I probably only ate half of my plate, and I'm a good eater. Come super hungry or share!

Don't forget to order a mimosa. First I had the mango-orange, which was a tad too sweet for my taste but still amazing. I had the grapefruit next, and it was perfect. Fresh, bubbly, and surprise-surprise, served with extra fruit!
author: Kendall S.

description: I like this restaurant's sunny side up eggs. You have to eat here for breakfast. The wait is a bit long but is worth it. I would love if you made the restaurant bigger.
author: Ethan Q.

description: This place is really friendly and their food is extremely delicious. I would definitely be coming back!
author: Juan M.

description:
Believe the hype!!! 

You will have to wait but I assure you it is worth the wait. The food is mind blowing and I love that their "side" of fruit is a pound and a half of super fresh and super sweet goodness.

Do not visit SF Without going here!
author: Karin M.

description:
Ok...I don't get the hype. Mediocre food high prices sour faced waitress with a bad attitude.  I feel robbed. I searched for a good place to take a friend for breakfast before his departure to SoCal and Yelp users highly recommended this place.  What am I missing. Was I there on a bad day. 
Don't go there don't go there don't go there!!!!
Crappy fruit bowl 9$
F
Oranges had no taste and the grapes were not good.  Cantaloupe still green and flavorless. 
I also expected some Hollywood flare but a bunch of pictures doesn't give you the cred. To call yourself Hollywood cafe

And to the ahole host... Suck it
author: Jaime S.

description: Awesome breakfast; the fresh fruit with anything is a great start to your day! Seating was quick for this small venue, orders came out quick, everything tasted great and was hit from the kitchen.
author: Dave F.

description:
I went in because I was craving a strawberry, goat cheese and spinach salad but I was tempted by the "side of fruit" this place is famous for. 
I got a Greek omelet  with fruit instead of hash browns and was not disappointed. The omelet, had tomatoes, spinach, black olives  and feta - it was OK for a restaurant omelet, a little overcooked and a tad under-seasoned but with the addition of pink salt, fresh ground pepper and some Cholula ( all available on the table) it was quite satisfying. The side of 5 slices of toasted, crusty, chewy, pre-buttered sourdough toast were perfect for soaking up the juicy tomatoey omelet stuffing too! 
But you won't care about the omelet.  it's really all about the fruit. It is a giant pile of very fresh beautiful bing cherries, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, kiwis, bananas, watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapple, orange, grapefruit, apple slices and grapes. It's crazy. It's enough fruit for like 4 or 5 people. I ate way too much in an attempt to get my money's worth but I still left about a third of it. I suggest taking most of it home.
Next time I swear I'll get that strawberry salad.
author: Missy F.

description: We found this place next to the grey line bus station waiting area before our trip up to wine country! We were sat immediately outside and even though it was raining the inning covered us just fine. For 3 of us we split two breakfast entrees which was more than enough. They are not shy in portions at all! And their pancakes tasted amazing. Not sure what they do differently but I loved their pancakes! Also, the have great sourdough toast and a good blackberry jam to go on it. They were quick and efficient and I would definitely recommend. The only reason for 4 stars is because they share a public restroom and it wasn't very clean and that's just the men's. Other than that this place was great!
author: Jake A.

description:
Wow! Amazing food and service! 
Warm and cozy ambiance. Very polite and happy staff. Everyone I interacted with were very helpful and smiley. I had the Vivian Leigh from the breakfast menu and it was great tasting and very generous with portion. 
Best breakfast I had in a while!
author: Mariluz G.

description:
Not really sure how this place is getting almost 5 stars... The food was mediocre at best. If you're a foodie go to Taylor Street Cafe on Taylor and Ellis-WAY better. 
Only came here since it was close to where we need to go, but definitely will be the last time! 

Huevos rancheros were not good. The "salsa" was clearly from the jar- at least try to make a decent salsa especially if there are Latinos in the kitchen. The hash browns were still slightly raw- should have been cooked longer. The French toast also were ok. The food just lacked flavor all around. I've had better. But it did the trick and filled us up.
author: Sara O.

description:
Portions were generous and delish! We had salmon and shrimp eggs Benedict, omelette, beet salad, and fried eggs and fruit. Everyone was very pleased with their item. The decaf machiato was a good compliment with breakfast. 

Service was good and friendly. They don't take reservations but they are well organized and efficient and get you seated as soon as they can.
author: j. l.

description: Absolutely fantastic!  We ate breakfast at this restaurant every day that we were in Fisherman's Wharf.  The fresh fruit and sourdough bread made it stand out for me.  The kids loved the chocolate chip pancakes.
author: Brad B.

description: Breakfast that counts as your lunch. Servings are beyond ample. I had the crab Benedict which was beyond outstanding! A few tidbits of fresh fruit accented the dish which was great because I was ogling the person setting next to me's plate which had a heaping bowl of fresh fruit making me second guess my upcoming order. The bite redeemed my order choice which was outstanding (Did I say that already?). Hubs got the Greek omelette which was also outstanding. Fresh. Fresh ingredients, we will return for sure! Prices may seem a tad high at first (Well not compared to the hotel...) but the servings are humongous! We will prob actually share the deliciousness next visit!
author: Pamela K.

description:
Not many places can pull off both healthy AND comfort food. These folks do it with style. The fruit is fresh and amazingly sweet. The Benedict's and hash-browns are to die for. 
And Not only is the food amazing, but the staff is wonderful. They went out of their way each day we were there to make our kids feel special. 
Hollywood cafe was a very special part of our family vacation and we can't wait to come back. 
My 2yr old son even said that his favorite part of SanFrancisco was Breakfast!
author: Andrew B.

description:
One word to best describe this place, AMAZING! 

Their fruits are so fresh, making the orange juice and mimosas extra delicious! Even their water is fresh! LOL (I'm serious). My favorite dish is the Gregory Peck breakfast and I've also tried their French toast combo. Both are just outstanding! Another bonus to this place is their staff! They all work together to make sure all the customers are happy. A downfall, like any great restaurants, would be the wait time. But let me tell you, it is definitely worth it!!

Today was my second time dining here, this week. I highly recommend this place for breakfast/brunch!
author: Rechell E.

description:
Great food, big portions, they get our orders and bring the food super quick as well! Loved it! 
Best breakfast I've had in a while! 
I ordered a eggs Benedict salmon and shrimp, there were not a lot of shrimps but it tasted amazing!
author: Duda B.

description:
We were staying nearby and I went here and ordered breakfast to go to take back to our hotel. First of all, the service was excellent and the food was ready in no time. 

More importantly, the food was fabulous! I ordered a Vivien Leigh, a breakfast sandwich on a grilled croissant and two fried eggs with Hollywood hash browns. The Vivien Leigh croissant was stuffed with wonderful scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese and bacon (lots of bacon) and came with a huge side of delicious fresh fruit (really a bowl with bananas, pineapple, melon, berries and pineapple - a meal in itself). The Hollywood hash browns that accompanied my fried eggs was a huge helping of perfectly fried hash browns topped with a mountain of sautéed mushrooms, peppers, onions and bacon topped with a cheese sauce. I love hash browns and/or home fries and these were some of the best I've had anywhere. 

Either breakfast was really enough for two, and the prices were reasonable. This has to be one of the best places to eat breakfast in San Francisco!
author: Bob P.

description: Delicious breakfast. It was so good we went two days in a row while in San Fran. Got the fruit plate both days. Amazing. They're very generous with the fruits and potions. Not just melons, apples and grapes. Also got the crab benedict and it was phenomenal. Highly recommended. The Greek yogurt was also so so so good.
author: Katy F.

description: Just had an incredibly amazing crab omelette at Hollywood Café! Naturally, 3 blocks from the water, one would get really good crab and that was the case here! Total win!
author: Michael E. B.

description:
Holy smokes! My wife researched this place for our trip to SF (good call honey!) 
It's not a very big place so even on a Thurs late breakfast (10am) there was a short wait. 
Well worth it though. We ordered the Vivian Leigh- a bacon, egg & cheese croissant with a HUGE side order of fresh fruit. The sandwich was fantastic on it's own merit but now I can honestly say I've become full on fruit alone. 
Yeah it's in the touristy Fisherman's Wharf, but this place is worth a visit if you're fighting through all that stuff anyways. Enjoy!
author: Scott A.

description: Really good breakfast - eggs , bacon , sour dough bread , try the Hollywood hash Browns . Patio side tables and solid  service .. Keeping doing a job.
author: DR W.

description: When I visit the Wharf, I always eat breakfast at the Hollywood Cafe.  If there is a line, believe me it is worth the wait.  Fruit bowls are huge and the omelettes are big.  You'll be happy.  Stop in and give them a go.
author: James D.

description: The food is excellent with very generous portions. A little pricey but worth it, I had the Vivian Leigh  and it was as so good the fruit salad was all fresh fruit and lots of it, raspberries, strawberries, kiwis, watermelon, banana, pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew and more. The coffee wears excellent!
author: Peg K.

description:
ENVIRONMENT: It was a busy place. It only took us about 5 minutes to get seated even though they said it would take 15 minutes.

STAFF: The employees were nice, but once you ordered, it was difficult to get their attention again. My advice would be to order any potential drink when the waiter takes your order.

FOOD: The portions are GARGANTUAN! And that's an understatement. Beware...don't let your hunger cause you to order too much. But whatever you do, someone at the table should get the fruit cup!
author: Paul D.

description:
Right next to Fishman wharf, this is one of the most stressful breakfast places I've ever eaten. The food is good - hashbrowns sausage patty and the coffee is just a great next to start your day but the que is often long and it is on a first come first serve basis. 

Service is pretty quick but not very personal so this is more of a place to come to eat and then leave, and I got impression that's what the staff expect you to do.
author: Daniel R.

description: Good hearty breakfasts served fast. Long line, because it's convenient to many of the Fisherman's Wharf hotels.  Friendly waitstaff. San Francisco prices, but that's no surprise. :-) Only real negative was the washroom was an ill-maintained public washroom.
author: John B.

description:
Came here for brunch and ordered the crab eggs Benedict and the one with kimchi on it. I'm not a huge kimchi fan but it was pretty good. The crab one was great, but I found that I enjoyed eating the crab meat separately from the English muffin and egg personally. 

The place was packed and the service wasn't too great because of this. I think we both finished our orange juice about when the meals came out and weren't offered more before we left. Not awful, they were just busy and didn't pay a ton of attention to us. 

I would recommend trying it out, some of the other stuff I saw come out of the kitchen looked very good as well.
author: Troy C.

description: Perfect choice for a wonderful breakfast!  The place fills quickly, so get there early. The menu has the basics and a few decedent extras, and all of it was delivered beautifully.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Food is lovely but a bit too much. Toilets are down some dank corridor you need a code to access. Pretty hideous. Staff were quick and fairly nice. Good if you're in that area as most other places are awful
author: Rhiannon P.

description:
Best breakfast place EVER! Not going to say much since I've said a great deal on TA, but if I lived closer I'd be eating here all the time! 

All the rave reviews couldn't have said it better! Excellent quality food, friendly customer service, fresh and healthy fruit salads, and all mouthwateringly delicious! 
There's a line, but it goes pretty quickly and worth the 15-20 minute wait. 
Do yourself a favor and eat here. Your stomach and taste buds will Thank You
for it
author: J S.

description:
This place is the best! We arrived on a Saturday about 9 am and only had to wait about 10-15 minutes.  My husband and I ordered a fruit bowl to share.. And it was the best fruit bowl I have ever ordered.  All varieties of fruit, and not just the cheap melons like most restaurants.

I ordered the French toast, and my husband ordered the pancakes.  Both were very delicious and fresh.  The OJ seemed to be freshly squeezed and tasted good, and the coffee tasted great, more of a dark roast which I prefer! Family friendly with great staff.
author: Mo D.

description: The wait looks long when arriving but they shuffle people in and out pretty quick.  First come first serve-no putting your name on a list. They need better signage as to that issue and where they want the line forming instead of the hostess rudely telling people to move and then making fun of them because they didn't know.  I had the vanilla French toast and it was wonderful.  Coffee was good too. I would definitely go back.
author: Christy A.

description: Great food, good price, fast service. My coffee cup never got below half full, nice and strong, just the way I like it (don't ever let my cup get empty!).
author: Dan F.

description:
Great place to sit outside and "people watch"!
Had a yummy breakfast complete with latte and mocha. Eggs and sausage, huge hash browns. 
Traffic is a little noisy, otherwise it's perfect.
author: Cathy L.

description: Huge portions. Easily shared around our table. The mimosas were wonderful. Long wait but worth it.  We shared a burrito and French toast. So glad we found this little restaurant right near our hotel.
author: Kyle M.

description:
This place is delicious!!!
Make sure to order the honey garlic fries!!!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I won't repeat what other yelpers have said, but here is my two cents:

We went for breakfast at 9:30 AM on a Thursday.  

Amazing food.  Really, really good.  Yelpers are right.  Six stars.

Long...long...long...long wait time.....we waited 35 minutes standing outside in the cold.  Really miserable.   Negative two stars.

Terrible service.  Very bad.  Our server took our order and brought our food.  That's it.  No checking back.  No filling water.  Not one conversation.  It seems like they are thinking, if people will wait 30 minutes in line for our awesome amazing food, then why do we need decent service?  Part of the blame also falls on the management who lets it all happen.  Negative one star.

It's really a shame, because if they could find a larger venue and hire nice competent and attentive servers (and/or managers), they could be one of the best breakfast venues in the country (IMHO).
author: Bradley K.

description: Awesome place for b/f or lunch around fisherman's warf area!!! They have great menu options along with freshly ground coffee and freshly squeezed OJ!! Good portion size and very quick service!!
author: Shivani K.

description:
The food here, along with the service, was great.
The line builds at rapid speed but the servers do their best to make a quick turnover.
What I noticed almost immediately was the great work flow the servers had, you're not helped by one central person, everyone kind of just helps each table, in my observation. 
The food was filling, although my grapes were soft and tasted older.  aside from that, the food was delicious and my husband and I would return again, if not for this cities plethora of eateries.
author: Ella A.

description:
One of the best breakfast places I have ever visited. I live in DC and was in town for a few days with a friend. Went here because of the great reviews.

We went really early and were able to easily grab a table. However by the end of our meal, 745 the place was filling up. 

The egg sandwich was great. Fresh light and delicious. However as mentioned by others the real star is the fruit. You get a generous portion of fresh fruit. All different kinds. Service is fast and friendly. 

In a touristy part of town but Def worth a visit.
author: Adam G.

description:
Great service, decent pricing, amazing quality food. The fresh fruit is AMAZING. 

Worth the wait.

5 stars for all of the above.
author: Nicole W.

description:
This was a very good café the line is really long most of the time but it moves very fast. Don't order too much food, because the tables are really small. The pancake was really light and airy. It was very good. The fruit was also very good, particularly the bananas. 

My table mates liked their crab meat Omelets and fruit and their dulche French toast. It's a bit annoying to sit outside because the people in line stare at you and the big busses honk a lot.

The servers were friendly. I would come back here but I would order less because of the small tables.

I wish I could give this 4.5 stars.
author: Olivia S.

description: Most average breakfast I have ever had. I asked for onions in my omelette they were raw and I was cringing at the taste. The service was terrible. I felt like they were rushing us out and brought the check halfway through our meal. The gluten free options are limited to omelette st hey don't have gluten free bread. Also on the expensive side for the quality of the food.
author: Mara T.

description: Breakfast was great but they took so long to bring my breakfast out and my egg Benedict was cold and also my hash brown was completely cold, other then that the food was really good .
author: Sal A.

description:
Wow!
Probably one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. Not only was the food good quality and an enormous quantity, by it tasted amazing and the servers were extremely well trained, proficient at their jobs and friendly.
I ordered the Vivien Leigh special and it was exactly as I had seen in pictures and tasted great. I also appreciate how they bring out each order as it is completed so that everything is the correct temperature and fresh.
I will definitely make a point to come back here for breakfast whenever I am in the area.
author: C K.

description: Don't miss this amazing stop!!!  Delicious food, great service.  We saw the positive reviews but were distracted by the seeming touristy name.  We would have missed out on a fabulous meal and the kindest servers.  You will be happy with a great experience!!
author: Mary S.

description: The food is delicious! There's usually a 20-30 minute wait to get a table BUT it's worth it! Service is very fast & everyone is nice & friendly! The portions are prefect!
author: Sandra C.

description:
Checked out this place earlier this morning since we were in the area. My husband got a recommendation from a friend/colleague from work who resides in the city. And, this place was so popular, after writing in your Name at the counter inside, there were lines out the door. 

Seating is limited considering the dining room inside wasn't big + there were limited seating outside as well. And, thank goodness for good weather because we got a table outside and with the sun we enjoyed our breakfast. 

From the Menu:

My husband got the Club sandwich that was stuffed with avocados and something else. He liked it, but said he tasted a hint of wasabi he didn't like.

Our kid got the Blueberry pancakes off of the kid's menu, which was topped with whipped cream + fresh blueberries and on the side, he had assorted sliced fruits of bananas, strawberries, blueberries, oranges and grapefruit, oh my. hehe

I had their Vegetarian Omelettes, which was a big portion I had to take home, but ate all my hash browns (big portion) + 2 wedges of oranges.

Our waitress brought out 4 bread with butter on a plate right before our meals came out.

I noticed how fast our orders came out from the time we got our orders taken by our waitress. 

Definitely a go to place if you haven't visited here yet and I will definitely be back if/when I'm in the city again.
author: Risa S.

description: Holy Fruit!! Went to Hollywood Cafe for a solo breakfast. Sat outside and ordered the Audrey Hepburn - do not order this or the Marilyn Monroe unless you really like fruit! It was absolutely delicious and the service was outstanding. My coffee cup was consistently filled and the food came out quick! My server was wonderful and even the busboy was friendly. Absolutely recommend!
author: Jill S.

description: Amazing!!!!! I had the turkey-avocado Benedict with a mimosa. My husband had a meat lover's omelet with a Bloody Mary.
