They both came with a HUGE side of hash browns that neither of us could finish. It was extremely fast, we hardly waited at all - even though the line outside scared me at first. I was a little skeptical given the hokey name/theme, but this place is wonderful!!! My husband keeps saying "great find!" And it definitely was!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Had a great brunch here this morning! We arrived around 8:30 on a Saturday morning and waited for around half hour to be seated. This staff is beyond efficient: every person I saw working the floor was checking on tables, taking orders, bussing tables and serving. The wait could have been much longer if the staff were any less efficient!

I got the dolce French toast, served with a mountain of fresh fruit and a fried banana. It was just like I remember my grandpa use to make. 

My mom got the bacon scramble and it had a half an avocado, bacon, and what can only be described as a quilt square of hash browns underneath. 

Word to the wise: Hollywood has browns come with bacon, veggies and cheese(but it's liquid cheese!!! Not my fav..) 

All around tasty breakfast with excellent service.
author: Kate S.

description: Very good breakfast restaurant. Tastes like home cooked. I ordered a dish that brought pancakes eggs bacon and a side of fruits. The fruits were fresh and delicious. The bacon was very good quality bacon not the thin greasy stuff you get everywhere else. My husband hada veggie omelette with hash browns and a side of toast. He really liked it as well plus they had orange marmalade on the table  which was great fir your toasts and coffee with free refills. Next time we're in SFO will come back for sure.
author: Karina S.

description: Delicious brunch!! Amazing quilliquillas and blueberry pancakes. Fresh squeezed OJ and great cup of coffee. Everything comes with a side if freshly baked sourdough bread. And you also get lots of fresh berries. The portions are  generous. You can definitely share a dish. And the prices are super fair. Definitely worth the visit and I will definitely be coming back.
author: Shelly P.

description: Amazing food and service!! Waiting in a long line but got seated within 15 minutes. Some of the best breakfast we've had in our lives.
author: Allison E.

description:
Tried 3 different things and they each were deliciousssssssss. 
All I remember though is my vanilla almond french toast that I will be dreaming about forever. #ilovefrenchtoast
author: Ali M.

description: Food was amazing! After reading all the comment's I had to come try it out. The place looked really nicely fashioned. Staff was helpful. And once again the food was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G
author: Michael O.

description: This place was ok! It wasn't anything spectacular, and I probably wouldn't make a trip to go again, considering I would like to try a long list of other places in SF. I had a breakfast burrito, which was not bad, but not amazing. I really don't have much to say about it. The service was fine, the space was pretty small, but fine. Everything was just fine.
author: H K.

description: Crab omelette with nice chucks of crab and avocado, well cooked hash browns, and a little fruit tease.  Good choice after leaving a job fair that was a little disappointing.
author: Ronald B.

description: Very nice place and reasonable prices considering the size of the portions. The kitchen is open and as we passed it, the sight of food waiting for servers cheers your appetite pretty quickly. The coffee was good, and servers arrived to refill or top off frequently. Service was attentive and responsive, cheerful and sweet.
author: Monica A.

description: I ordered the Jr IV which is a chocolate chip pancake with scrambled eggs and fresh fruit. Not much to expect but it was surprisingly one of the best breakfasts I ever had. Pancakes were the fluffiest topped with whipped cream and incorporated with decadent chocolate chips. Simple, easy breakfast for $6 on the kids section because I wanted to save money.
author: Tim T.

description: Pressed for time & unable to wait in line for Mama's, we stumbled upon this place & I'm super glad we did!  The crab omelet was loaded with tons of crab& avocado. The portions are huge and everything is reasonably priced.  Service was extremely prompt and friendly. We were sat right away and our food was out within 10 minutes.  They have cute little bistro tables out front on the sidewalk if you'd like to sit outside. I'd go out of my way to come back here whenever I'm in the city again!
author: Lauren N.

description:
We passed this place a couple of mornings and there were long lines waiting to get a table.  They have a few tables outside and the dishes they were eating looked pretty tasty...sorry for staring folks.

When we got back from visiting Alcatraz, we were starving and there were no lines as they were probably 15 minutes from closing time (which is at 1:45pm...kind of an odd time).  I ordered the cheese burger which comes on a brioche buns.  Holy Moly...that big burger was mighty tasty!  It comes with fries or salad...I had the salad and it had greens and fresh fruit on it.  Now I understand why they have a long line to get in.  

This place is a pleasant surprise since there's some pretty crappy places to eat around fisherman's wharf.
author: Janey A.

description: Based on the Yelp reviews for the area, my family and I decided to give the Hollywood Cafe a shot which turned out to be a great decision. I ordered the Denver omelet which was delicious with fresh ingredients and sliced sourdough for the toast in true San Fran style. My son had the kids chocolate chip pancake and said it was the best he has had. My wife's French toast was served with a huge bowl of ripe delicious fruit of multiple varieties. Lastly one of my favorite things was the fresh squeezed oj which was so delicious. I would highly recommend this place for all your breakfast and brunch needs!!!
author: Allen A.

description:
This place is awesome!!! Came here because it is close to our hotel and had really good rating. I now know why. 

It is a small place and when we went there there was a pretty big line waiting to be seated. The hostess said it would be 15 to 20 min wait. I did not believe her, but true to her word we were seated in less then 20 min, Wow. Then we ordered our food and found that they are super fast there, because we got our food in no time. Normally a place that fast cooking the food is not going to be that fresh or good, but again I was wrong. There food was delicious and perfectly cook. We were in and out and on our way to for a day of sight seeing
author: Bobby W.

description: Absolutely delicious. You have to try the sweet bacon and Hollywood style hash browns. The staff is extremely attentive and a definite two thumbs up in my book.
author: Jay F.

description: Good breakfast. Best waiter/busboy Nelson very professional and kind. Julia waitress greeted with a smile. Very kind. The lady waitress's leaves a lot to be desire.
author: Serg L.

description: The breakfast was excellent. My family of four waited 30 minutes to be seated on a Saturday around 9:00AM. The service was very good and fast. The only negative is the bathroom. Avoid going to the bathroom at all cost! It is located outside the restaurant and it is in very bad shape. Overall the restaurant exceeded my expectations in the quality of food. After we left there were at least 20 people waiting outside. It is a very small place, but they serve very quickly so I would say is worth the wait.
author: Mayelyn B.

description: Definitely worth the wait.  One of the best breakfast places I've ever been.  The service was outstanding and the food was even better.  Try the chilaquiles, Hollywood hash and the sweet bacon.
author: Jeff C.

description: French toast and crab eggs Benedict were fabulous! The portions are HUGE, especially the fresh fruit servings. My husband  could not even finish the crab eggs Benedict there was so much crab. We got there around 11/30 and had about a 20 min wait. The wait staff was friendly too.
author: Laura L.

description: Awesome place for breakfast or brunch. the misses had the classic eggs and sausage combo, mother-in-law had the french toast and  I had the eggs Benedict. The hash browns came without the usual soggyness you would get from ihop or Denny's. A bit pricey but worth it!!
author: J M.

description:
You'd think a restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf would be super touristy and therefore the food would be just mediocre but this place was great and lived up to all the positive reviews! Also happened to be right across the street from where we were staying so that was a huge bonus too!

The portions are huge. They start you off with giant pieces of toasted sourdough bread with butter. I had the Marilyn Monroe - just right French Toast with plenty of syrup to pour on. Plus there's a giant fruit bowl and it is good - strawberries, blueberries, sliced bananas, kiwi, raspberries, pineapple, canteloupe, honeydew, blackberries, oranges and apple slices, yes, it had everything! 

Friends ordered the Kimchi Egg Benny which was equally large and really good. Others had the omelette which is definitely shareable, I can't even imagine how many eggs were used! 

Coffee and hot water for tea was always being refilled without being asked and the service was quick and friendly!
author: Mel L.

description: My favorite place for Sunday brunch. They use the freshest ingredients, and everything I ordered was very yummy!
author: Zifang H.

description:
Just smell the burning rubber as the wait staff rushes by to meet demand.  And they were doing a great job.  Long lines along the sidewalk and its worth it.   Its great for the tourists and good enough for the locals. 

Everyone at my table ordered eggs a different way.  I would thought for sure the orders would get mixed up but nope.  Like the rapture, I was proven wrong again.  My sunny side up eggs were perfect.   Over easy medium, over easy well done, scrambled, all was good.  Best part was the crispy hash browns that covered the whole plate and then some.   I mean just look at the pictures.  They will make your eyes pop out.   And none too greasy.  

On top of that every plate had some fresh fruit.  Coffee kept coming.  And the heaters kept us toasty warm on the sidewalk.
author: Marcus K.

description:
We stayed in Fisherman's Wharf and found this to be the best spot. 

Recommend:
Crab omelet
Chicken sausage omelet
Healthy plate
Hash browns

Prices for the area are excellent. 

Staff is super friendly. 

We stayed in San Fran for 5 days and had breakfast there twice. 

Cons: none...honestly
author: Ashley F.

description: Absolutely blown away by this breakfast/lunch joint! The portions are MASSIVE... The food was so good we came back the next morning & ate there again! The most impressive fruit bowl I've ever seen... It is literally overflowing with delicious, sweet, ripe fruit! The service is fantastic too. The food comes out quickly & is out of this world. Definitely worth the wait if there is one.
author: Kelsey C.

description: Best place to go for a quality breakfast! I hate to sound cheesy but I just get the feeling of warmth and happiness when I go here. Amazing eggs, sizzling soft bacon, and savory fresh fruit! What's not to love?
author: Michelle T.

description:
Every time my friends visit SF, Hollywood cafe is always the one of stops in my list to eat.
I went yesterday and my friends review were filled with: amazing/ omg that fruit bowl/ large portion/ cheap in the city....all I do is smile smile  :)
Recommend starlet series brunches- won't let you down!
author: Tseng J.

description:
Very close to the Best Western Tuscan hotel.
Very good coffee and hot cocoa.
Food was not bad at all. 
Nice and comfortable place for having breakfast.
Friendly people.
Prices were just good, not too expensive.
author: Sarah V.

description: I got the Marilyn Monroe - french toast with fresh fruit. The French Toast was good; nothing to rave about. The fresh fruit is what made the meal. You get a ton and large variety - berries, melon, grapefruit, pineapple, grapes, etc. It was all delicious. The place is small so get there early or be prepared to wait.  I walked in at 715 and it was already 3/4 full.
author: Morgan R.

description: Came here for some good breakfast and they didn't let me down. It was so much to choose from, I'm going back tomorrow to try something else and the day after that too. Not only is the food great but the customer service is great as well...
author: Donald C.

description: My dad and I were in San Francisco this past week. Before the trip, I made a list of different places we could go for breakfast. We ended up going to the Hollywood Cafe every day that we were there. We LOVED it! The food was fantastic! Some of our favorites were the eggs benedict and the meat lovers omelet. Also, the amount of fruit that you get with each order is amazing! We got at least 6 different fruits each day. The service was phenomenal. They were rather crowded each day that we were there, but we only had to wait once. If I ever find myself in San Francisco again, I will definitely come back the Hollywood Cafe.
author: Teegan M.

description:
My boyfriend and I visited this restaurant after wandering around the Fisherman's Wharf area looking for something brunch-y. 

I was starving, so I proceeded to order as much food as possible. Luckily, it was fantastic. I decided on the eggs benedict with mozzarella and prosciutto which comes with a side of hash browns. I waffled for a few minutes on if I wanted to upgrade the potatoes to their "Hollywood hash browns" and went for it. Soooo worth it. 

Definitely stop by this place if you're in the area.
author: Becca S.

description:
DISGUSTING. Do not come here.

We were really excited about this place after looking at all the good reviews. Damn... What a HUGE letdown.

Eggs Benedict: gross. Seriously disgusting, both taste and texture
Hashbrown: decent at best
Smoked turkey: gross. Clearly some cheap thick cuts of smoked turkey
Hollandaise: Gross 
Chicken Sausages: worst sausages we'd ever had
Scrambled eggs: yolky, heavy and overcooked
French toast: Imagine a moist, flavorful and delicious French toast. Well this one is the opposite: dry, bland and absolutely not worth any good review

Worst breakfast I've ever had. 

The service is "good". They refill your coffee every 5 minutes which is nice.

The fruits are very good but I mean I can go to a grocery store if I want good fruits.

I didn't think breakfast could be gross until I came here.

Why do people come here and wait for this? No idea.

Actually why would they come at all..
author: Antoine C.

description: Delicious breakfast and generous portions ! We will come back for sure next time in San Francisco
author: Alicia G.

description: Wondering where to get warm and have breakfast after your early adventure  securing Alcatraz tickets. This is the place. Wonderful breakfast. Big selection of items all with great preparation... Customers seemed very happy and we certainly were!The side of mIxed fruit was a bowl of about 10 fruits, all perfectly ripened, delicious and more than one person could eat. Latte was divine. Lots of eggs dishes and pancakes. Highly recommend.
author: Louise P.

description: Best breakfast I've had in SF since we've been here! The B.A.D. was so delish snd their sourdough toast was to die for! Get there early to avoid lines but if you find yourself waiting; it'll be worth it!
author: Jason T.

description: After seeing it on DD&D, it was a must. The Hollywood hash browns were amazing. The portions are large with fresh ingredients. It was a hit across the board with personal service & amazing food. A true gem for grub!!
author: Cleve A.

description: Awesome place to have brunch. I got the teriyaki chicken burger with blueberrie pancakes. I loved the pancakes and the burger could have used a little more flavor. My favorite part without a doubt were the French fries. Really crunchy and flavorful. My girlfriend got the eggs Benedict and she had no complaints.
author: Jonathan C.

description: I'd give this place 3.5 stars, but It leaned more towards 4 than 3, so there ya go. Expect to wait on a weekend morning because they stay pretty busy. Your first inclination when asked if you want to wait for outside, inside, or first available, may be "first available", but it's pretty uncomfortable to sit outside with a big line of people 2 feet away eyeballing your food and willing you to eat faster and leave. I wasn't crazy about the rancheros I ordered, but it was certainly superior to what you would get at a greasy spoon diner or chain breakfast place. I'd eat there again, but it's not a "must" for return visits to San Fran.
author: Shelley S.

description: Great place to eat breakfast,  The wait might be a little long, but worth it.  The fruit the serve is very fresh and in large portions.  The egg platters are sizeable and very well done, as it the French toast.  Definitely better than I thought it would be, given the number of tourist that frequent the location.
author: Kevin W.

description: The wait is well worth it. Crab omelette was just superb. I wish they had some curtains or blinds outside because if the sun is out and you're eating outside you will get sunburnt. Other than that, service is great and so is food. It's a must in SF.
author: Yamel F.

description: Great spot for breakfast in San Francisco, highly recommend! Amazing selection of delicious breakfast and lunch foods. I ordered the B.A.T. omelette and was not disappointed!
author: Samantha S.

description: The food here is fantastic and totally worth the wait! Customer service and super small atmosphere weren't my favorite.
author: Alexandria M.

description: Delicious Breakfast! My family and I dropped by this location before heading out to our Alcatraz tour! (-8 We all enjoyed our meals! Will definitely return soon!!
author: Claudia R.

description: Small establishment but good breakfast if you are close to wharf. I had the pancake combo with chicken sausage which was very good. About 10 min wait time at 845 am on a Thursday
author: Scott H.

description: The best breakfast in Fisherman's Wharf. You can wait in line for an hour for Momma's or you can go here instead. Huge plates of delicious omelettes and hashbrowns, fresh fruit and orange juice and homemade preserves on every table. Worth every penny! The staff was lively and friendly and I wish I had this place at home. I'd eat there every day.
author: Troy B.

description: Food is excellent at this popular place.   We had to sit outside, but the heaters worked nicely.  Service is fast which was great for us.  Everyone enjoyed their breakfast, it was pricier than we expected.
author: Tara C.

description: This place was great !! Went on a busy morning and had an Audrey Hepburn . The pancakes were delicious, the fruit was fresh and sweet. Highly Recommend . They even have an outdoor heater for the chilly mornings.
author: Amanda T.

description: Long lines but worth it! Love their generous fruit sides. Waitresses are fast, friendly, and efficient.
author: F M.

description:
We flew in from Dallas just to eat here...   Just saying...

However....  Gnat's  everywhere!  Guard your food and drink!
author: Chuck L.

description:
The food: The food was delicious! I split the french toast and crab eggs benedict with my cousin. The crab was AMAZING and fresh. The french toast was nothing special, but of course nothing was wrong with it either. I probably could have gone without it. But the portions of fresh fruit that they give you makes it worth ordering! The hashbrowns are also not like anything I've ever tried before because of the crispy-ness, but I love it! 

The wait: It was only about 30 min on a Sunday around 12. Can't complain too much considering it was freezing outside so we wanted to wait a little longer and sit inside. 

The service: Very attentive! Food came out super fast and you can tell the waiters and waitresses work very hard. 

Basically, if you're looking for a good brunch place in the city, but don't want that whole fancy shmancy feel then this is an amazing place to try out!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
We came here Sunday with a party of 6 for breakfast. We made sure to come early to put our names on the list so we could all get seated just as soon as everyone in our party had arrived. 

The service was fast and friendly even when this place was busy, busy! 

The food came quick and was plated very nicely. We had the crab omelette, crab benedict, denver omelette, original benedict, rancheros, and dolce french toast. While everything was plated very nicely and things tasted good, a couple improvements that we would like to see are better food temp (all our plates were served warm, not hot!) and higher quality crab. Portion sizes were great and fruit is yummy. 

We will be back!
author: Vanessa S.

description: Fabulous! I had the French toast with fruit. Beautifully presented and so delicious. The fruit was perfectly ripe seasonal fruit. French toast was tasty! They also have different French toast flavors that sounded interesting.   The service was fast and friendly and they were nice to a homeless person.  We're going back again it was so good.
author: Shannon T.

description: This place was so tasty and the portions are great. Almost every table took a doggy bag home. Hashbrowns are meh, but literally everything else was fire!
author: Laura Pepe B.

description: The portion are huge, the price is very reasonable, the food is pretty good. I loved the creamy tomato soup, it was fresh and tasty came with some bread.  My friend had the club; came with fries and some fruit.   She said it was good and was pretty big too.  All of plates that I saw on the other table were huge too!! Wish I could have tried some other stuff but did not want to over eat.
author: Norma P.

description: Amazing!!!The wait is worth it. We got pancake combos. From the fresh fruit to the perfectly cooked bacon everything was done to perfection. You can't miss this fisherman wharf gem.
author: Zachary F.

description:
If you're looking for an awesome breakfast or lunch near Fisherman's wharf, don't waste your time at the overpriced tourist spots on the wharf. Hollywood cafe is where it's at!

I went for lunch with my family close to closing time, and even then the place was jam packed - they kept taking as many customers as the could until the last minute too. 

Everything on the menu sounded delicious, which made it hard to decide on one thing but I settled for a chicken sandwich. It did take some time for the food to come out, but I can understand because they were so busy. Even though the food took some time, the service was great. The servers came to our table often to see if we needed coffee refills, and they brought us sourdough bread with butter as appetizers. (I believe the bread came with the salads, but since three people in our party ordered salads, we all decided to share the bread). 

When the food came out, man we were all starving, which made the food taste that much better. The bread of my sandwich was a little wet - not soggy though - because the juices from the sandwich were seeping out, but it wasn't wet enough to make the sandwich unpleasant. The chicken was grilled and seasoned to perfection. And the rest of the stuff in the sandwich was just icing on the cake. I chose to have my sandwich with a salad instead of fries, which had a very interesting, and again delicious, dressing - I think it was ginger based. 

It makes me sad that we only discovered the place on the last day of our trip but I know for sure that Hollywood cafe will be on my to-visit list the next time I visit SF again.
author: Julian B.

description: The wait was about 20 minutes on a Friday morning. The menu has some interesting and delicious meals... I went with the Healthy Plate, which had 2 egg whites with lots of fruits and veggies. Their side of fruit is HUGE and so delicious! Would definitely come here again if in the area.
author: Rachel M.

description: Was a great small cafe. Service was timely albeit not the best I've ever had. Food was exceptional. I ordered the Hash-Burrito, which is a very unique breakfast burrito. It has creamy wasabi in it which gives it a nice but different kind of kick.
author: Nino S.

description: Good breakfast spot in SF! Had about a 30 minute wait in line but you can have coffee while you wait. Fresh fruit was delicious. CAS omelette was not as good as I expected but still acceptable. Sweet bacon had an interesting flavor not sure it was worth the extra charge. Service was really good. Chai latte was also good. Overall it was a good place.
author: Conchita L.

description:
Get here early if you want to eat or be prepared to wait in line! We got here at 7:45am and by the time we left around 8:45am there was a line forming. 
Delicious food, great service, would definitely go back!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Excellent breakfast choice in the mid range of prices when you don't want to wait 1.5 hours to eat at Mama's.  We had a great meal and only waited 15 minutes for a table for two at 9:00 am on a Sunday. 

Pros:  The breakfast choices are vast from basic eggs and bacon to fancy seafood benedicts.  They also have numerous pancake and french toast options as well as vegetarian choices and fresh fruit.  The food all had solid flavor, was quality and preparation was rather high.  The service and food prep is also quite fast.

Cons: We were told that the orange juice wash fresh-squeezed (and they charge fresh squeeze prices) but it was definitely not fresh-squeezed.  Frankly it was watered down and almost gross.  The coffee is also more like typical dive diner coffee.
author: Zack B.

description:
Yep. All the 5 star reviews here say it well. I will just share that I had a ridiculously awesome fresh & real egg, cheese and ham sandwich on a specially toasted sourdough baguette. The masterpiece breakfast sandwich was delivered within minutes, even while the place was jumping with a line of people hawking for a table. 

The amazing taste of fresh quality and natural, unadulterated ingredients was a rare treat for such a concoction that I often attempt elsewhere with much less success. Further proof of the quality food was that after eating this delicious giant sandwich, I did not have the regretful feeling I just committed a horrible sin. This was further confirmed because my body felt happy and content and had no after effects sometimes associated with lesser quality ingredients. Possibly the best traditional breakfast food within a casual setting in San Fransisco, if not California.
author: Brian A.

description: Long lines at least on weekend but they move you through pretty fast.  Great food and service no WiFi
author: Daryl T.

description:
If the consistent 5 star reviews weren't enough for you and you insist on reading a review on this joint, I'm happy to appease.

Holy food! I've never seen so much for breakfast/brunch since I stayed at an all-inclusive in Mexico. Run, don't walk over to this place. A couple of fyi's... they don't take reservations. There will be a wait, there are no public potty's. And, it's a small spot, a few tables on the street as well. 

If you have 3 people, order 2 plates. There will be PLENTY and possibly enough to take some home after that. The hash browns are off the chain and enough to feed a small South African country on one plate. 

Wait time no longer. Just go!
author: Gina B.

description:
HUGE Portions, reasonable priced, and everything was yummy!  It's not the absolute best breakfast that I've had thus the 4 stars but it's really good...

It's worth the wait and the lines move fast...go for a walk around the block and you're set...Enjoy!!!
author: Jorge C.

description:
I will start this review by saying that I did enjoy the atmosphere of Hollywood Cafe. I loved the cramped space and the outdoor tables. Here is a restaurant that took it's limitations and ran with them. I felt like I was back in Paris ordering from a crowded street side cafe. I loved the quippy names for the specials and I liked the photographs of the famous Hollywood stars scattered on the walls. 

What I didn't love were the pancakes. I feel like I'm constantly disappointed by pancakes. For such a simple meal they're never really down right. Or at least to my pancake standards (sorry for the food snobbery but I work at a restaurant with hands down the best pancakes around). For me, the perfect pancake is crispy on the outside while being cooked through and fluffy. It comes down to the batter, and if the chef has not over mixed the poor thing to death. The batter was alright but lacked the fluffy yet crispy texture that I believe makes up the perfect pancake. It was a bit more chewy than I would have liked. Don't get me wrong they were still great pancakes and worth ordering, but I wish they were lighter/fluffier. Also, they mean business at the Hollywood Cafe when you order the fruit cup. Piled high with seasonal fruits, it's the perfect compliment to their pancakes.
author: Sarah M.

description: Great little (very little) restaurant.   We ate outside.   Try not to do that if you can help it. The people waiting in line to get a table stand right in front of you. Tour buses park on the road and the fumes are pretty bad. The food is great. I was not fond of the special bacon. I like crisp bacon and the sauce makes it very limp. The French toast was great and don't miss the fruit salad. It's very fresh and contains berries, citrus and melon. Don't order the maple syrup for the extra 1.50,  it tastes just like standard syrup just a little less corn syrup.  Coffee was good just don't expect a refill. The staff are really busy but very polite.
author: Renee H.

description:
Best find during our San Fran trip- thanks yelp!  The portions here are HUGE and the good is fantastic. The menu options on the front if the menu are amazing and come with huge portions of fruit. 

This place is small so I recommend going early, which wasn't a problem for us since we were still functioning on east coast time. 

Amazing restaurant!
author: Erin H.

description:
When you come to the fisherman's wharf, you have got to come try the hollywood cafe. 

I had the omelette..i forgot the name but it had the most meat....with bacon...i mean...how can you go wrong with bacon. I definitely recall this was one of the best omelette I ever had in my entire life on his blue planet. It was soft and fluffy, everything about that omelette just makes waking up and getting there super early that much worth it.

Friendly inviting service from the staff, I can see how this place can withstand the test of time and continue to provide such quality service to san francisconians.

ps. when you order hot tea, you are given a choice of tea bags to choose from. This is probably one of the best breakfast spots I will ever go to. 

would love to come back if I was in the area for some breakfast grub.
author: Ji T.

description:
Three wedges vanilla french toast. Three wedges vanilla french toast. Three wedges vanilla french toast!

Enough said! The best breakfast and brunch place I have experienced so far in San Francisco. Everything including the burgers, french toasts, coffee, tea, pancakes were excellent!
author: Nitish S.

description:
If your not from San Francisco this will be OK. 

If this is your town, why are you coming to Disneyland? We have over 5,000 places to eat, some of them the best on earth.

I had the crab omelette and it had no flavor. The crab was at least 48 hrs in the refrigerator and although it didn't make me sick I didn't finish the entire thing. 

There is less than a 1% chance I will ever return.

If your visiting on a Saturday morning, go the the Ferry Building Farmers Market. It's amazing. Take the F Market Street car.
author: Justin S.

description: Going up on a Tuesday..... Seriously though, came here for breakfast today and it was delicious. I had a classic egg with bacon and the Hollywood hash browns. The bacon was super thick, yummy and cooked perfectly. We also had the crab omelet which was loaded with lots of fresh crab and avocado. Would definitely come back here.
author: Gina S.

description: Absolutely delicious, huge servings, and heated outdoor seating.  Fresh fruit was the bomb!
author: Todd C.

description:
Very good! I like this place. I knew that brunch in SF would involve a line but it moved really fast and I think the servers move fast.

I got the vanilla banana french toast ( 3 wedges) and plenty of fruit. It was tasty and well made. I definitely enjoyed it and finished it all. My boyfriend got the Denver omelet and I will definitely try that next time! Its a big omelet with everything in it and a SHEET of hash brown. Every brunch place has a unique way of making their hash browns and I really like their way. In addition, there was three slices of bread ( sour dough?) with warm butter. I stole some of his bread and it was FANTASTIC. The omelet is like 2.5 dollars more but it definitely has more food. I intend to get it next time.

We will be coming back next time. 

PS. Trip Advisor gave this place a certificate lol so expect a good amount of the demographic to be tourists (this place is still good and not too expensive!).
author: Eileen W.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST/brunch Ever!!!
My boys and I (11&14 and hungry)  ate here before we hopped a bus to Muir Woods. The amount of beautiful food was CRAZY and exceptional!    

If you're going on the Muir Woods tour get there an hour before departure and you will get seated and fed easily. If not the stress of being late for your bus could take away from the experience.
author: Joan S.

description: Everything here is amazing! Get there early to skip the long wait. Their fruit cup is full of berries and a huge portion. I recommend the vanilla French toast. Don't come here and just get the traditional eggs.
author: Kelsey F.

description:
Amazing breakfast. Huge portions. There's usually a huge line/wait, but the food is worth it. 

The fresh fruit is yummy, sausages amazing, Hollywood hash browns weren't my favorite, I might get regular ones next time around. 

BUT the service is pretty terrible. I was so disappointed.
author: Yolanda R.

description:
AMAZING. We came to San Francisco for 7 days and we've been here 3 times for brunch already. Everything is delicious. They would serve SO MUCH fruit it's unbelievable, soooo so good. 
Also, great service, really kind people. 
Highly recommend this cafe.
author: Maria A.

description:
Highly recommend.  I had breakfast here my first day in San Francisco, and none of the other breakfast places I tried during my trip could measure up to the amazing breakfast I had here.

The golden crunchy hashbrowns were perfectly cooked and seasoned.  They were absolutely delicious.  The poached eggs were perfectly executed.  My husband's scrambler was packed with flavor and delicious goodies.  The avocado on top was a great touch.  Our meals were also garnished with fresh fruit which was a nice treat.

The outdoor seating was great for people watching, and the overhead heaters kept us comfortable on a chilly morning.

The service was good too. Our coffee and water glasses were refilled frequently.
author: Kelly F.

description: Holy food heaven! This place is wonderful for a good start to the day.  We waited in line for 20-25 minutes, but WELL worth it.  They portion sizes of food are HUGE; might want to split.  The fruit bowls are large as well, and you cannot go wrong with a mimosa.
author: Ashley R.

description: This is the most awesome breakfast diner that I've ever been to. The amount of fruits served is amazing.
author: Marek W.

description: This place is a hidden gem! Everything here is SUPER fresh. No, it's not the most aesthetically pleasing place but the food is AMAZING. The best thing I feel like I ate during my trip to San Francisco was the Salmon Eggs Benedict. PLEASE try it. You will not regret it!
author: Khizra S.

description: Food was ok.  We had the salmon benedict and the dungeness crab benedict.  Both were pretty good, but I have had much better eggs benedict (for instance Whistle Britches in Dallas Texas - now they make a benedict to write home about).  Biggest complaint is that they accidentally delivered our food to the couple at the table next to us.  Although the guy had ordered the salmon benedict,  the girl did not order the crab benedict and so sent it back.  She recognized that it was not what she ordered before actually taking a bite.  So, they took it back to the kitchen and sat it on the counter until they got another salmon benedict ready.  Then they proceeded to deliver it to me.  Kinda gross really.  They should have discarded it and made me another one rather than giving me that one.  I complained about it so they did make me a fresh one.  Other than that, they tasted just fine but nothing ground shattering.  So, I'd give a 3 for the food and a 1 for the service --- Average 2 stars.
author: Buddy F.

description: We love this place!  We stayed at the hotel near by and went to Hollywood Cafe for breakfast and it was so good we went back the next day.  Portion is huge and fresh ingredients.  Service is very nice too.  We would go back again next time we are in SF.
author: Viranya F.

description: Wonderful food, unique combinations. I had an omelette with crab, avocado and cheese. Fantastic hash browns. Sour dough bread is on every table. If your dish comes with fruit or you substitute fruit for potatoes, you get a bowl of fresh mixed fruit that overflows over a third of your plate!  There will likely be a  died wait and it is well worth it!
author: Gail S.

description:
Great Breakfast
Really big portions 
Omelette was perfect
Fruit was fantastic 
Raspberry jelly to die for
author: Dale T.

description: Breakfast was great.  Lots of fresh fruit.  Little bit of a wait since we went there at 9am on a Saturday...but worth it.
author: Matthew V.

description: Great food and service. The line to get in was a bit long,  but moved quickly.
author: Theresa A.

description: Awesome breakfast and lunch. Most breakfast dishes come with an amazing fruit cup the size and variety of which you have likely never seen at a restaurant. The dishes taste great, will fill you up most of the day, and are fairly inexpensive by downtown SF standards. I hit this place at least once every time that I am in SF. I wouldn't have it any other way.
author: Andrew C.

description: A breakfast legend that lives up to the hype. Wait time at around 0900 on Thursday was about fifteen minutes. The crab and avocado omelet is easily enough for two very greedy but discerning diners.
author: Karen B.

description:
Came back again
Shouldnt have gave five stars cuz this place is packed. Yikes. Food still good and great value
author: L C.

description:
This place offers really good as well as healthy breakfasts. We were attracted by the queue of people waiting outside. It's really worth the wait, give this place a try if your nearby!

I had the Vivian Leigh bfast twice and one time I opted for the Healthy Plate.  The Vivian Leigh (with the croissant) was my favorite, more american style eggs and bacon, the Healthy Plate is probably more healthy (only eggs-white and more vegetables) but I didn't like it as much.  Off course this is just my personal opinion and tastes differ.

The best thing about this place is their fruit bowl so be sure to pick an item from the menu that comes with the fruit bowl, it is amazing!
author: Kris C.

description: Best breakfast we had in SF. I got the French toast and it was incredible. The fruit here is also awesome, normal stuff not just cantaloupe like most restaurants haha. Definitely a very small place but we got there right when they opened and didn't have to wait but it was already almost full.
author: Katie B.

description: Loved it!! Def worth the wait. The coffee was great. I had blueberry pancakes with eggs and bacon. My husband had French toast orange marmalade. The servings are generous and I've never been served so much fruit without it being an extra price.
author: Kathy O.

description: The food was excellent...I had the crab omelet. The part I didn't like is that if you are standing in line and your whole party is not present, they won't seat you and won't allow the missing people in your party to order. The waitress claimed that they place the order for the entire table and don't allow to add on. So strange.
author: Lucie P.

description: After being disappointed at Mama's the day before we  decided to try Hollywood's. Wow! The food was excellent, the portion sizes were huge, and the fruit fresh and perfect. Prices were reasonable and the service great.
author: Brian K.

description:
Fast service and great food. An awesome breakfast place when you are in a hurry. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and delicious. 

We had a great time and enjoyed the food and the service. We will be coming back tomorrow most likely.
author: Mae W.

description:
This place was a stop for our family while we were in the city last week for breakfast. They had a wait but they turn around quick. Really impressive. 

The fruit is amazing. Seriously made my day. I ordered a fruit plate for our kids as a side to their pancakes, eggs and bacon but all their plates came with a large amount of fruit unbeknownst to me. The fruit plate really isn't necessary unless you really like fruit. Like really. 

The pancakes are delicious but their french toast is even better. Order the Hollywood hash browns. You will thank me.
author: Kate L.

description:
As we walked up and saw the line, we almost just kept walking but decided to wait it out.  Surprisingly, we only waited about 10 minutes for a table for 6- probably due to the impressive speed of service we would later receive.

All of the food was very good, with the fresh fruit being the highlight.  It is so nice to be served such a variety of fresh quality fruit, that alone almost gets 5 starts.  Fortunately, all of the food is good and the service quick and friendly.  

Believe the hype, this place is great!
author: James J.

description: Pretty delicious food! I just thought the bacon was a little too fatty and chewy for my liking. We got there at 8:30am, and there was already a line outside. There's not a lot of space for seating, and you sit extremely close to other people. The staff was very friendly though.
author: NericePhotography L.

description: BEST BREAKFAST JOINT IN SF! If you are looking for a good, reasonable in price, excellent-efficient service and awesome food, make sure you stop by this restaurant!
author: Juan H.

description:
Outstanding fresh fruit and yogurt for breakfast with sourdough toast
Also the Orangish French toast was awesome . It's dipped in orange grand mariner  batter
author: P S.

description: The food arrived cold and it was ok but nothing more than that. Maybe coming from Austin I'm used to a differnet kind of nice but the service wasn't pleasant.
author: Reut Z.

description: The crab omelet was amazing (and huge)! Full of dungeness crab and avocado, it easily filled me up.  Be sure to get the hash-browns "Hollywood Style" with bacon, peppers, and onions on top.  You will not be disappointed in this All-American breakfast!
author: Rob R.

description:
Fruit loops.

Not good for you: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Froot_Loops

Very good for you: Two egg whites scrambled with tomato, roasted beets and bell pepper alongside an English muffin and massive side of fruit.

Raspberries, pineapple, bananas, apples, blueberries, grapes, oranges, watermelon and strawberry. Perhaps it was all this with a side of eggs.

Either way outstanding and filling enough to be two meals for $12.  Probably didn't need the oil glazed chicken apple sausage. Americano was forgettable.

Decided to return for lunch and was rewarded with an excellent grilled chicken sandwich with homemade teriyaki sauce on ciabatta. Side of greens too.

Planned to have half and finish the rest later. Soon both were gone. Reasonable $11.

Each visit was packed yet run efficiently as there was not much time between ordering and devouring. Unpretentious diner vibe throughout.

Much to enjoy. Just be sure to save room for the fruit.
author: Jason B.

description: I enjoyed a  wonderful crab Benedict. They also have great bread with custom jam. Outside seating on a beautiful San Francisco morning.
author: Michael P.

description:
Expect a heavy wait line but it's totally worth it. The service is fast and friendly and the crowd knows it's a rat race to get in. 

The food is amazing. As you wait, you change your mind on what you want to each as a new dish being served is calling your name. 

I stuck to the classic eggs Benedict and my mind, body and soul we're thankful. My hubby ordered the French toast combo and neither one of us spoke--we just ate in heavenly peace. 

Come here for great food from a highly efficient staff.
author: Nando R.

description: This cafe is in the middle of the tourist part food town and is always busy because of it's amazing food. I recommend coming here to get a large breakfast and great service!
author: Mariah V.

description: Cablecar operator recommended this place for breakfast. Not at all disappointed. Fluffy pancakes. Side if bacon came with five strips. But beware... The Hollywood hashbrowns are not a small side.  Plenty of leftovers to give to one of the homeless on your way down to the wharf.  Fast, friendly service. The restroom situation is weird but so is it everywhere in SF.
author: Kendra M.

description: Absolutely perfect breakfast. We had to sit outside which I thought would be a deal breaker, but other than a little road noise from passing busses, it was perfect. I had the hash burrito and the wife had French toast and everything was super flavorful and prepared quickly.
author: Adam G.

description: This place is my absolute favorite breakfast place to come when I visit San Francisco. The staff is so friendly which I think is an important factor when choosing a place to eat. There portion size and quality of food is exceptional,  in comparison to any other breakfast spot in the area. You know a place is worth it when you constantly have a line of people waiting to get in.
author: amy s.

description: From my stay in San Fran, it was by far the best breakfast I had tried there, or even ever! The wait is definitely worth it as the food is just fab! I had the French toast and my mum had the crab omelette and both meals were absolutely delicious! It's obvious that they use fresh produce. The service was good too and it was definitely cheap for what they give you! Still remembering the time I went there and I would definitely go back!
author: Anastassia D.

description: Awesome food! The price isn't bad for being in sf and the portions are at least twice the size of any other breakfast spot I've been to in sf . The only downfall is it's almost impossible to eat if you go On a weekend,my husband and I took our daughter there during the week and there was no wait and we got our food super fast but when he went to take our daughter back on the weekend he said the line was around the building so they had to leave
author: Amber C.

description: Great brunch spot.Amazing omelettes with fruit bowls are must trys...
author: Ekin O.

description: Live this place!  Skip the long line at Mamas and enjoy awesome French toast and pancakes with fresh fruit.  And the staff is amazing!!
author: Russell C.

description: All of the servers worked together to be as efficient as they could. We ordered the Hawaiian omelet and French toast combo. Everything tasted great. The fruit was fresh, the sourdough bread delicious, and my omelet was also great. They make the bacon very crispy so be sure to ask for softer bacon if you don't like that. Prices were reasonable and portions were large.
author: Tara R.

description: Had the Vivien Leigh, scrambled eggs on a croissant with a very big dish of fresh fruit, lovely meal.  Would highly recommend this place, fast, friendly staff and nice atmosphere.
author: Andrew C.

description: The food is AMAZING. The proportions are really big and they are very generous with the fruit. Definitely a must go to.
author: M S.

description:
A small breakfast spot that usually has a line out front...but not much else...except a lot of fruit.

This is one of those places where I am not fully convinced of its rating just yet. There may have been a special dish I should have ordered or something, because my order was a typical breakfast and not much else. I ordered the meat lovers omelet, which came with a lot of hash browns and some toast. Both taste and presentation were basic. Something I could have had at home. Not a must have in my opinion. The other dishes my party had ordered were standard plates as well. Some of their dishes came with a whole lot of fruit.

If I get another chance to try this place. I may  order something different next time. But the menu did not have to much appeal to me.

Note: This place can seat a party of 5 or more. It may require two tables and a little bit longer than usual wait.
author: Tommy M.

description:
This place literally blew my mind.

Sourdough bread, pre-buttered, was an exciting and unlooked for beginning to our breakfast. Coffee was decent (not expecting much), and oh sweet Lord the FOOD. 

I had the shrimp-salmon eggs benedict. Incredible. My dad ordered the Chilaquales. Amazing (especially coming from a rich Tex-Mex tradition). Amazing. My mom had the blueberry pancakes with a side of fruit. Fantastic. The eggs benedict and Chilaquales came with a few perfect berries and orange slices, as well as a huge, delicious hash brown. 

It's a lot of great food: the perfect way to start off a day of walking around SF while trying to keep to 2 meals a day. You burn the calories, and I expect to be happily hungry by dinner :) 

In short, this place is amazing. Definitely worth a visit, and it has forced me to rethink all of my previously held beliefs about what "good breakfast food" means!
author: KJ R.

description: This was our first time at the Hollywood Cafe. Thank you, Yelpers. The polls are closed and we have a winner! We shared a crab omelet with Hollywood Hash Browns (which join Matt's Big Breakfast in the Hash Brown Hall of Fame). The service was also quick and polite. Although we didn't order one, the fruit bowls we saw at other tables were enormous and looked very fresh.
author: Gary H.

description: Over reviewed and rated.  This place is not like it used to be, but the homefries are good.  Everything else is as good as a Denny's.  Coffee is bland and sad.  Go to Plow!
author: M N.

description: Great SF brunch place. Very quaint inside and there is usually a line to get it that's how you know its good. Had an omelette with hash brown, bacon and french toast. Everything was delicious and had good taste. Staff was very friendly and the food came out in less than 10 minutes. Would recommend !
author: Alex T.

description: Best location for breakfast and brunch in the area!  This is our second time here during our one week stay. There will be a line outside, it moves quickly.
author: Haley B.

description:
I enjoyed my morning breakfast here. The friendly staff is why I have to rate this review as a 5 star experience. I felt like I had more than one server and my coffee and water never went empty. I also realized I had forgotten to charge my camera battery and a nice waitress showed me where an outlet was so I could charge my battery.
 I ordered the Crab Benedict. When it arrived the plate was huge and as for the crab there was so much crab piled on the benedict. I am used to ordering this at other restaurants and you get a little crab - not here at the Hollywood Cafe- they make sure you get more than your money's worth. The hash browns - are yummy, yum, yum. Mix them in with that amazing hollandaise sauce with a little crab for the perfect bite. I was very happy here at the Hollywood Cafe and felt right at home with the friendly staff. They made me feel very welcome and they didn't complain about how much coffee and water I drank they made sure they remained full with a smile. I had skipped dinner the night before and I came here hungry. If you come to the Hollywood Cafe make sure you are hungry because the portions are huge and food delicious.
author: Bonnie C.

description: The food was great. The only things that sucked was the place is a tad bit small, it was really hot inside due to it being crowded. Our server was slow and only checked on us once. Overall the food was great and the servers were friendly.
author: Mimi M.

description: The wait might be long but the breakfast is bomb. So delicious and the service is great too!! Must try!!
author: Izzy D.

description: Execllent service. Crowed, but was able to get a seats outside for 2. Ordered the Marilyn Monroe. French toast n fruit!! Give yourself some extra time. Arrived at 730 and the line was out the door.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Food tastes alright overall, coffee is decent, service is fast and friendly enough.

However, hash browns too greasy, and prices on the high side- though nothing that isn't expected from such a touristy location.
author: Alexander T.

description:
It was saturday morning and we wanted to try Mamas' on washington square but when we saw that the line was halfway around the block, we decided that we'd rather not spend 2 hours of our weekend waiting in line.  So I whipped out the trusty Yelp app, and found Hollywood Cafe.  

We walked over and got sat after a quick 10 minute wait. 

Service was decent.  Mostly friendly... I was actually surprised to see that most of the workers were vietnamese... interesting..

Anyways, I went with the Denver omelette, gf got the french toast. 

Omelette was good, more of a mixture of ham and veggies with egg thrown on top versus a rolled up omelette.  Tons of ham and veggies and a huge square of hash brown that covered the entire plate.  

All in all, the place was good but nothing was really spectacular.  It was A-OK.
author: Sennett L.

description: This place was really good! The bowl of fruit that is served with your breakfast is amazing! Long wait outside if you go late in the morning but they are quick to get you in and out. You feel a little rushed at first but after they take your order, they leave you alone.
author: B L.

description: I worked in customer service for about 5 years and I have a good idea of what good customer service looks like and this place is definitely one of them! Immediately welcomed into the cafe with a warm smile! Young lady in the cafe who was very helpful and hardworking...really appreciated her help! Food was delicious as well! I got the vivian leigh breakfast , yum! I'm picky and like my Bacon  crispy and they were that much but overall the food was delicious, especially the Fresh fruit!!! Definitely will come back and recommend to others :)
author: Mickey K.

description:
A bit pricey but definitely a stopping point for breakfast. Just don't ask to go to the restroom. 
Food is REALLY REALLY GOOD!
author: Monique W.

description: I have to say this place is fantastic! The service is great. They have tables for outside seating, and we were there on a super sunny day so we had such a pleasant experience having brunch under the sun:)! I had the eggs Benedict, and the french toast with fruits. Everything was DELICIOUS!!! Great place, super atmosphere, will deff have brunch here every time i am in San Fran!!
author: Karmen V.

description: My family agreed that this was the best breakfast we ever had! It's a bit pricey and there was about a 20 min wait, but it was definitely worth it! The hot chocolate was amazing, especially on a cold San Francisco morning.
author: Valerie W.

description: Recomend this place highly good food good service and large portion sizes.we went for breakfast 3 mornings in a row  fruit cup was excellent
author: Pete W.

description: Average food, the hash browns were kind of mushy.  The eggs Benedict was mediocre.  I didn't like the hollandaise sauce.  The wife got a French toast combo and it was pretty good.  The coffee was okay, nothing special. The service was great and the food was fast.
author: Rob M.

description:
I thought their food was good.  It certainly wasn't bad, and the service is really friendly.

The only thing I didn't like was that the chips that came with the chilaquiles.  It looked like it came out of a bag.  I prefer homemade tortilla chips instead of corn.  My sister got the eggs florentine and she loved them.  My dad enjoyed his lox too.
author: Vira P.

description: Food was decent. However I went to the bathroom mid meal and noticed there was no soap in the bathroom. While there a server went in the restroom and left without washing their hands at all. Although they served us with latex gloves, I was still very grossed out by the whole process
author: Roark B.

description: Stopped by here Saturday morning for breakfast, when you arrive you don't put your name on a waiting list, instead you stand outside of the restaurant waiting to be seated. If you're coming on the weekend expect to wait. The food is decent. I got the chilaquiles which I would not recommend at all with a side of Hollywood hash browns which were good. My girlfriend got the eggs Benedict which was much better. We were seated outside at the restaurant which would have been fine except because of the way they do their line all the people waiting to eat are right next to the tables outside. So the whole time you are eating here you feel rushed by all the people who are staring at you, waiting for you to finish your food so they can eat. Would recommend waiting for a table inside if you come here.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Did a quick yelp search for breakfast in area from my hotel. Went here after reading reviews. The place is great.  It was crowded but got a table within 5 minutes. I ordered the crab omelette.   My wife got the french toast combo. Both tasted really good. 

The portions are generous and the service is great. My coffee cup never reached the halfway point before someone popped out of nowhere offering to refill it. 

The decor and space are both lacking but the food and service are exceptional. I would recommend this to any tourist. It's kinda pricey but if you want cheap, go to McDonalds down the street.
author: Amsy V.

description: We had a nice walk around Fisherman's wharf and decided to stop here for brunch due to the good yelp reviews. Our first time here and we ordered the crab benedict with the fruit bowl. The fruit bowl contained a generous variety of fresh fruit. The crab benedict was well prepared. We also ordered the strawberry pancakes, which smelled good thanks to the fresh cream and strawberries. We enjoyed our brunch very much. The service was friendly and efficient.
author: Eric v.

description: The food is amazing we got the chilaquiles and the classic French toast the wait was only about 15 minutes and customer service was great will definitely make it my breakfast spots every time I am in town
author: Aranzazu R.

description:
I really wanted to love this place- it was my roommates birthday brunch, I saw the 4.5 stars on yelp, the weather was perfect... This was going to be the best boozy brunch.
When we got there, things went according to plan- this restaurant is super cute and the outdoor seating is perfect for sunny SF days. The wait wasn't totally ridiculous and we only waited about 20 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. The menu was very extensive and everything looked delicious! All our food had beautiful vibrant colors and tasted quite unique. However, there were too many problems with their poor customer service that I can't get over:  
1. My friend found a strand of hair in her omelette. When she told the waiter, he didn't even apologize, though the omelette was replaced. It was just not done in the most professional manner.
2. After my friend asked for water for the second time (they have such tiny tables, I had to keep my wallet on then floor), he accidentally dropped water on our table and my friend... and completely ignored doing that.
3. Switched the two cards we used for payment even though I specifically explained which one needed to be charged with more. 
Those were all forgivable mistakes, but it was a combination of all with the lack of a sincere apology from the waiters that really turned me off.

Overall, though, the food and cutesy ambience was great. Maybe I'll come back and hopefully will have better things to say about how I was treated!
author: Aradhana V.

description: Great cafe and excellent menu. The prices are better than some other cafés we have been to, which surprised us considering the location! They also have a few unique healthy options for breakfast like a breakfast salad if anyone is watching their diet
author: Stella M.

description: Great place. Opens early for San Francisco. We arrived shortly after opening time on Valentine's Day and were seated immediately for breakfast. Seating inside and out front but not a very large place. Line of people waiting to come in as we left. Breakfasts are hardy so should satisfy even a large appetite. As others have said the fruit bowl is a MUST HAVE. It was great. Friendly, attentive customer service and coffee cups were kept full. We both loved are breakfast meals. We will return!
author: Rick G.

description: I visited once and i don't think i'll go again. Service was bad and stuff was rude. Since there was 40 minutes left till they close they were hurrying us up to finish our plate asap and go. We went because of lack of breakfest place in Fisherman's warf but it worths making some extra miles and go anywhere else. food was tasteless on the top of everything. So overall was barely 1 star.
author: Osman K.

description: Bomb.com they deserve five stars and it was worth the wait we did have to wait in a short line but it was well worth it great service and the food was absolutely wonderful!!!! Love it #unique taste
author: Sarah S.

description: Came here at 7.15am and only half the restaurant was full(it opens at 7am). However, 15minutes later and people were lining up to get in. The food was pretty standard but the servings were MASSIVE! The fruit were really fresh and juicy :) will definitely come here again, but we'd probably share a dish.
author: Denis T.

description:
Went here on a weekday around 10:30am. There were a few people in line ahead of me, but their tables rotate pretty fast (at least it did that day), so I was seated within 15 minutes of putting my name the list. 

While I was waiting, I had already decided what I wanted to get - a Dungeness Crab Omelette with fruit. As everyone else here has been raving, they give you a GIANT heap of fruit and it's all very fresh and tasty, I loved it! 

However, unless I'm going to a fruit juice stand, freshness of the fruit isn't the main criteria...and unfortunately, I thought the crab omelette was ok at best. It had plenty of crab in it, but the combination of the avocado, onions and cheese didn't really do it for me. The crab didn't have much taste, or maybe the flavour of the cheese was overpowering the crab, or maybe just the combination of the ingredients wasn't the best... The eggs weren't light and fluffy like I've had a few other brunch places in the city. I kept on having to put salt, pepper, and hot sauce on it in hopes of sprucing up the flavour, but I ended up not finishing the omelette. 

Service was efficient and attentive and friendly enough. 

If I want a huge bowl of fresh fruit for a quick breakfast I might drop by again since I live close by, but otherwise I don't think I'll be back.
author: Anna H.

description: Best breakfast spot in the city imo.. The side of fruit is fresh and plentiful . Tiny place , you might have to wait a bit. In a real touristy part of town, but the breakfast here is a must!
author: Louie C.

description: We came here twice on our trip in San Fran and I was fantastic both times! Everything was delicious! The service was so quick too!
author: Taylor F.

description:
Obviously a place that serves buckets of fruit as a "side" is a must-visit if you're vacationing in the area. My mom and I tried to go here on a Thursday, but the wait was 30 minutes at 9:30 am...decided to try the next day at 8:30 am, and the wait was still 30 minutes. Yipes! This place is hardcore popular. My mom was barked at by the waitress for being in the way, which we both noted as being a bit too on the rude side. 

The fruit was incredible - fresh and lots of variety. I got the crab omelette...the taste was great, but they serve their omelettes up in the dreaded "egg taco" style, where the egg is just a shell for all the toppings. GAH! Blend your ingredients, people! Super disappointing when that happens. 
 
Nice place. Needs to get a bigger space, though. If this was in Seattle, it would be a restaurant I'd frequent..but when I'm on vacation, it's always great to try something new, so I don't know that I'll go out of my way to be a repeat visitor. 

Official rating: 3.5
author: Melissa B.

description:
Good fast breakfast~
Loved the pancakes and omelette served with always fresh fruit. We ate here twice in the week long period during our stay at Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco
author: May L.

description:
We came here after a long night of bachelorette fun for breakfast. The place was crowded when we got there but we managed to squeeze in out of the rain. The music they were playing was the kind you could sing along to - and we did... Much to the pleasure of the cooks in the kitchen. As the food came out while we waited it smelled and looked so good! After about a 30 minute wait we were seated. The service was excellent and the menu choices were so good we all had a hard time deciding! Ultimately we decided to share a Hollywood hashbrown. Then we each ordered our own; chiliquilles for the bride to be, a pack cake combo for myself, and a French toast combo for the other bridesmaid. 

The food arrived quickly. They are extremely generous with their portions! The food was absolutely delicious. Fresh fruit comes with every meal. My stomach gave out before my taste buds did! 

Overall, my only critique would be the decor. There isn't anything very Hollywood about it. But who cares? Not me because the food more than made up for it.
author: Jennifer O.

description: My husband and I ate breakfast here a few days ago. The line was pretty long, but it was worth the wait. I had the Old Favorite Eggs and my husband got the Gregory Peck. We both got our hashbrowns Hollywood Cafe style. The food was absolutely amazing! The hashbrowns were cooked perfectly and we're smothered in mushrooms, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and bacon. I will define come back if I'm in the area again.
author: Christina G.

description: I came here on a lazy Sunday morning.  Wait was about 15 mins.  Ordered the orangish french toast, fresh squeezed OJ, and Denver omelet with side of bacon.  Food was good but nothing special.  I opted not to get the fruit bowl on any of my plates, but I wish I had because they literally just pour on the fresh fruit in the kitchen.  Expect to take some of that fruit to-go.  Come with an appetite as portions are large!
author: Jeremy T.

description: This was the perfect place to have breakfast on our way to Pier 33 for the Alcatraz tour. This restaurant is within walking distance and offers breakfast/lunch, but closes before dinner. My husband got the B.A.T. (bacon, avocado, tomato) scramble with Hollywood style hashbrowns (onions, peppers, bacon, melted cheese). He was in heaven! I tried the Rancheros eggs with hashbrowns. So good! Great price, fast friendly service even with a line out the door, and delicious food.
author: Heather A.

description: Delicious!!!! Went to the Hollywood Cafe based on reviews and walking distance right down the street. All the recommendations were spot on! We wanted to get a good taste of a few things so between the two of us we ordered the original eggs Benedict with Hollywood hashbrowns instead of regular and it came with a side of sourdough toast. We got the Marilyn Monroe (3 slices of french toast) ordered in the vanilla flavor. It was sooooo good, almost like a brioche dipped in a banana vanilla mix, topped with sliced almonds and whipped cream. You truly have to come taste it for yourself,  we were so tempted to go back another day just to try another flavor like the 'Orangish'. The service was very quick,  the food was amazing,  and the jam and fruit was fresh! The only negative about this place was that it was small,  half seating inside/half out. Luckily we went during the week on a wed. and didn't have a line to wait in.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Yelp got us to Hollywood Cafe. One word...awesome! We went there the first day of our trip and immediately had high expectations for the rest of the San Fran. restaurants. This place is fast paced with good service. 

The sour dough toast is great. They stack it high for a sort of appetizer. My son loved the pancakes. The omelets are fantastic. 

The show stopper is the fruit. They serve fruit with many dishes and the side of fruit is stupid huge and fresh. We are heading back tomorrow for our last breakfast before heading home.
author: Ryan M.

description: I ordered the chicken sausage and avocado scramble.  I chose the fresh fruit for my side.  The portions are ridiculously huge.  I couldn't finish everything.  Service was good.  I liked the fresh jam and bread they give.  I would definitely return.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is I think the food (not the fruit) could have been seasoned better.  It was on the bland side.
author: Bryan D.

description: Great little place near Fisherman's wharf it's right across the street from the Hyatt fisherman's wharf Hotel, Food is reasonably priced, you get a pretty big plate of food tons of fruit so much that we had to take ours back to the hotel and it was very fresh not typical fruit on the side like at other breakfast place lots of berries boysenberries blueberries raspberries strawberries it goes on and on, the hash browns are huge and not greasy. One thing I didn't like was the water was pretty gross no one at out table drank it. The staff was very busy but very helpful when we asked questions about the menu. It's not a huge place so there is a line outside on weekends but well worth it maybe waited 25 mins.when we go back to  San Francisco we definitely will be going back the there...
author: Doriann H.

description: Our hotel concierge recommended this place since it was close by, and we were very impressed with the service and the food. So impressed we went back the next day! Fresh squeezed orange juice, good coffee, huge portions, and super speedy service. You won'regret it - just GO!
author: Katie J.

description: Really good food. Inexpensive. Fast service. Really long line but went through fast we waited 20 minutes. I ordered the Hollywood hash brown they were tasty. My medium eggs were overcooked but it's okay they still get a five star.
author: J T.

description:
Discovered Hollywood Cafe while roaming around the Fisherman's Wharf area on a trip to San Fran this past week. We were looking for a good brunch place and decided to try it out based on the great reviews. I am SO glad we did. As other Yelpers have commented - the food is great and portions are huge. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe which was 3 slices of french  toast with a fruit bowl. The fruit bowl included a TON of fresh fruit that was spilling over the bowl and all over my plate. The fruit and french toast were both really good. My husband ordered the HashBurrito, which he loved. It had a really fresh and unique flavor. We also got a side of the Hollywood Hashbrowns, which I highly recommend. The side order literally took up an entire plate!

In addition to the great food, the service was pretty outstanding as well. The seem to have a system where rather than have each server assigned to specific tables, everyone just helps out everywhere. So we had several different people come up at various times to take our order, ask how everything was and clear our plates, etc. This system seemed to work very well as we felt very well attended to and they seemed to get people in and out of there pretty quickly. 

I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a great value on a delicious brunch in SF!
author: Stacey S.

description: Eggs Benedict and freshly squeezed orange juice. Delish! Hubby enjoyed "Vivienne Leigh"Which included a bowl of fresh fruit delicious but recommend to order a side of yoghurt as fruit was a little tart due to the season. Great wait staff and very good value for money. Very close to Hyatt and The Tuscan.
author: Karen G.

description: Awesome place for the area. Don't be deterred by longish line -- they are quick and move people through. Kids were thrilled with breakfasts. Great fruit bowls accompanied a lot of the dishes. It wouldn't be a standout in another area of the city, but it was much appreciated by a hungry family on its way to fisherman's wharf.
author: S B.

description: A must stop for breakfast if you're in SF!  Great food and great sized portions!
author: Laura R.

description: Delicious food. Great service. Line to get in but it moved fast. Would definitely come back.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
The BEST breakfast you can have in San Francisco, hands down. Be warned, there is a wait. If you can help it, go during the weekdays. I went on a Monday around ten and had to wait twenty minutes.

The place is really small and not much room for you to move around in your seat, but what matters is the food. They give you free bread with their delicious orange and blackberry jam on the table. The menu has goofy actor/actress named dishes. I ordered the Vivian Leigh and my parents shared a spinach florentine omelette. I could spend all day describing the flavors. Everything was delicious. The huge bowl of fruit was fresh and ripe. the crossaint sandwich exploded in my mouth with a cascade of multiple flavors.

 Out of everything I ate in SF, this is THE place to go. You wont regret it.
author: Gill S.

description:
Rude service. Real real bad. Never had this experience before. The Asian old lady just yell at us.
But food is pretty good.
author: Jerry Y.

description: this place gets packed and its small so be prepared to wait ... but... IT'S TOTALLY WORTH IT! Portions are LARGE and everything on the menu is fresh and delicious!  ENJOY!
author: Cari V.

description: Solid effort by the staff here. They are quick with their service and the portion sizes are huge. I had the breakfast salad which was really nice. We ordered the fruit bowl and yogurt to share but wouldn't if we had realized some of the other breakfasts came with fruit bowls themselves. The fruit was great, lots of fresh berries and a huge serve. Also it would have been easier to fit everything on our table! They were a bit small for four people when you have all the plates, waters, juice and coffees on the table. The boys enjoyed there choices, one had eggs, hash browns and toast and the other had a croissant with scrambled egg and fruit. All very tasty.
author: Linda C.

description:
I ordered the turkey and avocado egg Benedict ($13). It was a LOT of food. I suggest sharing with a friend.

Decent place, decent food, good service. I won't be back as there are a lot of better breakfast places to try in SF!
author: Kim N.

description: Fresh fruit and huge portions.. What's not to love about this place?! If you love brunch as much as I do, this is definitely a place worth visiting when in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Braelyn B.

description: Definitely deserves a 5-star rating! The food is delicious, portions are really very big. Usually this place is very busy, but it's worth to wait. Remember that it's only open for breakfast and lunch (7am-2pm) so no dinner or late lunch here.
author: Sergiy M.

description: Simple review here. Great breakfast food. Big portions. Good price. Felt like a local joint in the middle of tourist central.
author: Peter G.

description: Beautiful, delicious, fresh plates. Worth the long wait. The Eggs Benedict are on point and don't miss the delicious raspberry jam on your sourdough bread. This place is a must-visit when in the city.
author: Kristen B.

description:
My original brunch plans was to hit up Mama's but when we found out the line was over an hour long our party split up to check out the waits in other well Yelp rated places. 
At first looks Hollywood looked rather disappointing, being in a tourist area with tacky name and decor.  The only thing that kept us here was that it seemed to be the shortest wait and the rave yelp reviews.  Needless to say it didn't disappoint!  
Tips, grab a menu and be prepared to order.  The service is very fast and they will be ready to take your order within a few minutes of sitting.  Servings are generous and the portions are large.  When I asked them for a disposable coffee cup to take my the rest of my coffee with me (since i hardly touched my coffee) they were nice enough to give me a new cup of coffee.  
They do seem to rush you in and out. But if you are a tourist trying to make the make the most of your time here while getting delicious breakfast I definitely recommend this place!
author: Su H.

description: I ordered the two eggs with bacon for $12.50 and made the hash browns, "Hollywood" style for an extra $2.50.  The eggs were fine, the bacon average, but the hash browns were about the size of a McDonald's hash brown, but thinner.  The hash browns were so small, that the "Hollywood" style toppings were extremely sparse, maybe 3 bacon bits, and 4 thinly slices peppers.  It also came with bread, which possibly could of have been toast at some point, it was devoid of warmth.  Going into restaurant I wanted to have a lighter breakfast, which I got, but I feel like I paid for a huge breakfast.  My son had the "basic" pancakes for $10, which he was not thrilled about.  We ate about 7:45 before the crowds arrived.  It was 40-45 degrees outside, people were eating on the sidewalk, and the doors leading in were wide open, so it was on the chilly side.  I don't understand why people wait in line for this place.  If this were a breakfast restaurant in Sacramento, it would not be in the top 10 breakfast restaurants within 5 miles of my house.
author: john h.

description: Solid breakfast choice. You know it's going to be good when there is a line at 7 AM. Good coffee and real cream on the table without even having to ask. I did the meat lovers omelette with avocado... Solid choice. Definitely one I would return to.
author: Jeff C.

description: This is a Incredible place for Breakfast - do yourself a favor go early r wait in line - you will not be sorry - Fruit Bowl WOW
author: Adam J.

description:
This place is a definite must eat for breakfast. The fruit bowl was the best fruit i have ever had. Not one sour thing in there. Each bite was a bite of heaven! 

Service was great as well. Constant refills never had an empty cup of coffee. Kitchen runs extremely efficient as well. If your in town and looking for a place to have breakfast, make this your first choice.
author: Adam H.
