description: Excellent food and service! good place for breakfast/brunch. Not only is the food delicious, but they give you good portions as well. Try to beat the tourist crowd because that seems to be the majority of the customers here.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Good food had the old fashioned 2 eggs! Hollywood hash Browns and the sweet bacon www delicious !! But if u have to use the bathroom hold it! Nasty!!!!
author: Shelly M.

description: Brunching with the stars! If you like big portions like I do, this is your place. Yummy hashbrowns (and such a generous heaping of them)! Eggs benedict was delicious. The large portions do not compromise taste, it's all flavorful and good quality. I'm picky about brunch and I was very pleasantly surprised by Hollywood Cafe. My only suggestion is to take reservations or expand seating, the restaurant was pretty crowded and stuffy when I visited.
author: Anna J.

description: This has to be one of the best breakfasts I have had in a long long time.  I ordered the fresh OJ, and it was really freshly squeezed not the from concentrate pasteurized crap many places advertise as fresh.  I ordered 2 eggs over medium with ham and hash browns, the serving was huge! I am not a huge fan of hash browns but per the reviews I figured I would give them a try, and wow! am I glad I did! they were delicious!!! I told myself do not eat it all because it was a very generous serving, but I couldn't stop eating them, everything was so good! They also served fresh fruit like orange slices and blueberries served along with breakfast orders, a very nice touch.  My mom had a breakfast sandwich and she was very happy with it.  We got there early so we didn't have to wait, but by the time we were done there was a wait. This place is very popular and fills up quick.  Service was very attentive and accessible.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Charmie P.

description: Hollywood cafe comes across as highly rated and well known but when we went there, the service was great but rushed and the food was just ok. We had the Blueberry Pancakes, an egg white veggie omelet and French toast. It was heavy and greasy. Especially the hash browns. Great for a heavy unhealthy breakfast. Not so good for vegetarians.
author: Kunjarani D.

description: I'm glad there wasn't a long line when I came, because it definitely would not be worth the wait. I ordered their "famous Dungeness eggs Benedict with hashbrowns" and I've had better. The hashbrowns weren't very crispy and the crab was eh. The highlight was their jam,  which I realize now that they forgot to bring me toast
author: Carol F.

description: Amazing brunch!! I got the bitter mimosa and avocado salad. Both were to die for! The wait was worth it!
author: Lisa A.

description: Out of this world food and service! But, be ready for a half hour wait in line. Prices are in line with other good Fishermans wharf locations.
author: Jim F.

description: The wait for Hollywood Cafe was only about 15-20 minutes last Saturday morning. They are very efficient about moving patrons through their restaurant. Very good food, fresh fruit, and absolutely worth the wait. But it may be cold right off of the bay.
author: Matt F.

description: Best food and best service. Hands down the best breakfast cafe on the Wharf. Would definitely go again!
author: Mike P.

description: Arrived just before 9am and had a 5 minute wait, yummy pancakes and Hollywood hash. Fast and good service too.
author: Jules H.

description: Lots of food, good service albeit a bit slow, prices are kind of high but it is San Francisco, so... The fruit was great!  Fresh, plentiful, and perfect.
author: Eric S.

description: The Vivian Leigh was delicious... I loved the enormous pile of eggs and bacon on my croissant and the bowl overflowing with fruit. My only complaint is that it was just way too much food for one person! I wish I could have ordered a half size, and at half the price.
author: Danielle M.

description: Fresh and convenient, plus they get you out quick. Nothing exceptional. Not on par with Cafe Golo or Home Plate.
author: Will T.

description:
Great food, great staff, wonderful atmosphere! My husband, son and I were staying at the Hyatt directly across the street and walked over around 8am on a Sunday. 

It's a busy, fast-moving place and what seemed like it could be a long wait was a little over 10 minutes. My son (1) was greeted by many staff members and they were so nice and waved at him when they rushed by. This made him so happy!

Their portions are very generous and delicious! They start you off with fresh and warm sourdough bread, and they were thoughtful enough to bring fresh berries for the baby. I had the Vivian Leigh which was provided with a delicious and fresh fruit bowl. My son ate almost his entire plate of scrambled eggs, toast and  bacon because he loved it so much! We all know how picky of an eater little kids can be.

This place is definitely a must for breakfast when visiting the Bay Area. Stop by here and you won't be disappointed!
author: Valerie D.

description: This place dishes out massive portions with 4 star quality and 5 star service.  Perfect start for a big day when you might skip lunch.
author: Luc L.

description: Five stars are not often handed out by me, but let me tell ya, this place is one of my favorite breakfast spots in San Francisco. My wife and I always order the dolce French toast and the dish is amazing. Every time we come back to San Francisco we will continue to make it a point to come back here for food. Everything on the menu looks so good too; my in-laws ordered omelettes (the Denver) and the helping is plentiful and delicious! The only draw back to this breakfast spot is that it is small and everyone else seems to like it, so the wait can be longer than what someone wants to wait for. However, it is worth it and sometimes it is not that bad of a wait. Friendly staff too!
author: Chris R.

description: I ordered tuna salad where it said seared tuna. Instead i got tuna with mayo. Very disappointed. I pointed it out to the waitress that it's not what it said in the menu, and she offered to replace it, but was afraid of getting my food tampered, so I ate my disappointment.
author: Irene T.

description:
Amazing brunch!  Definitely get their fresh-squeezed orange juice!  My friend and I ordered for 3 people because we wanted to try EVERYTHING!  Boy were we stuffed!  We finished everything except the fruit which we took to go.  Their portions are huge and worth every penny!

Yes, we were tourists but the cafe itself didn't feel very touristy.

Note, bathroom is hidden in the building next door and away from the cafe.
author: Jing X.

description: The food here is pretty good. I had the original eggs benedict and it was great. The hashbrowns were just ok. My boyfriend loved his meat omlette. They weren't stingy with the meat. The service was good. The prices were a little steep.
author: Mallayana B.

description:
Meh... 
Surprised how many stars this is getting... Hash browns were good. Crab Benedict was just ok and the fruit wasn't very fresh. 

Service was nonexistent...
I have a problem with restaurants where I never see my waiter after I order...until they bring my check of course.  My waiter never looked me in the eye and even dropping off my check seemed like a chore to him...

I definitely will not be going back...
author: E W.

description: My husband and I ate breakfast here twice during our vacation in San Francisco. We arrived both days before 7:30 so we didn't experience the lines that many people write about. The portions are big, and everything from the fruit to the eggs to the more sweet food (french toast, pancakes) was all delicious. We also enjoyed our iced mochas, which were quite large. Depending on what you order, breakfast for two will run about $35-50. That's part of the reason why I'm giving it four versus five stars. Another reason is their lack of friendliness. They definitely get you in and get you out. No small talk or smiles. With that said, would we return? Absolutely!
author: Motrya M.

description:
This place only gets 3 stars not because of the food but because of the poor service. The server was short with us and ordered us where to sit, when I inquired about gluten free choices she just said flatly No! Even though in my yelp search this restaurant came up in my gluten free search.
I ordered the B A T omelette, which was very good but She messed up our order even after repeating it back to us and being corrected, we then had to ask for every single thing, such as, coffees, cream and sugar for our coffee, a paper cup with a lid and straw for our toddler to drink out of (server gave us her chocolate milk in a large heavy glass) 
With so many other options in the area I will not be back.
author: Nicole S.

description: So yummy in my tummy. We are Visiting from Orange County California and we were lucky enough to stay at the hotel right across from this place. There was a wait but the line moved fast. It was so hard to pick what to eat since everything sounded and looked so delicious. Our food came out fast that I couldn't believe it. I was very happy with this place!!!! I would definitely come back without a second thought
author: Nataly C.

description:
Great food. Huge portions. Fast service. No pretense, just a good experience.
Fruit was super fresh.
Everything was nice and hot.
A hidden gem we found by accident.
If you're near Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place for breakfast.
author: Dennis B.

description: I have mixed feelings about this place.  The service was quick and efficient.  I loved my breakfast of French toast and the fabulous fruit that has been mentioned here repeatedly.  My husband on the other hand,  ordered Huevos Rancheros and was extremely disappointed.  Instead of corn tortillas - corn chips were used and the salsa was sweet and probably from a bottle or jar.  He declared it the worst he had ever had and it is normally one of his favorite breakfast choices.  The bathroom is in an alley.  I think it was clean enough, but he said, "You wouldn't have liked it."
author: Missy J.

description: Best breakfast my whole family could agree on. Even my finicky eater asked if we could have breakfast here tomorrow.  Great service, great food. Highly recommend
author: Amy K.

description:
I liked the food, reasonable prices, fast service. 
On the downside: bathroom situation is horrible,  you have to exit a restaurant,  go thru side door, follow a maze of dirty back rooms and walkways and don't forget the door code too! Bathroom are extremely filthy,  think of a gas station type. 
There is always a wait to get a table, as this restaurant is tiny. Cheap decor throughout.
 
But you are there for quick breakfast,  and they make it fast and rather well.
author: Max P.

description: Busy little restaurant with fast service and excellent food. The restaurants nothing fancy but it's clean and you can sit outside if you like which was nice.  We got there and it was full and they said it would be a 5 min wait, we literally had a table right away.  The service was great, fast and efficient.  We ordered are breakfast and we had it in less then 10 mins, and it was so fresh & delicious!  I had the B.A.T with side of fresh fruit ( soo much fruit) soo good and my husband had the vanilla french toast combo and they were delicious.  I would definitely go back here again!!!
author: Tracia R.

description:
The place is dirty and cramped. I asked for ice water and got served disgusting dish water with a lemon in it. The staff doesn't really speak English and the service was of the bare-minimum variety. The food wasn't horrible, but it wasn't anything special. Fake maple syrup and greasy eggs. Not worth the money. I came here when it was a little slow and I feel bad for the people who wait 20 minutes in line.

Edit: They also call you a liar if you don't give them a rave review. Your service is bad, don't shoot the messenger.
author: Pete C.

description: Outstanding bread and crab benedict! Will definitely return. Go early, line gets long but well worth it. Service was great and quick!
author: Lisa S.

description: My husband and I came here for a brunch on our day off last week. There was a bit of a line but it was not a long wait. Once we got seated, our server greeted us with a friendly smile. She was pretty helpful with recommendations. We ordered a Vivian Leigh and a French toast. The Vivian Leigh was ok; tasty croissant but I wish the eggs were more seasoned. The French toast was IMPECCABLE! It was sweet and rich! And the fruit bowls were humongous! Fresh and Juicy! The service was very attentive; staffs kept checking on us.  Might come back here again if we can get parking.
author: Joelle K.

description: This place is amazing! Huge portions with diner like food. I had the meat lovers omelet. The omelet was stuffed with 3 kinds of meat and cheddar cheese on top of a bed of crispy hash browns and toast. The wife had the French toast with two over easy eggs and bacon. Come here hungry and leave satisfied
author: Bryan N.

description: Very cute spot. Food was okay. I ordered a Blt it was alright. My family was very happy about their breakfast meals! Maybe that's what I'll try next :) also they add a bit a fruit to the plates  The service was quick we were out in about 40min!
author: Lesly S.

description:
I wanted to like this place. The people were nice. But between dodging shell in my crab Benedict (which was plentiful but phoned in) and not actually giving me the kind of hashbrowns I ordered, they made it real hard.  It's also super touristy. If you're a tourist, it's probably the best you'll do near the wharf.

Locals, Skip it. So many better places.
author: Nate M.

description: There is nothing really bad to say about this place. I went here while I was on vacation for brunch, and I really enjoyed the experience. I ordered the lox platter which came with smoked salmon and a bagel, and my husband had the pancakes. Everything was on point. The portions are huge, and reasonably priced. Everything is fresh and simple. If you want a good, home-style breakfast place, you should visit this cafe.
author: Hanan Q.

description: Really great food that tastes amazing, huge portion sizes, extremely fast service, good prices, fun location! What else could you ask for??? When I first saw this restaurant from the outside it honestly didn't look that great but we were staying at the Hyatt across the street and wanted a convenient breakfast place so we decided to look it up on Yelp. After seeing the 4.5 stars out of many reviews we decided we would check this place out and it didn't disappoint! I got the Greek omelet and wow was it delicious and so much food. The omelet was jam packed with veggies and was probably the biggest omelet I've ever gotten at a restaurant. It also came with hash browns that were a long flat rectangle. Never had hash browns like this before but since they were thin they were really crispy and so amazing. They also being French bread to each table and have super fresh jam to put on it. Not a huge jam person but this stuff looked legit so I had to try it and really loved it. Only downside to this place is it gets packed and you have to wait even early. We got there at 7:30 and had to wait about 10 minutes. The staff turns table quick but it's a small restaurant so it doesn't hold many people. Definitely check this place out!
author: Sarah H.

description: A good place to enjoy freshly prepared lunch or dinner from scratch.  Portions are fair, prices are reasonable, and quality is good.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating.  This is a popular place, so don't be discouraged if you have to wait a bit to be seated.
author: Ann V.

description: First off on yelp it says the open at 7, I sat down and got in by 645. Had the pancakes and the eggs Benedict with a side of fruit. Easy to say the side of fruit was bigger then I could believe. Great service and ppl with amazing tasting food.
author: Joseph G.

description: The breakfast is really good.if you are a fruits fan,order something with the fruit cup as a side.trust me,u won't be disappointed
author: R M.

description:
Came here a few days ago with a friend of mine. We were planning on trying another brunch place but unfortunately it was closed so we resorted to Yelp-ing another closeby brunch place, and we ended up here. 

Upon our arrival of this cafe, we were quickly greeted and asked if we preferred a table inside the restaurant or outside. We agreed to sit down inside, and were handed menus. I ordered blueberry pancakes and my friend ordered a Dolce French toast. 

Our food came with fresh fruits which was very appetizing. My blueberry pancakes were a bit on the disappointing side because I expected it to be actual blueberry pancakes and not pancakes with just blueberries on top. Nonetheless, the food was good and so was the service. We left the restaurant with full tummies and good vibes from the workers.
author: Phoebe C.

description: typically avoiding fisherman's wharf area, but making a visit with visitors in tow...morning visit and finding hollywood in breakfast search...completely full and a crowd waiting...placing name at the counter and waiting...about 20 minutes wait with 4 other groups ahead on the list...sidewalk patio or inside seating...watching meals on the tables and finding quite massive...seated inside and order of coffee, juice and water for everyone...menu browsing and orders taken...meal including toast and given good quality toasty sliced bread with butter melting...upgrades available for small additional fee...fruit instead of hash brown or get the hollywood hash brown...would highly recommend one person upgrade to the fruit...a huge pile of fresh and sweet fruit variety, so no need for everyone to upgrade..just share...hollywood hash brown upgrade includes hash brown topped with a mountain of bacon, cheese and chives...again, just share and no need for everyone to upgrade...portions are enormous...omelet is massive and good...the scrambles are filling...very generous with the bacon and avocado...meals are big enough to share...hash brown is cooked to a sheet of paper size, but finding not very crispy...just a massive potato blanket over the food...eggs are bit overcooked dry...still a good large gut-busting meal overall...
author: Hen A.

description: Hard to find better breakfast food or service.  The staff was very courteous and thoughtful.  They brought my 2 year old son a cup of black berries while we waited to be seated.  The food is incredible.  Large portions and great flavor. This is a great place for anyone in the Fisherman's Wharf, Peir 39, or North Italian district to just walk to.  There is indoor and outdoor seating and if your not choosey the tables free up fairly fast.  This place is popular, so be prepared to wait if you arrive and they're slammed. It is a busy street so expect it to be loud if you choose outside. This will be our go to place for breakfast whenever we return.
author: Travis P.

description: Our go to place for breakfast in S.F.  Always great.  And the portion sizes fill up out 15 year old son.  Everything we've had has been very good but the french toast is wonderful.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I enjoyed this place.  The food was generally good, I wouldn't go to the five star range though. Some of my pluses: 

+Even with a line they were quick to get us seated.  I'd say there were about 10 groups ahead of us and we waited no more than 15 minutes. 
+Nice outdoor seating area. 
+Food was plentiful. I ordered the pancaked combo and my friend ordered the french toast combo. Both orders came with a choice of meat, two eggs, and a mound of mixed fruit that I was not expecting.    
+Given the amount of food (especially the fresh fruit) the price was incredibly reasonable.  

The two "complaints" I have - I had to flag down a server to get a refill on my drink and the mixed up the egg orders.
author: Jessica J.

description: After waiting in a line that wound around the block , I enjoyed one of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time. The wait staff was practically psychic in determining our needs, and the food was quick and perfectly cook with big proportions. I highly recommend a stop at the Hollywood Cafe!!
author: Shayna R.

description:
Overrated! We went to the Hollywood Cafe on a Friday morning and were able to get seated outside immediately, which was great. The service was quick and friendly.

The food, however, was subpar. Nothing special about the eggs and Hollywood hashbrowns. The homemade jam was pretty good, but that was about it. Certainly not a bad place, but not worth a long wait, and definitely not as good as we would have expected based on the Yelp ratings.
author: Holly L.

description: OMG this food was great. The vanilla French toast was delicious. Their portions are big and you will be really full. The fruit is deliciously fresh. Good coffee. Good service. We did wait to be seated and couldn't get a table until one person from our group of ten arrived, but that's understandable.
author: Sandy D.

description:
This place was wonderful. It was the best fruit my mom has ever eaten she says!

We went on our way to the early morning Alcatraz tour. It is about a 10 minute walk from breakfast to Pier 33.

There were 5 groups in front of us, but it took less than 10 minutes to be seated, so don't let the line scare you!

The food also came out super quick! We ordered the chilequilas, French toast, and Marilyn Monroe, or whichever one is the pancakes and fruit. All of the portions are huge, all reasonable price for what I am used to. 

My mom couldn't believe the variety of fruit and the massive amount they gave you. 

We would highly recommend this place! Everything was delicious, we left happy and full.
author: Kathryn P.

description:
Great food and super fresh fruit.  The prices were a little high but they make sure you don't leave hungry.

Worth the wait!
author: Fareed T.

description: Best breakfast I have ever had anywhere! You get a large amount of food (fresh fruit overflows onto your plate) for the price and the service is fast! You can eat outside or inside but space is limited inside. Breakfast ends at 11 so get there early. You don't want to miss their breakfast!
author: James P.

description:
It was an amazing day in San Francisco and we were staying around the corner at the Marriott. It's walking distance from the wharf and the end of the Cable Car line and I'm glad to say the quality and price of the food isn't ruined by the proximity to a popular tourist attraction. 

Our party of 4 was seated pretty quickly at the peak of breakfast time. My only complaint was that we were a little cramped at our small table outside. We were too hungry to care though. 

I got the Franciscan which was chicken apple sausage, avocado, scallion, and mild cheddar cheese scrambled with 3 eggs. It was served with an awesome sized flat hash brown and a side of pre-buttered toast. It tasted great and was generously portioned. 

I ordered a mimosa and it was quite big. Too bad it wasn't served in a champagne flute, but that just meant I got more bang for my buck.

I will definitely be coming back for breakfast if I stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area next time I'm in the city.
author: Kathy T.

description:
"kind waitress, we'll be out of here soon" - me

"good" - kind waitress

The bad service I experienced here is nothing new but never have I experienced such rude attitude from a waitress. The bathrooms are filthy, the food is mediocre, and the service is the worst! 

Certainly a tourist trap which would explain all the high reviews but this place is crap compared to the SF breakfast heavyweights such as Dotties and Mama's. Both places have much better food and service.

Addendum: not sure why this is getting filtered despite the terrible service I experienced!
author: Charlie C.

description:
I live it the area and thought it would be a tourist trap! There is always a line. It goes by pretty fast 25-45 mins wait on weekends.
The food is plentiful and fresh. I love this place! It is nothing to write home about but it is good homestyle brunch place happening here.
I can't wait to go back.
author: Alison W.

description: After seeing all the 4 stars I was a little disappointed in the food, great fast service, but not the quality of Mama's
author: Tim H.

description:
DON'T DO IT.
I cannot begin to comprehend why or how this place has 4.5 stars, nor can I begin to delineate why or how this place deserves 1 star. But I shall try.

En route to LA from Redding (way up in NorCal) by car, I wanted to stop in SF for brunch. My cousin agreed, and after discovering that our first choice (Mama's a few blocks away) had a horrendous line, I suggest Hollywood Cafe, based on its vicinity, its rating, and its lack of a line at that time. Despite the 4.5 stars, I had my doubts, mainly originating from the name of the restaurant: why would I go to a restaurant 400 miles away from the actual place it's named after, especially when I live so close to said place? I tried very hard to ignore it.

But then when the food came... I just can't handle this. My heart is starting to pump faster just re-imagining this terrible, terrible brunch. I ordered the shrimp and salmon benedict, and my cousin ordered the crab omelet. Here I go.
The benedict was disgusting. Everything was cold, from the smoked salmon to the poached eggs. The hollandaise sauce was way too much and way too heavy. The combination was just a terrible one. And the three shrimp were just thrown into a corner of the plate, as opposed to being put into the benedict in some way. When I put everything together in one bite, I tasted not a pleasant breakfast, but rather the result of a bad breakfast. Ugh. 
Meanwhile, the crab omelet, which I momentarily thought was much better as relief from the benedict, turned out to be quite a fluke, as well. Omelets are supposed to be eggs, with various ingredients mixed in. This was a sheet of egg--I suspect they aren't even natural ones--wrapping a few shreds of crab with a huge handful of green onion and a thick slice of cheese. So like a sandwich. A very cold, hard one that was nearly void of its promised primary ingredient (crab). After a few bites, this omelet also became repulsive.
At least the hashbrowns were good, I suppose. They were very thin and took up about 2/3 of the space on each of the plates. But really... it's hard to mess up hashbrowns. 

The iced water tasted weird. My hot water came in a chipped mug (right at the point where I would have put my lips had I not noticed the chip). The bread (I don't know who serves bread baskets for brunch, but okay) was oily from them having just slathered butter onto each piece. The service was awkward--nobody really seemed to understand clearly or respond attentively to what we were saying. The restroom was soooo shady--or, rather, lacking, since the one they tell customers to use is in the vacant space next door, down two shady corridors and whatnot. 

Just disgusting. I wanted very much to have a filling meal before the long drive home, but my desire to just stop eating that disgusting food overpowered the natural need to eat. See if I'm ever trying a restaurant with "Hollywood" in the name again. Hmph.
author: Wendy C.

description: You have to try the Audrey Hepburn! Pancakes with an amazing fruit bowl! Yummy! The place is super fast and everything was really tasty! We highly recommend this place for breakfast. We'll be back tomorrow for the same meal! It was that good!
author: Kerry J.

description: Excellent breakfast.... The fruits and the hash brown are amazing .. One of the best ....
author: Abdullah K.

description: Best breakfast place ever!! The best eggs I've ever had, plus they have Cosmo magazines to look at while you wait to be seated, which doesn't take long at all either.
author: Jennifer N.

description: I've only been here once but definitely plan on going again next time I'm in SF. Didn't have to wait at all to be seated which was awesome. Wasn't really impressed by our waitress, she seemed bored but whatever. More importantly, the food was so good! Portions are outta control but who can really complain about an enormous side of fresh fruit. Totally recommend this place!
author: Mariah C.

description: Great breakfast.  Portions are huge. The sweet bacon was AMAZING! ! Had a fruit bowl that was great lots of fresh berries and grapes with banana kiwi and orange. Was very impressed.  Definitely going back.
author: James P.

description:
Excellent!  I rarely do five stars but I think this place warrants it.  Group of four on Sunday around 1130 or 1200, Father's Day actually now that I think about it so maybe more of a wait than usual.  Anyhow, we got in in about 30 mins, and someone came and promptly took our orders maybe the result of trying to push people through which I appreciate.  Food came quickly, like in 10 min.  I got the turkey eggs benedict and my husband got the cheesesteak.  My benedict was very good, lots of turkey and avocado and egg runny and perfectly cooked.  Lots of egg benedicts are good though but the kicker for me for the ginormous sheet of hash browns they were served on.  Super crispy and delicious.  My husband cheesesteak was delicious, one of the best I've tasted.  He got shoestring fries on the side which I usually don't like cause they lose the starchy texture in the middle but these were delicious.  Our friends got a croissant sandwich and something else I can't seem to remember but the croissant sandwich looked great and came with a giant serving of fresh fruit.  In terms of portions, very decent, we each ate half our food.  

Update. I accidentally just tried to review this place again cause I went to a lousy place and I wanted to reaffirm how much I like this place.  I wish I lived in SF so I could just come eat here on a regular basis.
author: Jenny H.

description: Excellent food and service. Big portions. I had the dungeoness crab benedict. My wife had a bacon/egg crouissant. Everything was tasty and huge. Generous amount of crab. Flavors were perfect for my taste buds. This place was highly recommended and it lived up to the hype. Can't wait to go back.
author: Reginald S.

description:
Pictures look good, doesn't look as good in person or taste as good.

Dirty feeling place.  Want to say wait staff had bandaids on....  Gross.
author: Kristin G.

description: We waited like 5 minutes to get in so that's not bad. service is excellent. we got our food in like 5 minutes. the food is great and the prices are too. we definitely recommend this place for breakfast or lunch. if we get back to San Francisco we will come back for sure.
author: John O.

description: Found this cute brunch place while visiting San Fran. The line looks more intimidating that it is. Was a little chilly sitting outside. The bathrooms are in the next building over and was a little sketchy and dirty. I got the eggs Benedict and it was average. Overall, decent experience.
author: Leslie T.

description: We visited San Francisco a year ago and came here for breakfast. We made it a point to come back for breakfast while we're here and it has only gotten better. My husband had the Meat Lover's omelette and I had the Original Eggs Benedict. His came with toasted sourdough bread slices, as did mine, and hash browns. He also asked for a bowl of fruit. Mine came with the same. Both of our dishes were delicious and fresh, and the fruit was the most tasteful and juicy we've ever had. I just can't imagine going anywhere else for breakfast. It's a relaxed and happy atmosphere, and the service was wonderful. We ordered and 10 minutes, our food was at our table. We definitely will go back before we leave, and also when we come back to visit again.
author: Sara F.

description: I wish I could take this place back to FL with me. The food is so tasty and fresh and the coffee and water flowed. The fruit variety, quality and quantity is impressive. Hands down the best breakfast.
author: Julie M.

description: Rude and freezing. Wouldn't let me take a seat with my 4 year old daughter while we waited for my pregnant wife to park the car. Sat down and asked if there was anything that could be done about how freezing it was. They said no. We walked out.
author: Scott F.

description: BEST egg benedict I've ever had. Fresh fruit comes with almost every meal. The latte I had was just soso. One of the waitresses was kind of impatient, but I guess it was just because of the morning rush.
author: Cass D.

description:
Went here for breakfast. The portions were nice and big. I got a fruit cup instead of hashbrowns for $2 more. That's a bit expensive, but whatever. It also came with 2 slices of toast. They have orange and boysenberry (i think) marmalade to go with it, which was delicious! 

I got the Greek Omelette. The eggs were nice and fluffy, but it wasn't fantaaastic. It was decent. I wouldn't go again though since it was a bit pricey for my liking.
author: Debbie P.

description: We were in SF staying near Fisherman's Wharf and checked Yelp for a good breakfast restaurant. And did we ever find one! Great omelettes, with a Mimosa, and a Bloody Mary. Special hash browns, sour dough toast, and an endless cup of coffee! Service was A+++, very efficient and extremely friendly. The servers all work together. You never feel rushed but everything came out pretty quickly and was 5 star all the way! The only drawback is no bathrooms, you have to use public restrooms, down a funky indoor alleyway 2 doors down. In hindsight, it appears this is fairly normal for SF. In any event, highly recommended, you cannot go wrong! Pretty pricey for breakfast, but again, we found that to be true for the whole city. BUT.... everything we had was well worth the price! They had a nice outside seating arrangement but due to inclement weather we ate inside which was bright and clean, not overly jammed in.
author: Rand T.

description: Well worth the wait. Grand memosa was a nice addition to the CAS omelet. If your staying at the Hyatt, this place is just across the street. Enjoy!
author: Matt M.

description: I came here on Saturday because I was visiting from San Jose, and wanted to find a good breakfast place. After reading the reviews, I was pretty excited to try this place; one thing that I think they should do is put a sign outside that lets people know they need to stand in line, because it is very unclear. I went inside to try and give them my name, and was rudely told by someone who worked there that i needed to stand in line with everyone else (I'm pretty sure she thought i was trying to cut) I didn't know thats how it worked, I thought I had to give my name to them, so that caught me off guard. Aside from her, overall my experience was good, but thats mainly because of the good servers who were very attentive. The food was honestly nothing special; I would say it was decent, but there was a lack of flavor. Aside from that, this place is okay for breakfast.
author: LisaMarie M.

description: We got there at 7:30am on a Friday and there was already a wait. It was worth it! We had the Vivienne Leigh and vegetarian omelette. Both were perfect.
author: Ryan C.

description: I had the Vivien Leigh. It's rare I'm full after breakfast but this left me grasping for stomach space. Why? The fruit! It was a great meal at a charming place with friendly staff. Highly recommended.
author: John P.

description: Ok lots of food. Big portions but was it tasty? Not really. Bacon was pre warmed prob in the microwave. Hash browns also. Not really worth it unless u wanna pig out. Service was good and fast.
author: Hovik B.

description: I had "The Marilyn Monroe" and it was delicious! The French Toast was just the right amount of sweet; but the best part was the FRUIT! There was an assortment of delicious and RIPE fruits on my plate, enough to feed more than one person. I loved the combination of healthy (the fruit) and sweet (the French toast) - perfect for the sweet tooth! There is outdoor seating, and even on a busy day like I went, the wait wasn't more than 20 minutes. The service was efficient and the waiters were polite. The bathroom is down a couple doors and kind of sketchy, that is my only complaint. The bacon was equally yummy.
author: Char M.

description: A must for breakfast while I'm SF. Large portions and a friendly staff make this a favorite for breakfast. Enjoy!
author: John K.

description:
Best breakfast spot on the west coast.  We were visiting San Francisco for the weekend and decided to fill up with a big breakfast before the Alcatraz tour.  
This place fits the bill.  
I had the Vivian Leigh.  Incredible portions, the side of fruit was fresh and was enough to fill me up.  This had had us full for a day of walking around Alcatraz and the Warf.
Show up early because you will have to wait.
author: Gus H.

description: Food is still good, although I would advise you to not come during prime brunch hour or when it's visibly packed because they don't cook your food as well as when things are more mellow
author: Marc L.

description: Food and service was amazing.  There's a lot of employees making sure that our water and coffee were always full. The portion is huge so come with an empty stomach or share a plate.  For additional $3 substitute, you can change hash brown for fresh fruits. Well worth it because the amount of fruits you get; almost half the plate. They have "Hollywood hash brown" instead of regular hash brown for $2.  Food wise, this place is good compared to others but thru Ry additional star for their portion and freshness.
author: LZ T.

description: We stopped here back of May of this year after a weekend in Napa. Desperately searched for a close breakfast spot for 13 hungry girls and stumbled upon this. The wait was long, but we expected that with our party size and the amount of people in front of us. We were seated on the front walkway and it was a bit cramped. The food was amazing. The bread and jam was to die for. The portions were huge and I honestly have not had better fresh fruit in my entire life. Everyone was happy with their dish and it was very reasonably priced. Would go back here again for sure. Also, the menu had tons of options, almost too many! Made it hard to choose.
author: Laura D.

description: My sisters and I are major food snobs and had originally planned to eat breakfast at a place we previously spent some time researching online. Our original choice of restaurant ended up having an hour wait and being short on time, we had to quickly pick some place else. We found Hollywood cafe as a nearby restaurant on yelp. Having many hesitations but being pressed for time, we reluctantly went here to eat. I'm so happy we did! We were all pleasantly surprised and beyond satisfied. Everything was delicious, fresh, and large portions. It was extremely well priced for what you get and I didn't feel like they sacrificed taste/quality for portion. We ended up buying a gift certificate for a friend and will remember this place as a favorite to come to when we visit SF again.
author: Megan R.

description: Terrific spot for breakfast. Good food, great service. Pay the extra upcharge for the fruit. It's worth it.
author: Tom C.

description:
This place was ok. There was a 20 minute wait, but the staff did a good job of keeping the line moving and organized. In general, the service was good.

We ordered the pancakes/fruit and the breakfast burrito. The pancakes were good and the fruit bowl was fantastic. They definitely don't short you on quantity and quality--not your standard honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapple combo. Lots of fresh berries, apples, grapes, oranges. 

However, the breakfast burrito left something to be desired. We found it to be a bit mushy and bland.  Maybe it isn't the best item on the menu, but overall we landed on 3 stars.
author: Sam S.

description: I had the turkey and avocado eggs Benedict here. Portions a bit larger then usual. A great place to share IMO. Will come back again next time I am in town.
author: G M.

description: Meh.  Tourist trap alert. If you have to wait in line there are plenty of other great places nearby to choose from.  I ordered sweet bacon crispy and it came out totally soggy. The beets on the healthy egg were misplaced - cold beets on hot eggs didn't complement each other. The fruit cup was the highlight.  My husband ordered the BAT - bacon was undercooked and pieces way too big; the tomatoes weren't  ripe - hashbrowns were the highlight of his dish.
author: Cheryl S.

description: Well worth the wait. Beautiful food beautiful scenery. Crab Benedict was phenomenal. Hollywood hash was amaze balls.
author: Clayton G.

description: My family and I came here for a filling breakfast before a day of sightseeing. We got what we asked for. The food is delicious, also extraordinary! The fruit salad is like no other, with cherries, apples, oranges, raspberries, etc. the pancakes are fluffy and the French toast was good. The service was typical, nothing special. They weren't so friendly, as they snapped at a simple question, but otherwise, we had a great breakfast. My family and I are definitely ready for the day.
author: Annie V.

description: Loved the food here. It was expensive but the portions were generous! We were also very impressed with the fruit bowl, delicious and a great variety of ripe fruit. Portions were great as well.
author: Dana T.

description:
Had the orange French toast, fruit bowl, and bacon.
Just average....nothing special.  Bacon a little tough.
author: Dave L.

description: For the touristy part of the trip we came to Fisherman's Wharf of course. We had brunch here and it was a beautiful sunny day so we got a table outdoors. The food portions are very generous. I had the crab and avocado omelette which was delicious. I think I need to try that combo more at other places.. :) You can also get sourdough for your toast which is great and after our brunch here I was ready for a food-induced coma. Very much recommended!
author: Ryna D.

description: Had a wonderful breakfast. The sweet maple bacon is amazing. Mimosas are weak, but still tasting. We were thirsty drinks served in tumbler with fruit. Eggs Benedict and  Denver omelette was good, omelette needed salt. But I like more than normal
author: Linda M.

description:
The wait was well worth it! 

Not only were the portions huge and delicious, but our breakfast came quickly and the staff is very attentive with coffee refills.

I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast without breaking the bank.
author: Kevin H.

description: There is a line outside and a waiting list for good reason.  Portion size is huge, like feed three people large.  Sides are big enough to be a meal and it is all so fabulous tasting you will stuff yourself silly because stopping is not a option until food comes out your nose.
author: Megan B.

description: Ok so got here right at 7am when they opened. Reviews looked good and breakfast being my personal favorite I was pumped. Now I'm not a huge sweets guy for breakfast however they had the best French toast I've ever had. My wife ordered that. Mine on the other was an epic Fail!!! I ordered the Denver Omelet. The ratios were all over the place. With rough chopped veggies and eggs ect. Idk just not good. Oh well. I didn't eat it in hopes of a better lunch. Ha ha. Come on lunch. If you want something sweet for breakfast it's ok but no go on the real food.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Great find for lunch in Fisherman's Wharf! Kids loved the chocolate chip pancakes, husband had a good burger and I enjoyed the Audrey Hepburn with pancakes and fruit. Service was slow at first but great after we ordered. Total was around $50 for the four of us.
author: Katy P.

description:
This place is great. It's in a high tourist area so know that in advance. And you'll likely have to wait a bit but it's good. Well above average breakfast food and portions are way too big for one person.
Positive experience for sure
author: Paul T.

description: My husband found this place and we decided to go after his haircut. There was a line, but the service is fast and we were seated after a 20 minute wait. The portions here are good sized and the breakfast food is delicious. Large hash browns that cover half your plate are delicious.  Service is fast and friendly. Also, they make sure your coffee and water are filled without asking.
author: Teri T.

description: I went here today for breakfast and it was amazing, the food was delicious and our waitress Tanz was amazing, polite, courteous and really took care of us
author: Keegan B.

description: Line was LONG but only took 20 minutes to be seated. Well worth the wait!! HUGE portions. Food is excellent. Fruit was fantastic. Nice small environment. Definitely recommend!!
author: Jason S.

description: Gooooood food in huge portions....especially the fruit.  Loved this place!  We ate so much that this meal qualifies for both breakfast and lunch.
author: April B.

description: This place lives up to the yelp hype. I loved how fresh, fast and delicious the breakfast here was. We went on a Thursday morning (no reservations or anything) and were seated within minutes. Service was a little haphazard since we did not have the same server through the whole meal but everyone was smiling and attentive. I had the Marilyn Monroe; the French toast and fruit avalanche did not disappoint! They have wonderful fresh orange juice here too. It tastes just like the juice you'd get on the streets in Morocco or Spain. The OJ really did it for me. Can't wait to go hunting for a place like this closer to home in Atl.
author: Anum A.

description: We are visiting from Chicago area and maybe we are spoiled brats, but this place was awful!!!!  I ordered the crab Benedict - one egg was half raw, the other cooked to an inedible, rubbery nightmare. Crab was fishy tasting and just slapped on a gross whole wheat English muffin with way too much spinach. Coffee was some of the worst I've had.  It cost $5 for one pancake (side) and that came out cold. AND if you want real maple syrup, you must pay $1.50!  Breakfast for two was over $40.  Avoid.
author: Mikala D.

description:
Thank you Hollywood Cafe for your delicious breakfast treats for 3 vacationing, slightly hungover ladies.  I will dream about the Hollywood Hash.  Perfect hash browns just the way I like them - flat and crispy.  AND topped with bacon, mushroom, onion, pepper and melted cheese?  I was in love.

I had a "side" of the french toast also and that was a meal on it's own.  Two nice pieces of french toast with a ton of fresh fruit.  

Another in our party had the crab omelette which we all tried - huge and filled to the brim with fresh crab and avocado.  Made me think of cheating on my Hash on our return visit a couple of days after the first.  But I can't pass up a good hash brown.

North Cali does breakfast right.
author: Tamera B.

description:
Oh man where do I start...

I was taken here by an ex-local who said this place was known for their eggcellent breakfasts. Cute, quaint place with both indoor and outdoor seating. We waited about 30 minutes and they moved pretty quickly considering how crowded they were (and probably always are, I would imagine).

We ordered 2 plates to share. One was the dulce french toast which came with a fried banana and whipped cream to top and a HUGE helping of fresh fruit. I can't even describe to you the heaven I was in when I took my first bite... almost better than crack.

We also ordered a croissant-egg-and bacon breakfast sandwich (gotta get some savory in there to mix with the sweet) and I have to tell you... seriously THE BEST breakfast sandwich I've had. Ever. I am salivating just thinking about it.

I will be back next time I'm in the city. This place is so, so awesome. HUGE portions at affordable and reasonable price.


Mmmmmmmmhhhhhhm food coma worthy.
author: Jessica G.

description: French toast was beyond soggy ! Only good part was the sourdough bread they give you. Disappointed. WAY disappointed. Wait staff didn't even care :(
author: Kaitlyn O.

description: While there was a line when we arrived we waited maybe 10-15 minutes.  They hustle and move people through quite quickly without making you feel rushed.  The restaurant is small with maybe a dozen tables inside and half a dozen more outside. The food was amazing but the portions were big.  They made every effort to accommodate my gluten free friend since they do not offer a gluten free menu.  The staff was very friendly.  The food is worth the short wait!
author: Maria B.

description: Not crowded at 10:30 on a wednesday, super fast service, all in all a great brunch stop.
author: Stephen E.

description: Highly recommend this cafe! Highly recommend the fresh fruit bowl! Berries, cherries, raspberries and more piled high in a beautiful display! Great service as well! Don't miss it!
author: Lisa H.

description: The food and service were excellent.  Also beautiful to look at.  Quick service and inside and outside seating.  The fruit was fantastic as well.
author: Patti H.

description:
The wait was 15 minutes but worth it. Early bird gets the worm, if you arrive early, that is late breakfast gotta wait. 

The staff is quick and efficient in clearing tables. Be a considerate guest and don't linger. It is not a place to leisurely lounge after eating.

Overall service was good. Food was good. My fav was the generous portion of fruit. I did not care for the sweet bacon--stick to the regular bacon. 

I would highly recommend a visit
When in San Francisco.
author: Lila P.

description:
*Breakfast Review*

I found the breakfast at Hollywood Cafe to be large in portion size, but not as spectacular as my fellow Yelpers had led me to believe. The service was average and seating was tight, including the sidewalk seating where you get to sit in front of a ubiquitous line of people waiting to get into the small establishment.

I had a basic omelette and I found it to be good. The accompanying hash browns were as big as my head and actually not greasy. The legendary fruit plate was, again, huge, but dominated by bananas.

Pro Tip: Make sure to sign up on the waiting list once you arrive. Patrons are served in order of the list and and NOT the line. We lost several spots due to that little fact, which in past explains my 3-star rating.
author: Matthew W.

description: WOW! Worth every good review I have seen. The place was busy but the staff was great, food was amazing (taste and presentation) - and this is the freshest squeeze orange juice I have ever had. Give it a try!
author: Justin B.

description: I saw all of the good reviews on this place so we stopped by for breakfast. We sat outside cause it was a nice day and shortly noticed the long line of people wanting to eat here. I ordered the meat lovers omlet (meh) and it was nothing to write about. My wife ordered the vanilla French toast and loved it, I thought it was so-so.
author: Jason L.

description: Wow, the healthy plate breakfast was great! A bowl of fruit packed with berries, citrus, banana, grapes, watermelon, and cherries. I was seated quickly and the service was great. Highly recommend!
author: Jeremy S.

description: Extremely busy even on Monday, brunch time. Food was excellent! Portions are grand - you may want to share. Got the healthy plate and chilaquiles. Healthy plate comes with a whole lb (or so it seemed) of fresh fruit, holy moly. Would definitely recommend to others and revisit when I'm in town.
author: Jane K.

description: I am not always a big fan of having breakfasts in fancy restaurants but last week I made an exception and visited Hollywood Café to see what all the hype was about. Well, I have to admit that it was stupid of me not to visit this amazing place. The breakfast was very fancy yet extremely tasty. The café itself had very modern fancy look which was important to match the taste of the food. I would recommend everyone to visit this place to have a perfect start of the day.
author: Denisse R.

description: Yes you have to wait in line and the lady that manages the list is tough. But the food is probably the best breakfast you can get in San Francisco. And it lasts long as portions are huge.
author: Nannette C.

description: AMAZING! So much fresh fruit and everything we got was beyond delicious. French toast, pancakes and eggs Benedict all done to perfection. Worth the line.
author: Heidi N.

description: Always a wait but it's worth it! Definitely pricey but the food is amazing and the service is great. Very unique menu items. Large side of fresh berries and fruit with the meals. Good portions.
author: J- K.

description: A must when your in the city, wait is kinda long but so worth it. Staff is amazing and always happy. I make it a point to go here every trip I take into the city.
author: Ayla L.

description: Great food, fantastic service! My husband got an omelet and there was a huge pile of veggies on it! I had an entire avocado on my B.A.T. So good! Best breakfast we had while visiting! Defiantly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a delicious breakfast!
author: Emily C.

description: My family and I always have a hard time finding a breakfast place we all love in San Francisco. Lord be hold we found a place! Hollywood Cafe. I got a Club sandwich. It was delicious. Big portions. Fresh fruit with every meal . The buttered sourdough bread they give you with the fresh homemade jam is out of this world. Def. a must have. Big portions at the right price. Love love have I mentioned love this place?
author: Nayobi C.

description: Wow, amazing brunch!!  The hash browns are perfectly done.  The Ranchero dish is great...perfect balance between savory and spicy.  The Gregory Peck dish is a glorified hamburger plate worth trying.  Fresh fruit galore!!  I highly recommend this place, but the wait line is long.  Worth it.
author: David H.

description: The food was amazing!!! Big portions and fresh fruit! There was a bit of a wait when I went but it was well worth it! I will definitely be back when I'm back in San Francisco.
author: Rene F.

description: Long wait but worth it. Fruit was amazing as were eggs and pancakes. Would eat here always if I could even if just for the fruit - berries, Apple, pineapple- amazing! Very diligent staff. One downside is the bathroom situation- they are not in the restaurant and it's a bit of an adventure to find and access them with codes and dark hallways! And one suggestion- don't over use the powdered sugar- food is good without it!
author: Michael R.

description:
I have a very mixed feeling about this place. 

Food is very good. A lot of fruits and vegetables are ripe and fresh. The portion is way too big, and this place wastes a lot of food. The hush brown is as big as a sheet of letter size paper. I don't agree on their portion size.

Service is spotty. Some servers are not very happy to work at this place. Others are cheerful and welcoming.

One thing that bothers me is that servers were eating and drinking at the hostess table. That is not professional and sanitary as they are handling food. Not great food handling standards. You can see through the kitchen, so it's really bad.
author: Nagisa A.

description: This little cafe is in a perfect location! I sat outside on a beautiful March morning and it was perfectly warm. I went with the number 5 which was a delicious croissant sandwich filled with scrambled eggs, bacon and cheese. The sandwich came with a large bowl filled with fresh ripe fruit and a cup of joe. My boyfriend and I loved everything about the cafe. The food was delicious, the service was great even though it was packed beyond belief and the atmosphere was impeccable. We are definitely going back soon.
author: Cindy G.

description:
Love this place! 

You would think people that live in the City would not dare to venture into Fisherman's Wharf to eat... because why would you do that? It's a tourist trap and everything is so-so and other neighborhoods could have hidden gems... well this place is the Wharf's hidden gem (to the locals at least). 

This place has yet to disappoint me. I've been here at least 8 times. Actually, my cousin visiting me once asked me to meet up with him here because he was staying at a nearby hotel. When he initially asked me, I really wanted to counter him and offer other places (Pork Store, Boogaloos, Eats, anything really.. I was plagued by the Wharf...) but I resisted and gave in... glad I did! 

Here are some pointers that make this place great... (for locals) 

- Tourists flock to this place well before 10am because then the tour groups start, the ferry to Alcatraz leaves, they're leaving for Napa, etc. So when you roll out of bed and stroll in, say 11 or 12 , for brunch, its almost always guaranteed you will have a table. 

- You can drive and 99.5% find parking. Why? Because tourists don't drive. Also, they take advantage of their hotel's parking. 

Moving onto the food...

- Generous sides of sourdough with jams and butter
- HUGE fruit bowls
- Fruit with everything! (even as garnish) 
- Hashbrown SHEETS y'all (so amazing)
- I love me some scrambles! (if  you love bacon, get the bacon cheddar scramble. you will NOT be disappointed) I also recommend you substitute for egg whites, it just tasted better to me. 
- Coffee is delicious

Service is prompt and friendly (Those Thai are so friendly) Definitely one of my go to places for a hearty breakfast or brunch. Check them out!
author: Maureen B.

description: Got here 20 minutes before it opened.  First in line.  Within four minutes of opening the entire restaurant was completely filled.  Quick, friendly service!  Ordered bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on wheat bread.  Only disappointment was bread not toasted.
author: Cyndi M.

description:
In the tacky and touristy  F.W. but that is the only downside.
Seated promptly and ordered a great breakfast of banana vanilla French toast.

Came with a lot of strawberries and blueberries and nuts.

The waitstaff was constantly refilling the coffee and were efficient and friendly.
author: Bradley C.

description: Today my wife and I were looking for a good breakfast in San Fran.... Well let me tell you that this place hands down does it right, there was a small wait but the food was amazing. We started with splitting a fruit bowl (SO WORTH IT!) then we each ordered something different. We not only loved our food we felt we had to write the review and pay it forward!
author: Tom L.

description:
First and foremost, I am a San Franciscan so going to any restaurant at or near Fisherman's Wharf causes skepticism.  However, after reading some of the Yelp reviews and viewing a few of the food pics, we decided to try this for breakfast prior to heading off on our Ferry ride.  We are so glad we did!

The one thing that you need to know before getting to the restaurant is that there will most likely be a wait (unless you get here first thing when it opens).  We got there at about 10:30AM and waited for roughly 25 minutes for table for 4.  

The food was great!  The portions are huge!  The size of their hashbrows was out of this world!  I swear it was 8 inches by 5 inches (a friend ordered this as a separate side).  Our main dish were filled with fruit, and I really enjoyed the meal as a whole.  We were full and could not finish our plates.  

On average, we spent about 20 dollars each.  We did purchase beverages and extra sides which adds to the cost.  If you stick with water, and just the meal, you can probably come out spending 15 or less.

The service was quick and excellent!  The people there were very nice to us.  

As a local, I would definitely come here again if I pass by that area during the first half of the day!

So if you are looking for a breakfast spot near the Wharf, look no further!  This is no tourist trap, it's an establishment.
author: Bernie C.

description: Almost gave them 4 stars because service is assembly line style and gave my wife regular eggs when she ordered egg whites but they have a super efficient system accommodating a high demand, with a great product.  Crab omelet was great with copious amounts of real crab meat exceeding expectations.  All food and fruit was excellent so take the food factory with a grain of salt as a necessary evil and enjoy the product of what looks like a tourist trap but certainly delivers for the price.
author: Howard L.

description: I had a big, beautiful fresh salad here. I guess I was surprised because this restaurant is right at Fisherman's Wharf and caters to the tourist crowd. It doesn't NEED to be good to succeed. The ample salad topped with plump raspberries and blueberries was under $10. I'll be back!
author: Paula H.

description:
We walked far and long to get here (in sf terms, that's ~ a mile), and I'd say it was well worth it! With Trader Joe's just a few blocks away, it's a convenient location for that Sunday brunch.

The Food
If you're into American breakfasts and maybe just omelets in general, you'll love this place. My favorite part is that almost all the entrees come with this delicious, refreshing bowl of fresh fruit. Definitely a steal for the price! 

The Ambiance
Think classic American breakfast joint. As an LA girl, love the Hollywood twist.

Tips
Sat outdoors and it was fine, but probably not the best option since it was raining.. Yea, sit indoors unless it's a nice day.
author: Linda X.

description:
Long wait, food is made pretty quickly, food was ok, huge portions, fresh fruit, rude service. They did not treat me like their Gucci bag owner behind me. I asked for refill and was ignore twice, while two other tables were getting royalty service. Their refills came before mine, and they would walk away from our table. 

I'm so down for waiting time, but this place ain't worth it on my list.
author: A C.

description: Had a long line but was well worth the wait. Cute little grandma place, had the Vivian Leigh and was so good. I got the entire fruit selection from the produce aisle. Definitely will go back next time I'm in SF.
author: Steph R.

description: Maybe my favorite brunch place in SF so far! Savory and sweet stuff. You will have enough calories for the day!
author: Mathieu F.

description: Very tasty food! Very friendly, fast, and helpful staff! We went three different mornings, and each experience was excellent. Fresh fruit with most meals. Very happy!
author: Robbie S.

description: If you're in San Francisco you've got to try this place, might be a wait but seriously good food and be warned the portions are good - and fruit with everything
author: Richard M.

description: Read the reviews one Hollywood Cafe and figured we would give it a try, it is next door to our hotel. We got there early and only had a 5 min wait, shortly after the wait went to 30-45 min. The food was fabulous! I had the pancakes and a side of beacon, my wife had the Vivian Leigh, we were astounded when the food came out! The fresh cut fruits were piled high. There is no doubt this was some of the best breakfast I have had. Highly recommended.
author: Chad L.

description: Really good Food BUT unfriendly Service, we didn't feel welcome at all!! They serve in a rush and try to squezee as many people as possible what makes you wanna leave and doesnt feel comfortable there at all. When we asked something about the menu, because it wasnt well explained at some points, they told us to read better...
author: Mer C.

description: Cool little spot near fisherman's wharf. Good food and great staff. The wasabi breakfast burrito is something different but well worth the try. Being a fan of heat, this one hit my tastebuds quite well. Check this cafe out! Very good and affordable.
author: Tyler J.

description: Pretty solid breakfast selection. A bed of hash browns comes with most orders, which is awesome! The brunch menu is your typical fare. Aside from the cute names for the dishes there wasn't anything truly original. The orange juice was good but expensive for the tiny cup you get. The restroom situation is pretty awful--avoid using it if you can.
author: Linda Q.

description:
Nothing about this place seemed "HOLLYWOOD"...but then again, we were seated outside so I have no idea what the ambiance is like inside.

Everyone that knows me, knows I love breakfast and all about breakfast spots!. This one was, "eh."  Food was good; fruits were fresh, and prices were reasonable.  But our table was super small shared between 4 people and a glass of water tipped over and spilled onto my plate.  Who wants a soggy breakfast sandwich? =/

Service was lacking....we had a grumpy Chinese girl. 

It's close to the Ferry if you're looking to grab breakfast nearby.
author: Diana M.

description: Some of the best breakfasts we've had.    The fruit bowl is amazing and the eggs Benedict the best I've had.
author: Casey H.

description:
3.5 stars 

Always looking for a good breakfast and Yelp brought us here.  It's a nice walk from home so it helps to justify a big breakfast.  

We were greeted immediately when we walked in and picked a table away from the door.  Although it's open kitchen, we were surprised that we didn't smell like food when we left - such is the case at Darren's.  There are plenty pictures of Hollywood stars from the past to current.  Each menu has a different back cover.  

Service was friendly and efficient.  I love how they kept my coffee cup full with piping hot coffee!  I dropped my knife - while one person picked it up, another brought me a new one with a napkin within seconds!  

What we had:
2 eggs over easy with Peter's hash brown - $9.95 - generous portion.  The hash brown is topped with bacon, green onion, mushroom and cheese. 

pancake combo with 2 eggs over easy and 3 slices of bacon - $10.25 - pancakes were topped with fresh banana, strawberries and powdered sugar.  hubby really enjoyed the bacon - he said they were crispy but not crunchy, so still had a bit of chew to the meat.

coffee - $2.50 - piping hot and refilled throughout, fantastic!

It's good old American breakfast to fill the tummy.
author: Gloria H.

description: Freakin awesome! Get the fruit, so fresh. You can't go wrong with your order, it's all amazing!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Oh my gosh --- we had no plans for breakfast today, and we decided to eat somewhere near the Fisherman's Wharf.  I had little time to think, so I went with a recommendation off Google.  The Yelp reviews helped solidify a last minute choice at Hollywood.  Thank God it did too.  Amazing neighborhood and view.  Food was insanely amazing.  I had the Vivienne Leigh, and my husband had the Gregory Peck.  Mine was sooooo good.  It came with a monster-sized fruit cup that had the best bananas ever.  Adam replaced his fruit cup with the Hollywood hashbrowns.  Those were enormous.  Little did I know that when I ordered this as a side that it would be bigger than my face.  In the end --- if you want this food --- ask how big the portions are.  It was honestly way too much for two people to handle.  It was some of the best breakfast I have had in my life though.  For real.  Amazing.  Go.
author: Marisol O.

description: Great place!! The food was awesome and wayyy more than enough! The prices weren't bad at all for the food you get, so the value was great. We felt a little rush, but I assume it is a good thing for people who are starving and for tourists who are on the go. We are local, but still the place was good for San Francisco, I might even dare to say that it is better than Mama's and we live right in North Beach, so we do have exposure to some awesome places. Would definitely come back again...this time on a weekday!
author: Aleksandra G.

description:
If there is a line, be sure to go in and write your name down on the list. That is how they will seat you.

I didn't have to wait too long luckily. I loved the decor. They serve HUGE portions so you don't need to order too much. Service is quick as they like quick turn over.

Bathroom key is given only upon leaving (it is a code you have to request)

Great place for breakfast
author: John W.

description:
Checking my recent reviews, you'll discover a lot of breakfast spots attended as a hangover-cure. This place did not disappoint to fit that category and satisfy my post-long-night-shenanigans-headache. 

I got the classic french toast combo. A big ole plate of eggs, ham, fruit, and french toast landed in front of me as I basked in the sun outside. I annihilated everything - the french toast was bomb, fruit was fresh, eggs were eggs, and ham was a little dry. Overall a very fulfilling meal. Coffee was great too.
author: Nick W.

description: Always excellent. Get a side of sweet bacon. Fruit bowls are amazing. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The line tends to move pretty quickly.
author: Meg M.

description:
EXPANSION COMPLETE!

This place has remodeled and has finally expanded! (It was closed from January till March 2011) This is a great place to grab breakfast or brunch (keep in mind they close at 2:30PM) before or after walking around the pier. 

The food is fresh and delicious! They also offer outdoor seating too if you wanna enjoy the nice weather. Try the omelet with the fresh crab and avocado -- Can't get it anywhere else! 

Helpful Tip: If your cheap on the parking, there's the Bay st. parking lot (one with the Safeway and 24 hour fitness) just a block away with a free 90 minute validation. Just putting it out there.
author: Albert L.

description:
It's not often that I would attempt having breakfast near Fisherman's Wharf, but if I have to, this place is probably one of the better restaurants there. Sure, they mainly cater to the tourista crowds that are staying in the nearby hotels and motels, but even a localite can sometimes venture into strange and unexplored territories once in a while.

On Sunday morning (and it is nice to see that they open up bright and early every day for early risers that aren't bent on "Brunch") I had their Greek Omelette. This was an absolutely HUGE breakfast. I think it says it's made with three eggs, but this had to be at least 4-5 eggs worth; plus, the large side of hashbrowns are done extremely well ~ nice and thin and crispy. There was a lot of fresh sautéed spinach and Feta cheese; I would just have rather seen real Kalamata olives in it instead of the flavourless black ones from a can.

If you would care to read a more detailed review of my meal (and a few other stupid unrelated items), please click on my account here and check out my silly breakfastary 'blog.
author: Brian M.

description:
Food was delicious, especially the hash browns. Most meals come with a large portion of seasonal fresh fruit.

Only thing negative is the creepy restroom next door. As long as you don't need to use it, it's perfect.
author: Araceli A.

description: Ordered the beet salad (plus chicken) and BLT sandwich. Food presentation and taste was great. Mango mimosas were delicious and refreshing. Quick service.
author: Nani K.

description:
While staying across the street from here, we would pass by this cafe and each time my nose would start reaching for the amazing smells that were emanating from it.

On our last day, we decided for convenience that we would head over here for breakfast.  I use convenience loosely because even though all we had to do was walk across the street, we still had to wait 20 minutes before getting seated. 

I was having an my-eyes-are-bigger-than-my-stomach moment and ended up ordering the french toast combo which included 3 pieces of french toast, eggs, and choice of meat. I also ordered a mocha. It was vacation, right? 

Well I didn't come close to finishing all of it, but everything I tried was pretty good. I don't know what kind of seasoning they add to their sausage (and eggs), but it was tasty!  Overall, not the very best breakfast I've had but certainly not the worst.

That being said, I still don't know if I'd return here unless I stay across the street again (most likely won't).  I'm also betting SF has a lot better to offer for breakfast that isn't as crowded.
author: Brittany L.

description: Excellent food! I had the 2 eggs scrambled with a ham steak and the sourdough toast. Eggs were perfect! Ham steak was thick and perfectly grilled! The Orange-ish french toast was perfect! Hashbrown potatoes were huge! Staff were gracious and friendly and very good with coffee refills! Definite thumbs up! We were waiting when they opened at 7, and we're seated immediately.
author: Deborah C.

description: Super yummy food! I'd recommend getting the pancakes and French toast. We waited over 30 minutes to be seated but it was definitely worth it.
author: Barrett S.

description: Excellently prepared Denver omelette came with hash browns and 3 thick slices of sourdough toast, orange slices and a couple of fresh cherries. Coffee was okay but free refills  made a good bargain . Small and comfy Cafe setting waiting list from 7:30 to 8:15 the morning I was there. Highly recommended. Skip IHOP and enjoy the local fare here.
author: Tom B.

description: Sunday brunch was so worth the wait! My sisters ordered delicious mochas, and I had a regular coffee which was a little weaker than I typically like. My group ordered 2 eggs and bacon, dolce French toast, crab eggs Benedict, and blueberry pancakes and shared - they were all really tasty! Hash Browns were to die for, and they were not stingy with the fruit
author: Ann S.

description:
My son was playing on his iphone and asked Siri for a breakfast recommendation close to our hotel.  Hollywood Cafe was recommended so we decided to give it a try.

The food was fresh, well prepared and very good tasting.  The service was great.  My coffee cup was never empty and the food was served quickly.  One member of our party ordered an omelet with specialty hash browns (which cost more) and the waitress said that she wouldn't recommend the specialty hash browns with that particular omelet because it would be way too much bacon.   She could have gone for the sell and made more money but we appreciated her unsolicited advice.  

Thanks Siri, next time we are in the City we won't need to ask you where to eat, we'll go straight to Hollywood Cafe.
author: Lyn A.

description:
A-OK brunch spot. Nothing special, and they try and rush you through as fast as possible, but a solid breakfast in you're in the market for standard fare.

Had eggs & the Hollywood hashbrowns (fine but probably wouldn't upgrade them again), and had a bite of the vanilla bean French toast which I really liked.
author: K. D.

description: Worth the wait. Expect to wait in line on the street but it won't be that long. Remember to sign in first then get in line. We were in San Francisco for 4 days and ate here for 3 of them. Food is good, portions are large, coffee is decent. If you in the Warf it's the best option for a sit down breakfast.
author: Jason B.

description: This is probably the most efficient restaurant I have ever been to, the food was great with a beautiful presentation. Service is fast but also very friendly. I will make a point to go back when in the area, my kids loved it.
author: Michele M.

description: I loved the bacon and eggs there.make sure to go there one of my new favorites!And the French toast is the bomb! Went there twice with my family. I Recommend it.
author: Steve B.

description: To be honest I think this place is a bit of a tourist trap. I live nearby and can't really say there's anything particularly special about this place. Service is mediocre. They have a nice outdoor patio space for sunny days. The food itself is pretty standard which is fine because it's diner. The interior is kind of a mess. Definitely better options if you walk up a bit farther to North Beach. I will say the portions are HUGE and come with a ton of fresh fruit.
author: Ana D.

description: Went there at 8am on a Saturday, only had to wait 10 min, but got to park right across the street. If there is a line when you get there, go inside and put your name on the list then get in line. There are places to eat outside as well as inside, you can request either. The staff is very, very friendly. The food was good, but the pancakes were not as big as I expected. I believe there are only 2 flavors of pancakes; buttermilk and blueberry. We were served a complimentary piece of toast for each person as well. There are more things than just pancakes and fruit; eggs, french toast, and hash browns to name a few. Everything comes with fruit on the plate, so you don't HAVE to order the ala-carte fruit bowl, although it is good. The kids meal is a good amount for the price when compared to the other meals. Overall it was pretty good, but not AMAZING.
author: Austin Y.

description: We had breakfast here this morning and it was awesome! Our daughter had the blueberry pancakes and they were nice and fluffy. My husband had the Eggs Benedict with kimchi and sweet potatoes and he really liked the unique taste. I had the Vivien Leigh and it was so good. The fruit bowl was amazing! So much fruit and each kind was perfect!  Will definitely come here again and recommend to friends.
author: Monica S.

description: Excellent butter toast and homemade jams, raspberry and orange marmalade. Shrimp and crab Benedict was amazing. Hash browns crispy and yummy. The fresh fruit was wonderful too!
author: Ellen S.

description: Omfg! Julia Childs Gordon Ramsay Bobby Flay and all the rest watch out!  Absolutely the best eggs benny I've had in a very long time. From presentation to the mouth, fantastic. I should have taken a photo so you could see. I think I'm coming back tomorrow on our final day of the trip!
author: Ed G.

description: Good food and fast service. Felt a little rushed, but at peak breakfast time it was expected.
author: Ryan N.

description: Just finished breakfast and our family of 5 (we have three kids) gives this restaurant 5 stars. We especially loved the seasonal fresh fruit, attentive service and free coffee refills. They even sent us out the door with a cup of coffee to go! Would recommend this place to anyone who wants a comfortable breakfast with indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Wynter A.

description: Breakfast is very important to me and this place delivers what is expected. .. food was great fresh and plenty. Is pretty busy but with good reason...close to pier 39 cant wait to come back
author: Roy C.

description: Where I live you can't find a meal with diversity and creativity, this restaurant has both. Super big delicious portions, I recommend sharing. You have to wait in a line so get there early!
author: Slade S.

description: Great breakfast place with large portions and all the plates come with a large variety of fresh fruit. If you are in the fishermans wharf area a must go!
author: Nick V.

description: Seemed like a lot of people waiting but it was quick seating sat morning. Food was quick and hot. The staff not so friendly and a bit rude. But for the many other over priced and slow brunch places this is worth it. Piled high fruits with every plate. Huge hashbrowns. Id def come back.
author: Leo M.

description: This was the best breakfast we had in California!! I read the reviews and suggested this to my group of travelers. We arrived just after 8am, and had a 5-10 minute wait.
