This is not a big place, but they make good food. My husband enjoyed the Orange juice, which tasted fresh and delicious. They kept the coffee coming for the coffee enthusiasts in the group. The sweet bacon was good. The Hollywood plate was huge and very filling. I ordered the grand mariner French toast which had very pleasant flavor. The fruit that comes on the  plate is fresh and plentiful. Seriously we had enough to have a go box of fresh fruit, so good. I would come back here again and recommend it!
author: Megan M.

description:
No complaints. They service was very good, we only had about a 15 min wait for a table which was outside. As most know, early am San Francisco can be a little cold, which is was. Over all the food was super good. French toast and eggs. They move a lot of food through there!
I will go back
author: Stephen T.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast places in SF - been there for lunch a couple times with good results, especially the hamburgers.  I've tried the omelettes, eggs benedict, and the croissant sandwich, and they've all been really good.  I definitely recommend the fresh fruit bowls - perfectly ripened fruit with a lot of flavor.  The hash browns, which are super thin, perfectly browned, and cover about half the plate, are a real treat.  I like how they serve sourdough bread with jams while you're waiting on the food - nice touch.

The place is fairly small on the inside and it can get a little cramped.  They do offer seating outside but it's not necessarily a great view or charming.

The service has been consistently friendly and attentive, even when they're busy.  And this place does get busy, especially in the summer months.
author: Steve F.

description: This place was awesome!  Eggs Benedict, French toast, Hollywood hash browns were all exceptional.
author: Bill C.

description: Excellent Service, Very good Food..a bit pricey for us Texans but hey...it's SF...they  pay $45.00 per night for parking and think its okay.
author: Anthony H.

description: Got the traditional eggs Benedict which was very good. I was more impressed with the mountain of fruit they stack on your plate. Extra $3 but it's worth it.
author: Austin H.

description: Small cafe but worth the wait. Order the Hollywood hashbrown, so GOOD!! The side of fruit is a must, delicious, sweet, and fresh!
author: Sabrina C.

description: One of the best breakfasts eva!  Seriously you cannot go wrong!  Food was amazingly fresh, portions were crazy big, service was excellent!  Well worth the 20-30 minute wait!  The "Audrey Hepbun" is the pancakes with an amazing fruit plate consisting of bananas, grapes, apples, cherries, raspberries, blackberries, pineapple, cantaloupe, oranges and honeydew melon!  Mouth-watering!  Highly recommend!
author: Lisa D.

description:
I've passed by this place over a thousand times, but I finally got to try it for brunch.  Aside from the huge portions, the ingredients are fresh and fulfilling.  The fruit bowl is enticing with its vivid colors and nutrition.  Whether it's any of the Hollywood star combos or a variation of eggs benedict, you'll be satisfied with a thin slice of hash browns to cover the plate.  However, it can be rich and salty especially the eggs benedict prima with olives and thick hollandaise sauce.  Leave room for toast with butter and marmalade or berry spreads.  The freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee helps start the day with a refreshing taste too.

The service is fast and friendly, but can requires reminders for water and check-ups on how is the meal.  They can also be rude with interruptions during conversations for the sake of removing plates without asking you if you're finished or would like to box it up.  The outside seating is great for sunny days.  Otherwise, there is ample room inside with a clean and bright ambiance.  Parking can be tough on the street, but there are nearby lots.
author: Jenny L.

description: Awesome place for a quick breakfast if you're staying in one of the hotels near the Wharf.  Good home style cooking, friendly staff, speedy service!
author: Nat N.

description: Amazing breakfast in San Francisco.  Portions were huge and the amount of fruit served was a delicious meal on it's own.  Food was all exceptional.  The French toast was the best I've had. Great restaurant!!
author: Mike M.

description: Honestly food and service was pretty good. We kind of went there when they were closing, we were the last ones to leave and felt a little pushed which is ok, but we had kids, not mad but everything else made up for it. The food, mimosas, and service was great. Next time I'll go a little earlier to give them a 5 star!
author: Hamed A.

description: Food is awesome!  I have never received THAT many berries in a fruit bowl before.  We ate here two mornings in a row during our stay.  Only problem is it is TINY... so if you don't want to wait an hour for inside seating, you have to sit outside... and outside is cold... Because... you know... It's San Francisco.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Those fruit bowls you see all the pictures of... Yeah, they're all they're cracked up to be. The best I've ever had! 

Overall this a great breakfast spot, just a hop, skip, and a jump from Pier 39, which makes it an outstanding location. All of the food is outstanding, service is very good, and prices are reasonable (for San Fran). I subtracted one star just because I didn't think much of the coffee. This is important for a restaurant of it's kind.
author: Brian W.

description: One of the best breakfast places I've been to.  Complementary bread and jam that are delicious.  Everything I've had has been great.  Lots of fruit with meals.  Fresh squeezed OJ.  People have begun to find this place so the lines are longer than last year, but it moves quick...  I will be back here next trip.
author: Michael B.

description:
The manager emailed me a few times apologizing for the food which was a nice gesture. I thanked him but told him to be honest I really could not raise my rating since 3 stars means "A OK" and I did not find it in my case BUT once again proves how good the customer service here is!

While I stand my my original comments about the food the managers apology was sincere and appreciated. I tell each person try out this place and see for yourself, this was just MY opinion not to be taken as absolute.
author: Mike D.

description: Phenomenal breakfast. Fresh fruit was amazing and we are from Florida and used to lots of fresh fruit. French toast and  bacon was wonderful. Service was superb. Highly recommended!
author: Kim P.

description:
Now Ive never had egg benedict before in my whole life. Thats the truth,  not lying. I had left the house in a hurry and didnt have time for breakfast. I pass this place a couples times and decided to buy my breakfast to go. There were many choices to chose from, I had a hard time deciding.

 I finally ended up with the egg benedict. The service was fast and the waiters and waitresses are very nice. The food was delicious I devoured the thing in less than 5 minutes. I didnt know if it was because I was very hungry or the food was delicious. Too bad they didnt have a take out menu if they did, I didnt see any around.  Next time I pass by I just might buy another delicious item off their menu =)
author: Jen M.

description:
Terrible service and extremely touristy spot. Not a great breakfast stop if you're a local.

The server didn't even say hello before asking us if we wanted drinks, by saying "Drinks?" from behind me at the table. I couldn't even see who was talking to me.

Moments later, a different server showed up and without a greeting asks "ready to order?". We literally had been sitting at the table for no more than 30 seconds.

My girlfriend wanted a side of fruit instead of toast, but they brought the toast anyway. When she mentioned that she didn't want the toast, they took the plate and dumped the toast into the garbage. What a waste. You think they'd check if any other tables in a super busy restaurant needed a side of toast.

The sides of fruit are indeed large, just as everyone says. However they're so big they just fall all over your other food. My girlfriend's eggs were covered in berries and melon. The portion is so large we were completely unable to finish it between the two of us, which feels like a huge waste.

The whole experience felt very rushed and awkward.

There were some good parts though: The food was good. It also came out extremely fast.
author: Eric A.

description: As long as you are not picky on where you eat and do not have a large group, the wait time isn't bad..... The food was wonderful.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Myself and my pal waited in line for about half an hour for a seat at this place. Watching the ridiculously oversized portions being brought out to tables. By the time we sad down we were both starving and shaking with excitement. As amazing as the food looks the flavours didn't quite live up to appearance. The hash browns tasted quite greasy and there just wasn't any exciting flavours. Pretty decent value for San Fran and could be shared between two easily.
author: Rachel M.

description: This is one of the best brunch place I've ever been in my life, the food was amazing and everyone was so nice! They use good champagne in the mimosas, give you tons of fresh fruit, and the "shot" of espresso I ordered was about the size of a cup of coffee. It was huge. Amazing. Two thumbs up.
author: Maya S.

description: Food was absolutely delicious.  Fresh fruit was amazing. My wife said this was best eggs Benedict she has ever had. Kids loved the pancake combo. The sourdough toast was delicious. Would come back in a heartbeat.
author: Greg C.

description:
Saw this place get high marks from TripAdvisor, but was sorely mistaken. Service was alright, but the food is a disaster. I ordered the CAS omelette, which was overcooked and bland. My bf ordered the huevos rancheros, which ended up being a strange mix of canned salsa, tortilla chips and a flavorless egg. The only decent item was the Hollywood hash. It did not help that the food was cold when it was brought out to our table.

You want a good breakfast in SF? Go to Mama's instead!
author: Jules Y.

description: Probably the best breakfast I have ever had.  My wife and I ate there twice on a two day visit.  Go early to avoid the lines.  By all means ensure that you get a fruit cup.  I know that doesn't sound exciting and I am a bacon, eggs and chilaquiles guy, but the fruit cup is tremendous.  As is everything else we tried on their menu.  If you are staying on Fisherman's Wharf it is an easy walk.  If I was a local I would tolerate the tourists just to eat here.
author: Erik P.

description: I have been going to Hollywood Cafe for years and had both experience for to-go and dine in. If you do have the time to wait, eat at the restaurant is a better choice. If you are solo and not have much time to wait, take out would not hurt, if work or home is not far away. The reason being is that the flavors go away faster than usual for to-go orders. My work is about 4 blocks away. French toast with the big bowl of fresh fruit is my favorite at Hollywood. Customer service wise, the male servers are usually nicer than female servers but if you care about the food more, then you are good to go.
author: Lianna D.

description: I am staying at the Hyatt so I walked over to grab a sandwich to go. I ordered a club, on sourdough with no tomatoes. I get back to my room and its a huge sourdough roll with 5 chunks of head lettuce and 3 pieces of bacon. So, I called and the person who answered said to come back and they'd fix it and hung up. They have a delivery service and should've offered to deliver it to me but....I just walked back over. I reiterated what sandwich I had and she looked in the box and told me it was all set. I get back to my room only to open the box and see tomatoes on my damn sandwich. Really? You would think NOT putting something on would be easier. The sanwich was definitely not worth the pain in the ass.
author: Christina M.

description:
French toast and fresh fruit - delicious and lots of awesome fresh fruit -- strawberry, blueberry, kiwi, banana, grape, honeydew, canteloupe (just two pieces!)
Scramble harmony sub mushrooms for avocado - delicioso
Side of chicken apple sausage - savory
Fresh oj
Solid coffee
Fast and attentive service, friendly too

And worth the walk from union square
author: renee m.

description:
My husband and I didn't want to wait in the loooong line at another breakfast place up the hill, so we thought we'd give Hollywood Cafe a try. We are very happy we did, and we went back for a second go around this morning. 

Pros: Little to no wait, very friendly service, delicious food, hot coffee, and pretty good prices for being in the middle of a tourist area (and no tourist-trap vibe).

Cons: None that I can think of.

If you're at all adventurous with your food, definitely try the Kimchi-Tofu Eggs Benedict!  It was spicy and completely addictive!  Excellent hollandaise.

We went to the local Trader Joe's to stock our hotel room with some on-the-go breakfast items, but I have no doubt we'll be back for at least one more sit-down before we head home to the East coast.
author: Olivia R.

description: Our daughter is very allergic to nuts and they were extremely careful and diligent with our food. Portions were huge!  We had the french toast, with eggs done in a variety of ways, and also had an order of eggs benedict. The hash brown was spectacular, and we were impressed with the fruit that accompanied the meal - both in terms of serving size and in terms of freshness. My only negative feedback would be that the Canadian bacon was not, in fact, peameal Canadian bacon. But....this seems to be a common misconception amongst our southern neighbors, as opposed to being a specific criticism of this restaurant. :)
author: Andrew J.

description: The best breakfast ever , next door to Best Western Tuscan that's were we stayed. All family enjoined , food delicious and fresh .Hundred times yes , will come back before leaving SF for sure!!!Well kids loved this place so second   breakfast today before we leave to Chicago , fruit so fresh  / anything from menu goes , any vegetarian in the family this is the place to come / the best everybody enjoy!!!!!
author: Vaidas V.

description: The food taste good and has HUGE size with reasonable price, it's a "MUST try" brunch restaurant at fisherman's wharf.
author: Veronica X.

description:
We went there on vacation on Easter morning around 9. There were seven families ahead of us on the list but we were promptly seated within 15 minutes. 

Our family ordered French toast with fresh fruit, Denver omelet, blueberry pancakes and a breakfast wrap. All of them were amazing! The fruit served here is especially delicious and fresh! 

I would eat here every morning if I could!
author: C C.

description: Such a great find! Huge portions and fresh ingredients. The fruit was incredible and such a large portion. My French toast plate, called "the Marilyn Monroe", had a generous helping of French toast and the fruit bowl was overflowing onto the plate. Very good. Definitely recommend.
author: Julianne P.

description: Forgot to do the review and just now getting to it.  Anyway, it's our second time to here and they have not disappointed us.  Will keep coming back to this place when in SF.
author: Jon N.

description:
I came here with my mother for brunch and we had a really nice meal.  She had a veggie omelet and fruit bowl (13 dollars) and I had scrambled eggs with chicken sausage that came with a fruit bowl and free tea or coffee (11.00).  We both received three slabs of hot toasted sourdough bread with butter.  My mom liked her omelet which had a nice mixture of arugula, mushrooms, and bell peppers.  I loved my fruit bowl-- there were ten different kinds of fruit in it!  The pineapple was obviously cut from a fresh pineapple and there were huge chunks of it.  I was really impressed with the freshness and size of my fruit bowl which is easily worth 7-8 dollars. The service was quick in the beginning but it did take a while for me to get my bill.  The bathroom is located outside of the restaurant and inside an alley.  

The service was friendly.  I didn't like how my scrambled eggs tasted (it tasted like it was mixed with too many cooking additives) but otherwise, it was a good and generous meal.  With tip, 30 dollars will get you and a friend a very hearty brunch.  I highly recommend Hollywood Cafe!
author: Lorissa W.

description: I visited this restaurant on a Tuesday morning and the wait was approximately 30 minutes. I ordered the eggs and steak patty. The food was ok but not worthy of 4 or 5 stars. The coffee was average as well. Nothing to rave about as other reviews state. The cost was a little pricey but it was expected due to the area and tourism. Overall it was average...I've had better.
author: Dave J.

description: Long line and short tempered hostess. Suggest you pick a table inside or risk being watched by the hopeful patrons standing in line outside watching you eat on the sidewalk. Good coffee. Quick and friendly service once inside. Bland egg white scramble (I need to learn to not expect flavour when ordering egg white dishes). But a very generous, almost too generous fruit bowl with really fresh fruit. The serving size bothered us because it seemed like everyone was not finishing their meal and wasting all this food. I couldn't finish 1/2 of my bread, 1/2 of the egg white scramble and 1/2 of the fruit bowl. And I was pretty well stuffed in order to not waste as much as possible. Prices were on par with SF wharf area. We didn't go back the next day because of the line, gawking, wasted food and sharp toned hostess.
author: Barbara C.

description: Crab omelet was amazing. Large portions and fresh. If your looking for some fresh fruit with your breakfast this is the place to eat.
author: Rod S.

description: Nothing short of amazing! I started off with a mango mimosa, they use fresh squeezed orange juice and a mango purée..it was delicious. I ordered the bacon avocado scramble with a fruit bowl and it was enough food for two people. They give you a large bowl of very fresh fruit and the bacon they put on the hash browns and in the scramble was thick cut and smoked. This place is a must stop for anyone in San Francisco, I will definitely be eating here again!!!
author: Cristina H.

description: Stopped in while on vacation in San Francisco. We loved it so much, we ate here two mornings in a row. This is probably the best breakfast cafe I have ever visited. Even if there are a lot of people waiting, don't make the mistake of leaving as the place turns over tables very quickly. Overall, amazing service and amazing food.
author: Justin L.

description:
Overpriced and Underwhelming! 
Decided to try this place. Very pushy to get your order but after that no one to be found. I ordered the Dungeness Benedict. They wouldn't sub fruit for toast, said it would be $6 extra....seriously?!?! Then when it came out, eggs were completely cooked, like hard boiled. They are supposed to be warm and runny. The crab WAS NOT DUNGENESS! It is crab claw meat from a can (you can see and taste the difference!). Had to flag someone down to have it taken care of. Never did someone come to ask how it was or refill my drink, nothing. I would never recommend you going here....EVER!
author: Cheryl M.

description: First morning in SF and was starving for breakfast. HC right next door to our hotel so we had breakfast there. Food was great, service was superb and the people-watching experience was a lot of fun.
author: Bill A.

description: I'm a french toast connoisseur, and this was some of the BEST I've ever had! Upgraded to the pure maple syrup, and glad I did. The fruit served with was fresh and delicious as well. The coffee was so good, I enjoyed it black. Service was excellent. Will definitely be back!
author: Leslie S.

description: My blueberry pancakes were good. The line moves pretty fast, but be aware that there is probably a "to go" line and a "dine in" line. We had a misunderstanding there.
author: L V.

description: Great breakfast place! Huge portions. My wife had the salmon and shrimp eggs Benedict. I had the Vivian Leigh sandwich. Both meals were wonderful. And the fruit - abundant, fresh and delicious! Great service too! The place is run like a well-oiled machine.
author: Stephen M.

description:
So I was torn on whether to give this place three or four stars, I would have rather given it 3.5 if there was that option.

I've decided to go with three stars for a couple of reasons, I'll start with the good stuff.

PROS:
- Food portions are large and delicious!
- Their fruit platters are amazing.
- Had their omelette and Hollywood hash browns, delicious!
- Wait generally isn't too long if you're a party of four or smaller.
- Quick service, I mean really quick.

CONS:
- No real clear direction for newcomers on getting seated, you just walk in and try to find a waiter or put your name on a waiting list.
- Tables are very small, we had a group of four and there was no room to place anything on the table after we received our meals.
- For a group of five or more, expect to wait upwards of 30 minutes around 10am, and make sure the entire group is there or they will skip you.
- Feels like you're rushed all the time for them to move on to the next customer.
- The real reason I gave it three stars, the giant hair that was sticking out of my omelette.

Overall, this is a good place and I would love to give it four stars, but the hair in my food really killed it for me.  I would go back, much better option than the restaurant across the street from it as well.
author: Chris R.

description: One of my favor brunch to go to. Their omelette serve in a large size with side like fruit :) decent price consider for the large portion. I had their teriyaki sandwich today. Great flavor. Definitely check it out.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
BEST PLACE EVER!!!!

if you are looking for a nice, warm breakfast/brunch/ with your friends or whoever you are coming with, this is the place to go. Also the place is small, so don't come with over 5 people. Sometimes there is a long wait, but good then I never had to wait or I would've left (too impatient) lol. It's also very inexpensive I only spent $12-13 and you get your money's worth for the portions they give you. I came here once with my dad and he hardly finished his food, and he's a big guy (muscle wise) who likes to eat. I also love to eat as well and hardly finished. 

My favorite dish is the Audrey Hepburn and every time I get this dish the fruit I get is always fresh! I've been to some restaurants that give you fruit salad as the side and they weren't that great. But here it's amazing. I haven't tried any of the egg dishes because I HATE eggs! (I know I'm weird) So I wouldn't be able to help in the part but everything else is great! 

Everyone needs to come here and plus, you are right by pier 39 and the wax museum etc.  So you get to burn that load off. 

Also the workers there are super friendly!
author: Oisis J.

description: Came here and had a 45 minute wait. Located right where the wharf is, so it definitely seemed like a tourist spot. I got to try the French toast and one of their omelets and they were very filling. It is a cute small spot, so be prepared to wait.
author: Susie N.

description:
One of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time.  

We were seated immediately on a busy Saturday morning, orders taken before we even had a chance to sip our water, and our food was literally on our table in under 3 minutes.  I was shocked, and expected something pre-made and lukewarm since it couldn't have possibly been prepared THAT fast, but sure enough they had my custom added ingredients in my delicious egg scramble, cooked to perfection!!  

The hashbrowns were super thin, which I love, so every bite is deep fried goodness.  The sausage chunks and avocado were generously portioned, also a huge bonus since I can not get enough of either.  The eggs were cooked just right, the perfect consistency and temperature.  I was literally in breakfast heaven.  

The wait staff are in a big hurry so there isn't a lot of chitchat or time wasted, but the service was quick and thorough and I was very impressed.

My friend had a whopping pile of french toast with grilled banana and piles of fresh berries.  It looked divine.
author: Shannon H.

description: Best breakfast in San Francisco.   Outstanding food incredible fresh fruit with it too.   Staff are very very good also.
author: Joe R.

description: What a pleasant surprise!  I ordered a bacon and cheese croissant sandwich with a side of fruit featured on the front of the menu.  The fruit was the most spectacular serving I have ever seen, very little filler melon too, like 10 different fruits.  OJ was great too!
author: Nik N.

description: Place was busy but were seated promptly. It is a bit cramped but considering its SF then i suppose its ok. The service was ok. The food was good. I got the chilaquiles. I just wished they would use "home" made chips and not store bought chips.
author: Jay L.

description: I had the Salisbury Steak breakfast & the bf had french toast. I loved the jams on the table and everything tasted great. They bring toast to the table first thing, which is great if you're ravenous in the morning! Coffee, OJ & $40.00 later and we were pleased!
author: Chandra M.

description: We stayed at The Holiday Inn and were searching for a good breakfast spot in the area.  What everyone posted was true..... The servings were generous,  mountains of fruit,  and the service was excellent.  Our coffee cup was never empty.  It was raining and we were seated outside, but the heaters kept us warm.  We're coming back for sure... Our new Favorite breakfast spot :)
author: George D.

description: Not sure all the hype, decent food, but poor service and when the bill comes you have NO idea what you're being charged for. All charges on ticket were labelled misc tax, so you have no clue. If you use plain syrup for your whole order of pancakes you get charged 1.50. My we love to go to breakfast and this place due to service and how it's run would not wait in line.
author: Jessica F.

description: This place has really good breakfast food.  We were looking for something off the beaten path of the pier and this was a perfect find.  Good, fast service. Reasonable prices, and Great food!
author: Brock V.

description: On a college tour trip my daughter and I did our research and found this delightful place. After a morning of exploring we enjoyed brunch. Great coffee, super fresh ingredients great atmosphere.  Will be back and we tell everyone we know to try it!
author: Jean B.

description: amazing people and food! three days in a row we had breakfast there, they remembered us and asked about our day. Vivian Leigh is a grilled croissant with scrambled eggs and bacon with the best fresh fruit I have ever had. the pancakes and trench toast were incredible! the best food I had on SF! wish I could go weekly as it is just a breakfast and lunch place, a tiny place--worth your wait so put your name on the list!
author: Susan M.

description: Tasty coffee, good simple homestyle breakfast in a nice location with large portions and quality fruit pouring over the little side bowl as seen in photos.
author: Pepe L.

description: Great breakfast! Huge and I mean huge portions! Amazing and friendly help!!! If you are in San Fran check it out. Highly recommend Hollywood Cafe!
author: Beth K.

description: Great breakfast and lunch. French toast and fruit bowl is to die for. Hash brown burrito is great. Ask for fresh salsa. Sourdough toast is great while you wait with fresh jam ($2) fresh oj amazing and great hot cocoa. You'll wait 15-30 minutes but it's worth it. They turn and burn the tables quickly. Bring a jacket in case you sit outside.
author: Peter H.

description: Delicious food! It was pretty busy when we first arrived. You need to stand in line outside, at the front they will ask how many in your party. If your entire party is not present the staff will skip over you. They asked us how many we had (2) and asked the couple behind us. The waiter then said that they had a large table available and if we would be ok with sharing we could just divide the table into two. Both of us were agreeable to that. Directing us to our table they pointed to a round table in corner. It was set for a party of 5. Both us and the other couple were thinking it was going to be more rectangular and less intimate. It work fine in the end we chatted and ate:) I had the chilaquiles which come with a sheet and I mean SHEET of crunchy hash browns, it was super tasty. On top was a whole avocado, who doesn't like avocado?!? My boyfriend has the eggs Benedict with a sheet of crunchy hash browns and he was full after one but forced the second one down because it was so good! They have a variety of mimosas, I had the mango and my boyfriend had the grand. The grand was really a regular orange mimosa. Service was good, over all a tasty experience that you should defiantly try.
author: Ryan E.

description: The best breakfast near the wharf!! Service is excellent . Even with the long lines the wait was not bad. There was 8 people in our party and everyone enjoyed!!!
author: Tiffany B.

description:
I had very high expectations about this place, judging by previous reviews and photos of the food I had seen on Yelp. Unfortunately I was disappointed. I ordered the crab omelette. This was a $33 breakfast for one including coffee, an upgrade to Hollywood hash browns, OJ and a standard tip. I would have expected a better experience for that price. 

The food was lacking flavour, and the omelette needed a lot of salt and Tabasco to be palatable. The biggest disappointment was the fact that my omelette arrived cold! The hash browns were hot at least, but that didn't make up for the barely lukewarm morsels of crab and cold pieces of avocado that made up the majority of my omelette. The hash browns were very mushy and soggy, not crisp like I had hoped. They had a bizarre bright orange artificial-looking cheddar cheese sauce creepily drizzled on top, which reminded me of a cross between cheese wiz and cheese in a can. Everything was piled up on a very small plate, making for a messy goulash-like concoction on my plate. Sound appetizing? 

I was served by 3 different waiters during my short visit. None were bad but none were great either. They were in auto drive. It took forever to get my first drink. I found myself slightly annoyed as I waited for my beverage, while I saw a few other tables get faster service. I was not even offered or brought water. To me, that's a necessity at any restaurant. 

Hollywood Cafe was certainly not an experience I'm planning to repeat, especially for the price. In one word: overrated! I think the major draw is the huge portions.
author: B C.

description: Small place with a waiting line in front of it. But it is worthy. I really liked the Meat Lovers eggs and the fruit bowl.
author: Hugo M.

description: My family loved eating here. I had the orange French toast which was totally unique. I really enjoyed it. The service was good and they kept our drinks full. The hash browns were yummy too. They served lots of fresh fruit with my meal as well which was a neat surprise. The portions are large though - we could have shared. A good value.
author: Audra S.

description: There is usually a 45 minute wait to sit, but the experience is unique.  Good food at a good price, diverse menu, and it is a place where you will return.  Every time I make my way into San Francisco I try to eat breakfast here
author: Jose Manuel C.

description: I really don't understand the fascination with this place. Why people will stand in line for mediocre food and employees who don't have a clue. I live down the street so I'm not a tourist that doesn't know any better. I walk by this place daily. Outside the place smells like urine and the kitchen is filthy with 0 atmosphere. You're lucky if you don't get food poisoning. I would avoid this place and go to Mamas. Heck even Denny's is better.
author: Leland L.

description: First off the orange juice was freshly squeezed, and it was delicious. I ordered the pancake combo with eggs and sausage, and it was so tasty! Everything we ordered from the French toast to the fruit was amazing! The servers were super friendly so that's always a plus in my book
author: Janine S.

description:
Don't let the location fool you, there may be tourists swarming about, but this place is legit.

The side of fruit alone could get this place 4-5 stars. All fresh, ripe, colorful, and spilling over the sides of the bowl it comes in.

Another surprise, when I opted for tea over coffee the options brought out were a slew of Organic Numi teas vs. any of the many cheaper options.

Something for everyone on the menu, breakfast or lunch, healthy or indulgent, fruity or fried, I'd not hesitate to come here again with friends, out of town guests, or my parents.

Prompt service, not much of a wait, and timely refills of our beverages rounded out a pleasant morning, brunching in the sunshine.
author: Alissa A.

description: Food was delicious. The chicken sandwich was moist and flavorful. The French toast cooked with a crunchy crust. Fruit on the plate was amazing. Service, however, seemed a little pushy especially since it wasn't so busy.
author: Heng C.

description: This place has amazing food! So my friend and I came here on a Saturday morning and there was probably a 5 minute wait. We got seated outside and immediately were brought some delicious warm flaky bread and water in Mason jars. This small cafe located on a semi quiet street in the Wharf won me over with not only its delicious food but the awesome service. Our waitress was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our breakfast. I ordered the dolce French toast and a side of the Hollywood hash brown. The French toast was three pieces covered in a caramelized banana with walnuts,  powdered sugar, and maple syrup! In addition to that, I got fresh fruit on the side. The Hollywood has brown was delicious as well. The hash brown was perfectly combined with melted cheese, peppers, bacon, and onion to give it an extra spice and it was definitely not a side serving. The hash brown could've been a meal of its own, it was so huge! The food was delicious and I will definitely be coming to this place next time I'm in the city!
author: Sandra C.

description: Fruit bowls are great. Also had a croissant sandwich and my husband had the special of the day, a Salisbury steak. Everything was great!
author: Christi G.

description: There's a bit of a wait but the staff is very efficient and they move tables fast.  The food is fresh and tasty, the service excellent.  I highly recommend Hollywood cafe for breakfast or brunch.
author: Bernard L.

description: We loved our brunches here so much we ate here every day of our trip--nine days. The grilled chicken, the French toast, omelettes, eggs, hash browns and bowls of top quality fruit were all amazing.  Although it's not cheap, we felt we were getting good value due to the great quality.
author: Kirsten C.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST EVER! !!! This place is a whole in the wall with the best breakfast I've had in a while. I can't wait to visit San Francisco again...just so I can go back to Hollywood Cafe!
Overall, Great food and fresh fruit ....LUV this place!!!
author: Dom D.

description: Great food. The interior makes you think it's just a cheap breakfast place, then the food comes out. Wow.
author: Edwin R.

description: the food is great. we came around 11:30 on a Friday and the line was pretty short, maybe 20 minutes. coming from Chicago, the over priced items for average quality was surprising. I've had better breakfast for lesser price, but I guess everything in SF is expensive lol. the three stars is because of Buncha reasons. first, like I mentioned, all of us liked our food, but it wasn't anything absolutely mouth watering. second, the family before us had spilled coffee all over the floor and the chair. before they seated us they didn't clean it at all, if my mom hadn't spotted the spilled coffee on the chair I would've gotten it on my clothes. they were also very quick with everything, it made us feel like we had to rush through getting our food. both my parents also ordered tea but said they didn't want it till the end, but a different waitress (we had 2 different ones) brought out the tea before the food. I wish I could give more stars, but like i didn't feel like it was anything special.
author: Isabel K.

description: Good breakfast, served quickly. They start you off with 3 pieces of toasted sourdough bread with some yummy jam located on the table; very good. Eggs were done perfectly, pancakes were hearty, and the fruit side dish a nice surprise. Wait staff (entirely Japanese, it appeared) was extremely attentive, as not just one person serves your needs -- it seems to be a collaborative effort. And they all seemed friendly and happy, having a great time working there. Food arrived quickly, coffee was good. A good home-cooked meal just a few steps away from Fisherman's Wharf. Certainly a fine option for those wanting a good, quick breakfast.
author: Bill W.

description: Outstanding!  Best breakfast I've ever had. Crab omelet was loaded with fresh crab meat! Go early though. We went when they opened, no wait. Walked by an hour later and there was quite the line
author: Edward S.

description: Hands down the best service and food was off the charts. We went for breakfast had 30 minute wait but so worth it. It was a holiday and more tourist were in town.
author: K K.

description: Small little place with such friendly staff. This place is not stingy with their servings, I've never had such a huge breakfast plate! My eggs and hash brown were literally falling out from the side of the plate. I liked that they gave me fruit on the side and the good kind like raspberry, blueberry and strawberry. And the warm sour dough bread with melted butter OMG yumm! I also  ordered hot tea and they gave me this fruity tea which I now drink everyday because it's sooo good. You'll like it here :)
author: Paola H.

description:
I came here with my friends and was very impressed!
The wait was veeeeeery long, about 35-40 minutes. But when we got our food we were not disappointed, well worth the wait.
I highly recommend this place!!
author: A Z.

description:
Good experience. However, I don't understand the hype and long lines!!

If you like greasy food, large servings and mediocre coffee, then this is your place. The pancakes were very good though, llight, fluffy and delicious (according to my family members).  Massive servings of fruit. 

The staff is amazing. Genuinely friendly, professional and attentive. 

Fast service. 

The restroom is revolting. It's not attached to restaurant and is used by multiple restaurants, but I am still traumatized by the experience. 

I felt a little rushed to eat food because of long line of people waiting. Place lacks ambience and relaxed feel. 

I guess this place is not my cup of tea, but to some, I can see how it is a favorite haunt.

Kid friendly.
author: S B.

description: Fresh vegetarian sandwiches and salads. Clean tables, floors and ketchup bottles. Fast, friendly service.
author: Nicole H.

description: A must for breakfast. Do not stand in line....walk in and put your name on the list. Then get in line? The food is positively delicious, and so fresh. The amount of fruit was enough to table share.
author: Sharon M.

description: Make sure to come here hungry as hell!!! The eggs Benedict was a massive feast probably could have fed 2 normal hungry adults.  Came with a sheet of hash browns that covered the plate, 2 large eggs Benedict, some fresh cut fruit, 4 slices of buttered toasted French bread, and I got a cup of coffee.  That was a ton of food for 10 dollars.  Didn't wait at all either so that was nice, service was fast and the waitress was very nice.  Much better then Denny's and more food for the same price.
author: James F.

description: This place is sooo good. We came back again for our second day of stay in SF. We had crab omelet and combo pancake yesterday. Getting CAS and combo French toast today! Looking forward to it!
author: Marian C.

description: Great little quick spot to eat.  Crab omelette was as fresh as it gets! Little heaters kept us cozy on the outdoor patio. Plates come out bigger than you think! Was a great spot to eat!!
author: Jessica M.

description: Great healthy breakfast! Very friendly staff! A must stop in SF for breakfast!!! I will definitely come back!
author: Harun Ron E.

description: We loved this place so much! Delish fresh crab eggs benedict, flavorful hash browns including fresh fruit. Only down side was the wait of over 30 minutes on a Sunday morning. Fast and friendly service! Will definitely return when I'm back in the area.
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Good breakfast. Wait was a little long, but it was Sunday at 9:00. Took about half an hour to get a table. They move people through. I had the original French toast and over medium eggs. Sweetness has the Greek omelette and a fruit bowl. French toast was average, fruit that came with it was good-strawberries and bananas. Sweetness' omelette was good, and the fruit was overflowing-enough for lunch later. Service was good, everyone was friendly and they got the food out quickly. Definite recommend.
author: Michael R.

description: A lot of fresh fruit. The lox were awesome came with a lot of salmon, huge bagel, tomato, onion and capers. The pancake breakfast came with lots of fresh fruit, however, they didn't like the pancakes as much because of the cinnamon inside the mix. Someone close to us ordered the seafood Benedict which looked amazing.
author: Amber P.

description: I'm s SF local since 92 and I don't usually care about breakfast away from home, but this place is awesome. I love the staff. It's clear everyone is happy working there, even when it's slammed (weekends). Just exactly what you want when you wake up hungry. :)
author: Scott A.

description: This is my first review so it will probably be disregarded. But the food was alright. Service wasn't the best. I tried to order a combo meal but I do not eat meat so I wanted to get hash browns instead of meat so I asked my server and she yelled at me telling me I was unable to substitute even if I don't eat meat so I had to order things separately. I was really surprised because usually restaurants are very accommodating. I was fine with it but the server was just rude about it. It just left me with a bad impression. Being yelled at and getting mediocre food that all came out at different times is definitely not what I waited in line for 35 minutes for. The waitress was just very very rude and made us uncomfortable.
author: Bri R.

description: Came here because of all of the great reviews and our food was fine but not much to "write home about". The service was quite brisk. The food comes in huge portions but our Eggs Benedict and Heuvos Rancheros were not really anything special. They were tasty and well prepared but not exceptional. Always a line for a table!
author: K. L.

description: This place was recommended by one of the valets at our hotel, and boy was he spot on. The food was great, very fresh and the portions were surprisingly generous. It's now on our list of places we have to visit in the city. Can't wait to come back!
author: Wendi S.

description: Good variety and great food. Walking distance from our hotel. Small space like most San Fran cafes but quick service
author: Barbara Z.

description: Very good food and reasonable prices for pretty large portions. Crowded but what do you expect? I will eat here again when in San Francisco. I am reviewing the breakfast menu.
author: trisha h.

description: Excellent lunch  I ordered chicken sandwich with fries and my boyfriend ordered hamburger. We went there 01.15 pm and there were lot of free seats  Staff were also nice.
author: Susanna K.

description: Don't let the line up for a table stop you from going here. They seat you quickly and you'll have your food in no time at all. Great service, huge servings and delicious!
author: Mel H.

description: Awesome breakfast.  The French Toast was amazing and the service was quick.  A definite must for breakfast.
author: Chad W.

description: Good good, not long wait, good service, good prices, and importantly coffee was good.  Bathrooms are suspect but didn't go there for that. Huge portions. Great good for kids too.  Tons of fresh fruit.
author: Chase C.

description: Everything on the menu sound amazing making hard to chose a dish!! The portions are huge and will leave you with a full tummy. Their lemonade is delicious along with the original eggs Benedict. They also have great customer service. We will definitely be back in the near future!
author: Christina L.

description:
My favorite breakfast spot ever, hands down. The service is wonderful! The food is literally dream about and crave. The fruit cup is to die for. Such a huge portion with only the freshest of seasonal fruits. I can't get enough. Their omelets are massive and so are their scrambles. Oh, pretty much anything breakfast you order comes with toast. Its sourdough bread with butter and its still warm and its just incredible! I always want to ask for more. 

The only thing I do not like about Hollywood Cafe is that it is no longer a secret! Expect a wait on weekend mornings even for the outside seating (which is perfect on a nice warm day). I'm happy for their success but I guess the best kept secret in the wharf is out!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Best breakfast I've had in a LONG time.  I travel for work and get to try more than my share of restaurants, but this one goes on my top 5 breakfast joints.  The fresh fruit was bountiful and delectable.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the sourdough bread was as good as San Francisco can deliver.  

Prices were on par with the quality.  I had "The James Dean" and it included 2 eggs, 3 sausage links, two large slices of sourdough toast and a huge bowl of fresh fruit.  And I'm not talking about 2 or three different kinds of fruit.  I'm talking about grapefruit, grapes, raspberries, pineapples, apples, oranges, blackberries, bananas and kiwis.  In total, my bill came out to $10.80.  Add a couple dollar tip in there and you can walk away for under $15 a person.

I'm planning on going back tomorrow to try one of their FIVE types of eggs benedict.  Don't miss this on your next trip to San Francisco.
author: Brandon B.

description: The food was really good.  We ate there twice in the 3mornings we spent in SF.  The portions were large, enough to share.  Amazing fruit bowls and ommletes 4inches tall.  Service was great, atmosphere was great...a must do when in the Warf area
author: Christy D.

description: Wanted to come here because we had went to mamas on Washington Street the day b4 and we were staying at the Hyatt on fishermen's whafer, so I wanted to check it out because I found it on yelp. In my book def.better then mamas ,food portion is def a lot more! Quality of food is also fantastic! Service was great and it had a lot of fruit to your meals too!ha ha! Which I thought was a great touch over all it was an amazing place,I will definitely go there again to dine for breakfast or brunch!
author: Bibi D.

description: I rarely give 5 stars but this place deserves it for so many reasons. Huge portions of food (especially the fresh fruit, which is unusual), the coffee is great, the service is exceptional, everything is fresh, the hash browns and eggs were not greasy, and the French toast was yummy. I finally don't mind paying $11/plate! They have really made me excited about going out for breakfast again. Greeks should take some notes from the Thai's here.
author: Patty L.

description: When a breakfast for 4 costs $80 please don't ask me if I want maple syrup. Yes I do and don't rip me off by asking me to pay an additional $2.00 for the real stuff versus the fake stuff on the table. The breakfast here is very good but over priced and everything is extra. Dib't make me feel I need to be on guard.
author: Diane K.

description:
Great place to have a yummy b-fast! The plates are huge so u can share if u go with someone! Fruit is very fresh. 
The service is fast but the waiters are slow and not so great with their English.
author: Mariel G.

description:
Good is simple and great. Service is kind and prices are fair. 
Don't waste time on the shrimps.. Go directly with the fish and chips. The best we ever had. 
The Oreos were awesome just like any other fried desert :)
author: Iri T.

description:
Love the menu's ! 

Trying the southwestern Benedict 

Chorizo & Cherry peppers ( hot )
 must say it was different.. 

Very good also came with a Huge portions of fresh fruit on the side all you can drink hot coffee And very reasonable priced... Great alternative to all the over price fancy place in the wharf
author: Andrew ß.

description: So I went back a couple of times a few months later and I must say that service was so much better this time around. I sat at the same singles table each time lol but the wait staff was friendly and I didn't feel rushed at all. The food was good too...I ordered the regular hash-browns this time and they were delicious. I'm very happy I gave them another try as they are conveniently located close to the hotel.
author: Pilar S.

description: Excellent breakfast! Almost everything is served with a huge pile of fresh fruit. Delicious! We ordered the banana French toast, blueberry pancakes, and the dungeness crab omelette with a side of hollandaise. Everything was exceptional. The omelette was absolutely loaded with crab. Even the toast and jam was perfect. Service was friendly and really fast. There is often a line, so be sure to walk in and put your name on the list when you arrive. The line moves quickly and you can look at a menu while you wait.
author: Andrea M.

description: Absolutely amazing!  Service was outstanding and very friendly! Will be coming back that's for sure!
author: Mel S.

description:
Fantastic food, fast service and reasonable prices. Brought my out of town parents here and they loved it. I love that they serve fresh fruit (and I mean fresh) instead of greasy hash browns.

Only downside is they only take cash. I never carry cash. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Jillian C.

description:
After deciding not to wait an hour in line for Mama's ( sad face) my brother, his girlfriend. and I ended up here. 

It was large portions of fresh ingredients. Their "side of fruit" that came with my pancakes was staggering. I loved it. Their eggs benedict was really good, too. Also really liked their french toast. And it was pretty cheap. Can't go wrong.

Definitely the place for breakfast if the line is too long at Mama's.
author: Emily D.

description: I love this place. Healthy, huge, delicious brunch portions. Good quality ingredients and amazing fruit! I can't believe it took me so long to discover this place. From the outside it's hard to tell just how good it is!
author: Cynthia M.

description: This place rocks! We were out of town and needed breakfast. My mom is a health freak. She is all about healthy food, so it was a challenge for me to find a place that she can eat. First she was skeptical but after eating their veggie sandwich with a fresh fruit bowl (wait, it was more a fresh fruit mountain), she was all thrilled and that was a five star right there for me. I ordered Vivian Leigh and I thought my eggs are a little bland, but other than it was really good. All freshness! By the way, if you go on a weekend, be ready to wait. We were there around 9:45 AM and waited about 25 minutes to get a table.
author: Bella T.

description: Such a great place. I love the old school feel with the pics and memorabilia.  The food is amazing and in large portions so you get your monies worth. Definitely recommend to friends visiting the city.
author: Nikole D.

description: AAAHHMAZING food!!!  Came to SF for a few days on vacation and found this spot on Yelp. It didn't disappoint. The crab Benedict is super rich and tasty, the French toast is perfectly sweet and moist, and the fruit bowl is enough to share with 3-4 people!  Really quick, efficient service and the ken moves pretty fast. If you're near Fishermans wharf and want a huge, delicious, satisfying breakfast, don't miss out on this place. Definitely worth the wait!
author: YS M.

description: Awesome breakfast!  Breakfast fare was great... Pancakes, omelet fruit all fresh and great!  Will be back before this trip ends.  Highly recommended!
author: Dan V.

description: Great food! We went on my birthday for breakfast and we asked 2 times for another water and the lady failed to bring us one. So I asked someone else for more water. After the food came (super fast) it was good but no one came to check on us once! Service was not as good as it should've been. We didn't tip over 10% because of this and then the lady had balls to confront us about it. We explained this to her and left. Probably won't be going back.
author: Gracie S.

description: Pretty good - fast service - price not bad $60 for 4 if us (1 child) -  Nothing too special -  I had two eggs/bacon with toast/hash browns - all good but not amazing - my wife had the fruit/yoghurt which looked great with plenty of everything - would go back but not sure its worth the wait to be seated - had a long line of customers at 8.30am.
author: Ziggy R.

description: Amazing food walked in got seated and within 10 minutes of sitting down i got coffe ordered and got my food and it was amazing
author: Anthony N.

description: We had to eat at a local breakfast spot. I ate a the Clark Gable, my daughter had the Marilyn Monroe, my son had the James Sean, my husband had the regular pancake breakfast. These breakfast are huge and satisfying. The plates look beautiful with all the fruit they pile on the plate. The fruit it had was grapes, kiwi, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, melon, watermelon, banana, apple, and oranges, very fresh! Whew. That was a long list. Honestly, the fruit would of been enough. The eggs fluffy, the pancakes too. The French toast was soft and sugary. The only reason I gave it four stars was the hot chocolate. It was not homemade, it tasted like nestle. I will definitely come back.
author: Terry M.

description: Best. Breakfast. Ever. Nothing beats the gigantic mountain of fresh fruit they offer with many of their meals.  Got the breakfast sandwhich croissant which was mighty tastey as well. It was pretty packed even at 7:45 a.m. and it's a small place but none of that matters when you taste the food! Recommend going early!
author: Brad S.

description: Great hearty breakfast to start the day. Juicy fresh fruit with the Vivian Leigh and a manly meal with the Gregory Peck. Even had fruit loops, bananas and cocoa for my 9 year old. Going back tomorrow.
author: Todd G.

description:
You better come hungry! The portions are HUGE, and everything tastes so good that you'll want to eat it all.

There was a pretty long wait, but the food made up for it. It's definitely time for them to expand and open another location.
author: Samantha D.

description: This place is delicious. I had the bacon, cheese and avocado scramble and it did not disappoint. The hashbrowns and toast were perfect! We went early to avoid the long line and got seated right away. The menu is fairly simple and not a whole lot of stuff on it. So, it doesn't take too long to make a decision. The place is small so space is limited but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Food L.

description:
I absolutely love this spot - the location, the casual vibe and the brunch items.

All of the benedicts are off the charts! I've tried the Dungeness crab and Florentine benedicts and they were both equally incredible. The English muffin base is both crispy and soft and the hollandaise sauce is creamy and delicious. And the perfect way to conclude the brunch experience is with the French toast - it's soft and spongy without being soggy and serves as the remedy for even the deadliest sweet craving. 

Please note, the portions are massive, which is both a good and bad thing (good because duh, it's more yumminess and bad because your abs or lack there of will hate you afterwards). 

And since it's located about two or three blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf, Hollywood Cafe is just the right distance away from all the tourists. And you can take a quick stroll on the pier and soak in some clam chowder as a snack after brunch. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!

P.S. They don't do reservations like most brunch spots in the city so call ahead to see if the wait's insane. I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes in the three times that I've been here though.
author: Priya S.

description:
Loved this little gem!!

I felt like I was at the soup place on Seinfeld.  You wait in line and when you sit it's very fasted paced!! 
I don't blame them, long line or people makes you want to turn your tables fast!  They missed a few check marks by not refilling coffee, even when asked, and one of our plates came out quite a bit later then the rest but other than that the food was great, everyone loved it and I would totally go back!!

No time for conversation with the staff as they are running around like busy bees!!

The line looks long but it moves pretty quick!
author: Mike H.

description: A great gem at Fishermans wharf. Quick service, great food large portions. The fruit plates are fresh hearty and plentiful. The staff is friendly. There is often a wait but they move folks through quickly without feeling rushed.
author: Kristine G.

description: The food was the best breakfast I had since I have spent my time here in San Francisco. The food was fresh and the fruit was so tasty. I had to take most of it back to my room to eat!
author: Charlene F.

description:
Don't waste your time!  We went to breakfast here.  The waitress only put in my order and left my husband without his breakfast.  When she finally corrected it, she gave us a major attitude and basically said it was our fault.  
Oh, and if you are crazy enough to go, DO NOT USE THE BATHROOM.  They give you an access code to a long, dark and scary hallway in the building next door.  It was like something out of a horror movie.
author: Suzie B.

description:
Very Big portions... Very small place.  Expect to wait a few minutes to get seated.

Food was good but the latte was pretty bad.  The table toast was nice touch to keep the kid and me happy before the food came.   

The Hollywood hash browns are crazy good!!!!  My son and I who usually each get our own meals at breakfast couldn't finish 1 omelet dish with those hash browns.
author: mike k.

description: If I were a person that was recovering from a hard night out, I might appreciate the Texas sized hash browns. If you want a giant breakfast this might be for you. However, if you are not, run the other way. What this place does to perfectly good bacon is an insult to pigs. And..,They did it! World's worst coffee. I think it was brewed using water from the disgusting bathroom. Doesn't seem possible to make a crab, avocado, and cheese omelette taste poorly but they achieved that too. Go to Denny's.
author: Sean T.

description: I went there twice during my 3 days stay in SF. Despite the waiting line which was long, I am willing to go again when I go back to SF.
author: Abdulaziz A.

description:
Had their crab omelet and it was to die for! They have super huge servings and their hash browns were phenomenal.

I love that this place is right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf and is a great place to visit and walk around on a nice SF day!

I would have given this place 5 stars if street parking wasn't so difficult and pricey! But everything else is great!
author: Jay Jay M.

description:
Service was outstanding, hash browns were unusual but very tasty. Omelet was perfect,they even had my favorite tea!! 
They were very busy, but we received our order In a timely fashion
author: Jo Ellen G.

description:
This was probably the best breakfast I have ever eaten.

The location is a little cramped, the street is loud, the place was packed, but oh my lord, the food was amazing.  We had mimosas, a crab omelette, and a basic breakfast of bacon & eggs.  The fruit was so over the top we literally ate it for the next 2 days.  The service was very good, and even though the check in/waiting process seemed to be very unorganized, they made it work very well and I'm extremely pleased we didn't choose the 60minute line @ Mama's.
author: Jeff H.

description: The small line moved VERY fast & the service was beyond excellent, ordered the sausage, pancakes with fruit and eggs. Food was DELICIOUS! The servers were very kind. I can now see why this place has great reviews. The only downside is that there is no bathroom inside, you have to walk two doors down, walk down some industrial looking hallway, and then down another hallway just to get to it. Besides that everything was PERFECT
author: Angelo M.

description:
I have passed up this place many times based on 2 principles that I almost never break- 1. the tourist trap location almost always promises mediocre overpriced food all while being bombarded with people I will no doubt have to tell to "step-down" on the muni afterwards. 2. The fact that it is called Hollywood Cafe. 

There are the other obvious red flag factors such as the gimmicky photos, cheese decor and continued theme of Hollywood. Like I really wanna think about Hollywood and its starlets, albeit old school ones when size 8 was sexy, when I am eating my Benedict with fried items and bacon!

Anyhow, I was talked into going there and was VERY pleased that I gave up my fight and bias to this place. First of all, they give you SOURDOUGH bread all hot and warm with butter all over it...thank you for doing this for me. I would have never put that much butter on my bread but since you did it for me, how can I waste such perfect bread? That would be downright wasteful! Second of all, they have the best hash browns in the entire world- I think they are called Hollywood Hash browns..topped with bacon, green onion, bell pep, and a cheese sauce...HEAVEN. 

The fruit bowls that accompany the entrees are overflowing with FRESH cuts of excellent fruit- no half ripe, or over aired, ageing fruit- straight colorful delicious loveliness! One time I ordered an apple, mint iced tea...was so refreshing I wasn't too upset at the 4.95$. I did make sure to get my money's worth by having them refill it numerous times and even asked for a to-go cup...they did not even bat an eyelash or appear to want to roll their eyes (and if they did, they concealed their contempt which is all one can really ask for!). 

The service is fantastic and the food is on the same level- wonderful. I must say, I have beaten myself up quite a bit for letting my anti-things-like-hollywood-cafe get the best of me. I am working on it because this place put my previous notions in their place...now if I can only get over my hatred for places like the Tipsy Pig and Cha-Cha-Cha I will become more well rounded...yeah, I doubt that will happen any time soon.
author: Lucia V.

description: Excellent breakfast, huge portions, & cheerful attentive service. Won my heart with quick & easy coffee refills. Hashbrowns are amazing & bacon is fresh. Great place to fuel up for a leisurely stroll around fishermans wharf. Fun to people-watch at outside seating area, which has heat lamps for cooler days. Neighborhood gem! Check it out.
author: HJ B.

description:
Great breakfast. Although there was a long line, we only waited 15 minutes. Scrambled eggs and Hollywood Hash Browns were great. My daughter enjoyed the chocolate pancakes. All of the fruit looked like it was hand-picked the same day. 

It is a pretty bustling place and if you are looking for a quiet, leisurely meal, this is not it. But if you just want a great meal and not too much fuss, you will be highly satisfied.
author: Damon W.

description: Even though SF is spoiled with several bomb ass brunch places... this place is at the top of my list. The service is super fast. As soon as you sit BOOM silverware. 5 mins later BOOM order is taken 10 mins later BOOM delicious food. Their servings are huge but legit. Anybody can throw a crap ton of eggs or hashbrowns on a dish. Here... the eggs are so fluffy and cheesy. The hash browns are buttery and crispy.. and that is just a basic dish. Perfect spot for a weekend brunch.
author: Zeal B.

description: Wonderful place to have breakfast. Clean place, staff is pleasant and food is wonderful. We ordered cappuccinos which were delicious, fresh orange juice (awesome) and the breakfast sandwiches plus eggs Benedict outstanding.
author: Michelle R.

description: Hands down! Best breakfast I ever had. I went here twice during my stay in San Francisco. You get a great amount of fruit with every dish you order. The waitstaff is great. There may be a wait but this place is worth if.
author: Yali M.

description: Best breakfast and we had lunch as well all very good Marilyn Monroe French toast was delicious. Very small place and lines are out the door everyday, we stayed at Tuscan hotel so walked over picked up an ate in our room!
author: Traci H.

description:
Since we were spending the day down at fisherman's warf we actually parked all day early bird special for $12 and walked around. 
All I can say is the breakfast was so good here. The tables were all small but for 5 we were ok.  Seated in about half hr on sat 9 am. 
Coffee was nice an strong. Always topped up. Omelette sanfranscian was delicious and huge portion size. I've upgraded the hash browns to hollywood hashbrowns and shared my meal with daughter and we both were stuffed. 
The kids chocolate pancake (junior iv) came with scrambled eggs was large enough for an adult. 
The healthy omelette came with fruit was also very good and healthy. A note tho. The bread they serve with meal always tipped with huge amounts of butter so ask for it on the side as I noticed before I ordered. 
the servers are real friendly and I'll be happy to return anytime.
There is also meter parking just half a block down which is .50 cents an hr from 7-12pm and i think after that it goes up. don't park in fron of the restaurant unless u have to. the meter there is 2.50 an hr in the morning.
author: Mrs H.

description: Worth the wait! Amazing fruit bowls! Also large portions to fill even the biggest guy up, dishes are $10-$20, but fills you up. A must for the San Francisco experience.
author: Tin E.

description: Great service and a wonderful crab omelet. I know it sounds strange but it was fantastic. Bacon was great too. Spendy but  what isn't in San Fran. Big portions.
author: Dave L.

description: A cute little find. Very busy but they seat you quickly. Food is delicious. With such a busy restaurant you'd expect service to be lacking but it's the complete opposite. Very friendly! Always around to top off your coffee etc.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Came to Hollywood Cafe totally based on the fab Yelp when searching for a breakfast spot near Fisherman's Wharf.  This was on a Sunday AM and I was worried we wouldn't be able to get in...a line outside when our cab pulled up confirmed it.  Then, to my massive shock, I saw the freakish but friendly speed at which they were turning tables.  I still don't understand it.  We were told to write our own names down and that it would be about 10 minutes.  Amazingly, it was.  We got a lovely table outside in no time and coffee came quickly.  

Everything we tried was good but the stand-out was the fresh fruit.  After looking at all the food in front of us, we wished we had just gotten one omelette to share and two orders of fruit.  It was WAY too much food and the fruit stole the show anyway.  Coffee refills were quick and food was hot and fresh.  Will absolutely be back my next time in the area, fabulous.
author: Valerie M.

description: We went here because of the reviews on Yelp and were not disappointed so do not hesitate to give it a try. Just be aware that there is almost always a wait to be seated so if you are going for breakfast the earlier the better. We had the two eggs with bacon, hash browns and sourdough toast and it was delicious. I usually don't eat breakfast potatoes but these were hot and crispy and complimented the meal. We ate here twice during our 3-day stay and will definitely go back the next time we are in SF.
author: Barbara H.

description:
Day three in what has become my brunch across San Francisco trek.  With the help of Yelp reviews and Mama's being closed on Mondays, I landed at Hollywood Cafe.  The restuarant was smaller than I anticipated but with 45 mins until the 2pm closing time there were plenty of empty tables.

I ordered the Vivian Leigh which is a cheddar, chopped bacon scrambled egg croissant with a side of fruit and coffee/tea.  The croissant was nicely done, nothing spectaular but very much a menu item I would return to get.  The portions were huge; really too much to consume in one sitting.  I found my myself wondering about what happens to all of the perfectly good fruit that is sent back to the kitchen uneaten... This thought did not sit well with me so I immediately stopped eating my fruit. 

The coffee/tea promised with the meal never made it over to my table but I honestly could not consume another thing after finishing the croissant.  All-in-all I would return for another Vivian Leigh, sans the fruit.
author: Jen W.

description: The waiter spilled cream on me and didn't even clean it up or even say sorry or say anything. Uh excuse you? Wtf? Terrible service.
author: tomo g.

description:
Great breakfast 
Big big portions
Be good till dinner
Fruit was all fresh
One of the best breakfast I've ever 
Eaten
Will surly come again
author: Joey P.

description: Great Breakfast! Service was fast once you were seated, nothing bad about service or food! If you have a large party all members have to be there before they sit you down, parking of course will be on the street. One last thing, my friend had a Bloody Mary and said it was strong and spicy, a few others had Mimosas and they were not all that great, but once again breakfast was great!
author: German R.

description:
I wanted to review this place after a visit to San Francisco where I had breakfast at Hollywood Cafe and Mama's.

Mama's is an extremely popular place that I found through yelp and I would normally have eaten breakfast here, but it was Monday and Mama's was closed so I had to find a Plan B.  Plan B was Hollywood Cafe, a less hyped but still highly reviewed breakfast joint.

Let me start off by saying that my experience at Hollywood Cafe was AWESOME, even better than the breakfast I would have later in the week at Mama's.  And THAT is why I need to review this place.

What I had:

-Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict
-Fruitbowl Side
-Coffee
-Sourdough Bread (comes with every breakfast)

The Benedict was some of the best I've ever had.  It was traditional EB, but instead of canadian bacon, you got crab, spinach, and caperberries.  The meal was prepared very well and the flavor was awesome.  The only downside was the english muffin wasn't great, it needed to be a little more crispy.  But this did not prevent me from loving the meal.

The most impressive thing was the side of Fruit.  Never have I enjoyed a fruit bowl so much.  Not only was it huge, but there was a variety (raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, canteloupe, melon, banana, apple, pineapple, cherry, kiwi), but it was high quality fruit.  The fruit was prepared like a main attraction and not a side.  

The coffee and sour dough bread were also very good. 

For an everyday breakfast, the price was a bit high...crab benedict with fruit side was about 16 dollars.  However, the exact same thing at Mama's, minus the awesome fruit bowl, was selling for 22 dollars.  Mama's also includes and obligatory 30 minute wait outside in the cold.  For a direct comparison, my mother had french toast at both Mama's and Hollywood Cafe and she enjoyed the Cafe more.

Overall, this place was enjoyable enough that we had to come back again later in the week.  Again, we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated and the food was very good.  My parents had sandwiches which looked great.

I would highly recommend checking this place out if you are looking for a GREAT breakfast at a good price without the hype and wait that you get at other places.
author: Scott B.

description:
DELICIOUS fresh food & fruits, amazing coffee, cool classic Hollywood stars menu theme, great combos, convenient location, fast service, and outside seating!!

No complaints at all (actually maybe only that they don't have parking), I'M SO GLAD WE FOUND THIS PLACE!!
author: Jess C.

description:
UPDATE:

I've been here a few times since writing my first review, and Hollywood Cafe continues to crush it every single time.

Never a long wait, the staff is really friendly/nice and try to seat you as quickly as possible, they're attentive once you're seated (it's busy so your water glass may go a few minutes before they re-fill it, but they re-fill it), the food is delicious, and those ridiculous bowls of fruit. Dang.

Don't let the name or location fool you! This is truly a hidden gem in Fisherman's Wharf.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

HOLY COW how did I not know this place existed so close to my apartment? Supposedly a "touristy" spot for brunch/lunch but I'll fight them off any day for a meal from here.

1. Friendly staff.
2. Typical brunch dishes but they're known for:
- hollywood hashbrowns - hashbrowns topped with onions, mushrooms, peppers, bacon and cheese. are you kidding me?
- MOUNTAINOUS bowls of fruit that come with everything - we're talking apples, oranges, bananas, kiwi, grapes, pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew, watermelon, blueberries, raspberries...the list goes on and on.

Had lunch here a few weeks ago around 11:30 and only waited about 5 minutes (granted, SF summer tourist season was over) before we were seated. They sat us outside and even though it was a bit chilly, all was well because they have outdoor heaters!

Food came quickly. Service was meh but if you flagged them down to ask for anything (water refills, ketchup, etc.) they brought it out quickly. Prices are reasonable. Bathrooms are in a separate building next door. I'll definitely be back here soon.
author: Nicole W.

description: The food was really good, but the people were hateful. We wrote our name on the list and never heard them call it. A group of people with two were at a four person table and they invited us to sit down. We ate with them. One of the workers then chewed us out for not scratching our name off, and she had been calling our name. We were sitting right by the door and never heard her call our name. I really enjoyed my food, but you can find good food and nice people other places! It's San Francisco!
author: Ashton S.

description: Right around the corner from my hotel. Wait was 5 minutes. Good menu selection,  had 3 egg scramble w/bacon, cheese, tomato and avocado. Was super hungry and a little cranky  (no dinner last night). They sat us then we waited. No menus. Girl came up to us and asked if we were ready to order..... ok, again, I was a little cranky due to lack of food. Got the menus and ordered. My meal was really good :)  Also, hard to find good decaf and theirs was definitely drinkable. A good place to eat; would recommend sitting inside, a lot of cars drive by. My company wasn't too bad either.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I really wanted to rate this place 5 stars. The food was really good. We ordered the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and my husband ordered the French toast. We were really pleased with the fresh fruit selection also!! It was plentiful and FRESH!!! Omg, it was amazing!!! The 1 hour wait was well worth it. We had just flew in from Philadelphia and headed straight here, all thanks for the endless reviews! The food definitely delivered on its promise!!!

Now, onto the service, which is SOLEY why I rated this restaurant a 3 star. You write your name on a list for a table and wait outside where there's hardly anywhere to stand because it's so crowded with other people waiting. We knew the wait would be at least an hour, per the lady behind the counter. So we decided to walk a block down to the shopping area. I called the restaurant about 30 minutes later just to check the status on how far down the list we were at that point. The woman who picked up the phone wasn't at all helpful. Her response was "I don't have time to look. You need to come back to the restaurant right now because if we call your name and you're not here, you will be removed from the list and will have to wait at the bottom again." Then, she hung up. Wow...ummmm...okay then. So we headed right back. I walked in...and took a look at the list and there were still 15 names in from of us. Took me 2 seconds to look...which I'm sure she could have done. We stood outside for another 45 minutes waiting.

Once seated, our waitress had a very unpleasant attitude. It was almost unbelievable. When we placed our order, I order the fruit with my meal. After explaining to my husband how good I heard the fruit was, he decided to call our waitress over so he could add one to his meal. Her response was "it's too large of an order for you both to have one each. Just share". I kindly replied with "thanks for your recommendation, but as my husband asked, we'd like to each have our own, so please add one on for him. thanks!" her reply "well, if you decide you don't want it, I'm no taking it off of your bill" and she walked away.

At that point, I wanted to pay for the drinks we had, and leave. However, my husband convinced me to stay. He was a lot hungrier than me obviously...because I could have gone elsewhere. We decided to stay.

Her entire presence and attitude throughout the rest of our dining experience was just rude. She never came over to check on us, only when we flagged her down from across the restaurant. She rushed our questions and order almost s if she just simply couldn't be bother with us asking for more coffee or orange juice. It was ridiculous.

So, yes, the food is really good. But the service ruined my experience and I wouldn't dine here again based on that alone.

I've read that the service here isn't great, but I wasn't expecting that at all!

We left her a 20% tip, because we are respectable tippers. I do however, think that they should explore the idea on how to respectably treat their customers. I'm not the type to take being mistreated in exchange for a good meal. San Fran has plenty of other places to dine for breakfast that are just as good, if not better! Brenda's and Mama's to name a few!

BTW, we BOTH ate ALL our of fruit.

You're welcome.
author: Kera N.

description:
Like Alissa A. said, location and tourists (myself included) notwithstanding, this is incredibly good breakfast food. Really fresh and very tasty.
