We are staying in the area accidentally for a work trip -- would never ordinarily choose a touristic area like this one, and had high hopes but moderate expectations. In a word: go. at 9am on a Friday, we waited about 15 minutes for a table.

While we waited for our breakfast, they brought slices of toasted sourdough. There were raspberry jam and marmalade on the table -- these tasted like sysco brand but were tasty enough, and the bread was really good.

I had the Audrey Hepburn -- 2 pancakes and fresh fruit, plus a side of 2 over medium eggs and coffee/water. The eggs were done perfectly (if you've seen my other breakfasty reviews you know that this is a HG item and also a bit of a unicorn). The pancakes were very cinnamony; this was unexpected but not unpleasant at all. The fruit was extensive and there was a ton. Other people have mentioned the overflowing bowl of fruit -- I will specify that it was strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, cherries, pineapple, honeydew, cantaloupe, banana, orange, grapefruit, and apple slices. And yes, it was overflowing and very fresh. The coffee was fine and frequently offered refills; the water had a lemon slice. 

The man friend had the eggs benedict with Hollywood Hash Browns. The hash browns, omg, the hash browns! Bacon, onion, mushroom, pepper, cheese -- these are loaded and very good. Very crispy too. The benedict had lovely thick pieces of ham, but the hollandaise was only mediocre. Somewhat of a hollandaise snob, I feel that if it's not lemony, it's not hollandaise. This was pretty much just buttery -- I couldn't detect any note of lemon at all. 

The meal came to $30 before tip.

Overall, this was a win. A really solid four-star breakfast to stand up to the best anywhere, and extra points for being so legit in a tourist trap area. Bottom line: tons of fresh food served quickly and for a reasonable price given the location.
author: Jessica B.

description: I was a little disappointed in the Hollywood Café.  The crab omelet tasted too fishy and was not in lumps like I prefer.  The hash brown that came with it was slightly overcooked.  The bacon was textbook.  The fruit was delicious and fresh.  I ordered a grapefruit mimosa, which was tasty.
author: Bob B.

description: Quick, friendly and you get your bang for your buck. Small place that's relatively cozy. You can tell the workers there have a cohesive work environment as they're very nimble and make sure you have what you need.
author: Christian D.

description: In all seriousness, Hollywood Café served me what was probably one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. They don't do anything particularly inventive, but Hollywood Café is just classic breakfast food done right. The fruit cup is absolutely incredible and filled far past the brim with the freshest blueberries, blackberries, oranges, cherries, etc. Get the James Dean, and split it two ways for a wonderful, filling breakfast!
author: Kelly R.

description: Amazing! The portions are huge and the food is delicious. The fruit is so fresh and in great quantity. Everything we had was incredible!
author: Bob M.

description: Perfect for breakfast. Great price, great food, great environment. What else do you need? Thought it would be touristy being so close to the Wharf but it wasn't. I will be back and recommend it to anyone in the area that loves breakfast.
author: Todd L.

description: I don't like to wait in lines for breakfast but I would wait 25 minutes for breakfast here. The lox plate was huge, the French toast perfect, and the portions of fruit huge. And I mean huge.
author: Greg M.

description:
Heard this was a "must do" in SF, so begrudgingly I went to this crazy busy spot close to the Wharf.

First, don't let the crowds scare you.  They turn over the breakfast crowd quickly and efficiently.  While the service isn't really personal, it is quick and friendly.

Share something.  Let me say it again.  Share something.  You will NOT be able to eat an entire plate of their breakfast.  If you don't believe me, check out the tables around you before you order and waste a lot of food.

As many have said, the fruit is incredibly fresh and sweet.

Okay, so I'm going to say it.  This place really is a "must do" when close to the Wharf.  The breakfast will make your tummy happy until late afternoon!
author: Laurie B.

description: Fantastic breakfast. Had the "Combo" with french toast, fruit and bacon. Will definitely return!
author: Carl M.

description: The orange french toast was to die for! Add the fresh fruit variety and this was a fantastic breakfast. We also had chocolate chip pancakes and the Vivian Lee. The waitress was very helpful pairing items up to help save some money.
author: K M.

description:
At last, I've found an acceptable dining option for the Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 area.  Every time we are around there, we seem to wander around searching for something appealing that's not absolutely ridiculously overpriced as well as something my picky kid will eat.  We just happened to park near this place today, and I'm so glad we checked it out on Yelp first.....4 solid stars!

I got the greek omelette and it was possibly the best omelette I've ever had.  The kids meals come with a ton of fruit, which is very impressive.  My kids could have easily split a kids' meal.  They brought us a ton of sourdough baguette toast which was great, too.  Quick service, no wait (we visited at 1pm on a Sunday).  Highly recommend!!!
author: Wendy V.

description: A great place for brunch! Get their freshly squeezed orange juice.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Good Food, Big Portions.   

Ate: Vivian Leigh - Very big portion of Eggs laid in and over the croissant, bacon mixed in, with a tasty handful of fruits.
author: Joshua F.

description: Wonderful little cafe! We walked from our hotel and the wait was minimal. We had our two year old with us and the staff was very sweet to him. The inside can be a little cramped but there is also the option of outside seating. The food came out quickly and it was delicious! Huge portions- especially with their fruit bowls. Pricing was very reasonable
author: Lisa C.

description: Came here about a week ago on a Sunday. Breakfast was DELICIOUS I had Classic French toast and they were amazing! My sister in law and I both had Mango mimosas they were ok! The hot chocolate was better. Also, keep in mind that it's a busy place therefore you will have to be wait for a while to be seated. Especially if you have a large group of people. They will not seat you unless the entire group of people you are with are present. Overall, the service was great and the food was even better.
author: Carmen R.

description: While vacationing in SF, I had read the positive reviews about Hollywood Cafe & decided to include this on our plans. We were not disappointed! The cafe is quite small, so there was a wait. Once we were seated, the service was great. We ordered a veggie omelet & the Dungeness Eggs Benedict. Both were filling & delish! I highly recommend this cafe!!
author: Anj L.

description: The food is AMAZING here! Definitely recommend to have breakfast/brunch here. Everything I saw looked good, I wanted to taste it all. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe and my sister ordered the Hollywood Hash Browns  I was not disappointed. And the fruit tasted so fresh it was out of this world! At first I wasn't sure why the fruit bowl was anything to be excited for but after having it I see why everyone recommends it. It's all so delicious!!
author: Sara F.

description: Amazing fresh fruit. Coffee kept on coming. Pancakes were light and fluffy. Worth the wait if there's a line!
author: Emily H.

description: Great staff, friendly service with a smile.  I am convinced about the food being the best.  It is just us, that we wasted more food than we ate.
author: Jitendra S.

description: I have been here several times over the years and it never lets me down...fluffy pancakes, fresh fruit, and lots of it!!! Our server this time was super friendly and even suggested more cost effective ways of ordering our food...such as what to get "on the side" that would be half the cost of what I was going to order on the side instead that I could actually just get with my meal that would be included in the price...if that makes any sense? The only draw back is that it's crowded, there is almost always a line (but it moves quickly) and the bathroom is outside and around the corner from the restaurant. That being said, it's still worth a visit.
author: Sandra B.

description:
Cheap, plentiful, fresh breakfast? Cool! Served up quickly with a smile? Nice! Just a quick walk from my hotel? Even better!

There's really nothing more I could ask of Hollywood Cafe. In fact, I had their breakfast two days in a row and left full and happy both times! 

The first time, I had the Vivian Leigh. What a soft, flaky, amazing croissant! The fresh fruit (strawberries, blueberries, banana, melon, pineapple) had a nice variety and was piled high. I had chamomile tea as well, which is a great, relaxing way to start the day.

The second time I came with my boyfriend. He got the VL and I switched over to the James Dean. Again, excellent! 

The convenience, the price, the service and the food - everything here adds up to a sunny, lovely, tasty, perfect breakfast!
author: Erin W.

description: Excellent French Toast, fresh fruit, and wonderful service.  One of the best meals I've ever had, and the service was great.  This place is fantastic, we went twice in a three day stay!
author: Drew M.

description: I went there because the hot spots required at least an hour wait for breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised. Eggs Benedict was good and the fruit bowl was huge. Very friendly staff, prices are reasonable and my coffee cup was always being filled.
author: Paul M.

description: Great diner type spot.  Small and well worth the wait.  Read Yelp and ordered accordingly ... French toast, Vivian Leigh which includes the fruit bowl everyone raves about.  The fruit over flows the bowl and is not the typical melon medley.  Instead there are berries, grapes, kiwi and melon - delish!  Good solid breakfast spot with attentive staff!
author: Michelle O.

description: I can't tell you how much I love this place it's our breakfast place every time we visit from L.A , service is always great and the food omg Droool ... Try everything here its all delish.
author: R C.

description: Amazing. Great menu. The fruit sides are amazing. The service staff was very attentive. Longer than average wait times as it's not that big of a place. Well worth the wait.
author: Sam S.

description:
Food: Great value here. Large portions. My brother really enjoyed the crab omelette. Fruit is fresh and a great selection -- not day-old looking watermelon and cantelope here! I had fresh strawberries, grapes, bananas...some of the best side of fruit I have ever had. Seriously. I got the Vivian Leigh and an orange juice. So filling I couldn't even finish it, and a flaky, buttery croissant. Orange juice is ridiculous...ly good. You can taste the freshness, it really must be fresh squeezed here because I have never tasted orange juice like this before. It's worth the $4. 

Ambiance: Bustling is the best way to describe. There was only a short wait, and the place looks constantly busy. But...happy!

Service: Always a smile! Your coffee is never empty -- never even only half-full. We were seated quite quickly. 

Price: Wonderful price for the quality of food and service. Really the best breakfast value in the area.

Location: Right in Fisherman's Wharf. Great for tourists, we got this before heading off to the airport. Walkable from our hotel.
author: Farheen Q.

description:
My friends were in town from L.A. and we all wanted to go down to the Fisherman's Wharf. Since it was too late to go by the time we were ready to go out Saturday (after commute time, we would have only gotten a couple hours to hang), we decided to get up early on Sunday, and go have breakfast there instead. My hubby and I were excited when we each individually found Hollywood on Yelp. It sounded good, and the one dollar sign was a definite yay. 

We took the BART to the F-line, walked a little, and with no hassle, we were there. It was a beautiful day and the outside was crowded, but I was pleasantly surprised that the four of us were able to be seated at a table as soon as we walked in the door. 

We ordered a Diet Coke, two coffees, and one decaf (mine, of course) to drink. My husband also asked for ice water and we were served four glasses of room temperature water with no ice and a thin slice of lemon. For some reason, my coffee mug was served only half-full. I shrugged this off for the most part, and then we went on to order our food. 

The hubby and I split an omelet that had crab meat and avocado, and cheese, and also an order of French Toast. My friend ordered the fruit plate, and a bagel and cream cheese. My other friend ordered a simple eggs-meat-toast kind of breakfast. 

I have to say I have mixed feelings about the food. I appreciated how fresh all the ingredients were, and that they used sustainable, locally grown foods when possible. The fruit was really fresh. My friend received a huge plate of strawberries, bananas, apples, and kiwi. My omelet was just OK. I was a little adventurous ordering one with crab meat, but I'd had a salmon and cream cheese omelet once at Benjy's in Houston, and really enjoyed it, so I thought why not. The hash browns were pretty gross. I like mine a little crunchy, and these were just downright greasy. The omelet was more like a scramble. We had sourdough toast, and that was good, of course. 

The service was on par with the food. They were not very attentive. Could have been worse, I'm sure, but nothing special, either. 

The atmosphere was that it was a quaint, cute place. The menu items named after movie stars was half-cool, half-gimmicky -- I couldn't decide. 

Also, for the bathroom, you have to use the one that is for the whole building. You go out the front doors and then into another door in the building, and then down this dark, dank hallway, and around a corner, and then you get to a pretty icky, gas-station quality restroom (I hope you have sanitizer with you.). It's quite the trek!

The Verdict: This is more like a three-and-a-half. On the plus side, many of the menu items were under $10, which is hard to find in this town, much less the area of town where the restaurant is located, but I just wasn't feelin' it.
author: Cara S.

description:
So glad I didn't have a hotel breakfast and came here. Breakfast is served with generous amounts of fresh fruit. It went great with my Orangish French Toast. My partner had Eggs Benedict that was excellent. The plate of toast we were given was enough for a family. Nice orange marmalade and raspberry jam were on the table. 
Get there early! We arrived right at 7 and the place was empty. By 7:30 there was line.
author: A G.

description:
The service here is quick and very friendly.  The orange juice was fresh squeezed, and it was delicious!  The Harmony Scramble had everything I could want in a scrambled egg.  It had mushrooms, bacon, bell peppers, tomatoes, cheese, and onions.  Huge portions of hash browns (as everyone else stated too).

My mom had the chicken applewood sausage, and, although I usually hate sausage, I loved it.  The fruit was very good as well.

I never had to wait for a coffee refill.  The waiter was constantly looking around at glasses to check for refills without being annoying.  

I would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Not sure why this place has such high reviews. At 4.5 stars I'm expecting mind blowing food and expectation of being a repeat customer. 

First of all, the plates are so huge, when trying to squeeze 5 people at a small circular table outside, it does not work. We needed to put dishes on extra chairs around us, what the?? Have you done that before?

Our waitress forgot to give us waters, and service was slow.

Come here if you have a HUGE appetite because it is insane quantities of food. I probably took home at least 50% of my meal and I ate until I was about to burst. When I have that much food and I'm that full, I can't appreciate the taste. I had an omelet, and upgraded to Hollywood (loaded) hash browns. They were okay, but if you're expecting a small side of hash browns, you're going to get enough to feed an entire family.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I was leery of going here because it is in such a touristy area but I am happy I made the trip. I read the review of the fruit bowl and thought to myself how good could a fruit bowl truly be? WOW it was huge and loaded with berries pineapple etc. I also had the crab Omelet which rivals a competitor breakfast place in the city. It was loaded with crab and avocado and came with a side of their crispy hash browns. This is definitely in the top 3 of breakfast places in San Francisco.
author: Scott M.

description: We lined up w/all of the tourists, except we were prepared for the chilly SF weather, & they weren't! Had to wait about 30 or so minutes, but it wasn't too bad waiting. The service, once we were seated, was very nice! We each had egg dishes w/hash browns, 2 Hollywood style. Everything looked & tasted great, but could've used a little more seasoning. All in all, an enjoyable breakfast!
author: susan w.

description: Great food, great service, huge portions! I got an omelet w/ hashbrowns - very good! We ordered a fruit bowl which was huge and really fresh! OJ was great too. Super convenient if you plan to tour the waterfront area. We got there right when they opened, thankfully. Be prepared to wait in line otherwise!
author: Victoria W.

description: This is a pretty decent breakfast place. The wait is not too bad, but I dislike how they make us wait in line instead of asking for names. Whether it's rain or shine you would have to stay outside in a line. The dolce French toast was yummy but the candied walnuts were a bit too plain in my opinion.
author: Emily L.

description: Had breakfast here 4 days in a row during my recent stay on the Wharf. First let me say the serving sizes of the various items are more than most can eat. The fruit is super fresh. The scrambled eggs light and fluffy, excellent tasting. The hash brown, served flat pancake style, were quite tasty. The orange juice must have been fresh squeezed and was delicious. The raspberry preserves were deep flavored and great on the multiple pieces of french bread. Fast courteous service. Note: If you want a regular portion of scrambled eggs, toast and bacon I'd recommend the children's portion at $6---a great value and filling. Highly recommended.
author: steve d.

description: The fresh fruit was bountiful, hash browns delicious and coffee fresh!  They served buttered sourdough bread with fresh orange or blackberry marmalade.  Cozy place right next to where you need to catch tour bus to Miur Woods.
author: Christina M.

description: Ok had to try this place out. A local told us about this place. So as usual I yelped it be for anything. Only problem I had was groups more then four people might take longer to be seated. Other then that. The food was outstanding. Customer service was on point. Everything was A+
author: Amanda W.

description:
Breakfast was AMAZING! We just went there this morning, and we were amazed with the quick service, especially considering the number of people waiting. We ordered and got our food within 10 minutes once we got seated (which only took about 15 minutes to get seated, which was awesome, there were about 15 people ahead of us).

The staff was super friendly, very accommodating. My boyfriend got a fruit bowl with his, and it looked so yummy, I asked if I could order one to go, so I could snack on it later. They were glad to put it one together for me. 

The servings were huge, and the cost was cheap.The toast wasn't just sliced white or wheat wonderbread, but delicious slice and toasted french bread. YUM. The eggs weren't processed egg whites or anything- I watched a guy crack about 20 eggs, scramble them, and then pour them through a strainer to make sure there weren't shell pieces. Smart, and efficient! The bacon was crisp and well done.

And let me just say, the Hollywood Hashbrowns?! DELICIOUS! Even if you don't like a lot of stuff on your hashbrowns, they were delicious even plain. 

I got some chocolate milk, and they mixed it there, best way to make chocolate milk! They even have mimosas, which completely rocked my world. Who doesn't love a mimosa with brunch or breakfast?! :-) 

We are definitely going back before we leave town!
author: Cori P.

description:
I was super excited to go here based on the Yelp reviews and my fellow reviewers did NOT let me down.

SERVICE:  We arrived and requested a table for 6 during the morning hours.  There were only 3 of us there and when the table was ready, they wouldn't let us sit until our party arrived.  We requested to sit anyway and said we'd just order theirs to go.  The food was SUPER quick, though, and our friends finally joined us and we somewhat got ignored for a little bit.  Hey, as much as I was irritated, we also probably irritated them during such a busy morning and they finally took the rest of the orders and got the food delivered super quickly again.  I do not blame the servers for being that way and they actually became likeable again at the end.

THE FOOD:  IS AMAZING!  I ordered the crab omelette and it was delicious.  A couple of the party ordered the James Dean... and we all admired this.  It comes with a ton of fresh fruit!  Truly truly fresh and variations of fruit (as opposed to one or two options in a little cup, it was a BOWL of lots of fruit!.. enough to be its own meal for some!!!).  Also, the sourdough bread was AWESOME!  We ate that up and I have been thinking about it for days since!  Silly, I know, but I love bread in SF!!!

Bottom Line - GREAT FOOD!  EAT HERE!  But, if you have a big party, don't think you can get ahead by coming early without the rest of your peepz.  Your whole party must be present... or you get a bit of an attitude. ;-)
author: Jennifer M.

description: This is my favorite brunch place in San Francisco!!  It is a fairly tiny restaurant, but they pack in quite a few tables inside, plus a few tables outside on the sidewalk (they even have overhead heaters to keep you warm on chilly SF mornings!)  I think I have ordered the same thing every time I have eaten here: the Vivian Leigh- bacon, eggs, and cheese on a croissant with a side of fresh fruit.  Most places give a tiny ramekin with a few cubes of melon.  Not Hollywood Cafe!  They give you a big glass bowl overflowing with fresh berries and fruit.  Their portions are so big that I can rarely finish my dish!  The only downside is the restroom situation.... They don't have their own restroom in the restaurant.  Instead, they give you a code and send you next door into what looks like an abandoned office building, and you have to wind down a few hallways to find the locked restrooms (hence the key code). It just feels shady to me, but the rest of the dining experience is 5 stars, so I won't let the restroom situation stop me from eating here :)
author: Dana P.

description: I was recently in San Fran with my boyfriend and this was right down the road from our hotel. After reading a few of the yelp reviews, we decided to give it a shot. Out of 5 days, we ate here twice! Do yourself a favor and get the HOLLYWOOD HASHBROWNS. You won't be disappointed!
author: Jade W.

description: Good things come to those who wait. We dropped in for brunch on a Wednesday and the place was packed. 20 minutes later we were seated and then came the good part! We ordered the Greek Omelette, the Audrey Hepburn pancakes and some eggs with fruit. The fruit that came to our table was OVERFLOWING with berries (yum!). and eggs were cooked just the way we asked. And servers were polite and friendly. The ambiance was perfect for a warm, sunny day and our tummies were happy! Street parking is available, but just walk. It is better for health and it reduces the guilt of stuffing your face as well :P
author: Shruti D.

description: I had great experience during my visit. Tried different foods and they were delicious.  Staff was very friendly and kind. Service was good. Only problem I had about this place was waiting too long for a table. Of course I can't blame them for that. Highly recommended.
author: D. W.

description: I almost don't want to leave a 5-star review because I still think of this place as my hidden gem. We started visiting San Francisco a few years ago and this was always our go to spot for breakfast. Even if we were staying in other parts of the city besides Fisherman's Wharf, we would make the trip every morning. The thing that jumps out to me the most is the fruit. I've never had fresher fruit at a restaurant and the portions are incredible! We always take a box of fruit home with us. The pancakes, the french toast, the eggs are all delicious. The staff is very well organized and you get your drinks, your meal and your check quickly and efficiently. If you're going for breakfast - I'd suggest getting here before 8am or else the line stretches around the corner.
author: Kevin C.

description: The FRUIT!!!!  There's so much and it's so good. Not to mention the super yummy main portion. I had the Vivian Leigh. It was great and EASILY split between two people. The Marilyn Monroe is excellent too.
author: Peter O.

description:
There's a reason why they're number one on Trip Advisor.  They are good!

They bring you tons of food here, so don't plan on eating after wards, because the food is super filling!

The Denver was my favorite, so filling and tasty!
author: Yekta A.

description: Great food.  The fruit was fresh and overflowing the rest of the plate.  Portions are larger.  The turnover is slow so don't wait in too long of a line.
author: J N.

description: This is our favorite breakfast place in San Francisco! Huge portions and delicious food. I love the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend loves the Denver omelet with the Hollywood hash browns. It is a little bit of a wait to be seated, but that is because of its popularity and small venue. Hopefully they will expand one day, but until then, we will definitely be back!
author: Sheila S.

description: Visited San Francisco recently and this was, by far, the best value for the money. the food is great, it's appealing to the eye and the prices are very fair compared to other meals we had while there. Best of all, there is something great for everyone. The meatlovers omelet with hash browns or the pancakes with a heaping/spilling over bowl of fruit. wow. you need to try it. Don't be in a huge rush. there will probably be a line but it moves pretty quickly. Take a look at someone's plate and you will wait!
author: Kent W.

description:
This is a fantastic breakfast spot. 
 My husband and I eat here a few times a month, we arrive early to avoid the wait. Although, even if there's a wait it goes real fast as this place is super EFFICIENT.
The french toast with the fruit bowl is my absolute favorite (the Marilyn Monroe). I'm not sure what they do but they have the best french toast I've ever had. The fruit bowls are FILLED with deliciously sweet, fresh fruit (I always share it as there is no way I could finish on my own). The hash browns are also fantastic, they are thin, so you get lots of yummy crispiness with a soft interior. Service is great, your coffee cup will never be empty and there is always someone to fulfill your needs, portions are huge,  orange juice is fresh squeezed, fruit is always fresh; it's these little touches that make this place so great. This is a must try cafe if you're in the city.
author: Libra L.

description: Very poor service. Forgot our order. We waited a long time. We asked several times  for three orders. The food is alright. I do not recommend.
author: Gabby P.

description: Recently visited San Francisco and stumbled upon this place close to our hotel by Fishermans Wharf.  Went here twice and had a great breakfast experience.  Portions are pretty large and service is fast.  It's a very popular place and gets busy but the line goes pretty fast.  Their crab eggs Benedict is really good, try it if you like crab!
author: Sal I.

description: Unbelievable.  No words to express properly- just GO.
author: Angie E.

description: This place was excellent. Great and fast service.  Nice waiters, very attentive.  I recommend the hollywood hash brown. The portions are big and all our plates came with some fresh fruit
author: jack r.

description: There was a wait, but it was not to long. Excellent food! Eggs, pancakes and the fruit were all very tasty!
author: Trista H.

description:
Thanks to yelp was able to have great breakfast every morning for our trip for san fran.  Was extremely close to our hotel.  We ate here back to back mornings, everything was excellent, you can't go wrong with an order here so I won't even recommend something in particular.  Their fresh fruit and fresh squeezed OJ is very good too, worth the splurge.  Ate here basically for half the price of our hotel.  

Service was very fast, friendly and accomodating. 
If you're by the wharf come here for breakfast!  I wish I had a chance to try lunch, breakfast was that good.
author: Aaron K.

description: Nice food but nothing special. It wasn't full when we got there so we got seated right away, yet our server was so stressed. Within 10 minutes he asked us 3 times if we were ready to order. He forgot to bring what we asked for, didn't refill our water glasses and were of no help to adjust the menu to fit our desires. The food was good, I admit, but doesn't deserve 4,5 stars. Overall a cozy breakfast place with big portions, but nothing special.
author: Viktoria B.

description:
Ordered four plates and orange juice. It all looked delicious. 
The orange juice was definitely fresh but just was't worth the price. ITs sad but... I just didn't like it.
My boyfriend loved his french toast and got a huge pile of eggs. I got the California. It definitely tasted like Dungeness Crab and the avocado was very creamy. The hash browns were very crispy but tasted like vegetable oil. That sucked. The service was okay...it was weird to me that they were asian lol.
I spent +80?? and I just didn't think it was worth it.. For that much money... I've experienced better.
author: Samantha H.

description: Great food with a twist. Little pricy but worth a try. The waitress was in a mood and the service was awful. I would not recommend this place more than once.
author: Paul J.

description: We went here on or visit to the city. The portions were great for the money and the fruit was fresh.
author: Nasto D.

description: Hollywood Café offers an array of breakfast classics, and is located just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. I split the South of the Border wrap and the Vivien Leigh, which is a croissant sandwich with a side of fresh fruit. Yes, I know it might be hard for some of you to get excited about fruit, but this medley was amazing and aesthetically pleasing to boot. I favored the Vivien Leigh over the wrap because I thought was the croissant was the perfect amount of flakiness that went great with the eggs. The staff was very friendly and provided us with great service. Also, the wait time was only 10 minutes or so, not bad at all for a Saturday morning.
author: Megan F.

description:
Delicious food.  Quick service.  Great prices.

I really wish LA had a place like this.  It's just so simple, no need for fancy omelets or pancakes to make this place famous.  Just the freshly squeezed OJ is enough for 5 stars.  

I loved the fact that they served fresh fruit with the breakfast plates.  I would much rather stuff myself with these natural delights than greasy carbohydrate filled hash browns.  

I will be having breakfast at Hollywood Cafe every time I visit San Francisco.  You should too.
author: Al S.

description: The only word to describe this place is YUM! What an awesome find! Thank you Yelp! I had some out of town friends staying in the nearby financial district and we decided to do brunch. Being from Marin, I had no idea really what was in that area so, as always, I turned to yelp to help me find a place. Found this gem and couldn't be happier.  I put my name in and only waited 10 minutes for a table when there was a line around the corner. The service was fast, polite, and very very efficient. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe (3 pieces French toast and fruit). All of our food arrived within 10 minutes. The portion was enormous. Being a 105lbs, it was like a thanksgiving feast of breakfast. Every kind of fruit imaginable was literally falling out of the bowl. Am-az-ing!!!! Food was fantastic. We all enjoyed everything we ordered but none of us could finish our meals with so much on our plates. It was awesome! I would very very very highly recommend this place. And don't be scared of the line.... It moves really fast!
author: Lauren W.

description:
The food is great.. it was a nice surprise.

Wonderful fruit salad with most of the meals and fabulous coffee.

I can't say enough.. great value...
author: Sharon S.

description: Awesome service and right across the street from the hotel we were staying at.  Huge fruit bowls come with your meal if you'd like.  Portion sizes are BIG.  Huge plates covered in hash browns.  I got the eggs benedict, which I could not finish.  Each meal comes with tons of fresh bread and jelly.  Wait staff is very friendly and attentive to keeping all of your drinks filled.  I will definitely come back here when I'm in SF again.
author: Liss B.

description:
If you are visiting San Francisco and need a great breakfast, THIS is your place!

There will be many tourists and there may be a line outside, but do not hesitate to go inside and find the clipboard where you can write your name and number in your party - it may take only a few minutes (our wait was about 30 minutes) but the food as very well prepared, tasty and the portions generous.  You will be shocked at how small this place is and how fast they turn the tables.  But you will be extremely pleased with the food quality and preparation - no doubt they know their breakfast and this is a GREAT place to eat.  Your breakfast will cost a lot less than the hotel and you will feel like you are eating at home.

We stayed at the Hyatt Regency and took the F Streetcar to the neighborhood and then found the Hollywood Cafe,  Easy.  And the streetcar ride is a hoot on a weekend morning.

Enjoy and have a great time here.
author: John M.

description:
I was running late the day I ate here, so by the time I arrived, my party had already ordered and there were beverages and toast at the table. Our main dishes came not too long afterwards.

Our eyes bulged a little when we saw my plate of eggs and hash browns- the portions were huge! I happen to love breakfast, so this was definitely a plus. (I never cease to be disappointed by the portions of most diner chains.) My boss and coworker were also served generous amounts of food. The quality matched up with the quantity- the eggs were nice and fluffy, while the hash browns were perfectly crisp.

The downside of this experience was the difficulty in trying to flag down our waitress from time to time. However, the restaurant was pretty busy, so I acknowledge that she was not at fault.  

Overall, as indicated by the four stars: Yay! I'm a fan. If I'm in the area, I'll definitely come here again. 

P.S. I like how the breakfast specials are named after iconic celebrities, i.e. James Dean and Audrey Hepburn.
author: Lauren S.

description: Some of the fruit had mold on it and was served on top of hot eggs. No one likes hot fruit
author: Kyle M.

description: The fruit looks amazing and is very fresh. French toast is very delicious, vanilla banana, would stick with classic if you are picky w french toast. I ordered the huevos rancheros, they come w kind of like chips under the eggs instead of a single tortilla like I am used to, but you cannot go wrong with that choice.
author: G N.

description:
So happy to find a small business offering quality, well-cooked food smack dab in the middle of such a tourist mecca, like Fisherman's Wharf.  

We got basics - eggs, bacon, fruit, toast and french toast.  All cooked perfectly and served up hot and fresh by smiling, gracious staff. 

Great strong coffee and they keep the cup FULL.  

My favorite thing was the sourdough toast topped with a little orange marmalade.  I am looking forward to my next trip, just for this toast and jam.  Seriously, it was just that good.  

Bon appetit!
author: Lana H.

description: Arrived a Saturday around 10 am...wait was about 20 minutes.  Popular spots close to many hotels.  Service was fast and friendly.  Food was delicious.  I had the eggs benny...best eggs benny since new orleans. Portions are CRAZY! if you like fresh fruit you'll love it.  4 people for under $60.
author: Edgar R.

description:
It was so hard to decide... I think really it's 3 1/2 stars.  The portions here are ENORMOUS.  Get the side order of sour dough bread.  The fruit cup is big but only get it when fruits are in season.   Omelets are super.   My hubby loves this place and makes us go every time he is in town. 

Seating is very tight, fast fast fast service and huge portions.  Nothing mind blowing but really solid breakfast food.  Its a good location if you are on vacation in san fran and staying near the pier.
author: Denise S.

description: The service here is kind of strange here -- very quick and curt, and entrees come out quickly but not all at the same time for the same table (e.g. my boyfriend received his entree 5-10 minutes before I got mine) -- but the food is definitely solid.  The toast and preserves (especially the apricot) are delicious, the hash browns are tasty, albeit a bit too buttery, and the eggs are done very well.  The only thing I thought was sub-par about the food was my crab meat (in the dungeness eggs benedict), which was kind of cold.  Big portions though, rapid service, and nice food.  A very decent breakfast choice, especially given how touristy the neighborhood is!
author: Ran L.

description:
This may be the best food I have eaten in both my SF trips.  Came here on a Saturday and were promptly seated.  Boyfriend got the eggs benedict w/ smoked salmon and shrimp (there was some fancy name for it that I forgot), and I got the dungeness crab eggs benedict.  Mine was...just amazing.  I never liked eggs benedict before, but this place converted me.  The hollandaise sauce was just right, and the crab + spinach together was perfect.  (UGHHH, the worst part about yelping is that when I try to remember the food, I get freaking hungry).  The eggs benedicts come with hash as well, but be smart like the bf and ask to substitute with Peter's hash.  It's loaded with everything!!!

Prices were OK, portions are huge.  But I bet you will finish every bite like I did.  Staff was attentive.

If you had to choose one place to eat breakfast at the wharf, eat here.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Love this place!! Excellent service and love the heated outdoor seating!! Huge portions, love they have mimosas!! Tip for visitors be patient and put your name on the sign up table sheet, the more you ask where you are in line just slows them down!!
author: Jeanine C.

description: Large plates of good breakfast items.  Specials have the amazing fruit side that is overflowing with sweet fruit. We waited about 20 min for a table on a week day. Only complaint is that seating hostess & servers seemed a bit abrupt & were in a hurry to take orders. If you've waited to get a table, you don't really want someone breathing down your neck to put in your order or to make sure you leave quickly.
author: Ch A.

description: A 45 minute wait for ordinary looking food in a place that looked to have maybe 6 tables. Nope. We went to Darren's Cafe just one block down and were seated immediately.
author: Heath H.

description: Good brunch place with relatively-short wait times, fast service, and generous portions. I loved the crispy hash browns here and the generous pile of fresh fruit. The scrambles were pretty standard, but on weekend brunch periods when other breakfast joints can be up to a 2 hour wait (e.g., stupid g'damn Mama's), Hollywood Cafe is a very worthy alternative.
author: Roy C.

description:
My best friend and I were in San Fran for a kid-free weekend and I got to pick where we ate for breakfast. I looked his place up on Yelp and it sounded quirky, so we checked it out. 

The size of the space was kind of a buzzkill, because you're literally elbow-to-elbow with strangers, but this may also be the very thing that draws such a crowd. I kind of wonder if they might be wise to invest in a bigger space, but that might kill the "local hangout" vibe. People will only wait in line for thirty minutes if the people ahead of them have done the same. 

The waitress wasn't memorable, except she seemed slightly confused when I asked her about a substitution, but if I had stared at hundreds of people in a four hour time span, I'd be confused about what my name was. 

The decor was groovy, with pictures of celebs on the menus and walls. Fun stuff. 

The food was above-average breakfast fare and worth the price. I would love to come check the out the next time we are in the area, but SF has so many restaurants to try that if you're not a local, then realistically, you'll probably be shuffling around to new spots every time you're in town. Goes on the "good standby" list.
author: Ashley H.

description: Good food. Best fruit bowl with breakfast. BUT Unbelievably terrible customer service. Servers are shockingly rude.
author: Shadi B.

description: All the positive reviews were right!  Crab omelet is a must try. Everything was very generous portion. Freshly squeezed orange juice was nice and sweet.  The line moves fairly quickly too.  This place is definitely a must try in SF
author: Cindy L.

description:
Stopped by here a whiiile back when a bunch of buddies and I decided to stop by San Francisco on our way up north. We arrived at around 5am and slept in the car until about 6am when they opened. 

The wait (and rest) was well worth it. All of us enjoyed our food and the service was great. 

The place itself is a tad small, but it felt equally homely. I enjoyed the pictures on the wall and almost felt like I was back in LA.
author: Jagg M.

description:
Went there for the first meal after New Years.  Food was good and the service was great and super quick. We were starving so it was great to be able to get in order right away and then have the food come out within minutes.

Overall real cute place with in/outdoor  which was nice. The only downfall was the bathroom is not connected you need to go down this long creepy side hallway to get to the bathroom which reminded me of a gas station bathroom. N\
author: Sunny S.

description:
We dined on a rainy early morning. No dining was available inside, but patio dining was available. Imagine that? Such luck. As long as we nestled together we were able to huddle under the overhang to keep dry, and there was a heater to keep us warm.

The husband ordered a ham & cheese omelet which came with hash browns. I had the special hashbrowns with two scrambled eggs. They were topped with a mixture of bacon, mushrooms, onion and cheese. It was tasty and just enough to hold us over until the Ferry Building opened.
author: Kellee K.

description: Decent breakfast...awesome fresh fruit. On a busy street so if you sit outside you can enjoy the sun but the view is mediocre.
author: Monica P.

description:
After being dropped off at the ferry and having to fend for myself I found the Hollywood Cafe bustling on a Monday morning.  They have a number of options with egg and non egg breakfasts.  The food was excellent and pretty close to 5 stars.  It was delivered very fast and very good.  I did not even have to use hot sauce!  I had sausage mixed in with scrambled eggs, avocado, and a few other ingredients commanding an excellent flavor.  The hash browns were very good too.  Served a little cold.  The bread that was served first was incredible also.  It was so tasty and already slathered in soft butter.  Good selection of tea.  Lots of food for the price, thankfully.  Left full.

The service was 50/50.  The manager and the guy that took my order were awesome and super friendly, but the chick waitresses had attitudes and wanted a quick turn around.  

They also do not have any bathrooms.  A full star off for that.
author: Peter K.

description:
Hollywood hash? Benedicts? Sourdough...What?

To be smack dab in a tourist trap the food could not be any more legit....

I won't go into detail about the incredible food or awesome service because I would like to keep this place to myself but seeing that there are multiple 5 star reviews, I can only dream. 

Head over early to avoid the wait....but, if you have to wait, it's totally worth it.
author: Shy A.

description: I will start by saying the food here is absolutely delicious, the healthy plate I ordered was phenomenal, anyone looking for an amazing breakfast should go here. The reason I only gave it three stars was because the waitress hardly spoke to me or checked on me, she took my order and nothing else, after I received my food I never was asked if I needed anything. I believe not only the food but also the staff make or brakes a place, in this case the staff broke it.
author: Alesha C.

description: This place is tooooo good!!! Service was great! Food came out quick and was fresh and delicious!!!
author: Danny S.

description: The food is amazing but the bathroom is disgusting. They don't even have hand soap. Makes me think, "Do they even wash their hands?"
author: Elvira M.

description: Excellent!!  Very delicious food and in great portions.   Every time I come to San Francisco is a place to have breakfast.
author: Julio Cesar M.

description: The portions are huge. Had eggs, hash browns, and bacon...the hash browns were delicious but the rest was mediocre. The mimosas tasted off and neither me nor my companion wanted to finish them. Pretty limited menu as well.
author: Samantha M.

description:
After reading reviews of this place, I had few expectations for a breakfast joint in a tourist area but the meal I had here was far below par. 

I ordered a breakfast sandwich (scrambled eggs on whole wheat bread with cheddar cheese).  It came out with bread that was under toasted and eggs that tasted undercooked and lacked flavor.  My hash brown was mushy and undercooked as well.  The only thing great about this meal was the coffee. 

I know breakfast restaurants in this neighborhood are slim to none but if you can find something else, I'd highly recommend going somewhere else.
author: Nathalie R.

description: Here from NYC...breakfast was UNBELIEVABLY awesome.  My entire family enjoyed everything from start to finish.  Highly recommend this spot for breakfast.
author: Bahar L.

description: If you are in the area, whether it's breakfast or lunch time, whether you're hungry or not, or whether you have somewhere to be or not, DROP EVERYTHING AND GO HERE. This lovely local cafe served me the best meal of my life- the Vanilla-Banana French Toast!
author: Angela S.

description: Excellent food and fast service.   The servers were very prompt and polite.  There was a little bit of a wait but it was well worth it.  Their prices were very affordable and the portions were not skimpy.
author: nick m.

description:
After reading reviews for the breakfast places around the hotel I stayed at near Fisherman's Wharf, I decided to give this place a try.

There was a nasty storm coming in and the dining area had taken on some water before they opened so they were having to turn people away.  The server I talked to offered for me to place an order to go though, since they did have their staff on the clock and the kitchen was prepared to go (it looked like they would be able to open in a couple of hours).

I ordered the crab omelet based on the other reviews I read and am glad that I did.  The portion was more than enough to count as breakfast and lunch and the crab was tasty.  Their coffee is a bit mild, but on par for a breakfast place.

One of the coolest parts about the experience was that the server offered me a discount for the inconvenience of having to take the food to go.  Instead of the $13 for the crab omelet plus ~$2 for coffee, she only asked for $10.  I gave her a $2 tip and we both felt good about the experience.
author: Kenny J.

description:
They were out of a lot of stuff, including hollandaise sauce, which they use in a lot of their entrees.

I thought the food was pretty good, but the environment was very "diner," and nothing special.
author: Daniel D.

description: Delicious homemade food with loads of fruit! Simple menu but you get your money's worth for sure!
author: Amanda C.

description: Oh wow. French toast was amazing. So was the eggs Benedict. The fruit is the freshest the season has to offer and a ton of it. We went about 9:30 on a sat morning and waited about 15 minutes. It s a small place so I think the line could get long but it was short when we were there. All the food looked amazing at all the tables next to us. I definitively had food envy.
author: Cori J.

description:
This review is not about the food since we didn't get a chance to taste it.  The review is about the hostess service.

My wife and I stayed @ the Sheraton and looked at yelp for a nice breakfast place that is close to us.  This place has 4 stars so we walked over there to check it out in the morning of 10/12/13 around 9am.  As we are approaching the corner you can see that there was a line already.  We thought to ourselves this must be a good place to have breakfast.  However, as we were about to get in the door, the hostess called out for a party of 4 and directed to a seat outside.  Another party of 4, POLITELY, asked if there was a mistake since they were ahead of the party.  The hostess, quickly looked and fumingly replied...."you asked for an inside table and this table is for outside.  LET ME DO MY JOB".   She huffed and puffed while we were a little shocked as we followed her into the restaurant.  She then spoke to us with a very stern voice..."PUT YOUR NAME DOWN".  My wife and I looked at each other and quickly turned around out the door as we looked at the other poor guests that were unnecessarily got their heads bitten off by this lady hostess.  She really didn't have to respond to them in that manner.  They were very kind and was even polite in asking why their party was overlooked.  The hostess might have been having a bad morning but we were like, wow you treat your guest like that?   I bet she would spit on the food too.  We ended up in Starbucks a couple blocks away where they're always cheerful.
author: Erby V.

description: Still a good bet for breakfast if you happen to be in fisherman's wharf. Disappointed that they've somewhat changed their menu, yet not on their website. The Hollywood specials used to come with coffee if I'm not mistaken... Not any more. Still, huge portions and great service...
author: Gerry L.

description: Great breakfast spot near fisherman's wharf.   Fresh, artfully prepared and delicious.   I will make this a regular stop when in San Francisco
author: Sean C.

description: Awesome!  Great coffee, friendly staff.  Food was excellent!  Refilled my coffee 5 times in the time we were there. They were on top of it!  Would definitely return!
author: Justin L.

description: Best place we ate during our stay in San Francisco! There is a line out the door down the sidewalk but worth the wait! Food was awesome! Fruit was outstanding! Large portions and is prices below what you would think! The service was excellent. The staff was refilling your beverage and checking on you but not rushing you in any way despite line of people outside! If you get a chance go here!
author: Peggy C.

description: Walked over for breakfast here from The Marriott.  Could not be more delighted with the food or the staff.  It was 7am, and the place had just opened.  Our breakfasts (3) came and they were huge.   French Toast and fresh fruit.  Blueberry pancakes and fresh fruit.  Scrambled eggs, hash browns and fresh fruit.  Everything was delicious, arrived quickly and hot.  Coffee was refilled, water was refilled, my ice tea was refilled.  Now, the restaurant is small, and it was too cold to sit outside so early in the morning, so it probably does get very crowded.  But, the prices are incredibly low, the quality and amount of food is unexpected and we will be back on our next trip to SF.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Great breakfast spot for a quick meal. There was a full house plus 3 groups waiting when I arrived and still was seated in about 5 minutes. 

I ordered the Vivian Leigh ($10) - a croissant sandwich of eggs scrambled with bacon and cheddar, plus a fruit bowl. Most restaurants' version of a fruit bowl is honey dew, cantaloupe and maybe some watermelon, but Hollywood Cafe has the full spectrum of fruit. There were blackberries, raspberries, grapes, cherries (real ones with pits), kiwi, oranges, grapefruit, apples, banana slices, pineapple plus the customary honey dew and cantaloupe. Topped the meal off with a mocha and I was ready to hit the pier.

Location is small, there is a triangle-shaped dining area inside plus outdoor seating. When I arrived, I signed my name on the clipboard and there you can specify if you want indoor, outdoor or either. I chose indoor since there was some wind. Decor is simple, just a couple pictures on the walls. This place is really just about the food.
author: Misti L.

description: One of the best ever. Never saw home fries in the form of a flat pancake. Portions are enormous, prices fair and the service attentive.
author: Steve F.

description: I dream about this place! So love it! Even tempted to take other people's leftovers home with me! So much fresh fruit, and flavors no hot sauce, ketchup, salt, pepper or butter needed!
author: Afton C.

description: I came in with a friend of mine for breakfast. We found the place on yelp and it was fairly close to the hotels we were staying at. We both ordered an entree with a side of Hollywood hashbrowns -- we ended up JUST eating the hashbrowns!! The food was amazingly good, but the hashbrowns had us sold. If I can make it back to this place again, I would probably just order the Hollywood hashbrowns as my meal.
author: Sonal P.

description: This was a good breakfast place not to far off from the wharf. There was a long wait outside (no room inside) but well worth the 20 minutes. I started off with a mango mimosa that was good while I waited for my French toast with over-easy eggs and bacon. The eggs were perfectly cooked and seasoned, the bacon crisp, and the technical toast were delicious. My hubby got the breakfast wrap and I had a bite and it was also really yummy. We also shared an order of the Hollywood hashbrowns which are traditionally cooked hashbrowns with a mixture of peppers onions and cheese over top and they were divine! They were fast but they never checked on us and didn't clean up properly between customers as I ended up stepping in grape jelly right by my seat which is why they don't get 5 stars. Overall, it was a good experience.
author: Jenna C.

description: This place was one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. The fruit bowls where huge and fresh. Kids loved the pancakes! Orange juice was also fresh squeezed..mmm yummy!
author: David T.

description:
Food and service was great. Glad this place is open early, it beats a hotel breakfast any day!  This was my 2nd visit, both times were sort of busy but neither time did I have to wait.

The fruit bowl is a little over the top...no need for that much fruit with breakfast (at least not for a meatatarian)..  The bread was some sort of french loaf, which was good, just not what I was expecting and not what I would have preferred to put their delicious blackberry jelly on.

Great location.  And now they accept AMEX, which they didn't use to.
author: Nick G.

description: Loved this place! The food was well worth the price. Everything comes with handfuls of fresh fruit and there's plenty of bread to go around the table. In fact, maybe too much bread. We had plates and plates full delivered to our table. We were a party of 6 and we were seated rather quickly. The coffee was also great. We had the Banana French toast and the plain French toast. Both were excellent. Came with strawberries, blueberries, banana, orange, grapefruit, blackberries and raspberries. Someone in our group had the classic eggs Benedict and loved it, but she says avoid the Hollywood hash browns. Stick with the regular. The rancheros were good minus a lot of lettuce. All around a great place. Highly recommend.
author: Trina C.

description: The wait is long but worth it.  Portions are huge so come hungry and as the menu is extensive and tasty.
author: David F.

description: Visited Hollywood Cafe with the husband on a recent trip to San Francisco. We tried to eat here a couple days in a row, but there always seemed a bit of a wait, and we had different sightseeing tours to catch, so we had to pass. On our final day of sightseeing, we had some extra time and figured we'd finally wait the 20 minutes to try this place. I'm glad we did. I had the dungeness benedict with hollywood hash browns. The "hollywood hash browns" are an upgrade from the regular has browns and will cost about $2 extra, but is totally worth it. Let me start by saying that they serve A LOT of food. A LOT!! So be prepared. My husband ordered a burger. He said it was just ok. I think he liked my breakfast better. He also got an order of french toast. Again, we were not aware of the portion size and had WAY TOO MUCH food. The french toast was delicious though, and came with a TON of fruit. All in all, very good breakfast place. Definitely worth the wait.
author: Ashley V.

description:
This place provides an amazing breakfast!  We were there on busy weekend morning, but were seated reasonably quickly- maybe 15-20 minutes.  

The food was delicious, the service friendly, and the portions were amazing.  There is something for everyone on the menu.  I had a lovely French Toast dish- what's really amazing is the pile of fruit you get- we did wish we'd only ordered one full meal and shared the fruit- we couldn't eat it all and it was sad to throw it out. 

I highly,highly recommend this restaurant.  If I'm fortunate enough to be in that area again, I will certainly go back for more!
author: Susan G.

description: Excellent early morning restaurant for delicious breakfast. Wait staff were very friendly and attentive. We had their basic eggs, hash browns, sweet bacon breakfast and tasty sourdough toast with jam. Very generous portions. Definitely will return.
author: Stein H.

description:
My husband and I decided to try this place based on the positive reviews. We like Mom and Pop establishments and thought we would give this place a try.
The Hollywood Cafe does not disappoint!! The decor was bright and cheery and we loved the pics of the the movie stars on the walls.
The service was prompt and the staff works as a team.
We both had Grand Marnier French Toast which was absolutely delish! There was a huge portion of fresh fruit served on top which was to die for! 
The staff was also very attentive to us and often stopped by to refill our coffee.
We were so impressed that we had breakfast there 3 of the 4 days we were in San Francisco. We highly recommend The Hollywood Cafe!!
author: Nancy B.

description: We stayed at Holiday Inn right next door. This lovely place offered great breakfast menu and it's a lot of fun to sit at a small table on the street. Definitely get yourself the crab Benedict and pancake with fruit bowl.
author: Yuchun W.

description: I'm a very food picky and go here almost every weekend now after trying a lot of other places including Mama's with that crazy line. This is certainly the best you can find in sf.
author: Omid A.

description: We needed a solid brunch and wandered into here on our way to rent bikes. Definitely a great thing to happen! We got an order of the crab benedict and french toast. Both meals were tasty.  The waitstaff was quick and attentive---constantly filling up my coffee.  The food was tasty and in extremely large portions that were enough to carry us through dinner.  Prices weren't bad, either, knowing how close we were to the touristy area.
author: William D.

description: Awsome !!!!! Great food, huge portions, fresh fruit. The eggs bennedict with crab meat are the best I ever had. Service is real good.
author: Andrew W.

description: We came here two days in a row because it was delicious! First day i had the breakfast croissant sandwich and it came with a huge fruit bowl .  The next day my  mom and I shared the chilaquiles because portions are pretty big.  Their hash browns are delicious and the sour dough bread they serve is perfect.  San Francisco restaurants give you sourdough bread all the time but at Hollywood cafe they cut if in thin warm slices making it easier to eat!
author: Griselda Y.

description: Best breakfast in San Francisco. The portions are huge and we ended up with a lot of fruit to take back to the room. Fresh and a huge assortment of fruit.
author: Dean S.

description:
Everyone is very friendly and provides the best service. All are delicious, well presented, and quite enjoyable.
thanks you!!!
author: Je L.

description: Just visited for the first time this week. There was a long line when we arrived, so at first I wasn't sure if we'd stay, but we stuck it out and finally got called to a table. It's a very small restaurant, but the decor is cute and welcoming. The food was delicious. Everything was fresh and the portions were generous. Very reasonable prices too! I would definitely go here again.
author: Katie H.

description:
This place was the place to go. The fruit bowl is very excessive, but it was SOOO amazing. I loved the variety of berries and fruits you got. 

Everything my boyfriend and I tried at this place was great.

We were in SF for 4 days and came here for 2 breakfasts. yum
author: Candra R.

description:
Absolutely BEST breakfast in the Fisherman's Wharf district.  Fast service, even though there is always a line. As everyone says, the fruit is wonderful: fresh, exotic (with berries and pineapple in addition to standard fruit offerings), and plentiful.  

I go every time I'm in the area.  Today I ate the veggie/vegan sandwich, piled high with grilled mushrooms, tomato, onion, bell pepper, avocado and sprouts plus fruit on the side.  Yum!  My companion had the Combo Plate and loved it too.  We were both satisfied till dinner.
author: Fern B.

description: We were 7th on the table list and were sat in less than ten minutes. The staff is incredible at turning over tables and easy to get ahold of for refills, etc. The food was AMAZING. My gf and I shared their Eggs Benedict and Denver Omlette. Good portions with awesome flavors. Their fruit is the freshest in town and the hash browns are to die for.
author: Nick P.

description: I'm giving this place 4 stars solely because of the happy employees and the love people have for this place that they are willing to wait an hour to be seated here. We waited 15 minutes and decided to go someplace else because of our time crunch. The time I spent inside I observed the happy employees providing attentive service to the seated guests. Too bad we didn't get to try the food, it looked tasty and fresh.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
I never would have had breakfast here if the husband wouldn't have insisted ;-)

But it was good, the service fast, the eggs benedict exactly as I like them. All a bit on the greasy side, but it's American breakfast, what do you expect?
Great fresh fruit, huge portions, nice waiters.  

Not really a place where you would love to sit for a longer time, just because it is right in the middle of all the touristy stuff and the guests are also mainly tourists. The tables inside and on the sidewalk were a bit cramped, but ok. 

Also, they take credit cards now (VISA and Mastercard)
author: Alexa W.

description:
We where staying across the street at the Hilton in Fisherman's Warf, tourist central!. We checked Hollywood out on our second day and ate the next three mornings.
The selection was great, the portions huge and very tasty and the fruits fresh and delicious. 

The price for a tourist area was great and for what you got a great deal. And on top of this the service was friendly and attentive.

What more could you want!
author: Bill S.

description:
We were meeting friends in the area before heading to Angel Island for a bike ride so we settled on this place.  The wait was minimal and we soon had a table outside.  I had a scramble with egg whites, veggies and cheese.  It came with hash browns and toasts and everything was fine.  

Our waitress was not pleasant, but the other people who came by to refill our waters and coffee were smiley and nice.  I guess we got the one bum server.

If I were in the area again, i wouldn't mind coming back here.
author: Seong P.

description: Delicious! Great service, large potions, great choices, they were constantly offering coffee. Can't recommend it enough. We went on a Thursday morning around 11 and the wait was 2 hours long with 23 names ahead of ours. We ended up leaving and  returning on a Friday at 8:30 and we waited for 5 minutes, as we ate the line became longer by the minute. So the earlier the better (I believe it opens at 7am)
author: Paula B.

description:
Went here with a friend one weekday morning. I honestly wasn't expecting much, especially since Fishermans Warf is full of tourist traps. This place was good!! The portion sizes were appropriate as well as the prices. 

Almost every dish came with a "side" of fruit. It was a bowl! Full of all kinds of fresh fruit. That was my favorite part. They serve this sweet bacon that was delish. Will definitely be going back for a quick, yummy, affordable breakfast.
author: Lauren M.

description:
With a place like this who needs breakfast buffets? Each dish comes with a parade of food. I got the Tofu-Kimchi dish (without eggs or sauce) and asked for avocado on top. Came with a mountain of delicious fruit salad (with all the best fruits! berries, kiwies, bananas, oranges, grapefruit) and sourdough bread. They have blackberry jam and marmalade on the table.

This place is worth the wait if you want a hearty fulfilling breakfast.  Oh and get the fresh squeezed orange juice, its amazing and well worth the price.
author: Allyson D.

description: With my family I had breakfast at Hollywood Cafe twice.  On first day we ordered - blueberry Pancakes,  French Toast and eggs benedict. In second day we ordered - Greek omlette, blueberry Pancakes ( again) and tuna melt.  The dishes come with big servings of fresh cut fruits and big smiles from the staff.  The dishes are plates full of happiness. Big thank you to Hollywood Cafe for making our 2 days trip to SF special :)
author: Deepti G.

description: Great and easy breakfast with flair. Try the sweet bacon! Eggs and bacon cooked perfectly. Get there early as it fills up by 7:45ish.
author: Kellie R.

description: When my girlfriend and I saw how highly rated Hollywood Cafe was on Yelp it seemed like a no-brainer to have breakfast there. We had a 20 minute wait for a table (which seemed to be a good thing.......the more the patrons the better the meal......right?) Wrong! Everything on our plated (sourdough bread excluded) was undercooked! The hash browns were a sticky mess of undercooked potatoes and grease and our all meat omlets were gross and runny! While the price may seem "right" the quality is all WRONG. I highly suggest if you choose to eat here that you ask them to overcook everything......otherwise be prepared for a runny mess. Oh....the music in the restaurant was nice.
author: John K.

description: Food was great...especially the fruit! However...DON'T use the restroom..killed the appetite! Even my 6 yr old was grossed out. But over all we enjoyed our meal!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Food was ok. Small coffee cups small omelets.  No waiting list. You just stand in a line outside Like it's elementary school.
author: Pahlavan N.

description: Job well done! Fast and efficient service, only to be outdone by the great tasting meal. Highly recommend this café. A truly 5 star restaurant with award winning service.
author: Joe K.

description: I would have enjoyed this place if we weren't stuck in corner, took 30 min to get a 2nd cup of coffee. Dropped my ham steak on the floor after one bite and busser scooped it up and didn't bother to ask if they could replace it. And I had to walk to the front of the restaurant to get sweetener for my coffee. Was seated quickly with party of 5 and food out fast but it was service fail after that.
author: Shannon K.

description:
Went for breakfast - place was really busy, but we found a table inside.  The food is very reasonably priced and tastes great.  You get some toasted sourdough baguette with every meal and it was very good (but we don't have great sourdough where I live!)

Service was quick and very good.

The breakfast sandwich was very good, as were the hash browns (thin and actually cooked!)
author: Andy B.

description: We went on a Thursday morning around 9am. Waited about 15 minutes in line for a table of two, and got an outdoor table. Food was good, ordered a combo French toast, generous sized portions.  Staff was attentive, kept my coffee refilled.
author: Fabio H.

description: Very impressed with my breakfast. fast seating and friendly staff will have me coming back. great sidewalk dining.
author: George G.

description:
The place deserves the 4 star review. Kimchee tofu egg benedict with chipotle hollandaise? Yes please! If you are a kimchee fan, I highly recommend this dish. It will go down in history for me and when I come back to SF I will definitely be back for it.

They are very generous with the portions, they are gigantic! So come hungry. Really, really hungry.  I upgraded to the Hollywood hash browns and although they were delicious I felt like the hash brows got a bit "lost" in all the toppings...but they were good. The fresh squeezed OJ was great, however the regular coffee leaves a little bit to be desired for me...It was a bit bitter. Overall a great place for brunch, although not cheap...brunch for two was just under $50 with tip.
author: Erika C.

description: Not sure why this has such good reviews. Food is bland and atmosphere is rushed. You're sitting on top of the tables next to you. I would not go back.
author: Kim G.

description: Great place for Breakfast. The portions are huge and good is great!! Highly recommend if your near Fisherman's Wharf!
author: David Y.

description: This place is awesome! I would think anyone who rated this restaurant with less than 4 stars is hard to please. We had a party of five with five different meals and they were all excellent! Come hungry, the portions are huge!
author: Lisa B.

description: Very prompt and friendly service.  Excellent breakfast!! Fruit bowl is fresh and delicious me all the food had fresh ingredients and very very good quality.  Highly recommended!
author: Jessica S.

description: Stopped by on a whim, what a joy! Excellent service, pleasant sidewalk seating. The breakfast omlets and fresh fruit are phenomenal!! Personally, I liked it better than the famed Mama's, and it was much more wallet friendly too!
author: Melanie P.

description:
This place is super. We've been there twice. Always went around noon either Saturday or Sunday. We didn't experience the crowd, always 'sit wherever you like'.

I like the orange and strawberry jam, they are decent. Not those cheap ones.
Coffee, I like it, sort of bean I favor. It is just tasting right.

The breakfast dish, like Jean, French toast, pan cake combo (we ordered so far) all come big. The fresh fruit bowl has all kinds fruit, even cherry. Again, comes with very big amount. Not the bowl I normally saw.  I think they only have sourdough toast, comes with 4 slices. Crunchy, yummy with Jams.
I'm always feeling so full, after finish my 2 scrambled eggs and some fruit...

Mimosa is good too. Scrambled eggs are cooked very good, just about right.
Service are good and attentive. 

I would say, this place is worth it!
author: Gloria W.

description:
I was happy to see that this place was open again after a short period of time being remodeled. I couldn't wait to try it again and confirm what I thought when I first came here - that this is a hidden gem. And a hidden gem it is indeed.

My friend and I went there for breakfast today. He ordered the Greek omelete, I had the Italian one. We both changed the potatoes for fruit ($1 more), and were again amazed by the freshness and variety of the fruit (strawberries, grapes, bananas, melons, pineapple, grapes, papayas, oranges). Our omeletes were well done and full of flavors The Asian server was fast to refill our coffees and always with a big smile. 

This is a little 'hole in the wall' that serves an honest and delicious breakfast! It's a hidden gem and I'm glad it's near my place. Will keep coming back for their breakfast! :-)
author: Simone W.

description:
This place is a hidden gem and we normally go here for a late breakfast on weekends.. It is near fisherman's wharf and so unfortunately is a little bit touristy but we have never had to line up for more than a few minutes. The staff are friendly and courteous without being in your face. 

There service is really quick and the food has a home made feeling to it. The spinach and mushroom omelette with sour cream on the side is really yummy. My wife normally has the buttermilk pancakes which she loves. Most of the dishes come with a side of fresh cut fruit on the side. You can tell the ingredients used a really fresh.

 In a city with lots of pretentious restaurants where you line up for 30 mins only to be treated poorly by the servers, it's nice to know there is a place like this which serves high quality, home cooked style breakfast, at a good price with friendly service. Check it out.
author: Matthew H.

description: My boyfriend and I came here while in San Fran due to the rave reviews - and we loved it! We got there about 9 on a Thursday and it was already almost full. The portions were HUGE and prices were more than reasonable. I got the egg white omelet with spinach, beets and peppers with a side of fruit. The fruit cup was giant. I ate only about 1/4 of it. My breakfast companion got the combo french toast with 3 wedges of toast, bacon and eggs. The eggs weren't the greatest in his meal but the french toast was amazing!
author: Sarah R.

description: Huge portions of very delicious food! Very friendly staff. Sit inside or outside. Great place to stop for breakfast when visiting the fisherman's wharf.
author: Scott R.

description: Everyone needs to eat here but arrive early! It is definitely worth the wait. I recommend everything hahaha. Serving sizes are large, customer service is quick and friendly and everyone works really hard. Delicious sweet bacon and fruit bowls
author: Mandy R.

description: This place was really awesome on our annual trip to San Francisco. But this year, it wasn't good at all. Quality of food was not at the same level as trips past. Need to rethink my coming here each year.
author: Lee P.

description: This restaurant it one of the best breakfast places i have ever been to also I got this app just to review this restaurant.
author: Cooper M.

description: Excellent customer service! Really great french toast (I got the Vanilla Bananna French toast) and Hollywood hashbrowns. We sat outside and did not have to wait at all to be seated. I am a light eater and a foodie but really thought the food here was great (I left no food on my plate).
author: India S.

description:
Great place like everyone else said already.  Very conveniently across from Hyatt and other hotels in the area

- good coffee
- extra $2 for fruit cup totally worth it, fresh cut fruits!
- The bread they bring to each table were fresh, nicely toasted
author: Thomas H.

description: After being unwilling to wait on line at Mamas, we found ourselves here.  The wait was 10 minutes and the Rancheros were tasty.  Hash browns could have been hotter, but overall, tasty meal!  I would definitely recommend making the trek from the Mama's line to here, if even for the massive/fresh fruit alone!  Good stuff, friendly staff, quick service!
author: Lauren R.

description: We stayed walking distance to this restaurant from our hotel (The Sheraton) in fisherman's wharf. We ate here two mornings in a row! Just their toast (sourdough) with jam was amazing. Their special plates with large side fruit is out of this world.  Fruit is fresh, huge variety (6-9 varieties) and huge. Took more than half of the fruit to go which was great for a snack late morning. We enjoyed their omelets , pancakes and French toast. Wasn't big on their hash browns was like a thin flying saucer I heard a neighboring guest say. Tables are really close to each other but yet didn't seem awkward. If every back in area will be back!
author: Jacob J.

description: Amazing. The best breakfast restaurant I have been to in a very long time. Very generous portions of food plus excellent fresh fruit.
author: Jeff Z.

description: We are visiting from Florida and found this place all because of the lines we saw each morning. We had to try it!  It was so worth the 20 minute wait and i would come here again.  Cute place with generous portions, plus the fruit was delicious!  A great value and we would come back again.
author: Robin B.

description:
Tiny, Tiny place near the Warf that has great food and great service.

I read the reviews on Yelp and decided to try the hole in the wall with very good reviews.
We were sat quickly and it was a little cramped and had cheesy Hollywood celebrity photos all over the wall and the menu had meals named after classic movie stars. This is usually a huge sign of a crappy tourist trap but this Cafe was anything but. They brought out a bowl of fruit that was so perfect, colorful, and tasty that they seemed fake. This was the best fruit I have ever had and I could have made an entire meal out of just the fruit...unbelievable.

Next up was the french toast which was perfectly soft with a little crispy of the crust area. The powdered sugar and syrup was decorated perfectly, and looked as good as it tasted. The only improvement I would suggest is to get a more gourmet syrup on the toast would really make this meal be perfect. Everyone else also loved their meal just as much as much as I did and the service was very fast and courtesy. 

Overall: A perfect spot with a perfect breakfast and there is no better place to go on a sunny day in San Francisco.
author: Cody F.

description:
we found this place on our last day. bummer for us.
