there was a wait, perhaps 30 minutes and it was cold outside. but well worth it. once we were seated and our orders taken, our meals came quickly. my eggs benedict were good. if the yolks had been a bit runny, it would have been awesome. fresh fruit that accompanied the meal was deliciously fresh. hubby really liked his sausage patty, scrambled eggs were good. 

loved the sliced slightly toasted sourdough that accompanies every meal. raspberry jam/preserves in the jar...scrumptious. marmalade, normally my fave, was just okay.

prices were reasonable. 

highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast.
author: Diane C.

description: I've eaten here twice and both times it's been amazing. It's not the fact that the eggs and bacon and toast are all great because they are, but what makes it amazing is all the fresh fruits they bring you with your breakfast. Also their hot chocolate and lemonade are very good. It's an easy place to get to from the wharf and it's worth checking out, you won't be disappointed.
author: Tim M.

description:
Great breakfast choices, amazing fruit bowl (it's well worth the 2 dollars, or even double that!), and speedy, delightful service. Wonderful choice for breakfast for anyone near Fisherman's wharf. 

Our party all got egg dishes, and loved them each. The french toast was also delightful.

If you can ignore the kitchy decor, only positives remain...we'll be back there on our next trip to SF!
author: LJ Q.

description: This little place is a score!  I went for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised, especially by the variety of menu options. The staff is 100% attentive without being intrusive, food was very good, portions are more than generous--they don't skimp on the good stuff.  Now, Iiit is "cozy" in there....don't plan on having an important, personal convo, but do plan on having a yummy breakfast.
author: Donna M.

description: Incredibly good!. largest fruit bowl we have ever seen.
author: Hgames R.

description: First rule of vacationing: throw normal, healthy eating patterns out the window. First breakfast was here at Hollywood Cafe due to the plethora of glowing reviews. Pleasantly surprised to have only waited about 20 min, a bit shorter than the average. Staff is friendly. Received sourdough bread with some super tasty jam. Try the jam. Ordered to share the french toast, omelet, bacon and hash browns. As noted by most, fruit topping on every dish. Greatly enjoyed the variety of fruit, french toast and the veggies in my omelet.  Wasn't impressed with the hash browns and omelet, both could have benefited from more of a kick. Overall, liked the place and will be back.
author: Mercedes L.

description: Good breakfast spot. I got the pancake combo there and it was a lot of food, which is good! Large portions, decent service, fast service. I have no complaints.
author: Paul O.

description: Great American breakfast with a flare- I would definitely do the dungeness crab benedict with capers again.  They don't skimp on the fresh fruit, either.  Be prepared for a bit of a wait, but it will probably be worth it.
author: Misha U.

description:
We ate here five out of seven days.  The hashbrowns is a huge portion, crispy and delicious.  The iced tea alone is fabulous.  The breakfast entrees, fruit cup  are huge and the luncheon sandwiches are all fresh and delicious.  The sourdough buttered toast is so yummy, I wanted to pack it and take it home.  

Service is friendly, although a little slow.  They move the crowds along pretty fast.  All in all, a delightful and wonderful breakfast and/or lunch spot.  Get there early.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Marian P.

description: My family loved this place it was the best place to eat breakfast. We came from the east bay and the trip was so worth it. The pancakes were awesome and for the price that my family paid for, it was worth every penny. I only wish I lived around the area to eat their food everyday!
author: A K.

description:
Girlfriend and I went here on a weekday morning. When we sat down, we were the only ones in the place. I ordered the "Clark Gable", which is two eggs, apple flavored chicken sausage, fresh fruit, and toast. It comes with tea or coffee, which is a welcome surprise. My girlfriend got the vegetable omelet, and was pleased with it.

My eggs were well cooked, the fruit was flavorful and very fresh, and the apple flavored sausage was tremendous. The tea was also a nice bonus. 

Definitely recommend for breakfast!
author: Benjamin W.

description: Our family ate here for all 4 days of our visit to San Francisco because it is that good!  It is fast, so do not worry about the line.  It is worth it.  All the food is great.  The staff is fantastic.  And it is a great value.  The fresh fruit was the best surprise.  I ordered egg whites each morning and they are fresh and they give a ton!  I would say that because the portions are so large, consider sharing or ordering sides.  It is so good you don't want any to go to waste; but it is very difficult to eat it all!
author: Kim N.

description:
Best place for breakfast in the area! they close at 2pm. Their french toast is the best I have had bar none! Try the Marilyn Monroe plate, is delish and the fruit cup that comes with it is just to die for!!  It is all so much better than anything around. Servers are nice hand helpful. Place is clean. And prices are GREAT! Will be going back all week!
WARNING: it is always very crowded but line moves pretty fast!
author: Wanda G.

description:
Just spent a week with my family in San Francisco, Santa Cruz, and Monterey. Stayed two nights at the Wharf Inn in Fishermans Wharf and had a blast. Tried HC after reading the reviews on Yelp. It was great! Hands down the best coffee I had all week.

Fruit bowl was beautiful and delicious... well worth the extra couple of bucks! Everything we had was great... so much so that we ate there again the next morning.

The best thing, though, was the staff. They were all so friendly and nice. Lots of genuine smiles and they all worked so well together like a great team.
author: Johnny C.

description: Great choice for breakfast when in the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf area.  I had the James Dean which comes with a large side of fresh fruit.  If you ask for sourdough toast, you get real sliced sourdough toast, not the store bought pre-sliced stuff.  They are quick on the coffee refills and the service was excellent.
author: Morgan N.

description:
We stayed across the street at the Hyatt and ate here every morning.    You know when you watch a movie and the shy quiet character suddenly busts out ninja skills?  Thats this place!   The building, the tables, the servers all broadcast that the food will be mediocre but then they hit you!  Damn!  They can cook!

I wont go through each menu item I tried because I firmly beleive they do everything well here.  Its just good.
author: Austin M.

description:
I ate here Last week on my trip to San Francisco. It was just a short stop on our way to do a little shopping near the wharf and some sightseeing touristy stuff. 
     It was pretty busy on Monday morning, but luckily for us they had a table for 2 ready with no one waiting. at this point, I had some type of special hash browns. they included bacon, cheese, and mushrooms. Maybe even some other stuff. The food was pretty good, i mean its breakfast food. If you can't cook breakfast you should be in business.
    Overall it was just another breakfast spot for us. Nothing special, but you won't be disappointed either. If you are in the area, you should stop in here for some breakfast.
author: Anthony R.

description: This place was located across a street from my hotel. So I thought I would try it as it was always busy. The prices was reasonable and the portions were good! The wait staff was extremely friendly and polite. This is a must for breakfast if in the area. Oh, ya the service was fast.
author: Glenn S.

description: Ok what happened. Three years now, we have been coming here when we come to SF. We liked it before. You used to get these nice large pieces of sourdough. Today it was little tiny pieces. We order the same every time. Eggs and hash browns. I saw the table next to us get theirs and everything looked normal. My hash browns were way too done; too brown, kind of on the way to burned. The bacon was annihilated; very hard. My husbands chorizo was hard and nasty. Some of that is the server. They should look at the food they are bringing.  They used to have iced tea, now no. I guess we will find another place for breakfast.
author: Nancy P.

description: My kids and I loved Hollywood Cafe.  French toast was wonderful, candied bacon, YUM!!  breakfast salad, amazing.  So much fresh fruit!!  Service was perfect.  They are on the small side so get there early and expect a short wait, they are worth it.  All this and mimosa's!!
author: Debbie s.

description: This place is awesome!  Wow, I could have gotten by with the kids menu. Lots of food and all of it was great, great prices too.
author: Sean M.

description: We received friendly service on a cool Saturday morning, we sat outside under a heater. It was busy but we still received fast and friendly service. The coffee was hot and tasted great! The breakfast portions are large. I ordered the French toast combo plate with bacon. The food was okay. The scrambled eggs were not fluffy, the bacon seemed like it had been sitting around a little bit, and the French toast was good. It came with a huge portion of fruit including an entire banana so keep that in mind. Good place to stop on the way to Pier 33 for the Alcatraz tour.
author: Jenelle R.

description: Reasonable price with acceptable food. Portion is good as well. I can't barely finish half...
author: Lydia C.

description: Love this place! Everything on the menu is yummy. The no. 5 Vivien Leigh (croissant breakfast sandwich with fruit) is my goto but there's a lot of other menu options. Nobody walks away from here hungry, the portions are generous.
author: Namtan A.

description: To quote my Dad "I'm 70 and that is the best plate of food I remember having".  Just alone the side of fruit was fantastic, add to it perfectly cooked hash browns and an overflowing bacon and egg sandwhich, friendly service and buttered toast to munch on while we waited for our food... We'll likely be back tomorrow :)
author: Kelly W.

description: Make sure you sign in for a table!  Well worth the wait but we got lucky and only had to wait for a table for 10m.  Staff is courteous and quick to attend to you and your guests.  Simple menu, great food and service a must do in San Francisco...
author: Bob S.

description:
holy crab! had the dungeness eggs benedict and it was amazing. i hate being that midwestern girl who goes ape for good seafood because it's so hard to get, but oh, i am. it was just so delicious. i couldn't help but compare it to the last time i had an eggs benedict with crab (at a fancier place in michigan) and it doesn't even compare (cheaper here too!). the hollandaise was delicious and so were the hash browns.

the boyf got a bananas foster-type meal and that was really great too. the best part though was the fresh fruit that came with his. everything was so fresh and the strawberries were even the little strawberries - the kind that are tiny but pack a huge, sweet strawberry flavor, unlike any you can find in a supermarket.

the service was super friendly and we had several people waiting on us but our main guy was very cheery and even offered us coffee to go without any reason. everything was just pleasant. it was more expensive than it probably would have been in other parts of town but still. i love fisherman's wharf and being around tourists (like me, hehe) so i did not mind at all.
author: Kensey W.

description: I've biked by this restaurant for 10 years and finally stopped in for breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and service. I ordered the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict with the hollandaise sauce on the side and their awesome hash browns. So filling, soooo good, and I took 1/2 to go.  Coffee was strong and free refills. I'll be back to try the pancakes. Friendly service with indoor and outdoor seating
author: Louisa P.

description: Only open for b-fast and lunch but really good.  Really fast.  Really cheap.  Best b fast place bear fishermans wharf.  Also had good selection.  Good family place.  Lots of choices.  Everything comes with lots and lots of fruit.  Every order is big big big.-- lots of food
author: Tom B.

description:
Very good breakfast place and convenient b/c it is very close to the hilton at fishermans wharf where I usually stay in SF.  I had the eggs benedict with crab instead of canadian bacon.  IT was really good.  The food came out fast too.  I was able to read my papers in calm b/c it was not too loud.  The only downside was when I needed a refill of coffee, I just could not get my waiter's attention, even by waving my arms as if trying to hail down a nearby ship.  So I had to go to the wait station and was about to pour my own damned coffee when a nice waitress did it for me.

Not too expensive and good food so I'll be back.
author: Marc W.

description: Make sure to get here early! This place had a large line outiside the door! Very small space inside and outside, but staff was great at getting people seated! My family and I were seated outside and recieved awesome service. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I had the "Marilyn Monroe" which is 3 slices (basically a full slice and a half) of yummy french toast and fruit. Let me tell you, they do not slack on portion size. They gave me so much that you couldnt see the french toast hiding underneath! Overall I had a great meal and will be sure to stop by on my next visit to san fran!
author: Carly W.

description: I had a lovely cup of tea here: Numi Organic Breakfast Blend. They had a number of different choices of tea. Vastly better than the tea I had from the nearby Starbucks.
author: Sarah G.

description: Seemed like a great place to go after reading yelp reviews but I will definitely chose a different place next time. The staff is quick to seat u and take your order yet that was the extend of customer service. My breakfast (Fransican) was terrible. The eggs were greatly over cooked and there were so many scallions it should have been called the FranSCALLION. I picked through to eat what I could and still had a pile of onions, gees! Disappointing experience for sure.
author: Momi B.

description: This place is ridiculously busy!!! While visiting friends in the area, they recommended we get breakfast here. It was right around the corner from our hotel so we figured we would give it a shot. A cafe in the middle of the touristy wharf neighborhood I wouldn't think would be that great but I figured our friends (the locals) knew what they were talking about. Placed a to go order for four, mostly French toasts with a side of fruit which set us back $75. Pretty pricey but any request we made like substituting for fruit was an additional charge which was unfortunate. The place is chaotic and picking up a to go order on a Saturday morning was no exception. All the orders were correct which in itself is great cuz anytime you pick up a large order, it seems like something is always off. The French toast tasted amazing. Had the vanilla banana and it was perfect. And the portion was just right. I thought they would be stingy with the side of fruit substitution but it was a large container of fruit and fruit I actually wanted to eat (not just cantaloupe or melon which I hate). I would eat here again but perhaps not on the weekend as I personally don't think a lot of foods are worth waiting in ridiculously long lines for even if it tastes good.
author: T H.

description: I love this place. Today I am enjoying a Mango Mimosa with my salad. Heavenly. They serve delicious breakfast food. Try then.
author: SunnyDays A.

description: Amazing breakfast! This has become a regular stop for me. A local told me about their crab omelette years ago and it's still the best I ever had. And their fruit? Why does it taste so much better than all the other fruit I've eaten? Perfect service, perfect food.
author: James Y.

description:
The Kimchi Tofu Eggs Benedict were a welcomed surprise. Was not the right choice for the day, but next time I stumble into this place hung over, that is my breakfast choice once more.

Nice toasted sourdough bread. Great attentive staff, reasonable prices.
author: Wolfgang I.

description: Great little breakfast joint!  Fresh  fruit of all kinds included with most orders.
author: Jeff J.

description: Don't believe negative reviews. So you wait. I only had to wait 15 mins on a weekday. Food was abundant and delicious. Servers were attentive and never rushed. If touristy means it is popular because it had good food and interesting ambiance, then so be it!
author: John B.

description: Honestly, this place is amazing!  The food is so good, I would rate it a 6 or 7 if possible. Probably the best french toast I've ever had!!  Great location, right down by the piers, super easy to get to via the cable cars.  Lots of food and not overly priced either.  The only downside of our meal was the service, it wasn't great and was the only reason I didn't give this a 5 star rating.  But highly recommended and can't wait to come back here again!!
author: David S.

description:
We got to the restaurant around 9am on a Tuesday and it was very crowded, but we only waited about 15 minutes for a table. 
Once we ordered our food, we only waited about 10 minutes-at the most- until it arrived. The raspberry preserves were delicious! 
My eggs benedict were perfect! The fruit was very fresh and not just cheap melons.
author: Erica G.

description: Great presentation, good service, easy to find. I ordered the French toast with bananas they were warm, strawberries fans blueberries fresh, walnuts candied and whip cream. It was delicious. My boyfriend ordered meat lovers omelette and Hollywood hash browns. His food was good too. They also serve sourdough with warm butter prior to food coming out. So if u went to sf to get your sourdough fix you will get warm bread here.
author: Deborah T.

description:
I'm not sure what's with the 4+ star rating.  I mean this place is ok.  The food is fine; nothing amazing, but definitely acceptable.  Service is good.  Price is ok.  Being in Fisherman's Wharf, I expect it to be a bit on the pricey side and it is.  I got the Southwest Benedict, Coffee and some bacon and the total came to $20.  Not exactly a steal.

It's a fine place to grab some breakfast if you're already in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.  There are so many better places in the city, I just can't justify giving this place 4 or 5 stars.

So, in summary if you're in Fisherman's Wharf and you want a decent meal and don't mind paying a bit of premium to be in tourist central, then this place is a good option.  Although, personally I think there are some better options in the area.
author: Ted G.

description: What a plateful of food!  The place is small and bright, the staff quick and efficient.  Ate here with my husband and kids and I wish we would have split just two entrees.  First, let me say the hash browns are perfect!  They are so thin it allows them to all be crispy with just a smidge of softer potato in the middle.  The omletts are ginormous, but spot on.  I had the crab one and it was delicious, although the crab wasn't quite as warm as I would have liked it.  The fruit bowl fed the whole table.  I was impressed they had such good fruit in the dead of winter.  I wouldn't want to wait to long to eat here, but if you can get it pretty quick, it is a total deal.
author: Carol L.

description: Very good breakfast. They have freshly squeezed orange juice, real maple syrup (extra) and the fruit plate (extra) is full of great variety. Also tried the Salmon Benedict and it was very delicious. Portions are great size and prices are decent. Very European style outside sitting. I'd come back!
author: Ugur A.

description: I was lucky to try this place out on a beautiful, perfectly sunny and crisp Wednesday morning. It was around the corner from my hotel in the Wharf and it was YUMMY! The ambiance is so kitschy and kind of old Hollywood backstage storage-roomy. But it totally works for the place and the great food helps. They have the breakfast standards, but they also have specials named after old Hollywood greats. I had the Vivian Leigh and it was amaze-ah-balls! The huge, overflowing bowl of sweet, chilled fruit and great coffee were icing on the cake. Next time I am in San Fran I will be sure to stop by this place again.
author: Gia G.

description:
Blown away!

My friend and I were looking for a good place to eat near the pier and ended up going here. I seriously cannot believe how amazing the food was! I would strongly recommend the egg and ham sandwich! It was huge!

The service was speedy and always there for you. You will not be disappointed.
author: Tony D.

description: We had breakfast here two days in a row.. the first wasn't as good as the the second. Round 1- stuffed tomato and seafood benedict.  Neither were very impressive but with the great reviews we tried it again. Round 2- French toast and blueberry pancakes. They were both amazing! The side of fruit was huge and delicious!  I feel sorry for the people that say this place has good service.  It seems to be slightly better then most places in the area but still  not great or even what I would call good.
author: Michael B.

description: One of my favorite breakfast spots in SF now! Food, service, and portions are all great! I got the vanilla French toast :)
author: Riss W.

description:
What took you such a long time for reopening? 
Thx for coming back with espresso drinks, quality food, squeaky clean ambiance. 
I just have to say 
WELLCOME BACK.... HOLLYWOOD STARS....
author: Sam L.

description: The serving sizes here are HUGE! Good quality is great and the service is excellent. Breakfast defeated me which is something I never say.
author: Hans S.

description: Solid breakfast place, was busy so we waited 10-15 minutes to be seated. Ordered the standards, eggs/bacon, French toast. Portions included generous amount of fruit. Service was quick, staff was friendly, and the food arrived all at once for party of 5. Ambience is OK.
author: Sam J.

description: Unhealthy overall place. Quantity over quality. Sooo much butter on everything! Order one dish to share for two.  Fruit bowl sides were large and good quality.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I really struggle to see how anyone could have had a bad experience at this place. My wife and i ate here on our recent trip to San Francisco. We originally were going to go there because it was close to our hotel but a quick look on Yelp suggested it may just exceed our expectations.

We turned up and there was a wait but we were seated within about 5 minutes. The restaurant is quite small and cozy. We were immediately asked what we would like to drink and ordered coffee and orange juice and given menus. The drinks arrived quickly and we ordered.

Firstly the oj is freshly squeezed and delicious. I had the hash browns loaded with eggs and a side of chicken applewood sausage and my wife had the open face lox. Both meals were very satisfying, good portions and delicious, served with orange wedges which was nice for cleaning the pallette somewhat after. Very impressed and would recommend. Staff are very friendly and efficient.
author: Ross H.

description: I have never written a review on Yelp, but after brunch this morning at Hollywood I felt morally obligated to. I am not exaggerating when I say this is the best breakfast food I have ever had. I ordered the Vivien Leigh (bacon eggs and cheddar on a croissant) and it was delicious. Even better, however, was the enormous serving of fresh fruit that came with it. The sourdough bread served with my family's orders as a side was also excellent. The portions are huge all around so it is well worth the money. And definitely worth the waiting in line!
author: Mattie S.

description:
Our first breakfast in SFO was an overpriced brunch at the hotel, but on our second morning we decided to test the little cafe directly across the street from the hotel.  Best. Decision. Ever.

Hollywood Cafe is a tiny little breakfast and lunch spot on North Point, about three blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. In a city of absurdly overpriced food, this little street side cafe was a welcome alternative.  Not only could the four of us eat for less than $50 (which, in SFO, is a bit of an anomaly), but the food was well-prepared, the portions perfect, and the service friendly and attentive without being overbearing (or creepy - see my review of Alioto's). 

I can safely say everything we ordered - omelets, pancakes, waffles, french toast, eggs, hash browns - was, well, delicious. The ingredients were fresh and cooked to order. The fruit on the side freshly cut. The orange juice freshly squeezed. The coffee piping hot. The food was so good, in fact, we ate breakfast there every day.

There are only two drawbacks I could identify, and they're not bad enough to downgrade it from 5 stars.  First, the place is cash only, but this fact is not prominently displayed.  Second, if you eat inside (which some people do avoid the early morning SFO chill), you end up smelling like breakfast. However, there is a solution: bring cash, wear a sweatshirt and eat at one of the sidewalk tables.
author: Gavin S.

description: Without a doubt, best breakfast place I have found near Fisherman's Wharf.  If you order one of the specials with the fruit bowl included I guarantee you you will be leaving there with leftover fruit in a container.  We have each time we have eaten there.  The sourdough toast is done to perfection, adds a nice touch to a great breakfast in San Francisco !!   We had the JAmes Dean and the Vivian Leigh... both prepared perfectly.  Good coffee too...  And trust me you get your money's worth.. Don't need much of a lunch after a breakfast there ....  We will be back, many times...
author: Patrick C.

description:
I stumbled across this place on my walk from the trolley to the bay. 

While I was waiting for table, I overheard the following conversation between four backwards capped twenty somethings and an elderly couple with Australian accents: 

"Wow...those breakfast sandwiches sure look delicious"

"We just had to come because everyone told us how amazing it was" (as they were packing the leftovers into boxes).

"If you go inside there are thank you letters from people all over the world. Even some famous people." 

Indeed there are tons of letters hanging from the wall all singing the praises of Hollywood Cafe. After breakfast there, I have to agree. I love a good hearty breakfast and Hollywood Cafe hit just the spot. 

As previously reviewed, the fruit was AMAZING. The grapes even tasted better than any grape I have had before (how this is even possible I don't know). The chicken sausage was delicious. The eggs covered with cheese and avocado were divine. A great hole in the wall breakfast find indeed.
author: Christina B.

description: place was horrible!! rude employees, place had way to many flies!!! it took way too long for me to get my food!! food made my stomach hurt an gave me the runs,i would like a refund,i wouldn't be eating here again!!!!!
author: Erinn B.

description:
Came here based on the Yelp recommendations and was a bit concerned given the mixed reviews since their reopening.

Granted I never went before and was only in SanFran for a day so don't have much to compare it to, but my breakfast was quite tasty!

Highly recommend the fruit plate.  For 5 bucks it is a heaping plate of fresh fruit, better than I have ever seen at any other place.

I ordered the eggs with peters hash browns which came with toast as well.  It definitely was not greasy or anything of the such although it could have been with all the toppings on the hash browns (thin cut hash browns topped with bacon, green peppers, onions, cheese, mushrooms, etc).  My scrambled eggs were cooked well and I was happy.

My wife had the egg, bacon, cheese sandwich and said it was very good as well.  Not sure why someone else complained that their sandwich didn't come with egg, it's pretty obvious on the menu which sandwiches come with egg and which don't.

The service, as mentioned by others, was very attentive and pleasant.  Couldn't be much happier with a breakfast place.
author: Kyle M.

description:
You just don't get this anymore . . . great tasting food, fast and affordable.  My wife and I didn't even have to get lunch after that.  The meal was that satisfying.  

The service was old fashioned in a very good way.  3 examples:

- A father came in with kid in a stroller and asked to purchase a single banana - the owner asked if it was for the kid, the dad said yes.  He just gave it to him.  That doesn't happen in L.A.

- I dropped my fork, mind you, I was sitting outside the cafe and by the time I leaned over to pick it up, he was there with a replacement knife and fork like The Flash!   He brought both because he did not see what I dropped, but he heard the 'ping'! when it fell.

- A panhandler asked for a cup of water - he gave him bottled water.  
What a refreshing experience.  We liked it so much that we took a cab from the Ferry building with our luggage in tow and a cab back with just minutes to spare before boarding to Larkspur and then making the drive back to LA!

BTW - They take credit cards now.
author: Tony T.

description: The fruit bowls are like nothing I've ever seen in a restaurant before! Great breakfast!!
author: Katie P.

description:
Had 2 good breakfast meals on consecutive days while in SF this past week. Veggie omelet , coffee, OJ, toast and French Toast was eaten by the 2 of us. But don't forget the fruit that comes with many of the dishes, it's a huge portion, top quality and very tasty.

The price is a bit high but it's at Fisherman's Wharf so that is understood. I wouldn't  drive out of my way to eat there but if your at the Wharf it's well worth the visit.

Very busy the mornings we were there, had to wait a few minutes for a seat.
author: Mikey I.

description: We were disappointed. We are locals and that might be part of the problem. This is really near the wharf and all the wharf hotels and it's definitely a tourist place. So for a tourist place it's fine but comparing it to other local bunch places, it just doesn't stand up. The food is fine but nothing was outstanding. Service was great and kudos for that. The crab Benedict did come with a decent amount of tender crab and fresh, not overlooked spinach. The French toast came with a healthy helping of berries which I was very happy about. I'm not sure what people are talking about the Hollywood hash browns being great but we didn't like that at all. It comes with some strange fake cheese sauce on it and the bacon is not crispy. Oh, and if you order a side of bacon "crispy" prepare to be disappointed because it wasn't crispy. I enjoyed the korean grain drink. Yummy. If you're a tourist looking for a solid place- go here. But if you're a local, skip this place for something better.
author: Piper W.

description: What makes the difference is the entrance in the moring. The team welcomes you very cheerful with a joined effort "MORNING". Food quantity and quality is OK (omelets are very large size).  Your coffee cup is continuously topped up, think not much you can wish for. Surely a must try for a breakfast person!
author: C S.

description: Great service love it. The food is delicious as well! so glad i came here!
author: Lupita Z.

description: Not great but not at all bad. If you in the fisherman warf area on vacation and you would like a simple breakfast then this is the place for you. Food was good and the service was good enough.
author: David R.

description: Hefty breakfast! Italian omelet with sourdough toast and hash browns $11. Got full fast, tasty! Gave rest to a man on the street.
author: Maria H.

description: A little thrown off by the appearance but the food was amazing! (All that matters) I def would recommend! Satisfied :)
author: Giovanna O.

description:
Seriously, I was pleasantly surprised and delighted when I saw the amount of fresh fruits on my plate! There were bananas, strawberries, grapes, blueberries, orange, etc... they took up half of my plate!  I'm a total fruit lover, so the my eggs and sausages became my side dish!

I definitely like it here and will not hesitate to come back!

One small drawback, this place is super small so be prepared to sit outside (in the cold).. the bf and I were lucky enough to go on a fairly sunny day but it was still a tad chilly.
author: Karina L.

description: This place did not disappoint! Definitely agree with the other reviews that it is the best breakfast!! My boyfriend had just the cheeseburger and it was also delicious! Will be back when we visit again!
author: Amy G.

description: Very Convenient Place to have a nice morning brunch, with access to the SF Wharf and other venues, ie Boudins, Pier 39, Rainforest Cafe, and the downtown wharf area near local restaurants and shops. Enjoyed a bowl of Clam Chowder with a fruit salad. Nice breakfast place with great access to a little sample of everything that SF has to offer, and all within walking distance.
author: Jackie W.

description: We were visiting San Fran from Ohio. My family and I loved this place.  Great service and food. We wished we had time to go back.
author: Sumner S.

description:
First of all it's Northpoint Street - Not  N. Point Street.  If you look for Point Street in San Francisco you'll never find it because there is none.

On Saturday morning, July 2 , after shopping the Farmers Market,  we came here for breakfast.  Sat outside.  It truly is the BEST breakfast in the area.  I asked for fruit instead of hashbrowns, and WoW.  It was a fruit salad with grapes, melon, pineapple, strawberries, oranges and a whole banana.  The omlette was perfect, the coffee robust, fresh squeezed juice.  It's a small sidewalk style cafe with little tables.  You might wait a few to be seated but well worth it.  Service is fast & friendly - prices are decent - food is great !!
author: StuknLodi T.

description: Had the crab and avocado omelette and Hollywood hash browns--delicious.  Very comfort-foody and exactly what i was looking for.  Tons of fresh fruit came with my fiancee's scrambled egg and bacon croissantwich, which was delicious as well.
author: Andy D.

description: This is a must go eat when you are visiting San Francisco. Location was convenient, as our hotel was only a few blocks away.  We ate here 4 times for breakfast during our 6 day stay... That's how incredible the food was.  Big portions ( consider sharing a plate) and the fruit was fresh every time. Service is good and quick! Even on those mornings when there was a line, the wait was not as bad as you would have thought.  Seating is a bit cramped... But your in SF area where the real estate is ridiculously over priced so get cozy!!!  Only one draw back... No accessible restroom, this is the only reason I did not give a 5 star rating.
author: P S.

description: Dungeoness (crab) Eggs Benedict- soooo fresh! Giant portions of perfectly ripe fruit with each plate. Soy chai latte- yum! The portions we so big my wife and I took her bagel with lox to go for lunch later. We will be back!!!
author: Mark C.

description: The parking was difficult at best but I walked from my hotel so it was ok.  The restaurant is small but worth the wait.  We dinned outside, which was a great start to the morning.  The only flaw was the size of the table.  We had a party of four and it was difficult to fit all of the plates.  The sides are huge.  We didn't do this but for a large group it might be good to order and share sides.  I highly recommend the Hollywood hash browns.
author: Duff L.

description: quick service. average food.
author: Elise B.

description: What an over rated place, queue was a long wait and well quite frankly. Yelp killed this spot.
author: Steven S.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and there is no other place I would rather be than the H-Wood cafe. I'm a big dude 6'1, 240 lbs. and I always leave this place very full and satisfied. I go with the eggs, sausage and french toast mmm mmm... They also throw in some fresh fruit, usually chopped bannanas strawberries and oranges, which is an added bonus because I dont believe they tell you that on the menu.Your coffee cup will never be empty, that being said the service is great. I def. try to make it to the H-Wood cafe once a week.
The only downside is that it's a pretty small place and all the tables inside are jam packed in there.
author: John S.

description: Went here solely by faith that all of the reviews here on yelp couldn't be wrong.  They weren't.  I'm not a big fan of breakfast food, but the French toast and the HEAPING amount of fruit served with it hit the spot big time.  This place was a big hit with the wife and mother-in-law, too.
author: Jonathon S.

description:
Pros:  amazing  fresh food, good prices.  The service was some of the best i've ever seen.  They are great about serving and then turning over the tables, so the waits aren't long,

Cons:  It's small.  Only a handful of tables inside, then just as many on the sidewalk.  They do have heaters outside, but I imagine it's still pretty cold. Also, they don't take American Express, which we didn't find out until we went to pay.  Stinks when you are traveling for business and your company card is AE.

Their bathroom is in the hallway next door, it's creepy and shared with other places.

The FOOD

I will start by saying, I am not a breakfast restaurant kind of person.  Not a fan of greasy spoon or places most other people like for breakfast.  I like fresh, filling, and at least semi-healthy.

Their menu is very large and varied.  something for everyone.  Eggs, scrambles, pancakes, omelettes, benedicts, etc.  Healthy or not healthy.  

I  had the California omelette (crab, avocado, scallions, cheese) with fresh fruit.  The fruit and the omelette both were so fresh and amazing.

My boyfriend had the bacon avocado scrambled eggs with fresh sourdough, hashbrowns, and coffee.  He too loved his food.

I'd go back in a heartbeat.  Kicking myself now that it was 2 blocks from the hotel and I walked by it all week, not knowing it was there.  Didn't find it until I searched out breakfast places on YELP.
author: Mel K.

description: Nice little brunch place. I felt a little rushed so take your time here. Fresh orange juice was fantastic an I had the James dean selection yum fresh fruit ham steak and toast ! About 14$ op
author: Erin N.

description: This place is great! Awesome, fresh food and generous portions.. If you're in the Fishermans Wharf area definitely check it out and plan on leaving stuffed!!! You won't need to eat again until dinner!
author: Shauna G.

description: Don't let the name fool you - this place was AMAZING.  We had to wait a little bit, but the price was great and the food was even better.  Make sure you get something with the fruit - it is the best I've had anywhere.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Had breakfast here for the first time.  It was about a 10 minute ride by taxi from the Embarcadero BART station.

It was crowded but we got right in.  Service was fine.  The food was good and it is in a great location for tourists.  You can eat and then get right onto the sightseeing buses.
author: Rob D.

description:
Even though I've only been to Hollywood Cafe just a couple of times, I consider it a place close to my heart. It's the kind of place that makes a trip just that much more memorable.

If we didn't stay at the Hyatt across the street, we probably would have ignored this little gem. Situated in the most touristy part of town, and with a name like that, you would think this is just another tourist-fooling place like all the other restaurants in the area. But the truth is, Hollywood Cafe rivals any of your neighborhood brunch favorite in any city. In fact, it's probably my favorite breakfast/brunch place in the world.

I first came in here to buy a coffee and get some quarters for parking. The coffee was good, the staff was all smiling and the place just had a fresh, happy vibe to it. So when my parents asked where to get brunch, I took them here. Then we came here everyday, even right before our flight.

There's most likely a line. If you have to wait for a table, do it. If it's 30 minutes, wait. The space is small and the decor simple, but very warm and cozy and not plain at all. I even like the hollywood star portrays on the wall. There were compliment messages and letters from around the world on the fridge door. The staff was extremely nice, they were always smiling and looked like they were genuinely happy working there. By our 2nd time, they already remembered us and by the 3rd time, we felt like we'd been their loyal customers for ages. Service was always fast, and they never got anything wrong. Everything we tried there was fantastic. Fresh ingredients, big portions and cheap prices. The benedict was world class. Like everyone mentioned it's cash only, but you don't need a lot to have a great meal here.

A lovely place in a lovely town. One of these days I'll move to San Fran, and I would start as many days at Hollywood cafe as possible.
author: Qian M.

description:
Hollywood Cafe is a small, wonderful cafe near Fisherman's Wharf.  We arrived just before 9:00 a.m. and got a table right away.  However, by the end of the meal, there was a wall of people outside waiting for a table.  I have to admit that having forty people look jealously at my plate made the omelet taste that much sweeter.

The service is speedy.  I waited a minute or two for my coffee, but the food followed so quickly, I didn't have a chance to take a sip before everything was one the table.  I'd be tempted to say it came too fast and must have been microwaved.  I would have been wrong.  The kitchen is open and very small, and I got to watch the highly organized chefs operate more quickly than I could believe.

A previous post recommended getting fruit as a side, and I must agree.  Everything was fresh and the portions were outstanding.  The strawberries were as big as my fist and perfectly sweet.

Enjoy!
author: William B.

description: Great breakfast spot that I've not discovered in years, especially since I stay across the street on business trips. The servers were in a happy mood, all smiles early in the morning- and quick service.  I could not have asked for fluffier pancakes.  The chai latte was quite good too.
author: Manny F.

description:
My wife and I walked from the Sheration Fisherman's Wharf, only a couple of blocks, to find this tiny place wedged into Tourism Central.

There isn't much room inside, but all the staff was friendly, food delicous, and quick service.

Highly recommend.
author: Steve H.

description: It's good.  Not unique, but has everything you could want in a breakfast place and tastes good.
author: Amanda C.

description: This is the perfect spot for breakfast. The fruit bowl that comes on the side was almost a meal itself - you will leave full and satisfied.
author: Casey J.

description:
We spent a week in San Francisco and we had breakfast there every day!!! Their food is delicious, the dishes are huge and the price is great!
The place is tiny, so it was always full. 
The place was across the street from our hotel and was a much better option then eating inside...
author: Fernanda D.

description: The fresh squeezed orange juice is already enough to keep me coming back for more aswell as the omlettes! If it looks packed it's worth the wait and usually goes by faster than expected.
author: Ian R.

description:
If you don't enjoy your breakfast here, you're doing something wrong. I ate here 3 out of 4 mornings on a recent trip to the area and was very satisfied each time. 

Breakfast sandwich, omelet, and dolce french toast were all great. If you order a side of fruit, they bring you a large plate of various freshly sliced fruit. 

Great service - there are relatively few tables, but the wait was never bad at all for a group of 2 or 4. They do a real nice job of getting food out quick and turning the tables over. 

There are heaters above most of the outside tables so even on a cool morning, it is nice to sit outside. 

Expect to be surrounded by tourists (including many families) - not really a problem, but it is what it is.
author: Michael M.

description:
I am SO going back! The food is awesome, nice service and on a not-so-steep hill. Only problem is is that its crowded and small for the amount of people that come. Next time I visit family in SoCal, I am jumping off the plane and skydiving to this place. Haha that'd be fun!

The fruit isn't just fruit. It's all the top produced fruits that are at the pike of perfection and God takes the earth, shakes those fruits off, washes them, cuts them up and then puts it in a bowl. Yogurt on the side for an additional $1.00 or something like that. Yumm!
BEST BREAKFAST IN SAN FRAN. Maybe *gasp* all of Cali!
Hehehe. Go there and enjoy it buddies :)
author: Alaya C.

description:
If you want to break bread with tourists embarking on a busy day of site seeing, this is your best bet.  The breakfast was pretty good, but not spectacular.  Old standbys like pancakes, french toast, eggs and sausage are competently served up with a smile, and without gouging your wallet--notable given that this place is just a block from Fisherman's Wharf.   For $2 you can substitute chorizo, bratwurst, or chicken apple sausages in lieu of the usual breakfast links, and an extra buck gets you real maple syrup instead of maple butter, but that is about where the adventurousness on the menu ends.  

Their outdoor seating is a plus if there is nice weather, though the tables are a bit on the small side.  Definitely not a destination in itself, but if you are in the neighborhood or bringing visitors to this part of town, you could do much, much worse.
author: Aaron S.

description: Can't get over the breakfast I had there. We had the scrambled eggs w/ Hollywood hashbrowns and crab omelette with fruit bowl. Wish I had more room in my stomach for all the deliciousness. Service was great, wait was short and the food was great.
author: Megan D.

description: Very, very delicious breakfast. I had no problem finding parking and the restaurant was easy to find too! My girlfriend and I walked in and it seemed very busy, but we were seating right away. I had a hard time choosing what I wanted from the menu because everything sounded so good. I finally went with the Marilyn Monroe, french toast with fruit. As we waited, the waitress brought us toast. Don't forget to try the jams with the toast! The service was quick and the food was great!
author: Jamie T.

description: At breakfast here two days in a row, over the top. Fresh, tasty and huge portions including kids menu. Spilt an order it will be plenty. Our whole family loved and demanded to go back again the next day.
author: Jack B.

description: Delicious! Good sized portions. I absolutely love that they serve actual FRESH fruit.
author: Lupita L.

description: Excellent breakfast.  We were on vacation for an entire week and Hollywood Café was the best meal we had on our entire trip.  Food was tasty and the portions are big.  The staff was very efficient.  By looking at all the plates coming out of the kitchen it is so hard to choose what to eat.  I came here with my family (4) and all the dishes were fantastic.  There was so much food that I had to take my fruit to go.  The fruit was too good to be left.  Even my son who is not into fruit that much said, "That fruit is excellent."  My family is still talking about how great Hollywood Café is and we now compare everything to the restaurant.
author: Denise G.

description: This place has the best fresh fruit offering I've ever had at a restaurant. The hash browns are super tasty.  Also, nice quick service and I thought they did a good job of getting people seated despite the seemingly everpresent line.
author: J D.

description: I went here because of the high rating on Yelp. Bad idea. The ambience is sterile and kitchy. The food was sub par. I had the salmon benedict, and it wasn't very good. The hollandaise tasted off, like something in it had expired. The other thing was that I got asked if "everything is okay" by four people in less than a minute. They all seemed fake too. The only part that was good: the sourdough toast. But you can get that anywhere...
author: David S.

description:
I visited San Francisco December '09 and stayed at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. Since I'm from the east coast, the three-hour time difference caused me to wake up painfully early throughout my trip.  No biggie, waking up early means breakfast! I didn't have to look far for a quaint breakfast spot, since Hollywood Cafe is located directly across the street from the Hyatt.  

Hollywood Cafe is a cute, tiny place that serves breakfast and lunch. Tables are very close together and there are customer testimonials posted on the wall and refrigerator.  We managed to score the last table available.  Since it was a bit on the chilly side, they had space heaters plugged in adding to its home-y ambiance. 

The energetic waiter gave us menus and took our drink orders: coffee please.  The waiter came back lightening quick with coffee, milk/cream and sugar in tow.  How efficient!  As I scanned the menu, I was amazed how affordable this place was, considering it being in a rather touristy location.  

I decided on the waffles (I have a thing for waffles) with eggs and bacon.  When the waiter came back to take our order, my world came crashing down when he told me the bad news.  Their waffle maker broke and had yet to get it fixed. So no waffles!!  Crushed, I pulled myself together and went with my second choice: pancakes with eggs and a side of bacon.  My dining companion ordered his favorite: French toast with eggs and ham steak.  Both dishes came with crispy hash browns.

My pancakes were fluffy and buttery.  I love that the plates come with pieces of fresh strawberries and bananas.  Very Californian of them.  My dining companion's french toast was crispy (in a good way) and cooked perfectly.  We also ordered a side of their special hash browns, cooked with cheese, peppers and onions...mmmm I'm drooling thinking about the hash browns.  I also ordered the orange juice, which had the just-squeezed taste.  My coffee mug was never empty and the coffee was perfectly smooth, strong but, did not taste burnt strong.

Just a reminder: it's cash only.  Considering the size of the plates and the amount of food we ordered, we were expecting the bill to come out to around $40.  When the energetic waiter presented the bill, I was stunned at the price.  For two people, we spent a total of $34 (that's including tip).  After my breakfast, my dining companion and I walked from Fisherman's Wharf to the Golden Gate Bridge and back to Fisherman's Wharf.  Breakfast at the Hollywood Cafe is the best way to start your day of sight-seeing.  

I would have given them five stars, but I don't think I can forgive them for not having waffles.
author: Jenn C.

description: I was a little hesitant with the touristy name and location, but the breakfast was amazing, best I have ever had, highly recommended.
author: Melissa T.

description: Without a single doubt the best breakfast place in San Francisco! The staff is super friendly and quick at cleaning the tables for new guests. And the food, the foooooood! The food is AMAZING!!! I spent three days in San Fran and I went here every morning and tried different things every time. Their pancakes, french toast, omelettes and fruit bowls are out of this world! You have to try this place. Don''t let the line outside scare you, the staff if very efficient and you will wait at most 10 min.
author: Christina A.

description: Found it via Yelp and Yelp was 100% right! Don't eat at a hotel and get over here.  Great service and fast too!  Omelette's were big and fluffy.  Toast was unreal sourdough with a touch of butter.  Could have eaten it all morning.  Will definitely be back while on this vacation!
author: G K.

description: This place is KISS. Keeping it Simple Stupid. After hunting for a breakfast place that wasn't slammed we decided to go here based on other reviews. And although I can't bring myself to give it a 5 it was really good food with excellent service. Standard cafe menu and I highly recommend the pancakes. The eggs and omelets were cooked nicely and served with fresh coffee. Also I was happily surprised with the fruit that was served with our meal. Very fresh and ripe, not what you would expect from some diners/cafes. If I'm ever in that area again it would definitely be a place I would go again.
author: Roberto F.

description:
This place is amazing! Everything from the service to the food. 

I had the crab meat and avocado omelette which was phenomenal. Then my boyfriend ordered a fruit side order and omg! The fruit was huge and juicy and sooooo fresh! Overall the food is great. 

We did have to wait like 5 minutes to be seated but that is because of how packed this place gets. But it was definitely worth the wait. I'd recommend going here for breakfast to anyone.
author: Aileen P.

description: Fantastic breakfast, this place is a must stop for breakfast before exploring the wharf.  The breakfast salad was divine.  I loved the way they brought out your individual items as soon as they were ready, never sat under a heart lamp.
author: Jeff L.

description: We ate here Aug 15th & 17th. Food is extremely fresh and good. Large portions - easy to share.  Outside tables and excellent service. Get there early - fills up quickly. The sour dough toast and bowl of fruit served was a nice touch. Cappuccino was served in large coffee cup, hot and had a bold taste. We ate here last year and made a point to go back this year- glad we found this cafe.
author: Robin H.

description:
CASH ONLY! 
FYI 
Okay, I wish I had known about this place before my last day in San Francisco. It was really good. 
Decor is fine. Pictures of movie stars to go along with the restaurant name. It is a small place, so on a busy day you may have to wait. Also, it may not be a good place for a large group. 
The employees were so sweet and happy. 
The food was super fresh. We had enough to take along for the road trip home. 
My daughter ordered a tuna melt (at 8 am? Yes). Yum. Brother had a breakfast sandwich. Yum. Hubby had vege omelet. Yum. Me, I had your basic eggs with a big slab of ham. Yum. FRESH FRUIT with every plate. Fresh OJ, a beautiful thing. 
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying at a hotel on North Point and anyone living in the area or anyone else, for that matter.
author: Marnie B.

description: HUGE portions, great food!  Unfortunately, they cannot accommodate large parties (we had 8 people) so we ordered food to-go to eat at our hotel across the street, no biggie.  Super packed on a Saturday and they don't take reservations... so go during off-peak hours if you can.
author: Amy M.

description:
Little cute and delish gem in the city of the Bay!!
We, group of 5 people, were late to reach this place (we walked from the Clock Tower - extremely bad idea!) we reached almost at the time, when they were closing. But, we were seated quickly. Even though they were in a rush, we were warmly welcomed. The ambiance of the cafe is warm - bright tones, pictures of Hollywood celebs - Marilyn, Audrey, George P - classic black and white. 
We discussed quickly and ordered. The server was too kind to tell us that we had ordered too much of food since their portions are huge enough. We listened to him and cancelled 2 orders of sandwiches. And when the food came, we found it was so true! The order came in quickly. Since we were famished, in the meantime, we gulped down their wonderful OJ. Amazing. My bf who does not drink OJ at all, ordered a second glass himself. 
The vege sandwich was awesome, I was full in half of the sandwich. Audrey Hepburn was perfect - blueberry pancakes and fresh fruits by the side. The hash browns were tasty too. We did not get a chance to taste the egg dishes, but salmon was good. In all, everything tasted excellent.  
We were not rushed at all. We sat at our leisure, finished our food and stepped out to explore the city. This has already become my fave! Would def come for more.
author: Avi M.

description: I gave this a shot after reading the great reviews on yelp. If you like massive portions of somewhat low quality food - this might be for you. The food presentation was horrible - literally a massive plate slopped with the entree and sides on top of each other. It's in a touristy spot, so it's normally quite packed. If you need something in the area I'd go with Buena Vista or Pat's Cafe.
author: Tara T.

description: Fruit salad was unbelievable and very good French toast! Very efficient wait staff.
author: Stacey I.

description: Great food, service and atmosphere makes Hollywood Cafe a perfect spot for me!
author: Ricardo R.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST OF MY LIFE!

Came here instead of paying 20 bucks for a lacking hotel breakfast. Though the wait may seem long it moves quickly (just make sure to sign in when you get there).

Atmosphere: Right in the Fisherman Wharfs area and near local hotels like Sheraton, Holiday Inn, Hyatt, and Marriott. Great little restaurant on the corner with nice decorations and outdoor seating. Alittle on the cramped side though.

Food: AMAZING. Great food all around no matter what you order. Portions are huge! Get fruit instead of hash browns you will not be disappointed. The poached eggs on english muffins are my favorite.

Staff: Very caring and professional. They really care about the customer and are super polite. They are also very fast!

Save money and enjoy an awesome breakfast by heading to Hollywood Cafe instead of the hotel lobby.
author: Ryan L.

description: Excellent breakfast place! The only spot we hit twice during our 4 day stay in San Francisco. The first day we went around 9am and there was a ten minute wait (they move people fast). My husband had the salmon and shrimp eggs benedict with hash browns and toast. Delicious! I had 2 eggs over-easy with "Hollywood hash browns"--to die for! These hash browns are loaded with cheese, onions, red/yellow/green peppers, mushrooms and BACON. We also had the fresh squeezed orange juice and toast with marmalade and jam, which I am trying to find a way to buy. The next morning we woke up early before our shuttle to the airport and e were the first ones there when they opened at 7am. We weren't the only ones though. My husband had the crab eggs benedict and I had the Hollywood hash browns. This place is amazing! Will come back on our next trip.
author: C M.

description:
The breakfast gets 10-stars. Hollywood stars!

The locals might hate me for this tip-- tourists who like stuff off the beaten trail should skip the obvious Wharf choices and grab breakfast here on the sidewalk. People watching + noms = excellent morning conversations. So yummy and filling enough to fuel all the hiking you will do up and down and up and down and up and down those famous SF hills.
author: Janis H.

description: This place has really good service. The staff there is always running around with huge smiles on their faces willing to make your morning perfect. The food is awesome too. They give you HUGE portions of fresh fruit!  I definitely recommend checking it out.
author: Mary O.

description:
Great small cafe. The service by the staff was exceptional, and the food was magnificent!!

THE place to go for brunch if you're in the wharf. HUGE portion of fruit - not your 1/4 banana, slice of orange and a strawberry. We're talking, kiwis, blueberries, grapes, melon, etc! 

I recommend you try the french toast, you won't be disappointed.
author: D. M.

description: Friendly staff, very arge portions, amazing fruit, very yummy!!!   Four stars only because bathrooms are gross and shared with other building tenants. If I didn't use them I would have rates 5 stars.
author: Jenise C.

description:
What a great little spot!  It's tiny- about 18 seats inside, and a couple tables outside.  The staff is as nice as could be, and they serve big portions, cooked fresh, fast.  Great coffee too.

We had eggs and bagels and lox.  Everything was fantastic - twice as good as at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf where I was staying.  

This place is directly across the street from the Hyatt, and a much better option for breakfast.  Open for breakfast and lunch only.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Oh man. All I can say is that the portions are worth the wait. I ordered a delicious crab omelette with melted cheese, and fresh crab meat, (Mind you this was a few months ago and I still remember it.) It came with 2 slices of toast a slice of orange and a huge serving of hashbrowns. For a side I ordered some french toast, nice serving of two slices. Woooweee - the serving on that was also huge, and mighty delicious. It came with fresh, cut fruit and another side of hashbrowns, which I gladly gave to my fiance, as I would have been insane to eat that along with everything else I ate that morning. 

The service was prompt and completely friendly. The wait was about 10 minutes, around 10:00 am and was worth it! The cafe is very small, so on a weekend morning, expect a little wait, as it looks as if it tends to be packed.

I have no negative reviews - as the price fit the excellent service and the fresh, ever-so-yummy food. 

I'm definitely going here again when I come back to SF!
author: Patricia A.

description: We went for breakfast, and they did not disappoint.  We waited 5 minutes for a table of 4, and ordered.  The kids meals are a great deal!  Priced for a kid, but sized for an adult.  The regular plates were huge as well.  The meat lovers omelet was good.  The Hollywood hashbrowns pretty good, but not necessary with all the meat in the omelet.  Fruit included with the meals were great!
author: Stu E.

description:
Yet another SF establishment that is tiny, cramped and cold (in the winter). I can't vouch for the inside since we were forced to sit outside (no available tables). It wasn't earth shattering, but a bit chilly for January.

The food is good and served quickly. Hubby and I both had breakfast sandwiches. Yum. Fresh squeezed orange juice was really good. The fruit bowl/plate was yummy and had an impressive variety for the middle of winter.

A bit on the pricey side for breakfast and CASH only. But good and local.
author: J. C.

description: Good food and great service. We visited twice during our 5 days. Very non-descript frontage but a quality breakfast inside.
author: Evan M.

description: This diner is amazing! Seriously, the best breakfasts I've ever had!   I could go on about everything I ordered but the sourdough toast with homemade raspberry jelly is to die for!  Best egg dishes as well.  My family and I have eaten there multiple times on our vacation.  Favorite family dishes include the Franciscan, French Toast, and Meat Lover Omelette.  TRY THIS RESTAURANT!!!
author: Madison C.

description: Came here since it was conveniently located near our hotel Got the sweet bacon with my meal & had a nice sweet BBQ taste to it. I have to say their fruit bowls are awesome! Most of the time when you have a side of fruit, you get the standard cantaloup & melon, but here they give you like 8 different fruits in one serving. My husband upgraded to the Hollywood hash browns, but it was a bit too much (mushrooms,onions, cheese sauce, bacon) He decided to keep it simple next time :)
author: Erin S.

description: My first time eating here. Tried something totally different, the clam omelette. To die for!  Seating is a little to small. Linda awkward. But the fast friendly service wipes that away.
author: Kimmy D.

description:
This is more like a 3.5 stars. 

I was a bit surprised after my friend and I ate here that it received such great reviews on Yelp. I ordered the french toast, and my friend ordered an omelette with pesto, peppers, etc. 

The food was good, but I'm a bit biased because I think all breakfast food is delicious. I'd read that the fruit was abundant and varied, which was true. The omelette was also fairly tasty.

My 3 stars is predominantly centered around the fact that the food was pretty damn expensive, almost $10/plate for breakfast food, and that the food is really just nothing special. It is good, definitely, but there is nothing really amazing about it.

The strangest thing also happened as I walked away. I felt like I needed to throw up immediately after we started walking towards the car. Not too great of a feeling to start your day.
author: stacy c.

description:
Came across the place because it was across the street from the Hyatt, where I was at.  It was a nice place for lunch, and I'll probably go back if I get the chance.

FOOD: My party had a few of the breakfast items. Everything was good...not amazing or spectacular, just pretty good. One thing of particular note, I ordered a cup of fruit and the thing was enormous (for a cup...). It also had an incredible variety of fruit; melons, watermelon, apples, grapes, kiwi, blueberries, raspberries, bananas, oranges, & probably more. On the down side, our toast came out drenched in butter. Maybe some people like their toast like that, I think I should've been given the option. 

ATMOSPHERE: It's small, so it can feel a bit cramped. But it's nice and clean. The only thing really Hollywood about it is they have pictures of actors from the '50's on the wall. Otherwise, there's nothing really unique about the place. 

SERVICE:  The staff was great. They were pleasant and very responsive to every request. The food also came out very quickly as well. 

COST:  I found that it was a tad on the expensive side for what is ultimately just breakfast cafe, but it could be that price is closer to the norm for the area...

BOTTOM LINE:  This isn't a "must go" place, and I wouldn't go too far out of my way to eat here, but it's a solid spot for breakfast or lunch.
author: DA B.

description: Great place for breakfast! I had the Clark Gable. Yummy, great service, great food and great vibe. Doing it right on the wharf :) The coffee was even good.
author: Krista I.

description: My husbands favorite cafe for breakfast! We enjoy the fresh squeezed orange juice and love the generous portions served. I find it so entertaining they took the Hollywood name and incorporated the theme into their menu. Thank you Hollywood Cafe! We are definitely fans! Blessings!
author: Marie H.

description:
We stayed at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf.  I wanted to walk up the street to Mama's in North Beach, but it was closed on Mondays.  I saw this place on Yelp and the reviews were accurate.

I had the French Toast and it was outstanding.  As other Yelpers stated, its easier to eat outside.  Just make sure you have cash.  I liked it so much, we picked up some take out the next day.
author: Kirk Y.

description:
GREAT place!

We went there after looking for a place on Yelp.

They were FAST, and the food was GREAT. The fruit that was served on every plate was very good.

It's small, about 20 people at a time inside, and another 20 or so outside. It was raining when we went so we lucked out and got the last 4-top inside.

Definitely a nice change from the tourist trap restaurants in SF by the Wharf.

It is cash only, though, so if you go, take some moolah, because they don't take cards.
author: John P.

description:
This little place is one of the best breakfast places around - kind of a hole in the wall but HUFE on flavor.  The staff is very prompt and courteous.  I went there on a Friday morning - I was hungry and their portion sizes did not disappoint.  I got a spinach, mushroom & swiss omelette with fresh fruit and my hubby got the french toast with eggs and bacon.  Our food was ready in mere moments and it was delish!! 

I would recommend a stop at this place if you are anywhere near the area.  Love the cute napkins on the walls too! 

Looking forward to our next trip to San Francisco and to Hollywood Cafe!
author: Amanda S.

description: This place was the best small time diner that gives big time taste! The food was delicious. There was way more than I could eat. The prices were great. The service was great. All around an amazing place to eat at if you are visiting San Fran.
author: Nicholas I.

description: This place is awesome for breakfast. The plate of fresh fruit was my favorite, although I did order the Vivian Leigh. The egg,cheese,bacon crossainte sandwich was pretty good as well. My husband got eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, and toast. He was pretty satified as well. You cannot beat this price for breakfast. I did not like the coffee, but they had fresh squeezed OJ. Eat here for breakfast if you are in the area...
author: Brooke W.

description:
I stumbled on to this place thanks to yelp.  I was really craving some fruit but didn't want to cut my own so I went on yelp and found this place. Not only do they serve large portions of fruit, they serve BREAKFAST oh mah gah! I love breakfast! 

I just wish it wasn't all the way at the tippy top of San Francisco! Sometimes that ride up Van Ness can ruin my appetite, but if I've driven halfway toward Hollywood Cafe, then I mind as well suck it up.

The fruit I received along with my breakfast was sweet and ripe! I was surprised my kiwi was sweet! I usually expect to get very tart ones. After you finish your huge plate of breakfast, take the time to stroll around Fisherman's Wharf to burn it off!
author: Connie M.

description: This place is TERIFFIC!  I never write reviews but now the exception. Great food & service, huge serving and reasonable prices. It's a fun hectic atmosphere that is extremely entertaining. The most fun we've had in SF. You gotta go.
author: Scott P.

description: Super good breakfast. My bf got the Dungeness Eggs Benedict (the one with the crab) and loved it, minus the giant capers they put on it, but they were easily removed. I got the Orangish French Toast which was delicious, and it came with a large side of fruit! Decent coffee as well, and they bring you really good toast while you wait for your food. Overall, worth a trip!
author: Avery E.

description: Great diner ambiance! Dungeness crab eggs benedict are a must if you're a benedict fan. Price is a little high for cafe/diner food but it's made up in the portions and you definitely get what you pay for!
author: Hugo D.

description: My husband and I visited San Fran in early May 2013 and stayed at Columbus Motor Inn. We found Hollywood Cafe on Yelp and loved it so much that we went there for lunch two days in a row! The price is very affordable, and you get a TON of food! We sat outside and had great service both days. My husband is still talking about their cheese steak sandwich, and I'm still raving about the pancakes! You can get breakfast for lunch too, which is great. The sourdough toast is just yum as well!
author: Lisa G.

description: Excellent food and service. Only complaint (and I guess it's a sign of their success), is that we had to wait some 25 minutes standing on the sidewalk for a seat. Other than that we were very pleased with the experience. As many have said before, the fruit bowl they serve with breakfast is very generous and delicious!
author: Dave G.

description:
This is one of those fantastic tiny cheap diners that make San Francisco fantastic.
 
The amount of food is ridiculous. The fruit was amazingly fresh and plentiful (I hate those places that say side of fruit and give you a tiny piece of watermelon). The meal was delicious and the price was shockingly low.
author: Amber L.

description: Ok.  Certainly better food elsewhere in SF but a place with some character in a fairly touristy area.
author: Katie K.

description: Really great breakfast place!  Fastest service and food delivery I've ever seen.  Pleasant wait staff.  Dolce French toast was amazing and other egg dishes and hash browns were fantastic. Yummy blackberry jam on the table, and fruit bowl was awesome (not just cantaloupe and melon).
author: Traveler X.

description:
Thanks yelp! It's not the biggest place and there's a fair number of tourists, but boy are the omelets good. 

Definitely worth the wait!
author: Don G.

description: I ordered two eggs, hollywood hash browns and sausage links.  The eggs and toast were good the sausage was some strange meat that had the texture of wet particle board and tasted like you would thing a wood product might taste like.  The Hollywood hash bron might have been good had they not covered it in a gallon of melted processed cheese.
author: Mickey B.

description: A lot of great food for a fair price.  The French toast was awesome!
author: R M.

description:
This place is an absolute hidden gem.  They are small so get there EARLY for breakfast!  

We enjoyed one of our best breakfasts in a long time.  Opt for fruit as your side and you will not be disappointed!

Service is great and they will get you in and out quickly without hurrying you off.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: Jason L.

description: This place was amazing! We stayed at the Wharf Hyatt and it was right across the street. The Hash browns, pancakes, and bacon omelet and fruit were all yummy and amazing. Too bad I didn't get to try the French Toast :(  .. Will definitely go back.
author: Steven E.

description: Enjoyed the 60degree weather in San Fran in Feb, can't beat it especially on the sidewalk table basking on the sun. Had the dolce french Toast with lots of fresh fruit and caramelized walnuts. I also had the Hollywood eggs benedict with Hollywood hash browns (lots of bacon, and cheese, yum). Both were way too much to eat.
author: Bob N.

description: I woke up craving a big, fat omelette with crab and avocado and was led to this place.  It definitely surpassed my expectations.  They didn't skimp on the good stuff.  Huge slab of hash browns came with it.  Only complaint was my water and coffee were never refilled during my meal, but they gave me a to-go cup of coffee when I asked for a refill at the end so that was pretty awesome.
author: David P.

description: This a tiny cafe that specializes in breakfast and is right by the Fisherman's Wharf but isn't at all touristy or too busy (on weekdays anyway). It's run by Asians that don't have the best communication skills but do have prompt and attentive service. Prices are reasonable and the food is really good. The eggs were fantastic as was the mound of fresh fruit I got instead of home fries. The pancakes also looked pretty good. By no means are they a fancy or artisan type of breakfast place like Mama's but they put out good classic breakfasts that you'd be hard pressed to find much to complain about.
author: Matt E.

description:
Serendipity is the word I use to describe my luck when eating near by a tourist hang out.  It must be my Southern Californian leaning to look at tourist spots with mixed feelings.  Usually they are overpriced and the food inferior.  Not at Hollywood Cafe!

I entered Hollywood Cafe with some vague longing for anything Los Angeles.  I couldn't but smirk at their use of old Hollywood figures to describe the different types of breakfast plates they had (The Marilyn Monroe, the James Dean, etc.).  There is a fridge covered in testimonials written on napkins by folks from around the world.  I didn't have time to read them all (there was a lot) because my food was out pronto.

I usually am able to down my coffee cup before my order arrives and I almost spit it out when I saw how much food came with a fresh pot o' joe.  Now, I know my expectations were lower for being in a high tourist area, but the first bite kicked right to my taste buds.  The best part was the fresh fruit.  I wanted to order a bowl of fruit, but there was no more room (and I had things to see).

I definitely know where I'm eating when I find myself at Fisherman's Wharf.  Try and find yourself here.  Definitely worth pushing aside tourists for... =D
author: Bobby K.

description: Fresh OJ, toasted baguette, Hollywood hashbrowns, sweet bacon, drunken bacon, mountain (literally) of fresh fruit, hashbrowns, country sausage with biscuits and gravy, and eggs Benedict were absolutely delicious!  Although Chilaquiles were totally wrong.  Tortillas are supposed to be lightly fried not deep fried into tortilla chips and should be in lots of sauce...we essentially got a plate of nachos hold the cheese sauce for breakfast.
author: Lien N.

description: Great little hole in the wall type place. Excellent food. Good service.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! Pancakes are amazing and everything is really inexpensive. The fruit is so fresh and delish! I will definitely come back here next time I am in the Bay. 

Don't forget to bring cash!
author: Liv W.

description: Freaking' A the side of fruit is Ginormous!!  I counted more than 10 different fruits in this bowl. Took awhile to be seated but good pricing and food. Highly recommend.
author: Shawntelle E.

description:
Traveling through San Francisco, we spotted this breakfast cafe near our hotel and it looked packed.

It was packed for a good reason! The food is absolutely excellent. The pancakes were amazing, the French toast was as well. They serve fresh squeezed orange juice and a good cup of coffee to accompany your meal.

The service was fairly good. The waiter was very kind and helpful, but entering and putting your own name on the often-long waiting list can be a bit hectic. There is also not a lot of seating if you're waiting, so you are sort of huddled in a mass waiting for your breakfast.  

Other then that, everything here is incredible. All of the food is noteworthy, there is indoor and outdoor seating, and everyone is friendly.
author: Trey C.

description: 5 star breakfast place, always go multiple times on every trip to San Francisco. All traditional egg dishes are great, and the sides of fruit are the best sides you'll get, both size-wise and quality, including fresh banana and raspberries, etc. Funny waitstaff and curious Hollywood-related pictures on the wall.
author: David P.

description: Great food. My family ate there for breakfast and we all loved every bit of it.  I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu.
author: Bryn W.

description:
Classic greasy spoon in a touristy area. Don't come to the Hollywood Cafe is leg room is a priority because the tables are small, close and cramped.
The service is quick, the food is basic and my coffee cup was never empty.
author: Kathleen E.

description: Food was burnt service was terrible it took 3 different "servers" to bring me a glass of water!
author: Ryan C.

description: I had a delicious breakfast here 1 year ago(that's why the 2 stars). I was so excited to have breakfast again here on another thanksgiving holiday. However, I was so disappointed this time! The vegetarian omelette was not even warm and the eggs was just sitting on top of other ingredients. It's not even omelette. I wish this was just a bad day for them but I won't come back again.
author: LT C.
