description: Impressed. The food was delicious, those Hollywood Hash-browns are RIDICULOUS!  Definitely happy that we decided on checking this place out.  The wait is a bit longer than usual because it's so popular but not an issue, it's expected.  Sat outside on the sidewalk in the warm morning sun.  I passed on the fruit bowl (looked amazing but I was hungry and was ready to get down to business) and went with tan Avocado omelet which was incredible. Will definitely be back on the next visit to SF.
author: Alan K.

description: Very good...the Yelp reviews are all on point about this place.  Took some out of town friends on a Sunday morning.  We waited about 40 minutes for a table.  The service was good given how busy they were - plus it's a casual place - so not flawless service.  The food was well prepared and everything was good.  Everyone liked their food.  I had the two eggs and Hollywood Hash (shredded potatoes with bacon and vegetables).  It was good - although I am anxious to go back and try some of the other items on the menu.
author: Ryan O.

description:
bomb!!! loved my Audrey Hepburn inspired breakfast....pancakes and fruit.  My side of fruit consisted of..bananas,strawberries, cantaloupe,honey dew,oranges,apples, and KIWI.. yes kiwi!!!!!!!
Everything was great except it was small.  Only one table that seats 6 the rest are 4 and 2 seater's.   not kid friendly.
author: Cyn D.

description: Great breakfast.  Sourdough toast with fresh jellies.  Portions were large and food came out really quickly. Got the chiliquiles and burrito and both were really good.
author: Shannon F.

description:
Found this place during a stay at the nearby Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. It was 11 am the morning after 4th of July fireworks and we were looking for some late breakfast before setting out for some sightseeing. 

After a quick nearby Yelp search we landed here. Between three of us, we had the pancakes with fruit & sausage and an omelette & hash browns. It was all fantastic! Everything tasted great and was cooked perfectly. 

We watched in pity as the tables at the breakfast place next door sat empty while there was a line down the street for Hollywood Cafe. No wonder, it was worth the wait!! I'd drop in again, but next time I think I'd try one of the yummy looking burgers or French toast.
author: Irene L.

description:
wow wow wow...

found this place by accident while visiting SF. The breakfast was great, portions were huge. I couldn't believe the quantity and quality of the fruit sides, and the toasted sourdough bread rocked. 

I would HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Mark S.

description: This place was delicious! The dungeness crab benedict was hearty and high quality.  I got fresh fruit to the side and it really was fresh and delicious. A must visit for anyone in San Francisco!
author: Julie M.

description: Great food! For as many people as there were waiting and already seated we were seated pretty quickly. After we ordered our food came out quickly. It was so much food. The food was delicious!!! French toast with an enormous amount of fruit and a breakfast sandwich with fruit. Amazing!!!
author: Heather C.

description: Love this place!  The hash browns are amazing and the fruit bowl they give you could be a meal itself. Also an awesome value for the money
author: C Brandon H.

description: How good is Hollywood Café? Well we eat breakfast there 3 out of 4 mornings. The food is great, the portions are huge, and the service is good. Make sure to put your name on the wait list as it is self sign up. If you like fruit, a lot of items are items include a huge bowl of fresh fruit plus there is even more on the plate. Can't comment on lunch as we did it make it for one. The only thing wrong with Hollywood Café is that it is a 4 hour plane ride from home
author: PETER K.

description: Great find! Good gluten free options and my husband loved the portions! Only compliant was that my sausage was cold (but fully cooked). Instead of bringing me a new one; they brought me a whole new plate of food!
author: Elizabeth F.

description: All I can say is AMAZING!!!! HUGE portions. The waiter suggested the french toast and it was wonderful! Fresh squeeze orange juice was fantastic! Chicken sausage was really good too! Will definitely go back the next time we come! We were lucky and were able to get a seat right away but I bet it fills up quickly!
author: Rosie M.

description:
The food was all pretty good.  I really liked my "special" hash browns (with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, onions, basil and a side of eggs) and the french toast was definitely tasty.  But the service keeps this place from being any more than 3 stars, in my opinion.

It wasn't very busy when we went-- and there are only 4 or 5 tables inside with an extra few outside--so, you'd think they could handle it.... but the waitress was extremely inattentive and distracted.  They brought my wife's order a good 5 minutes after the rest of the food.... and it was wrong so they had to cook it again.  Never refilled the coffee or water in the meantime.... barely could muster up the word "sorry".

I'm leaving it at 3 stars because, ultimately, the food was good (nothing to write home about-- just good).... but I did not enjoy my waitress and I don't think I'll be back.
author: Matt L.

description:
Hollywood Cafe flagrantly violates Newton's First Law of Business: they serve food a) quickly, b) inexpensively, AND c) with quality. 

Their "fresh squeeze" orange juice is actually fresh squeezed, and amazing. The side dishes of fruit seem like they were just picked. The portions are huge (including the fruit). And the food is delicious - we had the french toast (fluffy, awesome), and a breakfast sandwich (cheesy, multi-layered, also awesome).

I don't think we waited more than 3 minutes before our food came out - though maybe that was because it was pretty empty at 1pm on a Sunday. 

Only thing to be aware of is that the place is tiny.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Brian G.

description: I enjoyed breakfast on both Mother's Day and Father's Day at the Hollywood Cafe. What a treat! Great portions of fresh fruit (mostly great berries) and delicious toast and eggs. We sat outside and watched the tourists, but get there early, it's popular!
author: Gail M.

description:
Great place, fast service, incredible food!  I was in town for the weekend, and usually visit somewhere different for every meal.  After my first breakfast here, I came back for 2 more.  The Parma Eggs Benedict is amazing.  Love the fresh sourdough, and the Grand Mimosa's rounded off a hearty breakfast.  
Try it out, and enjoy!
author: Lee B.

description:
I found this place on Yelp and did not find myself too satisfied upon leaving. I shared some sort of breakfast combo with a friend. It came with an over easy egg, which was done a little too easy. It was way too runny for my liking. The bacon was too crispy. The fresh fruit was certainly fresh, but nothing different from vising my local farmer's market.

Basically, I came in with high expectations and it wasn't met. However, the waiters were all very friendly and prompt. He refilled my coffee as soon as he noticed I needed more.
author: Emily T.

description: Nice place on the wharf.  Orangish French toast was amazing.  Resist eating all the toast they bring prior to the meal.
author: Kristin Z.

description: Great breakfast and service!  Particularly liked the Parma eggs Benny, hash browns, fresh fruit and buttery hot sour dough!  Mmmmm
author: Craig R.

description:
What a nice little cafe on Fisherman's Wharf! But very touristy. I came here with my bf this morning for a nice Thursday morning/afternoon Brunch. There was a 10-15 minute wait which was no biggie. We finally got seated inside and there were a lot of tourists surrounding us, lol. We took a look at the menu and everything sounded really good! I ordered a Smoked Turkey and Avocado Eggs Benedict with Chipotle Hollandaise Sauce that came with hashbrowns and sourdough toast; bf ordered the Meat Lover's Omelet (with hashbrowns and toast). Everything was DELICIOUS! And BIG portions too! My Eggs Benedict was very delicious. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the Hollandaise sauce was out of this world! And the smoked turkey was mhmmm Mhmm! I loved the Sourdough Toast as well. :) I tried a piece of the Meat Lover's omelet and it was good too! It had ham, bacon, and ground beef! We also shared a buttermilk pancake with sliced bananas and strawberries and a fruit bowl! Yum! I would definitely come back here! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

The service was decent and my water glass was never empty nor my coffee cup! 

Thank you Hollywood Cafe for a great meal!
author: Francesca H.

description: Friendly staff and manager food came lightning fast.  Eggs Benedict was very pleasing to look at and eat.
author: Brad A.

description:
This place was DELISH and conveniently located across the street from the hotel we were staying at.

The place itself is super tiny, and it was raining when we went, but managed to snag a table inside. They do have outdoor seating but it fills up really quickly, especially when it's nice outside. 

Service is awesome and everyone is beyond friendly. The food is amazing and so inexpensive! I wish there were more places like this in Chicago.

My fiancé had Eggs Benedict  and I had a Denver omelet. The service time was so super quick - I think it was all of 10 minutes and we already had our food. We gobbled it up and it so hot and fresh and YUMMY - great way to start of the morning. Coffee and juice were great too. A real hidden gem compared to the rest of Fisherman's Wharf area. I just wished they were open for lunch and dinner too!

Would eat here way too much if I lived here! Definitely a place to check out if you are in the area.
author: Beata P.

description: Service was slow but the food & portions made up for it.  The fresh fruit cup was really good.  I had a scramble with avocado, bacon, tomato & cheese and my partner had an omlette and got the special Hollywood hashbrowns.  It was a TON of food and we couldn't finish our meals.  Another reviewer said the toast was french bread but it's actually sourdough baquette.  Coffee was ok, orange juice good too.  The place was busy on a Monday morning but it was worth the wait.  It sustained us for 6 hours on Alcatraz!  We would go back if we were in the city again.
author: Leah M.

description: Great breakfast good price good servings...whenever I'm in San Francisco I stay rite across the street from this place at the Hyatt In fishermans warf I might have to wait a few minutes to get seated since it gets busy for breakfast but its worth the wait...make sure u try the French toast absolutely amazing.
author: Albert R.

description: Good food. Crunchy hashbrowns. Coffee is strong, but could be hotter. They have jelly other than orange marmalade, if it's not on your table just ask. Their toast is three small pieces of sourdough. Yummy! We arrived a little after 11:00 on a Friday and didn't have to wait for a table.
author: Stacey B.

description: I went here based on Yelpers reviews and they were so right! The crab eggs Benedict is a must-have!!
author: Jennelle S.

description: Great food and service.  Light on the stomach but nice sized portions.  Fruit was fresh and came with almost every meal.  I definitely would go out of my way to eat here in the future even if I am staying in Union Square area.  Wait was less than five minutes.  It was a bit pricey for a breakfast but it was worth it.  We ate here on Saturday and Mama's on Sunday.  I would take this place over Mama's any day of the week.
author: Chris S.

description: Great breakfast spot. Huge portions, could be shared. I had the three egg whites scrambled with bacon and cheese and it was awesome. The fruit is also a must get. Comes with raspberries, blackberries, cantaloupe, apples, grapefruit, grapes, bananas, pineapple, etc.
author: Aaron S.

description: The BEST Breakfast place in the area! They have the most amazing eggs Benedict in the area as well! The extra charge for fruit as a side dish is totally worth it. Try this place out if you have the chance! It's AMAZING and the reviews are great for a reason! The complimentary bread given with every order was also delicious, fresh, nice and toasty! The butter spread had a good texture for the deliciously toasted bread and fresh orange jam was also provided.
author: J G.

description: Hearty portions.  Good pancackes, but the fresh fruit was very impressive, they were very fresh.  Service was quick and attentive.  Good cup of coffee.
author: t d.

description: What friendly service and great food.  It is just breakfast food or lunch but the fast service and family like atmosphere puts it over the top! They were so kind to my kids--it is worth the wait.  It is just breakfast--no foodies here but great food!  You will not go wrong with this tiny place.
author: J G.

description: we stayed 2 blocks away and were recommended here. it was so good that we went 2 days in a row. the fruit is amazing and the portions are enough to share. I am into waiting, but it was worth it. get here. price was not too bad for SF either.
author: Javier Quiere Comer... ..

description: Stopped in for breakfast while on vacation. Service and food was outstanding. I will make it a regular stop when in SF.
author: Jonathan B.

description: OMG is over used but this place is Over The Top!!!'.    Huge portions excellent food fruit cup that comes with some the meals is a bowl not a cup. Berries kiwi bananas melons cherries grapes pineapple.  That is not your standard fruit cup.  Sweet Bacon. Is like candy and oh so good. Again huge portion of loxs go go with a great bagel. Wait staff excellent and food comes out fast.  We will be back. This maybe a new city standard place
author: Kathleen K.

description:
The place
If you blinked you'd miss this tiny little sidewalk cafe.  It is definately a hidden gem in an otherwise over priced touristy area.  The only place to really sit is outside, so you need to dress accordingly. 

The food
All of the food was very fresh as was the fruit that came along side it.  The omelet, pancakes, and french toast were equally tasty and I would recommend any of them.

The bottom line
Regardless of the location, this place is great.  What makes it especially good is that it's located in the heart of the Wharf tourist mecca and is a reasonably priced very filling start for your day.
author: Gregory L.

description: just go for the eggs Benedict you will not be disappointed. Major plus for serving fresh sourdough and butter while you wait
author: Mary Jane P.

description: Loved, loved this place. The bread is amazing, the service was always on par and the food was delicious. We stayed at the Hyatt across the street and walked over every morning for a week. I even asked for to go coffee every morning and they did not even bat an eyelash. I love this place, period. Every food item is great, tried several. Eggs benedict was my fav!
author: Sarah N.

description: My husband and I ate at Hollywood Cafe for breakfast 4 times during our week in San Fran!  We absolutely loved it.  The service was great and quick.  The fresh squeezed orange juice is fantastic, and the fruit is some of the freshest I've ever tasted.  The actually meal was also awesome; I recommend the hash browns!  When we go back to San Fran, we will definitely eat at Hollywood Cafe again!
author: Keely D.

description: Yes it's just as amazing as the pictures show to be.  Great food, fresh, large portions and friendly staff.  I will be sure to come back here next visit.
author: Lisa C.

description: fast delicious breakfast.  Tofu Kimchi was great.  Kids had standard breakfast fare.  Fruit was spectacular
author: Randy C.

description: This was place was pretty good. I thought the prices were a little high, it was like 4 bucks for a glass of orange juice, though it was fresh squeezed. The food was good though and my plate had a good sized portion
author: Patrick J.

description:
eh- it was only ok in my opinion.  i live in the area, so i've tried a lot of the breakfast places around and this is definitely not my favorite.  we got 2 different kinds of egg scrambles and a club sandwich.  the sandwich was decent but not great- the turkey was kind of greasy and tasted more like ham or canadian bacon or something.  the fries it came with were pretty good though.  the scrambles were fine but nothing special but the hashbrowns they came with were delicious and crispy.

For the value, this place is ok, but definitely not the best breakfast around.
author: Lisa C.

description: We had walked all the way to Dottie's, but it was closed. We then found our way to Taylor St Coffee Shop, but it was filthy. So, at this point we were starving and had high hopes of Hollywood Cafe being able to deliver. It did!!! Fantastic breakfast!!! We had french toast, scrambled eggs, the Hollywood hash browns, hot and good coffee, and a perfect bowl of FRESH fruit!! After a rough start trying to find a great meal, we left happy and full! This place is small, but the service is great and FAST. The staff was pleasant.  And it was quite cheap for large portions! We will be back. ((Thankful to Yelp for helping us find this place!!))
author: Jamie C.

description: Pretty good food...the egg white and spinach was too watery for me.
author: Melissa M.

description: This is an excellent choice. Great food and lots of it. The fresh fruit and sourdough bread/toast were a perfect compliment to our breakfast. Can't wait to come back to San Fran in spring to go here again.
author: David S.

description:
I've lived in the Bay Area my whole life and I must say that this is one of my favorite cafe's. Walking distance to Pier 39 and many other attractions, this place is perfect for breakfast and lunch. Food is always amazing and cooked to perfection. Service is top notch and everybody is so polite and helpful. I like to sit outside on sunny days and enjoy my meal. 

I really like the fact that the owner is always present. Shows that he cares about his restaurant.

Definitely worth trying if you're in SF!
author: Gerson K.

description: Arrived on a sunny Sunday morning around 10:30 and it was packed. Long line out front but don't let it scare you. We were seated after about 20 minutes, and from then on, we were rocking & rolling!  The menu was filled with lots of traditional, comfort style items with a flair. We ordered the Orangish French Toast, made with Grand Marnier. It was 3 thick halves on a plate loaded with gorgeous fresh fruit. The French toast was rich, golden and slightly crispy. Delish! And only 1 of 4 types of FT on the menu!  My boyfriend got a meat-lovers omelette. It was ginormous and came on the plate with the biggest, but thinnest, slab of hash browns I've ever seen.  Perfect for people who like hash browns for the crunch, and not all the mushy potato inside.  His omelette was filled with ham, sausage & bacon.. And (this was a first).. He could only eat half. Not sure if it was because we split the FT too, or the size of the omelet, but he's a big boy who took a to-go box for the first time ever that I remember. I ordered the chicken teriyaki sandwich, because lunch is served at 11am. It was sweet and loaded with tomatoes, arugula and dripping jack cheese.  Like my counterpart, I could only eat half.. But happily took the rest to go. The service was fantastic.  The waiter spoke with a bug smile and RAN to get us another water. The place was filled with couples, singles, families & tourists. A boisterous, noisy place with signs of old Hollywood on the walls.  You might have to wait if your group includes more than 4 or 5. Not sure they can accommodate large groups. Great place, great food, great service.  Can't wait to return!
author: Kerry L.

description: Fast service even when it was busy for Saturday brunch.  Great food!  Get the side fruit. Super fresh fruit.
author: Daniel L.

description: Waited in a short line. Got seated ordered. No toast given. Had French toast with Orange sauce good lots of fruit. Husband got bacon and eggs. All around people were getting their coffee and basket of toast. We had to ask for our drinks. Then when I had 1/2 my fruit left waitress came put the check down and took my plate. Service was not good others had another waitress who was much better than ours. Oh well on vacation but no good tip left either.
author: Susan B.

description: Hands down the best place for breakfast in Fisherman's Wharf! Incredibly generous portions, great homecooked food, super friendly staff, at an amazing price! We ate at 2 other restaurants before finding this gem, and none of them could compare. For $22 our family (2 adults 2 kids) ate delicious breakfast. Coffee was the best we had at the Wharf, and the generous serving of fresh cut fruit with all the plates was a really nice touch. The staff was always super friendly and happy to see us. The portions are BIG! As I said our family was satisfied sharing 2 plates between the 4 of us. We ended up always ordering out to eat at our hotel but the restaurant itself is really lovely as well.
author: Victoria M.

description: OMG Everything was delicious. They had the best fruit accompinments I have ever seen and all food on the table was scarfed up at a sickly pace. Banana foster french toast, omlettes, and every side imaginable. All delicious.
author: S C.

description: Wait was really long to get in and they got my order wrong  . I ordered chocolate chip pancakes and told them to hold the whipped cream. I ended up getting blueberry pancakes with whipped cream. I explained to them the mistake and they gave me some new pancakes and even then there were barely any chocolate chips and the pancake had a funny taste. Not a good experience.
author: Ronnie T.

description: The best place in town for breakfast! Excellent food and great customer service. Remember it's s cash only place
author: Karina B.

description: Little expensive, but more food. If you eat not anymore , three people,you can order two, we order 3, left 2/3 to take away, Too much, to big.
author: Amy W.

description: Good food and friendly quick service. Great find in a tourist area. Portions are a good size.
author: Bobby H.

description: DEFINITELY NOT a 4.5 diner. If you want basic "American" Denny's like diner food-then come here. Not sure why on earth this place got such high ratings. TOURIST TRAP in fisherman' wharf. I only came because the line at mama's was so long -like always. Sad I brought my friend from out of town here instead.
author: Margot G.

description: Very tasty, quick, reasonably priced for being in a tourist haven, and a very friendly staff. What more could you want?
author: Jason S.

description: Me and my wife went there on Thursday morning, and people were making a long line already. We ordered coffee, Hawaiian Omelet, Combination French Toast. They gave us toasted sower bread for an appetizer. The coffee and bread were very tasty. As soon as the main dishes came out, we surprised by the portion and freshness. I think their French Toast is one of the best in SF. Serving was fast and kind. We had very nice brunch at Hollywood Cafe.
author: Ryan K.

description: Amazing service! Delicious food! And huge portions. Kids and adults loved it, especially the warm sour dough bread they served soon after we sat down at the table. Kids meals were big enough for our 5yr old and 7 year old to split. Fruit cups served with most meals are really an overflowing bowl with sweet berries, pineapple, grapes, apples, mellom and more - truly a beautiful presentation that was delicious too. They also provided Us with togo containers for all the excess fruit. Also delicious was the salsa-whichamas a nice twist from your typical salsa. It had quiwi in the medium-spiced delight. On the expensive side but worth every extra penny.
author: Carrie P.

description: Huge portion, decent food and fast service. I'd say decent neighborhood brunch place to go.
author: Ricki H.

description: Small place, food is okay. I like the option to get fruit instead of hashbrowns.  Normal breakfast foods.  Very busy and had to wait to get a seat.
author: John H.

description: So good and worth the wait.  The fruit was so fresh and plentiful - so good.  Coffee was delish as well.  We all loved everything, but should have split the breakfast because the portions are very generous.  Eggs were perfect, bacon perfect, hashbrowns perfect.  The raspberry jam on the table was yummy too!!!
author: C M.

description: Loved our visit to San Fran.  Yelp didn't let us down with this restaurant.  Eggs Benedict was delicious.  My wife had French toast with fire roasted bananas, awesome as well.  Best of all was the toast with raspberry jelly.  Like an after breakfast dessert, the jelly was the best.
author: Adam B.

description:
Right next to the hotel we were staying at, I found Hollywood Cafe for brunch through the yelp app on the droid. 

Ordered:
Freshly squeezed OJ
Denver omelet sub ham for bacon - comes with hash browns and a choice of toast (English muffin)

Ran by, what it seems like, a Chinese family. Their service was great, the food was above average, inexpensive, OJ was really freshly squeezed. This combo will give any restaurant a 5-star rating. I will visit again if I am ever in that area.
author: Brian K.

description: The waitress didn't ask how we wanted our burger, so she brought it out and it resembled a regulation hockey puck.  I also asked what type of cheese there was and the waitress said Swiss and cheddar, so I glance at another item on the menu and I saw they also have mozzarella.  I ask for light mozzarella in my veggie omelett and they brought it out without cheese.  This place sucks, luckily it's not our last meal.
author: Marissa G.

description: MUST order fresh fruit!  Worth your money! Don't let the looks of this small hole in the wall cafe fool you - IT IS WORTH the stop!  Big, huge portions.  Hash browns to die for! Very affordable especially for SF. Fast service, great BREAKFAST, low prices - cant ask for anything more!
author: Mary V.

description: Super random little cafe near all the tourist hotels in this area - however, the Asian family running this place do a good job! The breakfast food was great! I would def grab food here in the future! Perfectly cooked eggs, yummy jam and fruit.
author: Jessica L.

description: Checked this place out because of the high Yelp rating and it was right next door to my hotel. I was able to sit right down and the service was super quick. I don't know if there's better items on the menu but I ordered a regular breakfast of eggs, bacon, toast, and hash browns. The hash browns were horrible. They came out in a thin sheet and soaked in grease. They made me sick for many hours after. This place will not be a stop when I'm in San Fran.
author: Melissa P.

description: Food was good and fast we were eating within 5 min of ordering. The sourdough bread was excellent. Great place to take the family.
author: Dan S.

description: Chicken omelet was delish.  A mix of flavored from chicken, mushrooms, jalapeños, and sweet chili glaze on top.  Best of all no cheese in the omelet.  Baguette toasted bread with ample butter then smothered with complimentary jam soooooo good.  Definitely a place we will be going back to.  Service was excellent.  Team atmosphere
author: Chris S.

description: All I can say is wow that was a kick ass breakfast. I split a dungeoness eggs Benedict w hash browns and a plate of fruit w my guy. Both of us got our fill just right. Best breakfast in months.
author: Autumn S.

description: First timers in San Fran and have no idea where to go to eat!  Came across Hollywood Cafe and was pleasantly surprised!  Charming little spot with a good variety of entrees.  We went for breakfast and loved all the fresh fruit, strawberries, bananas, oranges, grapefruit, kiwis, grapes, berries...really hit the spot!  I recommend stopping by!
author: Cheryl G.

description: Went here for breakfast with the hubs and we were both very happy with the fast service and quality food.
author: Mindy R.

description: Best Eggs Benedict I've ever had!!!  The hash browns are huge....HUGE!!! This is an awesome place to eat breakfast before venturing out into the city. Located next door to the hop on tour place - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Prices are decent and the service was above average. I ended up going here about 3 more times . I love this place.
author: A. C.

description: My husband and I stopped here for breakfast and let me tell you...the food was fantastic! My husband had a breakfast sandwich that he couldn't get enough of and I had an order of delicious french toast. Our orders came with a side of fresh fruit that truly added to our meals. The service was good as well. I would recommend this restaurant.
author: Steven and Monik B.

description: Awesome breakfast! Great service even though it was super busy. Breakfast was fresh and great. First time and will be making it our regular breakfast spot.
author: Robert L.

description: I chose this place for breakfast after reading the reviews. It was ok, nothing to write home about.
author: Amanda H.

description: I am a total foodie who is not easily impressed, yet this place blew me away. I would expect a wait with this level of quality so that didn't really bother me but once we were seated the service was impeccable and the food came out uber fast! We ordered Mimosas to start, fresh squeezed OJ! The fruit bowl has 11 types is fruit (I counted) and is more than two people can eat! I got the traditional eggs and bacon with hash browns and my girlfriend got the bacon scramble, both of which we're amazing! 5 stars!
author: joseph e.

description:
Oh my gosh...delicious omelets...fresh fruit that is ripe (not rock hard) and varied...(did I say DELICIOUS, creative omelets?)

Visiting SF from LA...we live a deprived existence in LA without a place like this.  Good work!
author: Albert K.

description:
I thought I had previously reviewed this place but I guess I didn't submit my 5 star review for a terrific solid breakfast place that was so liberal with the yellow American cheese it both made you crave and fear it at the same time. The dining room was tiny and so fast that you could actually get a tasty butter cooked eggs sit down breakfast quicker than waiting in line for a cup of coffee.

That is now a faded memory. Unfortunately this review is on top of a colossal disappointment. They have recently reopened after a renovation that took over the space next to them. We rolled out of our office to grab a quick cheese covered breakfast to replace the lunch we would have that day. I ordered my usual eggs cheese on a croissant (which was equal parts eggs and USA cheese...so great) and a side of hash browns, pretty simple stuff. Now when they asked me what kind of cheese did I want I had to question... the old Hollywood Cafe never had a cheese choice. American and lots of it. When you used to order a grilled cheese at this place they would have to triple-decker the thing to even out the cheese and keep the top slice from sliding off. So my answer to "what kind of cheese?" well I said American of course. The reply was, we don't have that. UHHHHH. Cheddar I guess, the other orange cheese. So the people I was with always enjoyed the same sandwich. A veggie breakfast 3 decker sandwich that was egg and cheese on one layer and avocado and grilled mushrooms, onions and peppers on the other layer. It was a giant sandwich, 2 meals worth and fantastic. So they ordered that. Their sandwiches showed up and this is when we discovered that this is not the same old Hollywood Cafe. They were the saddest un-toasted, two slices of bread, no cheese, veg on bread sandwiches we have ever seen with sprouts. They said no to them they were so awful looking. The staff asked what was the problem, the food looks and tastes terrible kind of problem. We asked them what happened to the old sandwich. They said that they merged the menus with the other place that they took over, then brought over some scrambled eggs so we could stuff them into the sandwich I guess. The croissant was OK but not the same, not a lot of cheese and so so eggs but definitely edible. The staff are and have always been nice, but I suppose this is my goodbye. I will not try to lend any advice as that I have never owned a restaurant and I understand that places down in FW don't really rely on repeat business. So, nice staff, don't order from a memory and you probably wont be disappointed. But, I will not be returning.
author: William R.

description: Yeah this place is amazing. Worth just coming here for the fruit alone. We had to wait a bit but it does move fast. Loved everything that we had. We actually ate here 3 days in a row while on vacation so yes it must have been that darn good! Kids loved what they got and everyone left there stuffed. Yes I would say it isn't cheap but you get a ton of food and we actually ate so darn much that we skipped out on lunch! If you are in the area you need to give this place a shot. So glad we did!
author: Shansar A.

description:
Wonderful, fresh eggs.  Excellent fresh french bread and jams.  Entire staff is happy and nice.  Touristy name but in no way a touristy menu.  Visited several times during our trip to the city.

UPDATE:  Tried Eggs Benedict on third visit.  Fantastic light sauce and perfectly cooked eggs.
author: Dee K.

description: After SUCH high reviews, we abandoned our plan to eat at Mama's and came here instead. I ordered the Marilyn Monroe (french toast & a side of fruit) and a mango mimosa. I was so disappointed. My french toast was horribly soggy, like I only ate the crust. The syrup was so mild that it barely had flavor and while most of the fruit was good, I had a moldy blackberry on my plate. To top it off, my mimosa didn't show up until we were almost done eating. What a bummer.
author: Misty D.

description: Thanks to Yelp, I found this place and the reviews were right on, this place is awesome! Ate at the Cafe for breakfast and it was perfect. This is a must stop for anyone who's in SF looking for a good breakfast. Good, quick service!
author: Kyle A.

description: The "Peter's hash browns" were amazing! However, If you get them, only order a side.... It's all you'll need...
author: Adam K.

description: Excellent food, fast friendly service! They never let my coffee cup go below half full (or empty?). One thing I really hate is ordering coffee and having an empty cup sitting on my table! The prices were reasonable and the portions ample, will definitely go again when we are back in the area.
author: Dan F.

description: Went there and got the clap. It was great! Oops.. Sorry, got the crab omelet. Really was quite wonderful !
author: Tony V.

description:
A busy place, but we had a brief wait and worth it.
Excellent breakfast and some unique choices.  Friendly and quick service.
author: Vivian O.

description: Best place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch in the Wharf. Fresh fruit and wonderful brunch items on the menu. Good service and reasonable pricing.
author: andrew c.

description:
It's really hard for me to write this - since I think the service is fantastic. 

Something so horrible happened to me and my bf here last Sunday.

We ordered our usual breakfast and when it came out - there was a LONG BLACK HAIR laying across my eggs.  Right when the server set it down, I said - no, please take this back.  He replied - I'M SO SORRY I'M SO SORRY and took it back.  Now, I can let that go since I'm nice like that, but, what happened next really upset me.

So while my breakfast was being fixed, my boyfriends came out.  As soon as he started to eat, there, laying in his hash browns - ANOTHER LONG BLACK HAIR!  My bf. just stopped said - excuse me, can you please take this - there is a long black hair in my food.  So with another couple apologies, they took the food back.  

Now at this point, neither of us even felt like eating anymore.  

My food came back out and my eggs were so runny that the whites were all over the plate.  I like to eat my whites, not drink them.  Anyway, we both ate as much as we could (which wasn't alot considering) and we left.

This was our new favorite place and now we won't go back.  Please - WEAR A HAIR NET IN THE KITCHEN!
author: Noneya B.

description: Amazing food, huge portions but tasty at the same time, quick and friendly service, great outdoor seating, and last but not least the fruit bowl. Definitely returning.
author: Robert J.

description: Boyfriend was disappointed with their crab benedict (soupy-ish?) after reading the raving reviews here about it, but the other more "basic" breakfast food we had was good.
author: Michelle S.

description: Fast service, rich coffee and a menu that will impress for breakfast.  The fresh fruit is delicious, and the french toast is amazing.  Eggs benedict are a staple here, so if you are a fan you must try! The chicken apple sausage is something fun to try.  Will definitely go again.
author: Kate K.

description: Just okay. Hash browns were good. Omelettes were pretty bland however. I would have liked to get some of their fruit because it looked fresh and had large portions. The service was great though, very fast and the people are very energetic. If you are in a rush or just want some quick eats this gets the job done.
author: Jon E.

description: One of the best breakfast joints in Fisherman's Wharf. Every visit has been incredibly good. After breakfast, walking on the pier by the water is also great exercise after excellent breakfast. :-)
author: Annie K.

description: This place was great for our morning breakfast.  We stayed at the Hyatt across the street and came here both mornings for breakfast.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The food was so filling that we had late and very light lunches during the days.  We did a lot of walking around the city and site seeing so it gave us a lot of energy.
author: Raghavi R.

description: It was very good. Loved the peters hash browns but wouldn't get the chicken sausage again.
author: Ryan M.

description: We were looking for a breakfast place and decided to try the Hollywood cafe based on Yelp recommendations. The food was really good. There is a good variety and some interesting twists on some old classics. The staff was VERY friendly and upbeat and when greeting you and saying goodbye were very genuine. They seemed happy to work there. After eating there on Saturday we returned on Sunday. The hash browns are excellent and you don't leave hungry!
author: Kevin K.

description: The breakfast portions here are enormous, easily big enough for two people. My wife had the #5, egg bacon and cheese on a croissant with fresh fruit. The eggs were a little hard to eat because of the small bun, the fruit "cup" was a bowl and everything in it was absolutely fresh. I had the eggs benedict with hollywood has browns. The eggs were perfect , the hash browns were enough for three people. The only downer was that the bacon was not crisp and was just a bit leathery. The coffee was perfect. We will be back.
author: J G.

description: Just had the Chorizo and eggs.  Excellent!  Plate was clean when I was done.  Nice crisp bacon.  Good service.  Come here instead of Denny's around the corner.
author: James C.

description: Fresh orange juice, wonderful hash browns and pancakes but no Nutella!
author: Àngel B.

description:
When my guy and i got  there it was a full house. Had to wait maybe 10 min before we got a table.

we sat outside and enjoyed the sunshine!

The waitress seemed to be running around (didn't really check in with us) ,  and it took a while for my guy to get refills ( - star )

I got the ham and cheese croissant - wow that thing had 3 thick layers of thick HAM!!!! and it was yummy and warm and toasty!! 4 Stars !!The o.j. was yummy


He got the Denver omelet. He said it was good. 

My guy had to run to the ATM because it is CASH ONLY
author: Kady A.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  I had a denver omelette.  Girlfriend had the bagel with lox and smoked salmon.  We shared the fruit plate (which was huge and excellent).  Everything was very fresh and tasty, the service was good, and the prices were reasonable.
author: Doug B.

description: Perfect, well-priced & unique little breakfast joint! Expect a little wait because the restaurant is small but worth it. We both got the combo plates (I got French toast combo & he got pancake combo) and we didn't have to eat again until 2:30 PM!!
author: Kim M.

description: WOW!  This place ROCKS!!!  Very small seating area so get here early.  The food and service were fabulous!!!!  They give you a ridiculous amount of fresh fruit alongside a ridiculous amount of breakfast food.  I would absolutely go back here again if I lived in SF.  Go here!!!
author: Sheri C.

description: Delicious breakfast.  Generous serving sizes.  They are serious about there fruit bowls, too!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Fast friendly service. The banana French Toast was very tasty. Coffee refills without having to ask. Overall a great experience.
author: Steven C.

description: I came accross this place while visiting the Bay area this weekend and it was absolutely great. The place is filled with tourists but the food is awesome and fresh. Conveniently located around Fisherman's Warf its a great breakfast spot. It's cool menu options are described and paired up with some of Hollywood's legends. I had the Audrey Hepburn and it was very tasty and large. Parking can be a challenge and luckily we got a spot right in front. The staff is friendly and are quick. Their OJ is freshly squeezed and very tasty too. It's a great breakfast spot and very easy on the wallet. Check it out!
author: Sunie Q.

description:
When it comes to breakfast/lunch joints, I'm not sure what makes them good. For instance, what makes Mama's so good? There's always a long line, but for breakfast? Are they known for something? Eggs Benedict? Oh well, I guess I'll have to stand in line to find out! I digress...

Anyway, I felt the same way going to Hollywood Cafe. First of all, it wasn't that crowded. I guess their location does not receive much foot traffic from locals. Then again that area is more for tourists. No crowd? Must not be good huh? To the contrary... I went here with my friend a while back and we had a very filling breakfast (most important meal of the day folks). I had a three egg omelet and he had a veggie something... While I didn't pay, we got a lot of breakfast for the buck!

Today I went there again, but this time for lunch. My decision on what to eat was further clouded when the waiter said they serve breakfast all day long. I love breakfast (especially French toast drowning in maple syrup)! But I settled on a regular burger. The burger was priced right at $4.95. It wasn't one of those thick 1/3 lb. burgers so if you like that go someplace else. It came with fresh lettuce, tomatoes, onions and mayo on a toasted bun. I love toasted buns (get your minds out of the gutter). No sides, but for $2 more, I got some garlic fries. Total lunch bill a little over $7.

What I like about this place is the service is fast and friendly, and the prices are reasonable. Oh and the presentation was great -- my plate came with slices of oranges arranged like a fan. If you're in the North Beach area and are looking for a quick, reasonably priced place to eat, give them a try!
author: K. F.

description: Fresh fresh fresh. Everything here was really good and fresh from the coffee to the hash-browns. I had the southwestern benedict and my wife the seascape. Both were good. I would definitely come here again.  Good quick service.
author: Rob V.

description: Excellent. Really fresh fruit, awesome food, fast service and great customer service!!
author: Bob N.

description:
reasonably priced.  the french toast is the best! get any menu item as long as french toast is one of the items. i got the french toast and fruit, my wife got the french toast combo w/ the hash browns and chicken apple sausages.  fresh fruit is not standard orange slice fare either. i got blueberries, strawberries, cantaloupe, banana. i dipped my fruit on the syrup given to me for the french toast. tasty.
orange juice at this place is good too.  
get there early.  very crowded.
author: jon c.

description:
I have journeyed to many countries over the years (the UK, Italy, Spain, Greece, France, North Africa, Romania, Belgium, Norway, etc, and many, many places in the US), and of course, eaten breakfast in all of them. Never have I questioned the name of an eating establishment and poured scorn or questioned their product for that reason (See Wendy C.!). 
I was in SF over Christmas (23rd to 30th) and breakfasted at the Hollywood Grill three times, including Christmas Morning. The food, service and general ambience of the place was five star. Never have I experienced a better breakfast. Everything we ordered was always fresh, hot (where cooked) and extremely tasty. The longest we ever had to wait for a table was five minutes. The staff were exemplary and very pleasant. I personally had the French Toast Combo Breakfast, the Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon  and Shrimp and the James Dean (with poached eggs and bacon). All were served with a healthy portion of the freshest and sweetest fruits (Melon, Raspberries, Strawberries, Kiwi, Blackberries and Orange). On the table were a lovely Raspberry Jam and an extremely good Orange Marmalade, both being perfect additions to the sourdough toast served to all.
The eggs were always served as I like them (the poached eggs are particularly well presented and good), the bacon thick, tasty and perfectly cooked, the salmon rich and smokey, the shrimp were shrimp.
We tried three other places for breakfast while in SF (Caffe Sappora, Pat's and the second-rate Beach Street Grill) but none of them even came near to the Hollywood Grill.
The Hollywood Grill is by far the best breakfast place I have ever eaten breakfast and I cannot recommend them more highly.
author: Brad B.

description: Fantastic!  Excellent service and wonderful fresh food.  The best breakfast ever!  I can be really picky and this was amazing.
author: Kitbrit R.

description: We went for a late breakfast around 9:15 am and were seated immediately. The wait staff were all friendly, quick and efficient. Our food was delivered quickly and as ordered - the James Dean (2 eggs, bacon, fruit, sourdough toast & coffee) and an order of 2 poached eggs, wheat toast and iced coffee. Our total bill (for 2 people) with tip was $16. We'll be back.
author: Ron B.

description: My wife and I stopped in here early on Labor day for some breakfast largely due to the good reviews we had seen on YELP. We were pleasantly surprised that there was our wait time was less than 5 minutes as we expected a bit longer wait, but seemed that we just missed the rush because after a few minutes we began to see a long line form. At any rate we were seated and proceeded to order. I ordered the veggie omelette with egg whites and a side of fruit, while my wife ordered the meat lovers omelette, along with a side of vanilla creme french toast. Little did we know that the the serving portions would be so big! Both our omelets came out in no time and were very generous. I was very pleased with the side of fruit which literally was falling off my plate! Watermelon, honeydew, raspberries, blueberries, it was all there and in a man sized helping. My wife's meat lover omelette was excellent and had just the right amount of bacon, not overwhelming like other places. The french toast however was TO DOE FOR! Banana cream with real banana's, on a light bed of maple brown sugar oatmeal with bread crumb style french toast, add in the glazed walnuts and it was DIVINE! Bear in mind it was a bit pricey for breakfast, set us back a bit over $50, but definitely worth the price in service and taste. We will defiinitiely be back.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Good, basic breakfast near Fishermen's Wharf.  Denver omelet and crab and avocado omelets were good; I preferred the Denver omelet.  Hash browns were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, just right.  Coffee was just OK.  I would go back to this place for a hearty breakfast.
author: Rob K.

description: SOOOOO GOOD!  Fantastic service, fresh squeezed orange juice, tons of fresh fruit, the hash brown special was amazing, food came so quickly and was very reasonable.  Best breakfast I've had in SF and I will absolutely be going back!
author: Robin R.

description: Good not great, not sure what the rave reviews are about but I can tell you I have had much better. OK breakfast but great fast, friendly service. Portions were good but the flavor:Eggs Benedict with crab was bland, pancakes were too spongy and dense, and the omelet was decent flavor but overcooked
author: Wil J.

description: Great lil breakfast spot! Get there early as it will get crowded. Fast & attentive staff, good portions, quick & really good!
author: Carie M.

description: Once again, yelp doesn't disappoint! Found this little gem of a place while on vacation. Quick, friendly service, delicious fresh fruit and huge helpings of food make this a great place for a meal anytime!
author: Phil M.

description:
I give it 3.5.

Good service, gigantic plates. The place has sidewalk seating which is nice, although there's a ton of tourists.

if they had sour cream it would've made my avocado cheddar bacon scramble a bit better but that's okay. I think it came to 23.00 for two entrees and a glass of OJ. Bf said OJ was a bit watered down though.

we'll most likely be back.
author: laura f.

description: This cafe was just down the road from our hotel, had great reviews so we thought hell yeah! Lets come here for  brekky. It was about 11am on a Monday so there were very few people eating here. It still took 15 minutes for our coffees and water to come out. My coffee was fine, apart from the fact that over half of it was froth which the waitress didnt see as a problem for a cappuccino. I ordered a BLT on white which came on wholemeal (which i let slide) and my buddy grabby philly cheese steak. My BLT was fine, my mate really enjoyed his cheese steak though we came away quite disappointed with this place and can't imagine how slow it would be on a busy sunday.
author: Jake H.

description: 4 stars because it is a quick, simple, good breakfast spot with healthy choices. My 5 year old devoured his breakfast...that is reason enough for 4 stars.
author: Sheila T.

description: Thank god for the iphone and staying next door to Hollywood Cafe.  I haven't had a great breakfast like this in a long time. Sunday's are not as crowded as Saturday mornings.
author: Rusty O.

description: I was initially worried this place would be a little too gimmicky (I ordered the Marilyn Monroe special, which is french toast with a side of fresh fruit), but the staff basically drops any indications of being catered toward tourists the second you walk in. My toast was delightfully buttery, and the fruit was the perfect complement to both my meal and my mothers. We're fully planning on visiting here for breakfast again after realizing it's by far the best place around our hotel.
author: Kyle H.

description: My Hop On Hop Off bus stop was located one block from here.  Since I saw a line to eat at this restaurant I decided to try it.  Luckily I did because this is a great place to eat breakfast.  Although there was a line we were seated within 15 minutes.  The food is fresh and delicious.  I had an omelette and fresh fruit.  My wife and daughter had scrambled eggs and hash brown.  They had freshly squeeze orange juice.  I recommend this place.
author: Enrique C.

description: A good solid breakfast for a reasonable price - nothing terribly frou-frou, but if you're looking for a mountain of tasty diner food, you've found your spot.  Bonus points for the most vigilant coffee/water refilling I've ever experienced and for parking right out front.
author: She-Ra ..

description: Went here on vacation with my family.  The restrooms were absolutely filthy.  Spent 50 dollars for breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children.  Had the Pancake Combo with scrambled eggs and bacon.  The bacon was dry and brittle, the pancakes soggy.  My wife had the omelet with hash browns, the omelet was runny and watery, her hasbrowns were cold.  Was disappointed with this place.
author: Ankur L.

description: This place is nothing special at all but if u want really simple breakfast cheap in this hugely touristy area this is the place to go and they have a few good kids selection on the menu and no shock that it was waaaaaaaaaay cheaper than eating breakfast in our hotel (Hyatt right across the street).
author: TJ H.

description:
Pros: great service & very accommodating, food is tasty, great fresh fruits, good portions, great price range for SF.
Cons: it can get really busy, table size is small, there are metered parking, but can be a challenge if none are available.
Recommended food: James Dean w/ bratwurst for choice of meat, French Toast  combo, any of the eggs benedict are good. Somehow, the vegetable pattymelt turned out really spicy, so I'm not sure if the cook mixed in the wrong pepper, but that was the only food ordered that failed expectation. Hot chocolate is adequate, not the best. Orange juice was served in regular size glass-definite plus (as opposed to small glass that charges for regular price).
Overall, we were very pleased with our breakfast experience, considering they are located in the tourist zone. There were 8 of us so I called them the day before to give them a heads-up. We were seated right away. I would give them a 4 1/2 stars score, if not for the unexpected very spicy sandwich and adequate hot chocolate. None the less, we will eat there again, if we're in the area.
author: Angelica F.

description: Best breakfast. Go with the French toast combo. Won't do you wrong!!! Everything is so fresh and pleasing to the eye. San Fran prices.
author: Jitty A.

description: The quality of the food here was totally unexpected! I ordered a breakfast croissant...not only was it huge and absolutely delicious it came with a large side of fresh fruit. Now, when many places say "fresh fruit" you end up getting an assortment of barely fresh melon, not at this place! Strawberries, apples, grapes....yuummm. Service was quick, waitresses were quiet but nice.
author: aleena U.

description: It took me forever to figure out what to order, I kept talking and getting distracted but our waiter was very nice and kept coming back to check in on us. I ended up getting a tip from a fellow yelper to try peters hash browns. So I did. Yummy! Service was awesome! Our waiter looked like Bobby Lee from MadTv it was hilarious! Loved it.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Cozy breakfast spot - but cash only people! But the coffee was hot and my omelet delicious. Decent size menu and the food comes out quick. Generous portions as well. Very nice to have a little sidewalk brunch. Swing by, you'll like it.
author: Lauren D.

description: Good food.  Great when avoiding Denny's or the like.  Plenty of the usual breakfast suspects as well as some extras, like fried bananas.  Ate here twice on our trip of five days.  First day:  good food, great service.  Second day:  Good food, awful service.  Very scatter-brained server who seemed overwhelmed.
author: Stuart A.

description: The food was very average, service was good. Solid 3 stars. Chicken apple sausage was brutal, hash browns were OK, and the OJ was great.
author: Sharam F.

description: This is only my second Yelp post. This place is amazing! Or, to quote my wife: "You know how much I love breakfast; this is best breakfast I've ever had." I'm glad I took the Yelp suggestions to get the fruit. There were so many kinds of fruit, and they were all so delicious. And I'm glad I took the advice to split a breakfast. We split the "Audrey Hepburn," which was two pancakes and a TON of fruit. We stuffed ourselves, and we still had some grapes left over. Good service and a nice atmosphere. The only down side was that we ordered the pancakes without butter, and they came with butter. We're going back tomorrow, my wife tells me!
author: Dave W.

description: I had pancakes and cappuccino. A bit pricey, but it's due to it's beautiful location. Friendly service!
author: Afshan K.

description: Amazing breakfast at the end of our vacation.  Portions are huge!!  Fresh fruit was amazing - so much we took it away in a box.  Everything we ordered was definitely something we would order again.  I would highly recommend for families not worried about their calories!
author: John Q.

description: This was the best breakfast we ate in San Fran!  We even ate at Mamas and this was just as good, if not, better. We were promptly seated (we did get there early) and the portions are huge. The fruit portion is CRAZY big and fresh/delicious. My wife got the Audrey Hepburn and I got the hash browns all the way with two eggs over easy - it was delicious.
author: John P.

description: Long wait for sub par breakfast. Crab omlette and crab benedict were not very good. Toast was the best part.
author: Luke B.

description:
Fantastic breakfasts, 2 days in a row!

The Dulce French Toast came with grilled bananas and a load of fresh berrys on the side. The lox were great and the kids loved the chocolate chip pancakes.

Great coffee to round it all off.

It's a busy spot, but service is fast an friendly.

We'll be back when we're in town next.
author: Doug M.

description: Thank you for the great reviews for this breakfast restaurant! I had the French toast and fruit or "The Marilyn Monroe" and it was fabulous. The fresh fruit is enough for two, but get your own because I ate all of mine. I agree with the other reviews this is a great breakfast place.
author: Karla P.

description: Conveniently located near fisherman's wharf and several hotels. The orange French toast was delicious and comes covered in fresh fruit. Service was a little inattentive and I never could get a refill of hot water for my tea. Otherwise would be 5 stars.
author: L S.

description: Food is good but not great. In the immediate area, there's not a whole lot of great choices. Venture a little further away (toward Columbus/North Beach - check the Yelp map) and you can do much better for the same price or less.
author: Bob D.

description: Food came fast, decent coffee. While the food was okay, it wasn't anything special. Slightly over priced, won't go back on this trip, probably wouldn't visit again in the future.
author: Chris V.

description: Very friendly staff but it is very tiny. We did the outdoor seating even though it was really cold outside but it helped that they had outdoor heaters. Had the hash special (forgot the name)and it was good. It had cheese, bacon, onions, and mushroom mixed together. Also included two eggs and toast. Very big portions so don't worry about still being hungry.
author: Crystal C.

description: Best breakfast I've ever had. I never knew breakfast could taste this good.  Inredible service too. Don't pass this one up!!!!!
author: Jason D.

description:
I went here with my 2 friends last time and it was delicious! we got to order anything we wanted for FREE :D One of my friend's dad works there and it was on the house ! 

I don't give it 5 stars because my food was free, but it was a good lunch. 
They give you a large amount and its very tasty. Most of the stuff that they serve at lunch can be served for dinner so it sucks they close at 2PM!

their price is reasonable too !
author: kathy t.

description: Perfectly cooked eggs.  Fast service.  Really small place.
author: Juliana Y.

description:
This place is a bit hole-in-the-wall-ish, but a great find within what is bordering on a very expensive and touristy area.  I got a vegetarian omelette which comes with hash browns (or fresh fruit for an extra $1) and toast.  They also have your standard eggs, pancakes, sausages, etc., and burgers and sandwiches.

Service was so quick, we must have gotten all our food within 2 to 3 minutes after ordering.
author: S L.

description: Excellent and fresh fruit, very good pancakes, melt in your mouth French toast, kid friendly
author: Dionne C.

description:
Simply excellent!  Living in San Francisco for almost 30 years, I thought  restaurants in tourist attractions that serve decent meal are expensive.  This place is an exception.  This one is a rare restaurant that serves excellent food at very good price in Fisherman's Wharf.  The size of the meal is more than generous.  The price is very kind to you (more or less $10) and the food is just as good as 5 star hotel.  The staffs are very courteous and kind.

Being hooked, I went there several times and here is some of the dishes I tried: vegetarian hamburger (tastes like real hamburger, delicious), steak hamburger (awesome!), and mushroom omelet with smoked salmon (I had this several times.  Excellent!).  The food is very tasty.  Each part of food is perfectly cooked and appropriately seasoned.  I can tell the cook is one of the best in town.  I loved their coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  Everyone in my party loved the food. This place will be my regular.
author: Chris M.

description: SO glad that i trusted yelp instead of my cousin (a san francisco native) and went to hollywood cafe for brunch. great location - just a few short blocks from the wharf. the restaurant itself was pretty tiny, but more than adequate considering the outside tables. service was fast and super friendly. prices are very fair for a delish and filling meal, especially compared to the crazy tourist traps in the heart of the wharf! the food was super fresh and i would DEFINITELY recommend the egg/cheese croissant special that comes with fresh fruit and coffee/tea for $8.95. the croissant was SO good, and the fruit was just as amazing as everyone says it is. yummm!
author: Laurie L.

description: Wasn't nearly as impressed with the breakfast as other people seemed, but perhaps I ordered wrong.  Ordered a bacon and cheese breakfast sandwich, assuming eggs would be standard on it.  I was wrong.  Companion ordered "healthy" omelette which was accompanied by a larger than omelette portion of hash browns and 2 slices of bread.  (Fruit could be ordered for more, but it was already a bit pricey for a diner type breakfast).  The omelette was subpar at best.
author: Sheri W.

description: I was visiting San Francisco and went here because of the Yelp ratings. I liked it so much I went back the next day. The menu is imaginative and the food is carefully prepared. Each dish seems to come with a lot of fresh fruit, too. The waiters and waitresses are friendly and efficient. When you order something they give you an order of sourdough toast. They have outdoor seating too.
author: Philip R.

description: I tried this place based on yelp recommendations --  I thought it was fine, but there are so many other options for breakfast, I feel like we can do better.  I had the omellette with spinach and mushroom, she had the french toast.  The food was ok; the servers were nice.  I think I would go back to this place, but only if I was otherwise in the neighborhood.
author: Chris W.

description:
This place is great if you are looking for an inexpensive, somewhat healthy breakfast.  #1, the fruit is sliced to order, so, if youa re like me (very picky fruit eater) you will love it.  And if you order a small bowl of fruit, you are presented with a huge bowl of gorgeous fresh fruit.
The value is great and the french toast is DELICIOUS.
My one negative... their lunch doesn't seem to be what I am looking for although, like breakfast it is inexpensive.
I work a block away so I go here quite a bit.
author: Alexis J.

description: Very delicious, very caring. A great place to start your day right and quite in touch with it's name...
author: Daniel W.

description: I came here for brunch after reading reviews and Hollywood Cafe did not disappoint. The portions are big and the fruit bowl is bigger. I love all the condiments they offer too.
author: Kate S.

description: Yummy, small and personal and quick!!! Very close to fishermans warf so just grab your Breakfast on the way! Very good place!
author: Britt m.

description: This place was great. Thanks to yelp we found it. Portions where huge, food was great, and service was lightning fast. I loved the Hollywood hash browns and my scramble was very good as well, my wife's French toast was good, or so she says I don't touch the stuff :-). For a breakfast spot it was a little pricey $38 (2 coffees, 2 entrees and my hash brown upgrade charge, tax and tip). If you made me pick a down side the only two things that come to mind are the cost and the lack of wifi access and picking on lack of wifi is being really nit picky.
author: Kris K.

description: AMAZING....We stumbled upon this place after trying to get into another place.  We where sat fairly quickly, despite there being several people in front of us.  Within 3 minutes of sitting down we had our toast ( amazing sourdough) and drink.  Roughly 8 minutes later we had our food, it looked great and was nice and warm.  My girl had the crab omlette, ( which was awesome) oi had the three scrambled eggs and apple wood sausage.  Bottom line it was the best breakfest we have both had in years and we will always eat here when we are in the city.
author: Chris H.

description: My wife and I ate breakfast here last Tuesday morning and enjoyed it very much. She had the french toast and I had the egg and chorizo. This place deserves an extra star for the small kitchen and the efficient crew working it.
author: Thomas M.

description: This place is REALLY small. There were maybe about five tables inside and five outside, so definitely not a good place for  groups with more than four or five people. The staff was friendly, and the food tasted fine. Nothing too special, just the usual breakfast fare. What I loved though was that just about every breakfast plate came with a heaping pile of fruit. And none of that canned stuff. Every piece of fruit on my plate was fresh AND sweet. Yum.
author: Anna T.

description: My kind of breakfast, great food, service, portions all served in a clean cafe. A cafe recipe for success.
author: Kirk J.

description: Super friendly service, giant slabs of hash browns and overflow plates of fresh ripe fruit.
author: Scott M.

description: Here playing tourist in the City, and we just had breakfast this morning based on all the good reviews. It was everything you promised! Friendly, quick service, consistently good food. Awesome hash browns (have the Special ones, 'cause -- well, 'cause they're Special), great fresh fruit. great coffee. The whole family was happy, from Grandma to Junior. Thanks, everyone!
author: Anne R.

description: OMG fell upon this gem this morning.  Food is great portions are enormous.  Fruit cup that comes with every dish is super.  Fast & courteous service.  Don't let the size of the place fool you it's not a long wait.
author: Kathy O.

description: The portions are huge and delicious. The crab meat omelet was out of this world.
author: Jason B.

description: Relatively good, very busy and seemingly unorganized. food swas average. One poorly pancake was hidden by another, very disappointing. However, the rest of the food was ok, and it was good for a quick breakfast to continue on the day.
author: Preethum P.

description: I live around here and have avoided this place for a while now to avoid the crowds/tourists, but I was pleasantly surprised when I came for brunch. Ambiance is nothing special, but the service is great. The food is standard breakfast food but I particularly enjoyed the fruit bowl, french toast, and hash browns.  Come hungry because the portions are HUGE!
author: Ayesha B.

description: Excellent! food was great, service was delightful. My boyfriend and I have been in San Fran for 3 days and this was hands down the best meal of the trip. Prices are very reasonable. my boyfrend even got a coffe in a to-go cup as soon as he asks, he was very pleased! One word: AMAZING!  Very cool spot. As we approached we saw a line infront of the restaurant. No big deal. We were seated in 5 minutes.  The fruits were aweome and the oj was freshly squeezed. Servers were extrmely attentive. Highly recommend this joint.
author: Lilly R.

description:
Thank goodness for Yelp! I would never have noticed this place if I hadn't seen these reviews.

We ate here 3 times in a week. The food was fresh, the staff was really nice, and the FRUIT! Vacation breakfasts can be so heavy, and although I love my hash browns and such, I am trying to eat better these days. So to get a platter of eggs or pancakes or whatever and have almost half that platter piled up with the freshest fruit available was such a treat!
author: Mary C.

description: We went to San Francisco for vacation and ate every morning at this restaurant. We ended up only eating 2 meals per day because we were so full after breakfast here! We tried omelettes, scrambled eggs, over easy eggs, eggs benedict, and the fresh fruit bowl (great variety and ripe) with yogurt. Hashbrowns come with most meals, and they are perfectly crispy! Delicious marmalade and jam are on the table to eat with the sourdough toast (you get a lot!) On our last day there, we decided it was a good thing Hollywood Cafe isn't near our home in NE. We would be eating breakfast there far too often! Delicious food!
author: Nancy T.

description: Everything was fresh and fantastic. The service was great. They made a mix up on my girlfriends order but it was quickly remidied and they threw in some free ham to boot. Awesome experience, will come again and then some.
author: John O.

description: Food was awesome.  Portions were huge.  There were 5 people in our party and we all ordered different things.  Everybody enjoyed everything.  I would've given 5 stars, but our waitress was not very friendly.  However, all other staff seemed very pleasant.  Would definetely visit again.
author: Alex B.

description: I came here after seeing the hour long wait at Mama's and definitely did not regret it.  The best meal I ate in two days in San Francisco. It looked like their was going to be a wait, but it ended up being only about ten minutes.  I ordered Eggs Benedict and while there was a little too much sauce, it tasted incredible.  The hash browns were crispy and delicious.  My sister ordered an omelette with the fresh fruit and every piece of it was so fresh and tasty.  Even the lemonade was scrumptious.  I would eat their all the time if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Dustin T.

description: My husband and I eat breakfast here often and we LOVE this place! The serving sizes are big, so I always have something extra to take home and the servers are some of the best! A great place to catch a "home cooked" breakfast if your on this side of the city!
author: Diane E.

description: This cafe was right next door to our hotel. Every morning I passed the line of people waiting to be seated and saw the HUGE fruit plates that were served to the diners and I couldn't resist trying Hollywood cafe! I am so glad I did. I ordered the Audrey Hepburn pancakes and fruit plate, my husband got the plain french toast and just because we had to try it, we got the hash browns, Hollywood style. Everything was wonderful! The hash browns Hollywood style came out first. It was a sheet of thin hash browns, topped with bacon, mushrooms, onions, peppers, cheese and probably other awesome things I am forgetting right now. The pancakes were great, and the fruit was ridiculously good. LOTS of berries, some slices apple, banana and orange slices. My husband likes his french toast, too. Very reasonable prices, considering it is located in a very tourist-y area. Will definitely like to return next time I am in SF!
author: Mimi P.

description: Two words......Sweet bacon.........And everything else......The food was all of great quality and huge portions....I demolished the orange french toast with an orange frsngelico cream covering 3 big pieces and a huge side of fruit. My wife ate the avocado tomato and bacon omelette that she struggled to eat all of and also included home fries toast and fruit....The food was great - the coffee was hot - And service was good - Only negative was the bathroom which was down a dirty hallway
author: Chris M.

description: I was really hoping for a better experience after reading all the great Yelp review.  First off, it was a Sunday morning so maybe things were a bit more chaotic than usual.  Basically, you wait on the sidewalk until the a table opens up.  The waiter hands you a menu and takes off.   When a table opens up you sit, order, eat and leave because there a 20 other people watching you and hoping you get up so they can sit and eat.  I ordered an eggs Benedict and was ok.  The ham was cut thick and the Hollandaise sauce was runny.  My partner ordered a croissant breakfast sandwich and it was bland.    Would I go back??  No.  I was not impressed or left satisfied.
author: anna j.

description: My boyfriend and I both got the meat lover's omelette.  The eggs were unseasoned and really undercooked. I almost gagged at one point. Hash browns could have been cooked more, too. Service was decent,  orange marmalade and toast were good.
author: Christine K.

description: Vivan Lee is the crescent thick bacon great eggs. Great fresh real fruit. Great coffee too.
author: Ed B.

description: Good breakfast restaurant & very fast service. The bkfst meals &  combination of bkfst meals are good so there is more of a variety than a regular bkfst joint. The food was good but only be careful due to fast service that your meal isn't done right & that's what lacked for us. Outside of this the bkfst dishes were a lot better than what our hotel offered.
author: Reggie A.

description: My husband and I ended up at this gem because of Yelp.  What an amazing place - the wait staff was energetic and so friendly, the wait time for a table and for our food was speedy, and the breakfasts (sourdough toast that comes with every meal, pancakes, side of crispy hash browns, and sunny side eggs and bacon) we ordered were delicious.  Great sized portions and the "side of fruit" was the best fruit salad I've had at a restaurant.  We will definitely go back there again and we've already told friends about this place!
author: Rachelle D.

description: Tried this diner based on Yelp reviews.  I was completely underwhelmed.  Sourdough toast is NOT real sourdough.  Hash browns must be frozen.  All of the ingredients tasted like they came from a can or freezer.  Eggs Benedict lacked flavor, scrambled eggs were slightly brown.  The service was wonderful.  Fast and friendly.  Just not the kind of food I want in SF.
author: Jenifer l.

description: Great breakfast place. Love'd the orange french toast, Fresh fruit and sweet bacon. Love it. Meals were well price. Good service.
author: Alex T.

description: The best breakfast we had on vacation, so good that we went twice! My family ordered a variety of items and every one of them were fantastic. Amazing egg dishes, French toast, hash browns and even the toast is wonderful. The service was very friendly and lightening fast. The fresh fruit was also out tof this world good. If you live in SF you're lucky, make the trip over to this great place for breakfast.
author: Anita M.

description: Great food, great service and thoughtful staff.  We ate breakfast here while on vacation after reading some great reviews here.  I usually don't leave reviews unless I feel either really impressed or really horrified.  I was impressed with everything about this place.  Food is great, service is exceptional and the staff was friendly and efficient.  I would like to thank our waiter for running a block to return our very expensive camera to us.  I really enjoyed the fresh fruit that came with our meal.  It was so delicious and welcomed after eating out for almost a week.  Large portions here so don't over order.  Loved the hash browns...just the way I like...crispy on the edges!  Coffee was good too.  I love that they leave the cream on the table versus having to ask for cream every time you get a fresh pour.  This area of the city is very touristy and you can definitely spend your $$ on a crappy place.  You will not be disappointed here, trust me!
author: Michelle R.

description:
My wife got the egg and cheese sandwich and was still asking "How can you make an egg and cheese that good" three weeks later.  The vegi sandwich was also great.  The coffee was good.

The service was fast and friendly, and the prices were reasonable, especially considering the area they are in.  Great place to start the day if you are sightseeing in the area.
author: Alpesh S.

description: This IS the best breakfast in San Francisco. We're out of towners that come to frisco twice a year.  THIS place is off the hook!! The breakfast is reasonably priced. Centrally located not far from the wharf.  Everything we ordered was perfect.  Definitely try the fresh fruit plate!!
author: Jaime H.

description: Good breakfast spot. I had the dungeness crab benedict and it was really good, they didn't skimp on the crab at all! My fiance had the eggs and Peters hash and enjoyed it as well.  They always made sure his cup of coffee was full which is always a plus. May 2011
author: Jennifer S.

description: The service was good.  The coffee was diner quality.  They were always there to refill your cup whether you had coffee or tea.  The fresh fruit was amazing. I would go there just for that.  My daughter had the Greek omelet and said it was fantastically delicious.  My husband had the chorizo and egg scramble and said it was very good.  Next time we are in the area we would definitely go again.
author: Elisa T.

description: Love the french toasts and the fruits, reasonable price
author: Febriana S.

description: We stayed at the Hyatt across the street for a weekend and had their expensive breakfast on the first day. On the second day, we went to Hollywood Cafe. Not a fancy place, but super fast service, good food--even with nice ripe fruit--and low prices. We highly recommend it!
author: Les B.

description: diner style, but ideal for breakfast or lunch. Great fruit salads and good pancakes. All of this for a very decent price. Much better than the tourist restaurants on the fisherman wharf that are expensive and average or low quality. We went there for breakfast, it made our day !!
author: simon p.

description:
If its one thing Texas doesn't have enough of its breakfast and lunch cafes. The staff was friendly. Food was great. Fairly decent in price compared to the rest of San Francisco's eateries. 

The only downside is that this place is pretty tiny, but I feel like its all part of the atmosphere.
author: Traci T.

description: The french toast w fruit and the greek omelet w hash is amazing. Next time I will have the veggie omelet. The orange juice was the best! Freshly squeeeezed goodness
author: Manorah R.

description: This is a great tasting and economical little place to eat at! If I'm going to splurge on a meal, it's gonna be breakfast and I had pegged this place prior to even getting into town. Our hotel was just down the street and the cafe was mid point to our GoCar tour...so we sauntered up the way for some morning grub.
