We had to pick up some SF street hoodies/jackets because it was COLD and unpredicted rain! We sat outside at a nice and cozy little 2 seater table with a few other tables outside and I think even less inside. The cafe was hoppin'. We ordered our food right away - my daughter got the pancakes and I went for the french taste - I believe it was the Marilyn Monroe and Audrey Hepburn, but.... there was nothing that made you go "OMG this is the best pancake/french toast EVER" but it was comfort food, warm, fresh quick and again...economical! I believe each were $7-8. The fruit was SUPER fresh, ripe and sweet...perfect, I will gripe and say the coffee was mediocre, I walked to Starbucks after to get a real coffee, but the food and service were outstanding.
author: Stacey A.

description: Good coffee. Tasty food for the $$. Probably your best bet in the near area
author: Rick B.

description: I went here for breakfast when I was on vacation and staying in Fisherman's Wharf. I wasn't sure where to go for a good breakfast and decided to try this place. I was so impressed! It was tiny and unassuming but so delicious. The orange juice was fresh-squeezed! I ordered the Belgian waffle which was perfect and came with the freshest sliced fruit I've ever seen. Really a great little spot. Try it if you are in the neighborhood and need a good breakfast.
author: Dawn G.

description: We stopped off here for a quick bite after a morning ride on the cable car.  I hadn't heard of the place and it was very unassuming so I didn't know what to expect.  To my delight, the service was great and the food was really good.  When I'm in that part of town again, I'll know where I can go for a good meal.
author: Julie D.

description: Delicious breakfast! Great service! Large protions! We were stuffed when we left. The fruit was fresh and a nice alternative to getting something fried like hash browns.
author: Tina L.

description: great place,wish i lived out in sf...from NY but next time i'm out here i'm coming back here,on the money every time
author: Nick D.

description: Did not like this place, food was horrible I ordered a tuna belt and it was cold, they put the sandwich on a biscut even though I wanted sourdough. No one smiled at me, it was cash only, no one said hi or was nice. Hated it.
author: Allanah C.

description: Hollywood is a cute little breakfast place, emphasis on "little." We went at 10 on a Saturday and were seated right away. I had a grilled croissant sandwich with eggs, cheese and tomato. It was incredibly good, as was the fresh orange juice. The service was great.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Wow, picked up the yelp review and thought I'd give it a try. Funny little place but wow. Everything the other reviewers said were spot on. Orange juice fresh, coffee hot, I had the meat lovers omelet - to die for, hasbrowns brill, and I had to get a side of fresh fruit because of the reviews. Excellent, fresh and juicy, but so much i had to take it back to my hotel. The staff were very quick and attentive, worth the wait.
author: Glenn M.

description: After breakfast at Denny's yesterday, I was looking for a good, fresh breakfast this morning, and we found it at Hollywood Cafe!  My french toast was fabulous  - and I couldn't believe how much delicious fresh fruit it came with!  We asked the waiter for a Mickey Mouse pancake for my daughter, and although it wasn't on the menu, they prepared one for her - with whipped cream and fruit for his face.  The bacon and eggs that my husband ordered were excellent, and the portions quite hearty.  After eating breakfast at 9:00 a.m., I didn't get hungry again until late afternoon!  Yes, the restaurant is a little small, but with fewer folks to feed at a time, they were able to get our meals to us very quickly.  Good food - good value!
author: Tasha K.

description: My husband read the other reviews and we decided to give this place a try and like the last reviewer, we ate there every morning of our stay! It was a block from the Hilton, so yes, most of us diners were out-of-towners, but so what! Why should we go to Denny's when we can get good, fast, cheap food, and eat outside and feel the breeze?! I loved the Ocean- its an omelet with shrimp and salmon in it- so awesome! you can't get that back where we're from. The french toast was great too, and everything you order comes with a little fruit to sweeten up your meal. They do only take cash, but they do state that on the menu to let you know ahead of time. Its a small place- I think 4 tables inside and 5 outside- but every time we went there at least 4 were already occupied. I think our meals averaged $20-$24 per day for both of us, not including tip. If you like a good little breakfast place, definitely give it a try!
author: S S.

description: Came for breakfast with kids. Fast courteous service and great food.
author: Scott S.

description: my husband and i went here for breakfast last saturday based on the reviews and location (it was close to where we were staying). this is the first time i feel like yelpers let me down :(  weird ambiance for starters. i guess it's called hollywood cafe because they have a few pics up of old, classic american actors (ie vivian leigh) and some plates on the menu have the actors names on them. other than that, the place has weird faux paint on the walls and everyone that works there seems to be asian. not that i have a problem with that AT ALL, my bf is asian it just added to the "offness" of the place.  the food was just OK. to be honest, ida been a lot happier at IHOP and ida paid a lot less too. when i order a hot chocolate im pretty sure everyone uses swiss miss or something like it, but when i'm paying over $2 for hot chocolate, i prefer not to watch them tear the packet of swiss miss open and pour it into my cup of hot water and stir it a few feet in front of me. the food wasn't horrible at all, i just honestly feel like i coulda had better and paid less at a place like IHOP. sorry, just bein' honest.
author: v g.
